es: Yo iba remando a toda prisa para delatarlo; pero cuando dijo aquello pareció que me quitase todas las fuerzas. Empecé a ir más lento y no estaba muy seguro de sentirme tan contento de haberme puesto en marcha. Cuando estaba a quinientas yardas, Jim va y dice:
vi_translation: I rowed the boat away, anxious to reveal this matter, but when I heard him say those words, it felt as if my insides were turned inside out. I rowed slowly, and I couldn't tell whether I was willing or unwilling to go. About fifty meters away, Jim spoke again:
tr_translation: I was rowing with all my might to report him as soon as possible, but when I heard these things, I suddenly became paralyzed. I gradually slowed down; I was no longer so sure if I was pleased with having embarked on this task. When I was about fifty meters away, Jim called out again:
es_translation: I was rowing as fast as I could to betray him; but when he said that, it seemed to take all my strength away. I started to go slower and wasn't very sure I felt so happy about having set out. When I was five hundred yards away, Jim goes and says:

en: “Dah you goes, de ole true Huck; de on’y white genlman dat ever kep’ his promise to ole Jim.”
vi: - Cậu chính thật là cậu Huck, cậu là người da trắng duy nhất đã giữ lời hứa với Jim đấy.
tr: “Haydi koluna kuvvet, dostum Huck, zavallı Jim’e veğdiği sözü tutan tek beyaz sahip.
es: —Ahí va mi fiel Huck; el único caballero blanco que ha cumplido sus promesas al viejo Jim.
vi_translation: - You truly are Huck, you are the only white person who has kept their promise to Jim.
tr_translation: “Come on, put some strength in your arm, my friend Huck, the only white master who kept his promise to poor Jim.”
es_translation: —There goes my faithful Huck; the only white gentleman who has kept his promises to old Jim.

en: Well, I just felt sick. But I says, I got to do it—I can’t get out of it. Right then along comes a skiff with two men in it with guns, and they stopped and I stopped. One of them says:
vi: Tôi cảm thấy đau lòng. Nhưng tôi lại tự nhủ: phải làm việc đó, không thể đứng được. Ngay lúc đó có một chiếc thuyền chở hai người đi tới, tay cầm súng. Họ dừng lại, tôi cũng dừng lại. Một người hỏi:
tr: Yok, bu gammazlama işini midem kaldırmayacaktı. Ama yine de yapmalıyım, diye düşündüm, artık vazgeçemezdim. Tam o sırada bir kayık göründü, içinde tüfekli iki adam vardı. Beni görünce durdular; ben de durdum.
es: Bueno, casi me pongo malo. Pero me dije: «Tengo que hacerlo; no puedo dejar de hacerlo». Justo entonces apareció un bote con dos hombres que llevaban escopetas y se pararon, y también yo. Uno de ellos va y dice:
vi_translation: I feel heartbroken. But I tell myself: I have to do it, I can't stand still. At that moment, a boat carrying two people approached, holding guns. They stopped, I also stopped. One person asked:
tr_translation: No, my stomach couldn't handle this tattling. But still, I thought, I must do it, I couldn't back out anymore. Just then, a boat appeared, with two men holding rifles inside. When they saw me, they stopped; I also stopped.
es_translation: Well, I almost got sick. But I told myself: "I have to do it; I can't stop doing it." Just then a boat appeared with two men carrying shotguns, and they stopped, and so did I. One of them goes and says:

en: “What’s that yonder?”
vi: - Cái gì đằng kia?
tr: “Şu ilerideki ne?” diye sordu biri.
es: —¿Qué es eso de ahí?
vi_translation: - What is over there?
tr_translation: "What's that over there?" someone asked.
es_translation: —What is that over there?

en: “A piece of a raft,” I says.
vi: Tôi đáp - Bè đấy
tr: “Bir sal,” dedim.
es: —Pues una balsa —contesté.
vi_translation: I answered - That's right
tr_translation: “Give me a ride,” I said.
es_translation: —Well, a raft —I replied.

en: “Do you belong on it?”
vi: - Cái bè đó là của mày hả?
tr: “O saldan mı geliyorsun?
es: —¿Vas tú en ella?
vi_translation: - Is that raft yours?
tr_translation: "Are you coming from the hall?"
es_translation: —Are you going on it?

en: “Any men on it?”
vi: - Có người nào trên ấy không?
tr: “Başka adam var mı?
es: —¿Y van hombres en ella?
vi_translation: - Is there anyone up there?
tr_translation: “Is there another man?”
es_translation: —And are there men in it?

en: “Only one, sir.”
vi: - Dạ chỉ có một người thôi
tr: “Bir adam daha var; bayım.
es: —Sólo uno, caballero.
vi_translation: - Yes, there is only one person
tr_translation: “There is one more man; sir.”
es_translation: —Only one, sir.

en: “Well, there’s five niggers run off to-night up yonder, above the head of the bend. Is your man white or black?”
vi: - Có năm tên da đen vừa chạy trốn về phía trên kia, ở chỗ đầu sông ấy. Cái người của mày da trắng hay đen?
tr: “Bu gece dönemecin hemen yukarısından beş zenci kaçtı. Saldaki adam beyaz mı, siyah mı?
es: —Bueno, pues hay cinco negros que se escaparon esta noche de allá arriba, donde está la curva. Tu hombre, ¿es blanco o negro?
vi_translation: - There were five black men who just ran away up there, at the head of the river. Is your person white or black?
tr_translation: “Tonight, five black men escaped just above the bend. Is the man on the raft white or black?”
es_translation: —Well, there are five black men who escaped tonight from up there, where the curve is. Your man, is he white or black?

en: I didn’t answer up prompt. I tried to, but the words wouldn’t come. I tried for a second or two to brace up and out with it, but I warn’t man enough—hadn’t the spunk of a rabbit. I see I was weakening; so I just give up trying, and up and says:
vi: Tôi không trả lời ngay được. Tôi định trả lời nhưng không nói ra được. Trong một hai giâu tôi lúng túng chẳng ra thế nào, không ra ngoài nữa, không co cái gan của một con thỏ. Tôi thấy mình đã yêu mềm quá rồi. Tôi đành thôi không dám nghĩ như lúc nãy nữa và nói:
tr: Hemen cevap veremedim. Denedim ama sözcükler bir türlü aklıma gelmiyordu. Birkaç saniye boyunca kendimi toparlamaya çalıştım, ama erkek gibi davranamadım, sanki bir tavşan yüreği taşıyordum. Giderek yenildiğimi hissediyordum, en sonunda çabalamayı bırakıp cevap verdim…
es: No respondí inmediatamente. Lo intenté, pero no me salían las palabras. Traté un segundo o dos de hacer fuerzas y decirlo, pero no fui lo bastante hombre: estuve más cobarde que un conejo. Vi que no tenía fuerzas, así que dejé de intentarlo, yvoyy digo:
vi_translation: I couldn't answer right away. I intended to answer but couldn't speak out. For a moment or two, I was flustered and couldn't make up my mind, didn't go outside anymore, didn't have the courage of a rabbit. I felt that I had become too weak. I had no choice but to stop thinking like I did earlier and said:
tr_translation: I couldn't respond immediately. I tried, but the words just wouldn't come to mind. For a few seconds, I tried to pull myself together, but I couldn't act like a man; it was as if I had the heart of a rabbit. I felt myself losing more and more, and finally, I stopped trying and responded...
es_translation: I did not respond immediately. I tried, but the words wouldn't come out. I struggled for a second or two to muster the strength and say it, but I wasn't man enough: I was more cowardly than a rabbit. I saw that I didn't have the strength, so I stopped trying, and I go and say:

en: “He’s white.”
vi: - Da trắng
tr: “Beyaz.
es: —Es blanco.
vi_translation: - White skin
tr_translation: “White.”
es_translation: —It's white.

en: “I reckon we’ll go and see for ourselves.”
vi: - Để chúng tạo tự đi xem
tr: “Gidip kendimiz baksak iyi olacak galiba.
es: —Creo que vamos a verlo nosotros mismos.
vi_translation: - Let them go see for themselves
tr_translation: “I guess it would be better if we go and check ourselves.”
es_translation: —I think we are going to see it ourselves.

en: “I wish you would,” says I, “because it’s pap that’s there, and maybe you’d help me tow the raft ashore where the light is. He’s sick—and so is mam and Mary Ann.”
vi: Tôi nói: - Vâng, mời các ông đi xem, vì đó là bố tôi đang ở trên ấy. Và có lẽ nhờ các ông đẩy giúp cái bè lên chỗ có ánh đèn. Ông ấy ốm, cả mẹ tôi và cô Mary Anne cũng vậy.
tr: “Çok iyi olur; çünkü oradaki adam babam. Belki salı şu ışığın bulunduğu yere çekmeme yardımcı olursunuz. Babam birazcık rahatsız… annem ve Mary Ann de öyle.
es: —Ojalá —dije yo—, porque es padre el que va ahí y a lo mejor me ayudan ustedes a remolcar la balsa a tierra donde está esa luz. Está malo, y lo mismo les pasa a madre y a Mary Ann.
vi_translation: I said: - Yes, please go and see, because that is my father up there. And perhaps you could help push the raft to the place with the light. He is sick, and so are my mother and Mary Anne.
tr_translation: “That would be great; because the man over there is my father. Maybe you could help me move the boat to where the light is. My father is a bit unwell… so are my mother and Mary Ann.”
es_translation: —I hope so —I said—, because it's my father who is there and maybe you can help me tow the raft to the shore where that light is. He's sick, and the same goes for mother and Mary Ann.

en: “Oh, the devil! we’re in a hurry, boy. But I s’pose we’ve got to. Come, buckle to your paddle, and let’s get along.”
vi: - ồ, quỉ quái, chúng tao còn đang vội đây. Nhưng có lẽ chúng ta cũng nên giúp một tý. Đim cầm lấy mái chèo đi.
tr: “Hay kör şeytan! Acelemiz var evlat. Ama yine de sana yardım etsek iyi olacak. Haydi dön geriye de işe koyulalım.
es: —¡Qué diablos! Tenemos prisa, chico. Pero supongo que es nuestro deber. Vamos, dale al remo y vamos allá.
vi_translation: - Oh, damn it, we're still in a hurry here. But maybe we should help a little. Dim, grab the oar.
tr_translation: “Hey, you devil! We're in a hurry, kid. But it would still be good to help you. Come on, turn back so we can get to work.”
es_translation: —What the hell! We're in a hurry, kid. But I suppose it's our duty. Come on, grab the oar and let's go.

en: I buckled to my paddle and they laid to their oars. When we had made a stroke or two, I says:
vi: Tôi cầm mái chèo đẩy thuyền đi. Họ cũng đi. Chèo được vài ba nhát, tôi nói:
tr: Ben geriye dönerken onlar da kürek çekmeye başladı. Biraz ilerledikten sonra tekrar başladım:
es: Agarré la paleta y ellos sus remos. Al cabo de un par de remadas les digo:
vi_translation: I held the paddle and pushed the boat forward. They also went. After a few strokes, I said:
tr_translation: As I turned back, they also started rowing. After moving forward a bit, I started again:
es_translation: I grabbed the paddle and they grabbed their oars. After a couple of strokes, I said to them:

en: “Pap’ll be mighty much obleeged to you, I can tell you. Everybody goes away when I want them to help me tow the raft ashore, and I can’t do it by myself.”
vi: - Bố tôi sẽ cảm ơn các ông lắm đấy. Nhờ ai giúp để đẩy vào bờ họ cũng đều bỏ đi cả, mà mình tôi thì không làm nổi.
tr: “Babam size minnettar kalacak. Salı karaya çekmek için yardım istediğim herkes kaçıp gidiyor ve ben de bu işi tek başıma yapacak kadar kuvvetli değilim.
es: —Padre les estará muy agradecido, eso seguro. Cuando digo a alguien que me ayude a remolcar la balsa a tierra todo el mundo se va y yo solo no puedo.
vi_translation: - My father will be very grateful to you. Everyone who was asked to help push it to the shore just left, and I couldn't do it alone.
tr_translation: “My father will be grateful to you. Everyone I asked for help to pull the boat ashore on Tuesday is running away, and I am not strong enough to do this job alone.”
es_translation: —Father will be very grateful to you, that's for sure. When I ask someone to help me tow the raft to shore, everyone leaves and I can't do it alone.

en: “Well, that’s infernal mean. Odd, too. Say, boy, what’s the matter with your father?”
vi: - ồ, cái đóe bao giờ cũng thế. Thật là tệ. Này, chú bé, bố mày ốm thế nào?
tr: “Dünya alçaklarla dolu evlat. Ama tuhaf doğrusu. Söyle bakalım neyi var babanın?
es: —Pues vaya gente más mezquina; pero, qué raro. Oye, chico, ¿qué le pasa a tu padre?
vi_translation: - Oh, it's always like that. Really bad. Hey, kid, how's your dad's illness?
tr_translation: "The world is full of scoundrels, my child. But it's strange, really. Tell me, what is wrong with your father?"
es_translation: —Well, what a bunch of mean people; but, how strange. Hey, kid, what's wrong with your father?

en: “It’s the—a—the—well, it ain’t anything much.”
vi: - ờ... ờ... cũng chẳng có gì nguy lắm
tr: “Eee… şey, pek bir şeyi yok aslında.
es: —Es... aaa... laaa... bueno, no es nada grave.
vi_translation: - uh... uh... it's not that dangerous
tr_translation: “Uh… well, there's not much actually.”
es_translation: —It... uh... well, it's nothing serious.

en: They stopped pulling. It warn’t but a mighty little ways to the raft now. One says:
vi: Họ dừng tay. Chỉ còn một quãng ngắn nữa là đến bờ. Một người nói:
tr: Kürek çekmeyi bıraktılar. Artık sala çok az yolumuz kalmıştı. Biri kaşlarını çatarak bana baktı.
es: Dejaron de remar. Ya estábamos muy cerca de la balsa. Uno va y dice:
vi_translation: They stopped. There was only a short distance left to the shore. One person said:
tr_translation: They stopped rowing. We had very little distance left to the raft. One of them looked at me with a frown.
es_translation: They stopped rowing. We were already very close to the raft. One goes and says:

en: “Boy, that’s a lie. What is the matter with your pap? Answer up square now, and it’ll be the better for you.”
vi: - Bé con, mày nói dối. Bố mày làm sao? Trả lời cho thật không thì đừng trách tao
tr: “Yalan söyleme oğlum. Babanın nesi var? Bana doğru cevap verirsen senin için daha iyi olur.
es: —Chico, estás mintiendo. ¿Qué le pasa a tu padre? Responde la verdad, que más te vale.
vi_translation: - Kid, you're lying. What's wrong with your dad? Answer truthfully or don't blame me
tr_translation: "Don't lie, my son. What's wrong with your father? It will be better for you if you give me the correct answer."
es_translation: —Kid, you're lying. What's wrong with your father? Answer truthfully, it's in your best interest.

en: “I will, sir, I will, honest—but don’t leave us, please. It’s the—the—gentlemen, if you’ll only pull ahead, and let me heave you the headline, you won’t have to come a-near the raft—please do.”
vi: - Vâng, tôi... thưa ông, tôi nói thật... nhưng xin các ông đừng bỏ chúng tôi. Vì là... vì đó là... các ông ơi, các ông đi trước đi, để tôi đi sau rồi vứt cái đầu dây cho, các ông chớ lại gần bè, xin chờ!
tr: “Doğruyu söyleyeceğime yemin ederim, bayım… ama ne olur siz de gitmeyin. Onun hastalığı… hem sadece önden çekseniz yeter, size halatı uzatırım ve sala yaklaşmanız gerekmez… ne olursunuz.
es: —Sí, señor, de verdad que sí..., pero, por favor no nos abandonen. Es la... laaa... caballeros, si se acercan un poco y me dejan que les eche la amarra no tienen que acercarse a la balsa; por favor.
vi_translation: - Yes, I... sir, I'm telling the truth... but please don't abandon us. Because... because it's... please, you go ahead, let me follow and then throw the end of the rope, please don't come near the raft, please wait!
tr_translation: “I swear to tell the truth, sir... but please, don't go. His illness... and if you just pull from the front, that's enough, I'll hand you the rope and you won't need to approach the boat... please.”
es_translation: —Yes, sir, really..., but please don't abandon us. It's the... theee... gentlemen, if you come a little closer and let me throw you the rope, you don't have to come near the raft; please.

en: “Set her back, John, set her back!” says one. They backed water. “Keep away, boy—keep to looard. Confound it, I just expect the wind has blowed it to us. Your pap’s got the small-pox, and you know it precious well. Why didn’t you come out and say so? Do you want to spread it all over?”
vi: - Lùi thuyền lại, John, lùi lại - Một người nói. Họ chèo thuyền lui lại. Tránh xa ra, bé con - tránh sang bên đi, mau lên. Đồ con khỉ, không khéo gió lại thổi cái của ấy vào chúng tao rồi đấy. Bố mày mắc bệnh đậu mùa, chắc hắn là mày biết rồi. Sao mày không nói ngay. Mày muốn cho bệnh nó lan ra hay sao?
tr: “Geri çık, John, geri çık!” dedi öbürü. Kürekleri tersine çekmeye başladılar. “Uzak dur evlat… arkada kal. Lanet olsun, esintiyle bize kadar gelmiştir. Baban çiçek çıkarmış ve sen de bunu çok iyi biliyorsun. Niye en baştan söylemedin? Herkese bulaşsın mı istiyorsun?
es: —¡Vamos atrás, John, vamos atrás! —dijo uno de ellos. Retrocedieron—. No te acerques, chico; manténte a sotavento. Maldita sea, sólo falta que nos la haya traído el viento. Tu padre tiene la viruela y tú lo sabes de sobra. ¿Por qué no lo dijiste a la primera? ¿Quieres que se le contagie a todo el mundo?
vi_translation: - Back the boat, John, back it up - Someone said. They rowed the boat backward. Stay away, kid - move aside, hurry up. You little monkey, the wind might blow that thing onto us. Your father has smallpox, you probably know that already. Why didn't you say so right away? Do you want the disease to spread?
tr_translation: “Back off, John, back off!” said the other. They started rowing backwards. “Stay away, kid… stay behind. Damn it, it must have reached us with the breeze. Your father has come down with smallpox and you know it very well. Why didn't you say it from the beginning? Do you want everyone to get infected?”
es_translation: —Let's go back, John, let's go back! —said one of them. They retreated—. Don't get close, boy; stay downwind. Damn it, the last thing we need is for the wind to have brought it to us. Your father has smallpox and you know it well. Why didn't you say it from the start? Do you want everyone to get infected?

en: “Well,” says I, a-blubbering, “I’ve told everybody before, and they just went away and left us.”
vi: Tôi lắp bắp trả lời: - Không, không ạ, lúc trước tôi đã nói với mọi người rồi, họ lảng đi, họ bỏ mặc chúng tôi.
tr: Kekelemeye başladım. “B… be… ben sizden öncekilere söyledim, ama hemen çekip gittiler.
es: —Bueno —respondí yo lloriqueando—, es lo que les he dicho a todos antes y se iban y nos dejaban.
vi_translation: I stammered in reply: - No, no, before I already told everyone, they ignored it, they abandoned us.
tr_translation: I started to stutter. "I... I... I told the ones before you, but they left immediately."
es_translation: —Well —I replied, whining—, it's what I've told everyone before and they left and abandoned us.

en: “Poor devil, there’s something in that. We are right down sorry for you, but we—well, hang it, we don’t want the small-pox, you see. Look here, I’ll tell you what to do. Don’t you try to land by yourself, or you’ll smash everything to pieces. You float along down about twenty miles, and you’ll come to a town on the left-hand side of the river. It will be long after sun-up then, and when you ask for help you tell them your folks are all down with chills and fever. Don’t be a fool again, and let people guess what is the matter. Now we’re trying to do you a kindness; so you just put twenty miles between us, that’s a good boy. It wouldn’t do any good to land yonder where the light is—it’s only a wood-yard. Say, I reckon your father’s poor, and I’m bound to say he’s in pretty hard luck. Here, I’ll put a twenty-dollar gold piece on this board, and you get it when it floats by. I feel mighty mean to leave you; but my kingdom! it won’t do to fool with small-pox, don’t you see?”
vi: - Khổ chưa, chắc có chuyện gì đó thôi. Chúng tao thấy mày mà thương hại quá, nhưng chúng tao... Thôi mặc kệ, khômg nói nữa chúng tao không muôn bị lây bệnh đậu mùa, nghe không? Đây này, tao bảo đừng có lên bờ, mày lên bờ thì sẽ lây bệnh lung tung cả. Hãy chèo xuồng phía dưới kia độ hai mươi dặm rồi sẽ đến một thị trấn ở bờ bên trái. Lúc đó là sáng rồi. đến khi nào nhờ người ta đoán là bệnh đậu mùa, nghe không. Thôi, bây giờ chúng tao sẽ giúp mày một việc. Mày cứ dọc theo đây xuôi thuyền xuống đó nhé, mày cũng là đứa bé ngoan đấy. Không nên lên bờ chỗ có ánh đèn kia làm gì, đấy chỉ là cái làn gỗ thôi. Này, có lẽ bố mày nghèo lắm phải không, chắc lão ta gặp nhiều chuyện rủi ro đấy. Đây này, tao để cho một đồng tiền hai người đô lă bằng vàng trên miếng ván đây này, nó trôi đến chỗ mày thì với tay sang mà lấy. Bỏ mặc mày thì thật tệ quá, nhưng lạy chúa, tao sợ bị lây bệnh đậu mùa, mày hiểu không? Người đó laị nói:
tr: “Vah gariban, senin de bir suçun yok ki. Senin durumuna çok üzüldük, ama biz… lanet olsun, çiçek geçirmek istemiyoruz evlat. Bak şimdi sana ne yapacağını anlatayım. Salı kendi başına kıyıya çekmeye çalışma, yoksa parça parça edersin. Yirmi mil kadar gittikten sonra nehrin sol tarafında bir kasaba göreceksin. O zamana kadar öğlen olur herhalde. Ayrıca yardım isterken seninkilerin titrediğini ve ateşlendiklerini söyle sadece. Bu kez budalalık etme ve bırak insanlar hastalığın ne olduğunu kendileri tahmin etsinler. Biz sana iyilik etmeye çalışıyoruz evladım. Söz dinle ve bizden en az yirmi mil uzaklaş. Işığın olduğu yerde karaya çıkmanın bir faydası yok… orası sadece bir keresteci. Baban yoksul bir adam olmalı… üstelik şansı da hiç yaver gitmemiş görünüyor. Şu tahtanın üzerine yirmi dolarlık altın koyuyorum, bizden uzaklaşınca alabilirsin. Seni kendi başına bırakmak çok alçakça, ama Tanrı aşkına! Çiçek dediğin şakaya gelmez, çocuğum.
es: —Pobre diablo, no te falta razón. Lo sentimos mucho por vosotros pero es que... bueno, maldita sea, no queremos que nos dé la viruela, compréndelo. Mira, voy a decirte lo que puedes hacer. No trates de atracar tú solo o lo destrozarás todo. Sigue flotando río abajo unas veinte millas y llegarás a un pueblo al lado izquierdo del río. Para entonces ya habrá amanecido del todo, y cuando pidas ayuda diles que tu familia entera tiene escalofríos y fiebre. No vuelvas a hacer el tonto y dejar que la gente se suponga lo que pasa. Estamos tratando de hacerte un favor, así que sé bueno y vete veinte millas más allá. No te valdría de nada atracar donde está la luz: no es más que una serrería. Oye, calculo que tu padre es pobre y desde luego que está teniendo mala suerte. Mira, voy a poner una moneda de oro de veinte dólares en esta tabla y cuando flote a tu lado la recoges. No es que me guste dejarte, pero ¡qué diablos!, con la viruela no se juega, ¿comprendes?
vi_translation: - Oh dear, there must be something wrong. We feel so sorry for you, but we... Never mind, let's not talk anymore, we don't want to catch smallpox, you hear? Look, I told you not to come ashore, if you do, you'll spread the disease everywhere. Row your boat about twenty miles down there and you'll reach a town on the left bank. By then it will be morning. Ask someone to guess if it's smallpox, you hear? Alright, now we'll help you with something. Just follow along here and sail down there, you're a good kid. Don't come ashore where there's light, it's just a wooden shed. Hey, maybe your dad is very poor, he must have had a lot of bad luck. Look, I'm leaving a gold coin worth two dollars on this plank here, when it floats to you, reach out and take it. Leaving you would be terrible, but dear God, I'm afraid of catching smallpox, you understand? That person said again:
tr_translation: “Oh poor thing, it's not your fault either. We felt very sorry for your situation, but we… damn it, we don't want to catch smallpox, kid. Now let me tell you what to do. Don't try to pull the raft ashore by yourself, or you'll tear it to pieces. After going about twenty miles, you'll see a town on the left side of the river. By then, it will probably be noon. Also, when asking for help, just say that your folks are shivering and have a fever. This time, don't be foolish and let people guess what the illness is themselves. We're trying to do you a favor, kid. Listen to us and get at least twenty miles away from us. There's no point in landing where the light is… it's just a lumberyard. Your father must be a poor man… and it seems he hasn't had any luck either. I'm putting twenty dollars in gold on this board, you can take it once you're away from us. It's very cruel to leave you on your own, but for God's sake! Smallpox is no joke, child.”
es_translation: —Poor devil, you are not wrong. We are very sorry for you, but... well, damn it, we don't want to catch smallpox, understand? Look, I'm going to tell you what you can do. Don't try to dock alone or you'll ruin everything. Keep floating downstream about twenty miles and you'll reach a town on the left side of the river. By then it will be fully daylight, and when you ask for help, tell them your entire family has chills and fever. Don't be foolish again and let people guess what's going on. We are trying to do you a favor, so be good and go twenty miles further. It wouldn't do you any good to dock where the light is: it's just a sawmill. Hey, I figure your father is poor and certainly having bad luck. Look, I'm going to put a twenty-dollar gold coin on this board and when it floats to you, pick it up. It's not that I like leaving you, but what the hell!, you don't mess around with smallpox, understand?

en: “Hold on, Parker,” says the other man, “here’s a twenty to put on the board for me. Good-bye, boy; you do as Mr. Parker told you, and you’ll be all right.”
vi: - Khoan đã, Packer. Này, để đồng tiền hai mười đô là lên miếng ván hộ tôi. Thôi, chào chú bé nhé, cứ làm như ông Packer đã bảo mày thì yên trí
tr: “Dur biraz, Parker;” dedi öbür adam. “Benden de bir yirmilik koy tahtanın üstüne. Hoşça kal yavrum, Bay Parker’ın sözünü dinlersen her şey yoluna girer.
es: —Espera, Parker —dijo el otro—, ten otros veinte para poner también en la tabla. Adiós, chico; haz lo que te ha dicho el señor Parker y seguro que todo os irá bien.
vi_translation: - Wait a minute, Packer. Hey, put the twenty-dollar bill on the plank for me. Alright, goodbye kid, just do as Mr. Packer told you and you'll be fine.
tr_translation: "Wait a moment, Parker," said the other man. "Put a twenty on the board from me too. Goodbye, my dear, if you listen to Mr. Parker, everything will be fine."
es_translation: —Wait, Parker —said the other—, take another twenty to put on the board as well. Goodbye, kid; do what Mr. Parker told you and everything will surely go well for you.

en: “That’s so, my boy—good-bye, good-bye. If you see any runaway niggers you get help and nab them, and you can make some money by it.”
vi: - Đúng đấy. Thôi chào chú, chào chú. Nếu chú mày trông thấy tên da đen nào chạy trốn thì kêu người ta bắt lấy nó, như vậy sẽ được tiền đấy.
tr: “Evet, evlat… sağlıcakla kal, sağlıcakla kal. Kaçak zenciler görürsen yardım çağırıp onları yakalat, bu sayede para da kazanabilirsin.
es: —Exactamente, chico; adiós, adiós. Si ves negros fugitivos, busca quien te ayude a atraparlos y sacarás algo de dinero.
vi_translation: - That's right. Goodbye now, goodbye. If you see any black person running away, call someone to catch them, and you'll get money for it.
tr_translation: "Yes, son... stay safe, stay safe. If you see runaway black people, call for help and have them caught, you can also make money this way."
es_translation: —Exactly, boy; goodbye, goodbye. If you see runaway slaves, find someone to help you catch them and you'll make some money.

en: “Good-bye, sir,” says I; “I won’t let no runaway niggers get by me if I can help it.”
vi: Tôi đáp: - Vâng, chào các ông. Nếu tôi thấy tên da đen nào thì tôi sẽ không để cho nó chạy đâu.
tr: “Güle güle baylar,” dedim. “Gücüm yeterse hiçbir zenciye geçit vermem.
es: —Adiós, caballero —respondí—; no dejaré que se me escape ningún negro fugitivo si puedo evitarlo.
vi_translation: I replied: - Yes, goodbye gentlemen. If I see any black man, I won't let him get away.
tr_translation: “Goodbye, gentlemen,” I said. “If I have the strength, I will not let any black person pass.”
es_translation: —Goodbye, sir —I replied—; I will not let any runaway slave escape if I can help it.

en: They went off and I got aboard the raft, feeling bad and low, because I knowed very well I had done wrong, and I see it warn’t no use for me to try to learn to do right; a body that don’t get started right when he’s little ain’t got no show—when the pinch comes there ain’t nothing to back him up and keep him to his work, and so he gets beat. Then I thought a minute, and says to myself, hold on; s’pose you’d a done right and give Jim up, would you felt better than what you do now? No, says I, I’d feel bad—I’d feel just the same way I do now. Well, then, says I, what’s the use you learning to do right when it’s troublesome to do right and ain’t no trouble to do wrong, and the wages is just the same? I was stuck. I couldn’t answer that. So I reckoned I wouldn’t bother no more about it, but after this always do whichever come handiest at the time.
vi: Họ đi rồi, tôi mới trở về bè, cảm thấy mình xấu xa, hèn hạ quá, vì tôi biết rất rõ rằng mình đã làm một việc sai lầm. Tôi thấy rằng đối với tôi nếu có học làm điều gì phải thì cũng đến vô ích thôi, một người lúc bé không tập làm điều gì phải thì lớn lên cũng chẳng ra gì. Sau này gặp những lúc khó khăn thì chả có ai giúp đỡ hoặc làm cho ăn gì, lại còn có thể bị đánh đập nữa. Tôi suy nghĩ một phút, rồi tự nhủ: nếu như lúc nãy mình làm điều không phải là đưa Jim ra, thì có phải bây giờ thấy dễ thở hơn không? Nhưng tôi lại nói: Không. Nếu như thế thì mình sẽ thấy khổ tâm chứ, sẽ thấy bứt rứt như chính bây giờ mình đang bứt rứt rồi đây. Rồi tôi lại tự bảo: học làm điều phải để làm gì trong khi làm điều phải thì khổ tâm và làm điều trái thì không thấy phiền lòng gì cả. Mà lợi lộc thì có phải hai đằng cùng như nhau không? Tôi thấy bí, không trả lời được câu đó. Sau cùng tôi nghĩ chẳng tội gì mà bận tâm về chuyện ấy nữa. Tuy thế nhưng về sau nó vẫn cứ luôn luôn quanh quẩn trong đầu óc.
tr: Adamlar gitti, ben de sala atladım; kendimi berbat hissediyordum, çünkü yaptığım şeyin yanlış olduğunu pekâlâ biliyordum ve doğruyu yapmayı öğrenmeye çalışmamın boşa olduğunu anlamıştım; küçükken iyi terbiye almayan, yol yordam öğrenmeyen bir insan ne kadar çabalasa boş. İş başa düştüğünde kendine dayanak olacak, azmetmesini sağlayacak bir şey olmadığından mağlubiyete mahkûmdur. Sonra biraz düşündüm, dur biraz, dedim kendi kendime, diyelim ki doğru olanı yapıp Jim’i ele verdin, o zaman kendini şimdikinden daha mı iyi hissedecektin? Hayır, dedim, kötü hissedecektim – tıpkı şimdiki gibi kendimi kötü hissedecektim. O halde doğruyu yapmayı öğrenmenin ne faydası var? Doğruyu yapmak başına dert açıyor; yanlış yaptığında ise kimse zarar görmüyor ve her iki durumda da kendini kötü hissediyorsun. Buraya gelince tıkanmıştım. Verecek bir cevabım yoktu. O yüzden artık bu meseleyi kafama takmamaya, vakti gelince o an için en uygun görünen şeyi yapmaya karar verdim.
es: Se marcharon y yo volví a subirme en la balsa, sintiéndome malo y traidor, porque sabía muy bien que había hecho mal, y veía que de nada valía que intentase aprender a hacer bien las cosas; cuando alguien no empieza bien cuando es pequeño no hay nada que hacer: cuando llega el momento no tiene en qué apoyarse y que lo mantenga, así que siempre pierde. Después lo pensé un minuto y me dije: «Un momento; supongamos que hubieras hecho bien y hubieras entregado a Jim, ¿te sentirías mejor que ahora? No», me dije, «me sentiría mal, me sentiría igual que ahora. Bueno, entonces», me dije, «¿de qué sirve aprender a hacer bien las cosas cuando tienes problemas si las haces bien y ningún problema si las haces mal y el resultado es siempre el mismo?» Estaba atrapado. No podía responder a aquello. Así que pensé que no me seguiría preocupando del asunto, y a partir de entonces siempre hago lo que me parece mejor en cada momento.
vi_translation: They left, and I returned to the raft, feeling despicable and cowardly, because I knew very well that I had done something wrong. I realized that for me, even if I learned to do the right thing, it would be useless, because a person who doesn't practice doing the right thing when young won't amount to anything when grown up. Later, during difficult times, there would be no one to help or support me, and I might even be beaten. I thought for a minute, then told myself: if earlier I hadn't done the wrong thing by bringing Jim out, would I feel more at ease now? But then I said: No. If that were the case, I would feel troubled, just as I am feeling troubled now. Then I told myself: what's the point of learning to do the right thing when doing the right thing brings distress and doing the wrong thing doesn't cause any discomfort? And aren't the benefits the same either way? I felt stuck, unable to answer that question. In the end, I thought there was no point in worrying about it anymore. However, it still kept lingering in my mind afterward.
tr_translation: The men left, and I jumped into the skiff; I was feeling terrible because I knew very well that what I had done was wrong, and I realized that trying to learn to do the right thing was in vain; a person who hasn't been well-mannered and hasn't learned the ways when young, no matter how much they try, it's futile. When it comes down to it, they are doomed to failure because they have nothing to rely on or to help them persevere. Then I thought a little, wait a minute, I said to myself, let's say you did the right thing and turned Jim in, would you feel better than you do now? No, I said, I would feel bad – just as I feel bad now. So what's the use of learning to do the right thing? Doing the right thing gets you into trouble; when you do the wrong thing, no one gets hurt, and in both cases, you feel bad. When I got to this point, I was stuck. I had no answer to give. So I decided not to worry about this matter anymore and to do whatever seemed most appropriate at the time when the moment came.
es_translation: They left, and I got back on the raft, feeling bad and traitorous, because I knew very well that I had done wrong, and I saw that it was useless to try to learn to do things right; when someone doesn't start off well when they are young, there's nothing to be done: when the time comes, they have nothing to lean on and support them, so they always lose. Then I thought about it for a minute and said to myself: "Wait a minute; suppose you had done right and turned Jim in, would you feel better than now? No," I said to myself, "I would feel bad, I would feel just as I do now. Well, then," I said to myself, "what's the use of learning to do things right when you have problems if you do them right and no problems if you do them wrong and the result is always the same?" I was trapped. I couldn't answer that. So I thought I wouldn't worry about it anymore, and from then on, I always do what seems best to me at the moment.

en: I went into the wigwam; Jim warn’t there. I looked all around; he warn’t anywhere. I says:
vi: Tôi bước vào trong lều. Jim không có đấy. Tôi tìm quanh, không thấy. Tôi gọi: - Jim!
tr: Barınağa girdim, Jim orada değildi. Her tarafa baktım, hiçbir yerde yoktu. Seslendim: “Jim!
es: Entré en el wigwam; allí no estaba Jim. Miré en mi derredor y no lo vi por ninguna parte. Grité: —¡Jim!
vi_translation: I stepped into the tent. Jim wasn't there. I looked around, but didn't see him. I called out:
tr_translation: I entered the shelter, Jim was not there. I looked everywhere, he was nowhere to be found. I called out:
es_translation: I entered the wigwam; Jim was not there. I looked around and did not see him anywhere. I shouted:

en: “Jim!”
vi: - Jim!
tr: “Jim!
es: —¡Jim!
vi_translation: - Jim!
tr_translation: “Jim!”
es_translation: —Jim!

en: “Here I is, Huck. Is dey out o’ sight yit? Don’t talk loud.”
vi: - Tôi đây, cậu Huck ơi. Họ đi xa chưa? Cậu đừng nói to.
tr: “Ben buğada, Huck. Yeteğince uzaklaştı mı onlağ? Sesini yükseltme sen yine de!
es: —Aquí estoy, Huck. ¿Ya no se les ve? No hables en voz alta.
vi_translation: - I'm here, Huck. Have they gone far? Don't speak loudly.
tr_translation: “I'm here, Huck. Did he get far enough away? Don't raise your voice, though!”
es_translation: —Here I am, Huck. Can you still see them? Don't speak loudly.

en: He was in the river under the stern oar, with just his nose out. I told him they were out of sight, so he come aboard. He says:
vi: Thì ra Jim núp ở dưới sông, dưới mài chèo đằng sau lái, chỉ thò cái mũi lên trên mặt nước. Tôi bảo hắn là họ đi xa rồi, hắn mới trèo lên. Jim nói:
tr: Nehirdeydi, dümen küreğinin altına girmişti ve sadece burnu dışarıda kalmıştı. Adamların artık gözden kaybolduğunu söyledim, o da sala çıktı. “Konuştuklağınızın hepsini duydum,” dedi Jim.
es: Estaba en el agua, bajo el remo de proa, sin sacar más que la nariz. Le dije que ya no se los veía, así que subió a bordo. Me contó:
vi_translation: It turns out Jim was hiding under the river, beneath the oar at the back, with only his nose sticking out above the water. I told him they had gone far away, and only then did he climb up. Jim said:
tr_translation: He was in the river, had gone under the rudder oar, and only his nose was above the water. I told him that the men had disappeared from sight, and he got onto the raft. “I heard everything you said,” said Jim.
es_translation: He was in the water, under the bow oar, with only his nose out. I told him that they couldn't be seen anymore, so he climbed aboard. He told me:

en: “I was a-listenin’ to all de talk, en I slips into de river en was gwyne to shove for sho’ if dey come aboard. Den I was gwyne to swim to de raf’ agin when dey was gone. But lawsy, how you did fool ’em, Huck! Dat wuz de smartes’ dodge! I tell you, chile, I ’speck it save’ ole Jim—ole Jim ain’t going to forgit you for dat, honey.”
vi: - Tôi nghe suốt cả câu chuyện, tôi mới luồn xuống sông và định bơi vào bờ nếu như họ lên bè. Nhưng sau thấy họ đi rồi tôi quay lại. Nhưng cậu làm thế nào mà đánh lừa được họ tài thế, hả cậu Huck? Giỏi thật đấy cậu ạ. Như thế là cậu lại cứu Jim một lần nữa. Jim không thể nào quên được cái đó đâu, cậu Huck ạ.
tr: “Hemen göğünmeden nehğe daldım ve plan yaptım: Onlağ güveğteye çıksaydı, ben de gizlice sahile yüzecektim. Onlağ gidince, ben yine yüzüp sala döndüm. Adamlağı nasıl da kandığdın, Huck! Bugüne dek göğmemiştim bundan daha kuğnazca biğ numağa! Zavallı Jim’i senin kuğnazlığın kuğtağdı. Koca Jim bunu hiç unutmaycak, ciğeğimin köşesi.
es: —He estado escuchando esa conversación y me metí en el agua y me iba a ir a la costa si subían. Después iba a volver a la balsa cuando se hubieran ido. Pero, ¡señor, cómo les has engañado, Huck! ¡Has sido de lo más astuto! Te digo chico que estoy seguro de que has salvado al viejo Jim... El viejo Jim no lo va a olvidar nunca, mi niño.
vi_translation: - I listened to the whole story, then I slipped down to the river and planned to swim to shore if they got on the raft. But after seeing them leave, I turned back. But how did you manage to fool them so well, Huck? You're really good at it. That means you saved Jim once again. Jim will never forget that, Huck.
tr_translation: “I immediately dove into the river without hesitation and made a plan: If they went up to the deck, I would secretly swim to the shore. When they left, I swam back to the raft again. How cleverly you tricked them, Huck! I have never seen a more cunning act than this until today! Poor Jim was saved by your cleverness. Big Jim will never forget this, my heart’s corner.”
es_translation: —I was listening to that conversation and I got into the water and was going to go to the shore if they came up. Then I was going to return to the raft when they had left. But, sir, how you fooled them, Huck! You were so clever! I tell you, boy, I'm sure you've saved old Jim... Old Jim will never forget it, my boy.

en: Then we talked about the money. It was a pretty good raise—twenty dollars apiece. Jim said we could take deck passage on a steamboat now, and the money would last us as far as we wanted to go in the free States. He said twenty mile more warn’t far for the raft to go, but he wished we was already there.
vi: Rồi chứng tôi bàn với nhau về chuyện tiền. Thật là một món tiền lớn đấy chứ, những hai mươi đô la. Jim bảo bây giờ có thể lấy vé đi thuỷ được, và số tiền đó đủ có thể đi đến những xứ tự do. Hắn bảo vài chục dặm thì đi bè cũng chả mấy, nhưng muốn đến nơi mau hơn nữa cơ.
tr: Sonra para meselesini konuştuk. Kişi başına yirmişer dolarımız vardı. Jim artık bir buharlı tekneden bilet alabileceğimizi söyledi, üstelik özgür eyaletlere ulaşıncaya kadar ikimize de fazla fazla yeterdi. Salla yirmi mil daha gitmek çok bir şey değildi, ama Jim’e kalsa bir an önce orada olmak istiyordu.
es: Después hablamos del dinero. No estaba nada mal: veinte dólares cada uno. Jim dijo que ahora podíamos tomar pasajes de cubierta en un barco de vapor y el dinero nos duraría hasta donde quisiéramos llegar en los estados libres. Dijo que veinte millas más no era mucha distancia para la balsa, pero que ojalá ya hubiéramos llegado.
vi_translation: Then we discussed money matters. It was quite a large sum, twenty dollars. Jim said now we could get a boat ticket, and that amount would be enough to reach free territories. He said traveling a few dozen miles by raft wouldn't take long, but he wanted to get there even faster.
tr_translation: Then we talked about the money issue. We had twenty dollars each. Jim said we could now buy a ticket on a steamboat, and it would be more than enough for both of us until we reached the free states. Going another twenty miles by raft wasn't much, but Jim wanted to be there as soon as possible.
es_translation: Then we talked about the money. It wasn't bad at all: twenty dollars each. Jim said that now we could take deck passage on a steamboat and the money would last us as far as we wanted to go in the free states. He said that twenty more miles wasn't much distance for the raft, but he wished we had already arrived.

en: Towards daybreak we tied up, and Jim was mighty particular about hiding the raft good. Then he worked all day fixing things in bundles, and getting all ready to quit rafting.
vi: Đến lúc trời tảng sáng, chúng tôi buộc bè lại và Jim đi tìm chỗ giấu rất khéo. Rồi suốt ngày hắn cú cặm cụi buộc đồ đạc thành từng bọc và sẵn sàng để rời bỏ chiếc bè.
tr: Sabah olurken salı bir yere bağladık ve Jim bu kez salı iyi saklamak için çok uğraştı. Ardından bütün gününü eşyalarımızı denkler haline getirmekle geçirdi.
es: Hacia el amanecer amarramos y Jim actuó con mucho cuidado para esconder bien la balsa. Después trabajó todo el día organizando las cosas en paquetes y preparándolo todo para seguir adelante sin la balsa.
vi_translation: At dawn, we tied the raft and Jim went to find a very clever hiding spot. Then, all day long, he diligently tied the belongings into bundles and got ready to leave the raft.
tr_translation: When morning came, we tied the raft to a place, and Jim worked hard this time to hide the raft well. Then he spent the whole day organizing our belongings into bundles.
es_translation: Towards dawn, we moored and Jim acted very carefully to hide the raft well. Afterwards, he worked all day organizing things into packages and preparing everything to move forward without the raft.

en: That night about ten we hove in sight of the lights of a town away down in a left-hand bend.
vi: Khoảng mười giờ đêm hôm đó, chúng tôi nhằm phía có anh đèn thị trấn ở bờ sông bên trái.
tr: Akşam on civarı sol tarafta nehrin kıvrıldığı yerde gördüğümüz ışıklara doğru ilerledik.
es: Aquella noche, hacia las diez, llegamos a la vista de las luces de un pueblo en una curva del lado izquierdo.
vi_translation: Around ten o'clock that night, we headed towards the town lights on the left bank of the river.
tr_translation: We moved towards the lights we saw around ten in the evening where the river bends on the left side.
es_translation: That night, around ten, we came within sight of the lights of a village on a curve to the left side.

en: I went off in the canoe to ask about it. Pretty soon I found a man out in the river with a skiff, setting a trot-line. I ranged up and says:
vi: Tôi xuống xuồng chèo ra hỏi thăm. một chốc, gặp một người đi chiếc thuyền con ra sông để mặc dây câu. Tôi đến gần hỏi:
tr: Yol sormak için kanoyla saldan ayrıldım. Çok geçmeden kayığıyla nehre çapari atan bir adama rastladım. Yaklaşıp seslendim:
es: Fui en la canoa a preguntar. En seguida me encontré con un hombre que había salido al río con un bote y estaba preparando unos sedales. Me acerqué y le pregunté:
vi_translation: I got off the boat and rowed out to ask for information. After a while, I met a person who was taking a small boat out to the river to set up fishing lines. I approached and asked:
tr_translation: I left the raft with the canoe to ask for directions. Soon, I encountered a man casting a fishing line into the river from his boat. I approached and called out:
es_translation: I went in the canoe to ask. Immediately, I met a man who had gone out to the river with a boat and was preparing some fishing lines. I approached him and asked:

en: “Mister, is that town Cairo?”
vi: - Ông ơi, có phải chỗ thị trấn kia là Cairo không? - Cairo nào ở đâu.
tr: “Cairo burası mı, bayım? “Cairo mu?
es: —Caballero, ¿ese pueblo es El Cairo?
vi_translation: - Grandpa, is that town over there Cairo? - Where is Cairo?
tr_translation: "Is this Cairo, sir?"" “Is it Cairo?
es_translation: —Sir, is that town Cairo?

en: “Cairo? no. You must be a blame’ fool.”
vi: Không! Mày điên hay sao thế?
tr: Yok canım. Salak mısın nesin sen!
es: —Caballero, ¿ese pueblo es El Cairo? —¿El Cairo? No. Debes de ser idiota perdido.
vi_translation: No! Are you crazy?
tr_translation: No way. Are you stupid or what!”
es_translation: —Cairo? No. You must be a complete idiot.

en: “What town is it, mister?”
vi: - Thế là cái gì hả ông?
tr: “Burası hangi kasaba, bayım?
es: —¿Cómo se llama ese pueblo, caballero?
vi_translation: - What is that, sir?
tr_translation: "Which town is this, sir?"
es_translation: —What is the name of that town, sir?

en: “If you want to know, go and find out. If you stay here botherin’ around me for about a half a minute longer you’ll get something you won’t want.”
vi: - Nếu muốn biết thì đi đến đó mà hỏi. Mày mà còn ở đây quấy rầy tao chỉ nửa phút thôi thì cũng đừng có trách tao.
tr: “Çok merak ettiysen gider bakarsın. Ama kafamı ütülemeye devam edersen hiç istemeyeceğin şeyler gelecek başına.
es: —Si quieres enterarte, ve a preguntarlo. Si te quedas aquí molestándome medio minuto más, te vas a llevar una torta.
vi_translation: - If you want to know, then go there and ask. If you stay here bothering me for even half a minute more, don't blame me.
tr_translation: "If you're so curious, go and see for yourself. But if you keep nagging me, things you won't like at all will happen to you."
es_translation: —If you want to find out, go ask about it. If you stay here bothering me for half a minute more, you're going to get a slap.

en: I paddled to the raft. Jim was awful disappointed, but I said never mind, Cairo would be the next place, I reckoned.
vi: Tôi quay trở về bè, Jim thất vọng vô cùng, nhưng tôi bảo không sao, chỗ sắp tới có thể là Cairo rồi.
tr: Sala geri döndüm. Jim büyük bir hayal kırıklığına uğramıştı, ama üzerinde durmamasını söyledim, Cairo bir sonraki kasabaydı büyük ihtimalle.
es: Volví a remo a la balsa. Jim se sintió muy desilusionado, pero le dije que no importaba, que según mis cálculos, El Cairo sería el pueblo siguiente.
vi_translation: I returned to the raft, Jim was extremely disappointed, but I told him it was okay, the place we were heading to could be Cairo.
tr_translation: I returned to the room. Jim was very disappointed, but I told him not to dwell on it; Cairo was probably the next town.
es_translation: I rowed back to the raft. Jim felt very disappointed, but I told him it didn't matter, that according to my calculations, Cairo would be the next town.

en: We passed another town before daylight, and I was going out again; but it was high ground, so I didn’t go. No high ground about Cairo, Jim said. I had forgot it. We laid up for the day on a tow-head tolerable close to the left-hand bank. I begun to suspicion something. So did Jim. I says:
vi: Chúng tôi lại đi qua một thị trấn khác trước khi trời sáng. Và tôi lại mò ra ngoài, nhưng chỗ này thì chỉ có núi, tôi không đi nữa. Jim bảo là ở Cairo không có núi đồi gì đâu. Tôi cũng quên đi mất. Ban ngày chúng tôi lại nghỉ ở một cái hốc ở bãi bên trên bờ sông. Tôi bắt đầu ngờ ngợ một cái gì. Jim cũng thế. Tôi nói:
tr: Gün doğmadan önce bir kasaba daha geçtik, ama yüksek bir yer olduğu için oraya gitmedim. Cairo civarında hiç dik yer olmadığını hatırlattı Jim. Ben unutmuştum oysa ki. Gündüz saatlerini soldaki kıyıya yakın sayılabilecek bir adacıkta geçirdik. Aklıma bir ihtimal gelmeye başlamıştı. Jim de işkillenmişti. “Belki de o sisli gece Cairo’yu geçtik,” dedim.
es: Pasamos otro pueblo antes del amanecer, y yo iba a volver a preguntar, pero estaba muy alto, así que no salí. «El Cairo no está en alto», dijo Jim. A mí se me había olvidado. Nos quedamos parados el día entero en un islote de hierba bastante cerca de la orilla izquierda. Empecé a sospechar algo. Jim también. Yo dije:
vi_translation: We passed through another town before dawn. And I ventured out again, but this place only had mountains, so I didn't go any further. Jim said there are no mountains or hills in Cairo. I forgot about it too. During the day, we rested in a hollow on the bank above the river. I started to suspect something. So did Jim. I said:
tr_translation: We passed another town before sunrise, but I didn't go there because it was a high place. Jim reminded me that there were no steep places around Cairo. However, I had forgotten that. We spent the daylight hours on a small island that could be considered close to the left shore. A possibility started to come to my mind. Jim was also getting suspicious. “Maybe we passed Cairo on that foggy night,” I said.
es_translation: We passed another town before dawn, and I was going to ask again, but it was very high, so I didn't go out. "Cairo is not high," said Jim. I had forgotten. We stayed the whole day on a grassy islet quite close to the left shore. I began to suspect something. Jim did too. I said:

en: “Maybe we went by Cairo in the fog that night.”
vi: - Hay có lẽ chúng mình đã đi qua Cairo trong cái đêm sương mù ấy rồi Jim.
tr: “Belki de o sisli gece Cairo’yu geçtik,” dedim.
es: —A lo mejor pasamos junto a El Cairo aquella noche de niebla.
vi_translation: - Or maybe we already passed through Cairo on that foggy night, Jim.
tr_translation: “Maybe we passed Cairo on that foggy night,” I said.
es_translation: —Maybe we passed by Cairo that foggy night.

en: “Doan’ le’s talk about it, Huck. Po’ niggers can’t have no luck. I awluz ’spected dat rattlesnake-skin warn’t done wid its work.”
vi: - Đừng nói chuyện ấy nữa, cậu Huck. Những người da đen nghèo khổ chả lẽ không bao giờ gặp may mắn cả ư. Tôi vẫn nghĩ rằng cái da rắn lột lấy chưa đến lúc đó báo oan đâu đấy.
tr: “Öyle şeyleğ söyleme, Huck. Zavallı zencileğin hiç bahtı yoktuğ zaten. O çıngığaklı yılan gömleğine dokunmanın bize kötü şans getiğmeye devam etmesinden koğkuyoğdum ben de.
es: —No hablemos de eso, Huck. Los pobres negros nunca tenemos suerte. Siempre he sospechado que aquella piel de serpiente de cascabel no había terminado su trabajo.
vi_translation: - Don't talk about that anymore, Huck. Poor black people never get lucky, do they? I still think that the snake skin hasn't brought its curse yet.
tr_translation: “Don’t say such things, Huck. The poor black man never had any luck anyway. I was also afraid that touching the rattlesnake skin would continue to bring us bad luck.”
es_translation: —Let's not talk about that, Huck. We poor Black folks never have luck. I've always suspected that rattlesnake skin hadn't finished its work.

en: “I wish I’d never seen that snake-skin, Jim—I do wish I’d never laid eyes on it.”
vi: - Giá như trước kia đừng nhìn vào cái da rắn ấy có phải tốt không Jim nhỉ. Tôi nghĩ giá như đừng nhìn vào nó thì hơn.
tr: “O yılan gömleğini görmez olaydım, Jim… Keşke hiç gözüme ilişmeseydi.
es: —Ojalá no hubiera visto nunca aquella piel de serpiente, Jim... ojalá no le hubiera echado nunca la vista encima.
vi_translation: - If only we hadn't looked at that snake skin before, wouldn't it have been better, Jim? I think it would have been better if we hadn't looked at it.
tr_translation: "I wish I had never seen that snake skin, Jim... I wish it had never caught my eye."
es_translation: —I wish I had never seen that snake skin, Jim... I wish I had never laid eyes on it.

en: “It ain’t yo’ fault, Huck; you didn’ know. Don’t you blame yo’self ’bout it.”
vi: - Cái đó không phải lỗi ở cậu đâu, cậu Huck. Vì là cậu không biết đấy chứ. Cậu đừng tự trách mình như vậy.
tr: “Senin hatan değil, Huck; neğeden bilecektin. Bunun için kendini suçlama.
es: —No es culpa tuya, Huck; tú no lo sabías. No te eches la culpa de eso.
vi_translation: - That's not your fault, Huck. It's because you didn't know. Don't blame yourself like that.
tr_translation: “It’s not your fault, Huck; how could you have known. Don’t blame yourself for this.”
es_translation: —It's not your fault, Huck; you didn't know. Don't blame yourself for that.

en: When it was daylight, here was the clear Ohio water inshore, sure enough, and outside was the old regular Muddy! So it was all up with Cairo.
vi: Trời sáng rõ. Đây đúng là nước xanh của con sông Ohio chảy vào phía trong này, và ngoài kia là bãi Muddy. Thôi thế là đi tong chuyện đi Cairo.
tr: Gün doğunca, berrak Ohio suyunun kıyıdan aktığını açık seçik gördük, daha açıkta ise bizim bildiğimiz çamurlu su akıyordu! Demek ki Cairo konusunda artık tartışılacak bir şey kalmamıştı.
es: Cuando amaneció vimos el agua clara del Ohio junto a la costa, sin duda alguna, y al lado venía el gran río como siempre. Así que nada que ver con El Cairo.
vi_translation: The sky is clear. This is indeed the green water of the Ohio River flowing inward here, and out there is the Muddy shore. So, the plan to go to Cairo is ruined.
tr_translation: When the sun rose, we clearly saw the clear Ohio water flowing from the shore, while farther out, the muddy water we knew was flowing! So, there was nothing left to argue about regarding Cairo.
es_translation: When dawn broke, we saw the clear water of the Ohio next to the shore, without a doubt, and beside it came the great river as always. So nothing to do with Cairo.

en: We talked it all over. It wouldn’t do to take to the shore; we couldn’t take the raft up the stream, of course. There warn’t no way but to wait for dark, and start back in the canoe and take the chances. So we slept all day amongst the cottonwood thicket, so as to be fresh for the work, and when we went back to the raft about dark the canoe was gone!
vi: Chúng tôi bàn tính với nhau mãi. lên bờ bây giờ thì không nên. Đẩy bè đi ngược dòng thì cố nhiên là không đi được. Chẳng có cách nào khác, chỉ chờ đến đêm, xuống xuồng đi quay lại xem mày ra có gì chăng. Thế là suốt ngày chúng tôi ngủ trong rừng rậm, để lấy lại sức. Cho đến chập tối quay ra chỗ giấu bè thì thấy chiếc xuồng đã biến mất.
tr: Bir yol bulmak için konuşmaya başladık. Kıyıya yanaşmanın bir anlamı yoktu, salı akıntıya karşı götürecek değildik herhalde. Karanlığın basmasını beklemekten ve kanoyla şansımızı denemekten başka seçeneğimiz kalmamıştı. Bu yüzden enerji toplamak için bütün gün sık ağaçların arasında uyuduk, ama hava kararırken salın oraya döndüğümüzde kanonun sırra kadem basmış olduğunu gördük!
es: Hablamos del asunto. No valía de nada ir a tierra; naturalmente, no podíamos llevar la balsa río arriba. No había nada que hacer más que esperar a que anocheciera, volvernos con la canoa y ver si teníamos suerte. Así que nos pasamos el día durmiendo entre los alamillos, para estar descansados para el trabajo, y cuando volvimos a la balsa al oscurecer, la canoa había desaparecido.
vi_translation: We discussed it with each other for a long time. It wasn't advisable to go ashore now. Of course, pushing the raft upstream was not possible. There was no other way, we just had to wait until night, get into the boat, and go back to see if anything had happened. So we spent the whole day sleeping in the dense forest to regain our strength. By dusk, when we returned to the place where we had hidden the raft, we found that the boat had disappeared.
tr_translation: We started talking to find a way. There was no point in approaching the shore; we certainly weren't going to take the raft against the current. We had no choice but to wait for darkness to fall and try our luck with the canoe. So we slept all day among the dense trees to gather energy, but when we returned to the raft as it got dark, we saw that the canoe had vanished without a trace!
es_translation: We talked about the matter. It was pointless to go ashore; naturally, we couldn't take the raft upstream. There was nothing to do but wait until nightfall, return with the canoe, and see if we got lucky. So we spent the day sleeping among the cottonwoods, to be rested for the work, and when we returned to the raft at dusk, the canoe had disappeared.

en: We didn’t say a word for a good while. There warn’t anything to say. We both knowed well enough it was some more work of the rattlesnake-skin; so what was the use to talk about it? It would only look like we was finding fault, and that would be bound to fetch more bad luck—and keep on fetching it, too, till we knowed enough to keep still.
vi: Chúng tôi lặng người đi một lát, không nói. Chẳng còn biết nói gì nữa. Cả hai đứa chúng tôi đều hiểu rằng đấy là cái da rắn nó báo oan đây, vậy thì còn nói đến nó làm gì nữa. Lúc đó thật đúng như chúng tôi đã làm một cái gì tội lỗi, và nghĩ rằng sẽ còn gặp chuyện rủi roi nữa đây. Nghĩ mãi và cả hai đứa cứ lặng im hoài.
tr: Uzun bir süre ikimizin de ağzını bıçak açmadı. Söyleyecek bir şeyimiz yoktu. Bunun da çıngıraklı yılan gömleğinin getirdiği uğursuzluklardan biri olduğunu biliyorduk; o halde diyecek ne vardı ki? Sanki suçu ona atıyormuşuz gibi olacaktı ve bu da daha fazla uğursuzluk getirecekti – sonunda biz çenemizi kapayana kadar uğursuzluk başımızdan eksik olmayacaktı.
es: No dijimos ni una palabra durante un buen rato. No había nada que decir. Los dos sabíamos perfectamente bien que era otra vez cosa de la piel de la serpiente de cascabel, así que, ¿de qué valía hablarlo? Aquello no sería más que como si estuviéramos buscando algo a que echar la culpa, y sin duda nos traería todavía más mala suerte, y seguiría trayéndola hasta que comprendiésemos que lo mejor era no hablar del tema.
vi_translation: We fell silent for a moment, not saying a word. There was nothing left to say. Both of us understood that it was the snake's skin bringing bad luck, so there was no point in talking about it anymore. At that moment, it truly felt like we had done something wrong, and we thought that more misfortune would come our way. We kept thinking and remained silent.
tr_translation: For a long time, neither of us could utter a word. We had nothing to say. We knew this was one of the misfortunes brought by the rattlesnake skin; so what was there to say? It would seem as if we were blaming it, and this would bring even more misfortune – until we finally shut our mouths, misfortune would not leave us alone.
es_translation: We didn't say a word for a good while. There was nothing to say. We both knew perfectly well that it was once again about the rattlesnake skin, so what was the point of talking about it? That would just be like looking for something to blame, and it would undoubtedly bring us even more bad luck, and it would keep bringing it until we understood that the best thing was not to talk about it.

en: So we shoved out after dark on the raft.
vi: Lúc trời đã tối, chúng tôi lại bò ra bè.
tr: Karanlık basınca salı çözüp yola koyulduk.
es: Así que después de oscurecer salimos en la balsa.
vi_translation: When it was already dark, we crawled back onto the raft.
tr_translation: When darkness fell, we untied the rope and set off on our way.
es_translation: So after it got dark, we went out on the raft.

en: Anybody that don’t believe yet that it’s foolishness to handle a snake-skin, after all that that snake-skin done for us, will believe it now if they read on and see what more it done for us.
vi: Những ai còn chưa tin rằng mó tay vào cái da rắn lột là một điều hết sức dại dột và sau đó cái da ráng nó sẽ báo hại như thế nào, thì bây giờ cũng sẽ phải tin, nếu như người ta thấy tình cảnh của chúng tôi lúc này.
tr: Yılan gömleğine dokunmanın aptalca olduğuna inanmayan varsa, yılan gömleğinin bize ettiklerini görünce inanacaktır; hele okumaya devam edip başımıza başka nelerin geldiğini öğrenince isterse inanmasın.
es: Y el que no se crea todavía que es una estupidez andar manejando pieles de serpiente después de todo lo que aquella piel de serpiente nos hizo a nosotros lo creerá ahora si continúa leyendo y ve lo que nos siguió haciendo.
vi_translation: Those who still do not believe that touching a shed snake skin is extremely foolish and that the snake skin will bring harm afterwards, will now have to believe it if they see our current situation.
tr_translation: If there is anyone who does not believe that touching a snake's skin is foolish, they will believe it when they see what the snake's skin has done to us; especially if they continue reading and learn what else has happened to us, they may choose not to believe it.
es_translation: And anyone who still doesn't believe that it's foolish to handle snake skins after everything that snake skin did to us will believe it now if they keep reading and see what it continued to do to us.

en: The place to buy canoes is off of rafts laying up at shore. But we didn’t see no rafts laying up; so we went along during three hours and more. Well, the night got gray and ruther thick, which is the next meanest thing to fog. You can’t tell the shape of the river, and you can’t see no distance. It got to be very late and still, and then along comes a steamboat up the river. We lit the lantern, and judged she would see it. Up-stream boats didn’t generly come close to us; they go out and follow the bars and hunt for easy water under the reefs; but nights like this they bull right up the channel against the whole river.
vi: Chỗ có thể mua xuồng được là chỉ gần nơi nào ở bờ sông có nhiều bè đóng lại ở đó. Nhưng chúng tôi không thấy chỗ nào có nhiều bè đóng lại cả, nên cứ phải tiếp tục đến hơn ba tiếng đồng hồ. Đêm đã bắt đầu ngả sang màu xám mờ mờ, và đó là dấu hiệu lại sắp có sương mù. Không thể nào nhìn rõ hơn bờ sông chỗ lồi chỗ lõm, và cũng không nhìn ra xa được nữa. Đêm đã khuya lắm và yên tính. Lúc đó bỗng có chiếc tàu thủy đang đi ngược dòng lên phía trên. Chúng tôi thắp đèn lên và nghĩ rằng chiếc tàu thuỷ sẽ trông thấy mình. Những tàu đi ngược dòng thường không bao giờ đi sát chúng tôi, họ đi cách xa tận phía ngoài và theo những chỗ nào mà dòng nước ở bên dưới không chảy xiết lắm. Nhưng vào những đêm mù như thế này thì họ cứ đi thẳng tuột.
tr: Salların karaya çekildiği kıyılarda genellikle satılık kano da bulunur. Ama karaya çekilmiş sal göremediğimiz için üç saat daha yola devam ettik. Bu arada gri ve yoğun bulutlar gece göğünü kapladı ki herhalde sisten sonra en kötüsü buydu. İnsan nehrin şeklini hesaplayamadığı gibi, etrafını da göremiyordu. Saat çok geç olmuştu ve hiç ses çıkmıyordu, sonra nehir yukarı çıkan bir buharlının tam karşıdan geldiğini fark ettik. Bizi görebilmesi için hemen fenerimizi yaktık. Nehir yukarı çıkan gemiler genelde bize pek yanaşmaz; sığlıkları izlerler; resiflerin altındaki durgun suları tercih ederler. Halbuki bunun gibi puslu gecelerde doğrudan ırmaktan yukarı gider; hiçbir şey için durmazlar.
es: El sitio donde comprar canoas es donde haya balsas atracadas en la ribera. Pero no vimos ninguna balsa atracada, así que seguimos adelante tres horas o más. Bueno, la noche se puso gris y el aire muy denso, que es lo peor que puede haber después de una niebla. No se ve la forma en el río ni se aprecia la distancia. Se hizo muy tarde en medio del silencio, y entonces, de pronto, apareció un barco de vapor río arriba. Encendimos la farola y creímos que la vería. Los barcos que remontan generalmente no se nos acercaban; iban buscando las barras de arena en busca del agua fácil bajo los arrecifes; pero en noches así suben por medio del canal enfrentándose con todo el río.
vi_translation: The place where you can buy a boat is only near where there are many rafts gathered by the riverbank. But we didn't see any place with many rafts gathered, so we had to continue for more than three hours. Night had begun to turn a faint gray, and that was a sign that fog was about to set in again. It was impossible to see the uneven riverbank clearly, and we couldn't see far anymore. It was very late at night and quiet. At that moment, a steamboat suddenly appeared, going upstream. We lit a lamp and thought that the steamboat would see us. Steamboats going upstream usually never go close to us; they stay far out and follow places where the water below isn't too swift. But on foggy nights like this, they just go straight ahead.
tr_translation: In the shores where rafts are pulled ashore, canoes for sale are usually found as well. But since we couldn't see any rafts pulled ashore, we continued on our way for another three hours. Meanwhile, gray and dense clouds covered the night sky, which was probably the worst thing after the fog. One couldn't calculate the shape of the river, nor could they see their surroundings. It was very late and there was no sound at all, then we noticed a steamboat coming directly towards us from upstream. We immediately lit our lantern so that they could see us. Boats going upstream usually don't come close to us; they follow the shallows; they prefer the calm waters beneath the reefs. However, on foggy nights like this, they go straight up the river; they don't stop for anything.
es_translation: The place to buy canoes is where there are rafts docked on the riverbank. But we didn't see any docked rafts, so we continued on for three hours or more. Well, the night turned gray and the air became very dense, which is the worst thing that can happen after fog. You can't see the shape of the river or gauge the distance. It got very late in the midst of the silence, and then, suddenly, a steamboat appeared upstream. We lit the lantern and thought it would see us. The boats going upstream generally didn't come close to us; they were looking for sandbars in search of easy water under the reefs; but on nights like this, they go up the middle of the channel facing the entire river.

en: We could hear her pounding along, but we didn’t see her good till she was close. She aimed right for us. Often they do that and try to see how close they can come without touching; sometimes the wheel bites off a sweep, and then the pilot sticks his head out and laughs, and thinks he’s mighty smart. Well, here she comes, and we said she was going to try and shave us; but she didn’t seem to be sheering off a bit. She was a big one, and she was coming in a hurry, too, looking like a black cloud with rows of glow-worms around it; but all of a sudden she bulged out, big and scary, with a long row of wide-open furnace doors shining like red-hot teeth, and her monstrous bows and guards hanging right over us. There was a yell at us, and a jingling of bells to stop the engines, a powwow of cussing, and whistling of steam—and as Jim went overboard on one side and I on the other, she come smashing straight through the raft.
vi: Chúng tôi có thể nghe rõ tiếng lịch xịch nhưng không trông thấy rõ tàu thuỷ trước khi nó tới gần. Chiếc tàu như đang nhằm thẳng phía chúng tôi đi lên. Thường thường họ vẫn làm như thế để thử xem họ có thể đi sát tới mức nào mà vẫn không chậm. Có khi cái guồng tàu của họ đập gẫy mất một mái chèo của người ta rồi, lúc đó anh lái tàu lại còn thò đầu ra cười. tưởng như vậy là hay lắm. Chiếc tàu thuỷ tiên đến, chúng tôi bụng bảo dạ có lẽ nó định liếm mình đây, mà hình như nó không có vẻ gì là tránh ra cả. Chiếc tàu to lắm, lại đi nhanh nữa, trông như một đám mây to đen tua tủa những guồng và có những con đom đóm ở xung quanh. Nhưng rồi bất thình lình nó quặt ra, trông lù lù khung khiếp, với một dãy cửa sáng lên trông như một hàm răng lớn đỏ chót, với những guồng những mái muốn ụp cả lên đầu chúng tôi. Có tiếng thét gọi, rồi một hồi chuông lắc vang lên để hãm mãy lại, những tiếng càu nhàu chửi, tiếng máy rít, và vừa lúc Jim nhảy sang một bên, tôi cũng nhảy sang một bên, thì chiếc guồng tàu đã quật thẳng cái bè của chúng tôi vỡ tan.
tr: Geminin sesini duyuyorduk ama iyice yaklaşana kadar kendisini görmedik. Doğruca üstümüze geliyordu. Çoğu kez bunu yaparlar ve değmeden ne kadar yakından geçebileceklerini göstermek isterler; bazen çark sala ucundan çarpar ve dümenci başını çıkarıp kahkahalarla güler; kendini çok akıllı zanneder çünkü. İşte geliyordu, herhalde bizi sıyırıp geçer diye düşünüyorduk, ama birazcık bile yolunu değiştirmeyecekmiş gibi bir hali vardı. Büyük bir vapurdu, hızlı da geliyordu; yanları ateşböcekleriyle çevrili koca bir bulut gibi görünüyordu; sonra aniden tepemize çıktı, kızıl kor dişler gibi ışıldayan ardına dek açık ocak ağızları, başımızın üstündeki devasa pruvası ve puntelleriyle kocaman ve ürkütücüydü. Birinin bize bağırdığını duydum, motorun durdurulması için çıngıraklar çaldı, buharın ıslığını işittim; ama çok geçti, Jim bir taraftan, ben öbür taraftan can havliyle suya atlarken gemi sala tam göbeğinden çarptı.
es: Podíamos oír su motor, pero no lo vimos bien hasta que se acercó. Venía directo hacia nosotros. Muchas veces hacen eso y tratan de ver hasta dónde pueden acercarse sin tocarlo a uno; a veces la rueda arranca un tablón, y entonces el piloto asoma la cabeza y se echa a reír y se cree muy listo. Bueno, aquí viene, y decidimos que iba a tratar de afeitarnos, pero no parecía desviarse ni un poco. Era grande y venía a toda velocidad, como una nube negra con filas de luciérnagas a los lados; pero de pronto se vio entero, enorme que daba miedo, con una fila larga de portezuelas de hornos abiertas y brillantes como dientes al rojo y con los costados y las barandillas monstruosos justo encima de nosotros. Alguien nos gritó, y se oyó un ruido de campanas para frenar las máquinas, un montón de juramentos y el silbido del vapor, y justo cuando Jim saltaba de un lado y yo del otro, arremetió contra la balsa y la hizo añicos.
vi_translation: We could clearly hear the clattering sound but couldn't see the ship clearly until it got closer. The ship seemed to be heading straight towards us. They usually do this to see how close they can get without slowing down. Sometimes their paddle wheel breaks someone's oar, and then the helmsman sticks his head out and laughs, thinking it's quite amusing. As the ship approached, we thought it might hit us, and it didn't seem to be veering away at all. The ship was very large and moving quickly, looking like a big dark cloud bristling with paddle wheels and surrounded by fireflies. But then suddenly it swerved, looming menacingly, with a row of lit windows resembling a large set of red teeth, and its paddles and oars seemed ready to crash down on us. There were shouts, then a bell rang to slow the engine, followed by curses, the sound of the engine screeching, and just as Jim jumped to one side and I jumped to the other, the ship's paddle wheel smashed our raft to pieces.
tr_translation: We could hear the sound of the ship, but we didn't see it until it got really close. It was coming straight at us. They often do this and want to show how close they can pass without hitting; sometimes they hit the edge of the boat and the helmsman sticks his head out and laughs; he thinks he's very clever. Here it was coming, we thought it would just graze us, but it seemed like it wouldn't change its course even a little. It was a big steamer, coming fast; it looked like a huge cloud surrounded by fireflies; then suddenly it was upon us, with its wide-open furnace mouths glowing like red-hot teeth, its massive prow and stanchions above our heads, it was enormous and terrifying. I heard someone shouting at us, bells rang to stop the engine, I heard the hiss of steam; but it was too late, as Jim jumped to one side and I to the other in a desperate attempt to escape, the ship struck the boat right in the middle.
es_translation: We could hear its engine, but we didn't see it clearly until it got closer. It was coming straight towards us. Many times they do that and try to see how close they can get without touching you; sometimes the wheel rips off a plank, and then the pilot sticks his head out and laughs, thinking he's very clever. Well, here it comes, and we decided it was going to try to shave us, but it didn't seem to veer off even a little. It was big and coming at full speed, like a black cloud with rows of fireflies on the sides; but suddenly it came fully into view, enormous and frightening, with a long row of open furnace doors glowing like red-hot teeth and with monstrous sides and railings right above us. Someone shouted at us, and there was a sound of bells to stop the engines, a bunch of curses and the hiss of steam, and just as Jim jumped to one side and I to the other, it crashed into the raft and smashed it to pieces.

en: I dived—and I aimed to find the bottom, too, for a thirty-foot wheel had got to go over me, and I wanted it to have plenty of room. I could always stay under water a minute; this time I reckon I stayed under a minute and a half. Then I bounced for the top in a hurry, for I was nearly busting. I popped out to my armpits and blowed the water out of my nose, and puffed a bit. Of course there was a booming current; and of course that boat started her engines again ten seconds after she stopped them, for they never cared much for raftsmen; so now she was churning along up the river, out of sight in the thick weather, though I could hear her.
vi: Tôi lao người xuống nước và lặn sâu xuống đấy sông, vì chiếc guồng to đến tám chín thước như thế có thể đập vào đầu mình chưa biết chừng, và tôi cũng cần phải tránh cho thật xa. Tôi có thể lặn ở dưới nước đến một phút, nhưng lần này tôi tưởng là mình đã ở đáy nước đến một phút rưỡi. Rồi tôi ngoi lên mặt nước, vì đã gần nghẹt thở. Tôi đưa tay lên nhay nhay cho nước ra khỏi lỗ mũi, xì xì vài cái. Cố nhiên là ở chỗ này nước cuốn, và chiếc tàu kia chỉ sau độ mười giây là chạy máy như thường, vì có bao giờ họ thèm biết đến số phận những người đi trên thuyền bè ra sao. Lúc đó, chiếc tàu lại lạch xạch đi, rồi mất hút trong đám sương mù, mặc dầu tiếng máy vọng lại tôi vẫn còn nghe thấy.
tr: Daldım – hatta dibe kadar gitmek istiyordum, çünkü 10 metre çapındaki çark üzerimden geçecekti ve ona yer bırakmalıydım. Normalde suyun altında bir dakika kadar kalabilirim, galiba bu kez neredeyse bir buçuk dakika kalmıştım. Ardından olanca hızımla yüzeye çıktım, çünkü ciğerlerim patlamak üzereydi. Neredeyse koltukaltlarıma kadar yükselip burnuma dolan suyu püskürttüm, sonra da derin derin nefes aldım. Müthiş, güldür güldür bir akıntı vardı, üstelik gemi de on saniye sonra tekrar motorları çalıştırdı, çünkü salcıları asla umursamazlar; vapur yine nehir yukarı köpükler saçarak ilerliyordu, pusun içinde gözden kayboldu ama sesini duyabiliyordum.
es: Salté y me propuse llegar hasta el fondo, porque me iba a pasar por encima una rueda de treinta pies y yo quería tener mucho margen. Siempre he podido aguantar un minuto debajo del agua; creo que aquella vez aguanté un minuto y medio. Después salí rápido a la superficie, porque estaba a punto de reventar. Saqué bastante la cabeza y me soplé el agua de la nariz, jadeando un poco. Naturalmente, había una corriente enorme, y naturalmente aquel barco volvió a ponerse en marcha diez segundos después de haber parado las máquinas, porque nunca se preocupaban mucho por los balseros, de forma que seguía chapaleando río arriba, invisible en medio de aquel aire denso, aunque todavía se podía oír el ruido que producía.
vi_translation: I plunged into the water and dived deep to the riverbed, because the large wheel, which was about eight or nine meters in diameter, could potentially hit my head, and I needed to stay far away from it. I could stay underwater for up to a minute, but this time I thought I had been at the bottom for about a minute and a half. Then I surfaced, as I was nearly out of breath. I raised my hand to rub the water out of my nose, snorting a few times. Of course, in this spot, the water was swift, and the ship would start its engine as usual after about ten seconds, as they never cared about the fate of those on small boats. At that moment, the ship chugged away and disappeared into the fog, although I could still hear the engine's sound echoing back.
tr_translation: I dived – I even wanted to go all the way to the bottom, because the 10-meter diameter wheel was going to pass over me and I needed to make room for it. Normally, I can stay underwater for about a minute, but I think this time I stayed for almost a minute and a half. Then I surfaced with all my speed, because my lungs were about to burst. I almost rose up to my armpits and blew out the water that had filled my nose, then took deep breaths. There was a tremendous, roaring current, and moreover, the ship started its engines again ten seconds later, because they never care about the raftsmen; the ferry was once again moving upstream, spewing foam, disappearing into the mist, but I could still hear its sound.
es_translation: I jumped and aimed to reach the bottom, because a thirty-foot wheel was going to pass over me and I wanted to have plenty of room. I have always been able to hold my breath underwater for a minute; I think that time I held it for a minute and a half. Then I quickly surfaced, because I was about to burst. I stuck my head out quite a bit and blew the water out of my nose, panting a little. Naturally, there was a huge current, and naturally that ship started up again ten seconds after stopping the engines, because they never cared much about the rafters, so I kept paddling upstream, invisible in the midst of that dense air, although you could still hear the noise it made.

en: I sung out for Jim about a dozen times, but I didn’t get any answer; so I grabbed a plank that touched me while I was “treading water,” and struck out for shore, shoving it ahead of me. But I made out to see that the drift of the current was towards the left-hand shore, which meant that I was in a crossing; so I changed off and went that way.
vi: Tôi lên tiếng gọi Jim đến hàng chục lần, nhưng không thấy trả lời. Sau tôi bám lấy một mảnh ván gần đó, rồi lấy chân đạp nước bơi vào bờ, đẩy mảnh ván đi trước. Nhưng bỗng tôi nhận ra nước cuốn về phía bờ bên trái, nghĩa là tôi đang đi ngược, nên tôi lại quay lại bơi theo dòng nước chảy.
tr: Jim’e en az on kez seslendim, ama hiç cevap gelmedi. Ben de suyun içinde cebelleşirken elime gelen bir kalasa tutundum ve onu önümde tutup ayaklarımı çırparak kıyıya doğru yüzdüm. Ama sonra akıntının beni soldaki kıyıya doğru ittiğini fark ettim, demek ki kavşaklardan birine gelmiştim, bunun üzerine ben de yolumu değiştirip sol tarafa gittim.
es: Llamé a Jim media docena de veces, pero sin recibir respuesta; así que agarré un tablón que me tocó mientras yo pedaleaba en el agua y me dirigí hacia tierra, bien agarrado a él. Pero logré ver que la corriente llevaba hacia la ribera de la izquierda, lo cual significaba que yo estaba en medio de un cruce de corrientes, así que cambié y seguí por allí.
vi_translation: I called out to Jim dozens of times, but there was no response. Then I grabbed onto a nearby plank, kicked the water with my feet, and swam towards the shore, pushing the plank ahead of me.
