Bir köşede deriden bir bavul, diğer köşede bir gitar kutusu duruyordu, ayrıca odanın sağında solunda kızların sevdiği cinsten biblolar ve süs eşyaları vardı. Kral bu aksesuarlarla odanın daha sıcak ve hoş olduğunu, yerlerine değiştirmeye gerek duymadığını söyledi. Dükün odası pek küçüktü, ama o da gayet iyiydi, tıpkı benim tavan arasındaki odacığım gibi.
es: Así que Mary Jane nos hizo subir y nos enseñó sus habitaciones, que eran sencillas pero agradables. Dijo que mandaría sacar de su habitación sus vestidos y demás cosas si molestaban al tío Harvey, pero él dijo que no. Los vestidos estaban colgados junto a una pared, tapados por una cortina de calicó que llegaba hasta el suelo. En un rincón había un viejo baúl de crin, y en otro, un estuche de guitarra; el resto estaba lleno de adornos y de esas cosas con las que les gusta a las muchachas alegrar una habitación. El rey dijo que resultaba mucho más hogareño y agradable con aquellos adornos, así que no había que cambiarlos. La habitación del duque era muy pequeña, pero más que suficiente, igual que mi cubículo.
vi_translation: Mary Jane showed them the guest room. The room looked quite ordinary, but it was tidy and clean. She said she would move her clothes and personal items out of the room if Uncle Hary wanted, but the king declined. Her clothes were hung on the wall, covered by a fabric curtain that reached down to the wooden floor. In one corner, there were two small boxes containing jewelry. In the other corner, there was a music box and other toys; it seemed the girls only sat and played together in this room. The king said to leave it as it was to maintain a homely atmosphere and keep it cheerful, without moving anything. The duke's room was smaller but also quite nice. As for my room, it was just okay.
tr_translation: Mary Jane took us all upstairs and showed us our simple yet charming rooms. She said that Uncle Harvey could take the clothes and other knick-knacks from the room if they would get in his way, but he replied that he wouldn't be bothered at all. The clothes were hung on the wall, with a flannel curtain drawn from ceiling to floor in front of them. In one corner, there was a leather suitcase, and in another corner, a guitar case, and there were knick-knacks and ornaments that girls like scattered around the room. The King said that the room felt warmer and more pleasant with these accessories and that there was no need to change their places. The Duke's room was quite small, but it was also very nice, just like my little attic room.
es_translation: So Mary Jane made us go up and showed us her rooms, which were simple but pleasant. She said she would have her dresses and other things removed from her room if they bothered Uncle Harvey, but he said no. The dresses were hung next to a wall, covered by a calico curtain that reached the floor. In one corner there was an old hair trunk, and in another, a guitar case; the rest was filled with decorations and those things that girls like to use to brighten up a room. The king said it was much more homely and pleasant with those decorations, so there was no need to change them. The duke's room was very small, but more than sufficient, just like my cubicle.

en: That night they had a big supper, and all them men and women was there, and I stood behind the king and the duke’s chairs and waited on them, and the niggers waited on the rest. Mary Jane she set at the head of the table, with Susan alongside of her, and said how bad the biscuits was, and how mean the preserves was, and how ornery and tough the fried chickens was—and all that kind of rot, the way women always do for to force out compliments; and the people all knowed everything was tiptop, and said so—said “How do you get biscuits to brown so nice?” and “Where, for the land’s sake, did you get these amaz’n pickles?” and all that kind of humbug talky-talk, just the way people always does at a supper, you know.
vi: Đêm đó, họ đánh chén một bữa ra trò. Tất cả các ông bà đều có mặt. Tôi đứng đằng sau nhà vua và quận công để hầu hạ, còn những người da đen hầu hạ các vị khách khác. Mary Jane ngôi ở đầu bàn, bên cạnh là Susan; có chê tất cả các món ăn, nào là bánh sao mà làm dở quá, món thịt sao mà tồi quá, món gà rán sao mà dai quá. Đàn bà rất hay có cái giọng như thế, cốt để nhắc khéo cho người khác khen mình. Còn những người dự bữa ăn thì thấy món nào cũng ngon cả. Họ nói: - Cô làm thế nào mà bánh nướng thơm thế? Cô tìm ở đâu những loại rau ngon thế? ... vv.
tr: O gece büyük bir yemek verildi, erkeklerin ve kadınların hemen hepsi geldi, ben kralın ve dükün sandalyelerinin arkasında durup hizmet ettim, zenciler de geri kalanlara hizmet ettiler. Mary Jane masanın başına oturdu, Susan yanında oturuyordu ve kurabiyelerin ne kadar kötü, şekerlemelerin ne kadar adi olduğundan bahsediyordu, tavuk kızartmasının çok yavan ve sert olduğunu da söyledi – kadınların her zaman yaptığı gibi zorla kompliman duymak için böyle zırvalayıp durdu. İnsanların her şeyin çok güzel olduğunu bilmelerini ve hatta dillendirmelerini bekliyordu. İstiyordu ki, “Bu kurabiyeleri nasıl bu kadar kahverengi ve kıtır kıtır yapabildin? Tanrı aşkına, bu şahane turşuları sen mi kurdun?” filan gibi şarlatanca gevezelikler edilsin; hani insanlar böyle toplu yemeklerde hep yaparlar ya, onlardan işte.
es: Aquella noche celebraron una gran cena en la que estuvieron todos los hombres y las mujeres, yo me quedé detrás de las sillas del rey y del duque para servirlos y los negros se encargaron de todos los demás. Mary Jane se sentó a la cabecera de la mesa, con Susan a su lado, comentando lo malos que eran los bollos y lo pobres que eran las conservas y lo ordinarios y duros que resultaban los pollos fritos, y todo ese género de bobadas, como hacen siempre las mujeres en busca de cumplidos, pero la gente sabía que estaba todo magnífico y se lo dijo: «¿Cómo consigues que los bollos te salgan tan tostaditos y tan bien?», y «¿dónde has conseguido estos encurtidos tan estupendos?» y todas esas bobadas que la gente dice por decir en las cenas, ya se sabe.
vi_translation: That night, they had a grand feast. All the gentlemen and ladies were present. I stood behind the king and the duke to serve, while the black servants attended to the other guests. Mary Jane sat at the head of the table, with Susan beside her; she criticized all the dishes, saying the cake was poorly made, the meat was terrible, and the fried chicken was too tough. Women often have such a tone, just to subtly remind others to praise them. But the other diners found every dish delicious. They said: - How do you make the cakes smell so good? Where do you find such delicious vegetables? ... etc.
tr_translation: That night a grand dinner was given, almost all the men and women came, I stood behind the chairs of the king and the duke and served, while the black people served the others. Mary Jane sat at the head of the table, Susan sat next to her and was talking about how bad the cookies were, how cheap the candies were, and also said that the roast chicken was very bland and tough – just like women always do, babbling nonsense to force compliments. She expected people to know and even say that everything was very nice. She wanted them to say, “How did you make these cookies so brown and crispy? For God's sake, did you make these wonderful pickles yourself?” and such charlatan chatter; you know, the kind people always do at such communal meals.
es_translation: That night they held a great dinner where all the men and women were present; I stayed behind the chairs of the king and the duke to serve them, and the black servants took care of everyone else. Mary Jane sat at the head of the table, with Susan beside her, commenting on how bad the buns were and how poor the preserves were and how ordinary and tough the fried chickens were, and all that kind of nonsense, as women always do in search of compliments, but people knew everything was magnificent and told her: "How do you get the buns so toasty and so good?" and "Where did you get these wonderful pickles?" and all that nonsense people say just to say at dinners, you know.

en: And when it was all done me and the hare-lip had supper in the kitchen off of the leavings, whilst the others was helping the niggers clean up the things. The hare-lip she got to pumping me about England, and blest if I didn’t think the ice was getting mighty thin sometimes. She says:
vi: Khi mọi người đã ăn xong, tôi và cô sứt môi đem những thức ăn thừa xuống bếp ngồi ăn với nhau. Trong khi đó, những người khác giúp anh da đen quét dọn bàn ghế. Cô sứt môi hỏi chuyện tôi về nước Anh. Thật là nguy hại, giá lúc này có lẽ nẻ thì tôi cũng chui ngay xuống đất. Cô ta hỏi:
tr: Herkes yiyip içtikten sonra ben ve tavşan-dudak mutfakta artıklarla yemeğimizi yedik, diğerleri de zencilerin bulaşıkları yıkamasına yardım etti. Tavşan-dudak beni İngiltere konusunda sıkıştırmaya başladı ve birkaç kez çok fena köşeye sıkıştığımı hissettim. “Kralı hiç gördün mü?
es: Y cuando todo se acabó, la del labio leporino y yo nos comimos las sobras en la cocina, mientras los demás ayudaban a los negros a limpiar las cosas. La del labio leporino se puso a preguntarme cosas de Inglaterra, y que me cuelguen si no me pareció que a veces las cosas se estaban poniendo difíciles. Va y dice:
vi_translation: When everyone had finished eating, the girl with the cleft lip and I took the leftovers down to the kitchen to eat together. Meanwhile, the others helped the black man clean up the tables and chairs. The girl with the cleft lip asked me about England. It was truly embarrassing; if there had been a crack in the ground, I would have crawled right into it. She asked:
tr_translation: After everyone had eaten and drunk, the harelip and I ate our meal in the kitchen with the leftovers, while the others helped the blacks wash the dishes. The harelip started pressing me about England, and a few times I felt really cornered. “Have you ever seen the king?”
es_translation: And when it was all over, the girl with the cleft lip and I ate the leftovers in the kitchen, while the others helped the black people clean up. The girl with the cleft lip started asking me things about England, and hang me if it didn’t seem like things were getting difficult at times. She goes and says:

en: “Did you ever see the king?”
vi: - Anh đã trông thấy vua nước Anh bao giờ chưa?
tr: “Kralı hiç gördün mü?
es: —¿Has visto al rey alguna vez?
vi_translation: - Have you ever seen the King of England?
tr_translation: “Have you ever seen the king?”
es_translation: —Have you ever seen the king?

en: “Who? William Fourth? Well, I bet I have—he goes to our church.” I knowed he was dead years ago, but I never let on. So when I says he goes to our church, she says:
vi: - Ai, William đệ tứ ấy à? Tất nhiên rồi, ông ấy vẫn hay đi lễ ở nhà thờ chúng tôi. Tôi biết là William đã chết từ lâu, nhưng tôi cứ mặc kệ. Thấy tôi nói là vua hay đi lễ nhà thờ ở chỗ tôi, cô ta lại hỏi:
tr: “Kim? Dördüncü William mı? Tabii ki gördüm… Bizim kiliseye gelir.” Yıllar önce öldüğünü biliyordum ama çaktırmadım. Kralın bizim kiliseye geldiğini söylemem üzerine kız sordu:
es: —¿A quién? ¿A Guillermo IV? Hombre, y tanto que sí: va a nuestra iglesia. —Yo sabía que había muerto hacía años, pero no hice comentarios. Así que cuando dije que iba a nuestra iglesia ella preguntó:
vi_translation: - Oh, William the Fourth? Of course, he still often attends services at our church. I know that William has been dead for a long time, but I just ignore it. Seeing me say that the king often goes to church at my place, she asked again:
tr_translation: “Who? William the Fourth? Of course, I’ve seen him… He comes to our church.” I knew he had died years ago, but I didn't let on. Upon saying that the king came to our church, the girl asked:
es_translation: —To whom? To William IV? Man, of course: he goes to our church. I knew he had died years ago, but I didn't comment. So when I said he went to our church, she asked:

en: “What—regular?”
vi: - Sao? Đi lễ luôn à?
tr: “Nasıl… Düzenli olarak mı?
es: —¿Cómo... siempre va?
vi_translation: - What? Going to the ceremony already?
tr_translation: “How… Regularly?”
es_translation: —How... is it always going?

en: “Yes—regular. His pew’s right over opposite ourn—on t’other side the pulpit.”
vi: - Phải, đi luôn. Ghế ông ấy ngồi ngay ở đằng trước chỗ chúng tôi ấy; ở phía bên chỗ giảng đạo.
tr: Düzenli olarak mı? “Evet… Düzenli olarak. Onun bölmesi bizimkinin tam karşısında… Kürsünün diğer tarafında.
es: —Sí, siempre. Tiene el banco frente al nuestro, al otro lado del púlpito.
vi_translation: - Yes, let's go right away. His seat is right in front of where we are; on the side where the sermon is given.
tr_translation: “Yes... Regularly. His compartment is directly across from ours... On the other side of the podium.”
es_translation: —Yes, always. He has the pew in front of ours, on the other side of the pulpit.

en: “I thought he lived in London?”
vi: - Tôi tưởng ông ấy ở Luân Đôn chứ?
tr: “Kral Londra’da oturuyor sanıyordum, öyle değil mi?
es: —Creía que vivía en Londres.
vi_translation: - I thought he was in London?
tr_translation: “I thought the King lived in London, didn't he?”
es_translation: —I thought you lived in London.

en: “Well, he does. Where would he live?”
vi: - Phải, ông ấy ở Luân Đôn chứ còn ở đâu nữa?
tr: “Evet, orada oturuyor. Nerede oturacaktı ki?
es: —Hombre, claro. ¿Dónde iba a vivir?
vi_translation: - Yes, he is in London, where else would he be?
tr_translation: “Yes, sitting there. Where else would they sit?”
es_translation: —Man, of course. Where else would I live?

en: “But I thought you lived in Sheffield?”
vi: - Nhưng tôi tưởng anh ở Sheffield cơ mà?
tr: “Ama siz Sheffield’da oturuyorsunuz sanıyordum. Orası başka bir şehir.
es: —Pero yo creía que vosotros vivíais en Sheffield.
vi_translation: - But I thought you were in Sheffield?
tr_translation: “But I thought you lived in Sheffield. That's a different city.”
es_translation: —But I thought you lived in Sheffield.

en: I see I was up a stump. I had to let on to get choked with a chicken bone, so as to get time to think how to get down again. Then I says:
vi: Tôi đâm ra lúng túng. Tôi phải làm bộ như bị mắc một cái xương gà trong cổ để có thì giờ suy nghĩ. Rồi tôi nói:
tr: Bir an afalladım. Boğazıma kemik tavuğu kaçmış gibi yapıp nasıl çark edeceğimi bulmaya çalıştım. Nihayet şöyle dedim:
es: Vi que me tenía acorralado. Tuve que hacer como que me atragantaba con un hueso de pollo, para pensar en cómo salir de aquélla. Entonces dije:
vi_translation: I became confused. I had to pretend that a chicken bone was stuck in my throat to have time to think. Then I said:
tr_translation: I was momentarily stunned. I pretended as if a chicken bone was stuck in my throat and tried to figure out how to backtrack. Finally, I said:
es_translation: I saw that he had me cornered. I had to pretend I was choking on a chicken bone to think about how to get out of that situation. Then I said:

en: “I mean he goes to our church regular when he’s in Sheffield. That’s only in the summer time, when he comes there to take the sea baths.”
vi: - Nghĩa là tôi muốn nói rằng ông ấy vẫn hay đến lễ ở nhà thờ chúng tôi khi nào ông ấy tời Sheffield. Đó chỉ là về mùa hè thôi, nhưng khi ông ấy đi tắm biển ấy mà.
tr: “Sheffield’de olduğu zaman bizim kiliseye düzenli olarak geliyor demek istedim. Sadece yazları geliyor denize girmek istediği zamanlarda.
es: —Quiero decir que siempre va a nuestra iglesia cuando está en Sheffield. Eso es sólo en verano, cuando va a darse baños de mar.
vi_translation: - I mean to say that he often attends services at our church whenever he comes to Sheffield. That's only during the summer, but when he goes to the beach, you know.
tr_translation: "I meant to say that when he is in Sheffield, he comes to our church regularly. He only comes in the summers when he wants to go swimming."
es_translation: —I mean that he always goes to our church when he is in Sheffield. That's only in the summer, when he goes to take sea baths.

en: “Why, how you talk—Sheffield ain’t on the sea.”
vi: - Anh nói thế nào ấy! Sheffield đâu có gần biển
tr: “Yok elinin körü… Sheffield’in denize kıyısı yok ki.
es: —Pero qué cosas dices... Sheffield no está en el mar.
vi_translation: - What are you talking about! Sheffield is not near the sea
tr_translation: "No way, you fool..." "Sheffield doesn't have a coast.""
es_translation: —But what are you saying... Sheffield is not by the sea.

en: “Well, who said it was?”
vi: - Ai bảo là gần biển?
tr: “Kim var dedi? “Sen dedin.
es: —Bueno, ¿y quién ha dicho que sí?
vi_translation: - Who said it's near the sea?
tr_translation: “Who said it?” "You said it.""
es_translation: —Well, and who said yes?

en: “Why, you did.”
vi: - Anh vừa nói mà.
tr: “Ben öyle bir şey demedim.
es: —Pues tú.
vi_translation: - I just said it.
tr_translation: “I didn't say such a thing.”
es_translation: —Well, you.

en: “I didn’t.”
vi: - Không, tôi không nói.
tr: “Hayatta o tür bir şey söylemem.
es: —No.
vi_translation: - No, I won't say.
tr_translation: “I would never say such a thing in my life.”
es_translation: —No.

en: “I never said nothing of the kind.”
vi: - Tôi chẳng nói thế bao giờ.
tr: “Hayatta o tür bir şey söylemem.
es: —Yo no he dicho nada parecido.
vi_translation: - I never said that.
tr_translation: “I would never say such a thing in my life.”
es_translation: —I haven't said anything like that.

en: “Well, what did you say, then?”
vi: - Thế anh vừa nó cái gì?
tr: “O halde ne dedin?
es: —Bueno, entonces, ¿qué has dicho?
vi_translation: - So what did you just say?
tr_translation: “So, what did you say?”
es_translation: —Well, then, what did you say?

en: “Said he come to take the sea baths—that’s what I said.”
vi: - Tôi nói là ông ấy đến để tắm biển.
tr: “Oraya denize girmeye geldiğini söyledim… Aynen böyle dedim.
es: —Dije que iba a tomar los baños de mar; eso es lo que dije.
vi_translation: - I said that he came to swim in the sea.
tr_translation: “I told him that he came there to swim in the sea… I said it exactly like this.”
es_translation: —I said I was going to take sea baths; that's what I said.

en: “Well, then, how’s he going to take the sea baths if it ain’t on the sea?”
vi: - Được, làm thế nào mà ông ấy lại tắm biển được trong khi Sheffield không gần biển?
tr: “Tamam işte! Denize kıyısı yoksa nasıl denize girecek?
es: —Bueno, entonces, ¿cómo va a tomar los baños de mar si no está en el mar?
vi_translation: - Okay, how could he go swimming in the sea when Sheffield is not near the sea?
tr_translation: “That's it! If it doesn't have a coast, how will it go into the sea?”
es_translation: —Well, then, how are you going to take sea baths if you're not in the sea?

en: “Looky here,” I says; “did you ever see any Congress-water?”
vi: - Thế cô trông thấy nước ở Congress bao giờ chưa?
tr: “Şimdi iyi dinle bakalım, hiç maden suyu gördün mü?
es: —Mira —respondí—, ¿has tomado alguna vez agua mineral?
vi_translation: - Have you ever seen the water at Congress?
tr_translation: “Now listen carefully, have you ever seen mineral water?”
es_translation: —Look —I replied—, have you ever had mineral water?

en: “Well, did you have to go to Congress to get it?”
vi: - Thế cô có phải đi đến đó lấy nước không?
tr: “Peki maden suyu görmek için madene mi gitmen gerekiyor?
es: —Bueno, ¿y tuviste que ir a una mina a buscarla?
vi_translation: - So, do you have to go there to get water?
tr_translation: “So, do you need to go to the mine to see mineral water?”
es_translation: —Well, did you have to go to a mine to look for it?

en: “Well, neither does William Fourth have to go to the sea to get a sea bath.”
vi: - Vậy thì vua William cũng không cần phải ra tận biển để mà tắm.
tr: “Dördüncü William’ın da denize girmek için denize gitmesi gerekmiyor.
es: —Bueno, pues tampoco tiene Guillermo IV que ir al mar para darse un baño de mar.
vi_translation: - Then King William doesn't need to go all the way to the sea to bathe.
tr_translation: “William the Fourth doesn't need to go to the sea to take a dip in the sea.”
es_translation: —Well, then, neither does William IV have to go to the sea to take a sea bath.

en: “How does he get it, then?”
vi: - Thế làm thế nào?
tr: “Peki o zaman denizi nereden buluyor?
es: —Entonces, ¿cómo se los da?
vi_translation: - So how do we do it?
tr_translation: “Well, then where does he find the sea?”
es_translation: —So, how does he give them to them?

en: “Gets it the way people down here gets Congress-water—in barrels. There in the palace at Sheffield they’ve got furnaces, and he wants his water hot. They can’t bile that amount of water away off there at the sea. They haven’t got no conveniences for it.”
vi: - Thì làm như mọi người ở đây đi lấy nước Congress chứ sao, nghĩa là lấy vào thùng. Trong cung điện ở Sheffield có lò nấu, và ông ấy muốn tắm nước biển nóng.
tr: “İnsanlar maden suyunu nasıl buluyorsa öyle buluyor… Fıçılarla getiriyorlar. Sheffield’deki sarayda büyük ocaklar var, kral suyu sıcak seviyor. Denizin içindeki suyu ısıtacak halleri yok herhalde. Bunun için yeterli malzemeleri yok.
es: —Hace lo mismo que la gente de aquí para beber agua mineral: en barricas. Allí en el palacio de Sheffield tienen unos hornos bien calientes y le gusta que el agua esté caliente. No se puede hervir toda el agua que hay en el mar. Allí no hay máquinas suficientes.
vi_translation: - Then do as everyone here does, go get Congress water, which means getting it into a barrel. In the palace in Sheffield, there is a stove, and he wants to bathe in hot seawater.
tr_translation: “People find mineral water just as they find it... They bring it in barrels. There are large stoves in the palace in Sheffield, the king likes his water hot. They surely can't heat the water in the sea. They don't have enough materials for that.”
es_translation: —He does the same as the people here to drink mineral water: in barrels. There in the Sheffield palace, they have some very hot ovens and he likes the water to be hot. You can't boil all the water in the sea. There aren't enough machines there.

en: “Oh, I see, now. You might a said that in the first place and saved time.”
vi: - Thế thì tôi hiểu rồi. Vậy mà anh không nói từ đầu cho khỏi mất thời gian.
tr: “Haa, şimdi anladım. İlk başta söyleseydin bu kadar vakit kaybetmezdik.
es: —Ah, ya entiendo. Podías haberlo dicho para empezar y habríamos ahorrado tiempo.
vi_translation: - So, I understand now. If only you had said it from the beginning, we wouldn't have wasted time.
tr_translation: “Ah, now I understand. If you had said it at the beginning, we wouldn't have wasted so much time.”
es_translation: —Ah, I understand now. You could have said that to begin with and we would have saved time.

en: When she said that I see I was out of the woods again, and so I was comfortable and glad. Next, she says:
vi: Lúc cô ta nói câu ấy thì tôi thấy mình yên tâm và khoái lắm. Sau đó, cô ta lại hỏi:
tr: Bunu söyleyince tekrar düzlüğe çıktığımı anladım, rahatlamış ve memnun olmuştum. Sonra yine sordu:
es: Cuando dijo aquello, vi que me había librado del asunto, así que me sentí más cómodo y contento. Después preguntó:
vi_translation: When she said that, I felt very relieved and pleased. After that, she asked again:
tr_translation: When I said this, I realized that I had come out into the open again, I felt relieved and pleased. Then he asked again:
es_translation: When he said that, I saw that I had gotten rid of the matter, so I felt more comfortable and happy. Then he asked:

en: “Do you go to church, too?”
vi: - Thế anh có đi lễ nhà thờ không?
tr: “Sen de kiliseye gidiyor musun?
es: —¿Tú también vas a la iglesia?
vi_translation: - So, do you go to church?
tr_translation: “Do you also go to church?”
es_translation: —Are you also going to church?

en: “Where do you set?”
vi: - Anh ngồi ở đâu!
tr: “Nerede oturuyorsun?
es: —¿Dónde te sientas?
vi_translation: - Where are you sitting!
tr_translation: "Where do you live?""
es_translation: —Where do you sit?

en: “Why, in our pew.”
vi: - Ngồi trong ghế.
tr: “Bizim bölmemizde elbette.
es: —Hombre, en nuestro banco.
vi_translation: - Sit in the chair.
tr_translation: “In our compartment, of course.”
es_translation: —Man, in our bank.

en: “Whose pew?”
vi: - Ghế của ai?
tr: “Kimin bölmesinde?
es: —¿El banco de quién?
vi_translation: - Whose chair is this?
tr_translation: "Whose compartment is it?"
es_translation: —Whose bank?

en: “Why, ourn—your Uncle Harvey’s.”
vi: - Ghế của ông Harvey.
tr: “Bizimkinde işte… Harvey Amca’nın sırasında.
es: —Pues el nuestro; el de tu tío Harvey.
vi_translation: - Mr. Harvey's chair.
tr_translation: “In ours, you know… During Uncle Harvey's time.”
es_translation: —Well, ours; your Uncle Harvey's.

en: “His’n? What does he want with a pew?”
vi: - Chú ấy cần phải ghế?
tr: “Onunki mi? Bölmeyi ne yapacak ki?
es: —¿El suyo? ¿Y para qué necesita él un banco?
vi_translation: - Does he need a chair?
tr_translation: “Is it his? What is he going to do with the compartment?”
es_translation: —His? And why does he need a bank?

en: “Wants it to set in. What did you reckon he wanted with it?”
vi: - Phải có ghế mà ngồi chứ? Thế cô tưởng để làm gì?
tr: “Oturmak için. Başka ne yapacağını sanıyordun?
es: —Para sentarse en él. ¿Para que creías que lo necesitaba?
vi_translation: - There must be a seat to sit on, right? What did you think it was for?
tr_translation: “To sit down. What else did you think you would do?”
es_translation: —To sit on it. What did you think I needed it for?

en: “Why, I thought he’d be in the pulpit.”
vi: - Tôi tưởng chú đứng lên giảng đàn chứ?
tr: “Şey, onun kürsüde olacağını düşünmüştüm.
es: —Hombre, creí que estaba en el púlpito.
vi_translation: - I thought you were going to stand up and give a lecture?
tr_translation: “Well, I thought he would be at the podium.”
es_translation: —Man, I thought he was in the pulpit.

en: Rot him, I forgot he was a preacher. I see I was up a stump again, so I played another chicken bone and got another think. Then I says:
vi: Hỏng bét rồi, tôi quên khuấy đi mất rằng chú cô ta là một ông mục sư. Thế là tôi lại phải làm trò hóc xương gà nữa để suy nghĩ. Rồi tôi nói:
tr: Kahretsin, onun rahip olduğunu unutmuştum. Yine çıkmaza girmiştim, bu yüzden yine tavuk kemiği boğazıma kaçmış gibi yapıp bir yol aradım. Sonra şöyle dedim:
es: Maldita sea, se me había olvidado que era predicador. Vi que me había vuelto a atrapar, así que volví a atragantarme para pensármelo, y después dije:
vi_translation: It's a complete disaster, I totally forgot that her uncle is a pastor. So I had to pretend to choke on a chicken bone again to think. Then I said:
tr_translation: Damn, I had forgotten he was a priest. I was stuck again, so I pretended to choke on a chicken bone to find a way out. Then I said:
es_translation: Damn it, I had forgotten he was a preacher. I saw that he had caught me again, so I choked up again to think about it, and then I said:

en: “Blame it, do you suppose there ain’t but one preacher to a church?”
vi: - Thế cô tưởng rằng trong nhà thờ chỉ có một người giảng đạo thôi ư?
tr: “Hay Allah, kilisede tek bir rahip mi olur sanıyorsun?
es: —Caramba, ¿te crees que no hay más que un predicador en una iglesia?
vi_translation: - So you think that there is only one person preaching in the church?
tr_translation: “Oh Allah, do you think there is only one priest in the church?”
es_translation: —Damn, do you think there's only one preacher in a church?

en: “Why, what do they want with more?”
vi: - Có nhiều để làm gì?
tr: “Evet, daha fazlasını ne yapacaklar ki?
es: —Pero, ¿para qué necesitan más?
vi_translation: - What is there to do?
tr_translation: “Yes, what more will they do?” “What!
es_translation: —But, why do they need more? —How!

en: “What!—to preach before a king? I never did see such a girl as you. They don’t have no less than seventeen.”
vi: - Để giảng đạo trước mặt nhà vua. Cô thật lạ. Nhà thờ chỗ tôi có tời mười bảy mục sư có mà.
tr: “Ne! Kralın karşısında vaaz vermek için mi? Hayatımda senin gibi kız görmedim doğrusu. En az on yedi rahip oluyor.
es: —¡Cómo! ¡Para predicar cuando va el rey! Nunca he visto una chica así. Tienen nada menos que diecisiete.
vi_translation: - To preach in front of the king. You're really strange. My church has up to seventeen pastors.
tr_translation: To preach in front of the King? Honestly, I've never seen a girl like you in my life. There are at least seventeen priests.”
es_translation: To preach when the king is coming! I've never seen a girl like that. They have no less than seventeen.

en: “Shucks, they don’t all of ’em preach the same day—only one of ’em.”
vi: - Không phải tất cả những người đó giảng trong một ngày, mà chỉ có một người thôi.
tr: “Aman canım, hepsi aynı gün vaaz vermiyor… Sadece bir tanesi veriyor.
es: —Caramba, no predican todos el mismo día: sólo uno de ellos.
vi_translation: - Not all of those people lecture in one day, only one person does.
tr_translation: “Oh come on, not all of them give sermons on the same day… Only one of them does.”
es_translation: —Darn, they don't all preach on the same day: only one of them does.

en: “Well, then, what does the rest of ’em do?”
vi: - Thế, những người kia làm gì?
tr: “Peki geri kalanı ne yapıyor?
es: —Bueno, y ¿qué hace el resto?
vi_translation: - So, what are those people doing?
tr_translation: “So what are the others doing?”
es_translation: —Well, and what does the rest do?

en: “Oh, nothing much. Loll around, pass the plate—and one thing or another. But mainly they don’t do nothing.”
vi: - Thì ngồi quanh đố, đi quyên tiền, hoặc làm cái này cái khác. Nhưng phần nhiều là không làm gì cả.
tr: “Pek fazla bir şey yapmıyorlar. Etrafta dolanıyorlar, tası tabağı gezdiriyorlar… Ufak tefek işleri yapıyorlar. Ama esasen boş boş dikiliyorlar.
es: —Bah, no mucho. Se pasean, pasan la bandeja, y cosas así. Pero en general no hacen nada.
vi_translation: - Then sit around the fire, go collect money, or do this and that. But mostly, they do nothing at all.
tr_translation: “They don't do much. They wander around, carrying dishes and bowls... They do small tasks. But essentially, they just stand around idly.”
es_translation: —Bah, not much. They walk around, pass the tray, and things like that. But in general, they don't do anything.

en: “Well, then, what are they for?”
vi: - Họ tới đó làm gì?
tr: “O zaman kilisede ne işe yarıyorlar?
es: —Bueno, entonces, ¿para qué están allí?
vi_translation: - What did they go there to do?
tr_translation: “Then what are they doing in the church?”
es_translation: —Well, then, what are they there for?

en: “Why, they’re for style. Don’t you know nothing?”
vi: - Đó là nhiệm vụ của họ. Cô chẳng biết là gì cả.
tr: “Onlar usulden orada duruyor. Sen de hiçbir şey bilmiyor musun?
es: —Hombre, es cuestión de clase. ¿Es que no sabes nada?
vi_translation: - That is their duty. She doesn't know anything.
tr_translation: “They are standing there as a matter of principle. Do you not know anything either?”
es_translation: —Man, it's a matter of class. Don't you know anything?

en: “Well, I don’t want to know no such foolishness as that. How is servants treated in England? Do they treat ’em better ’n we treat our niggers?”
vi: - Tôi không cần biết những cái vớ vẫn như thế nữa. Tôi hỏi anh điều này: bên nước Anh, những kẻ hầu hạ được đối đãi như thế nào? Có tốt hơn là chúng tôi đối với những người da đen ở đây không?
tr: “Bunun gibi budalaca bir şeyi bilmesem de olur. Peki İngiltere’de hizmetkârlara nasıl davranıyorlar? Bizim zencilere davrandığımızdan daha mı iyi davranıyorlar?
es: —Bueno, no quiero saber cosas tontas. ¿Cómo tratan a los criados en Inglaterra? ¿Los tratan mejor que nosotros a nuestros negros?
vi_translation: - I don't need to know such nonsense anymore. I ask you this: in England, how are the servants treated? Is it better than how we treat the black people here?
tr_translation: “I can do without knowing something as foolish as this. So, how do they treat servants in England? Do they treat them better than we treat our black people?”
es_translation: —Well, I don't want to know silly things. How do they treat servants in England? Do they treat them better than we treat our black people?

en: “No! A servant ain’t nobody there. They treat them worse than dogs.”
vi: - Không, ở đó, người ta coi bọn đầy tớ chẳng ra cái quái gì cả. Họ đối đãi tệ hơn chó ấy.
tr: “Hayır! Orada kimse hizmetkârları adam yerine koymaz. Onları köpekten bile aşağı görürler.
es: —¡No! Allí un criado no es nada. Los tratan peor que a perros.
vi_translation: - No, there, they don't give a damn about the servants. They treat them worse than dogs.
tr_translation: “No! No one there treats the servants as human beings. They see them as lower than dogs.”
es_translation: —No! There, a servant is nothing. They treat them worse than dogs.

en: “Don’t they give ’em holidays, the way we do, Christmas and New Year’s week, and Fourth of July?”
vi: - Họ có cho nghỉ những ngày lễ như ở đây không?
tr: “Bizim Noel’de, Yeni Yıl haftasında ve Dört Temmuz’da yaptığımız gibi onlara tatil vermiyorlar mı?
es: —¿No les dan días de fiesta como nosotros, por la semana de Navidad y Año Nuevo y el 4 de j ulio?
vi_translation: - Do they give holidays like they do here?
tr_translation: “Don't they give them holidays like we do during Christmas, New Year week, and the Fourth of July?”
es_translation: —Don't they get holidays like we do, for Christmas week, New Year's, and the 4th of July?

en: “Oh, just listen! A body could tell you hain’t ever been to England by that. Why, Hare-l—why, Joanna, they never see a holiday from year’s end to year’s end; never go to the circus, nor theater, nor nigger shows, nor nowheres.”
vi: Chẳng hạn như ngày Chúa giáng sinh, Tết, hay ngày quốc khánh không? - Đúng là cô chưa được đi đến nước Anh bao giờ, cô sứt... à cô Joanna ạ. Bên đóm từ đầu năm đến cuối năm, được đi xem xiếc, xem hát, chẳng có gì hết.
tr: “Yok canım! İnsan buradan senin hiç İngiltere’ye gitmediğini anlıyor. Bak şimdi Tavş… Joanna, yılın başından sonuna kadar hiç tatil yapmazlar; asla sirke gidemezler, tiyatroya ya da zenci gösterilerine de gidemezler, hiçbir yere gidemezler.
es: —¡Qué cosas dices! Sólo con eso se nota que nunca has estado en Inglaterra. Pero, labio le ...; pero, Joanna, si no tienen ni un día de fiesta al año; nunca van al circo, ni al teatro, ni a espectáculos para negros, ni a ninguna parte.
vi_translation: For example, Christmas, New Year, or National Day? - It's true that you have never been to England, Miss... I mean, Miss Joanna. Over there from the beginning of the year to the end of the year, there's no circus, no theater, nothing at all.
tr_translation: "No way!" "One can tell from here that you have never been to England." "Look now, Tavş..." "Joanna, they don't take any holidays from the beginning to the end of the year; they can never go to the circus, the theater, or to black shows, they can't go anywhere.""
es_translation: —What things you say! Just with that, it's clear that you've never been to England. But, lip...; but, Joanna, they don't even have a single day off a year; they never go to the circus, or the theater, or shows for black people, or anywhere.

en: “Nor church?”
vi: - Cũng không đi nhà thờ nữa?
tr: “Kiliseye de mi? “Kiliseye de?
es: —¿Ni a la iglesia?
vi_translation: - Not going to church anymore either?
tr_translation: “To the church too?”
es_translation: —Not even to church?

en: “Nor church.”
vi: - ừ, không đi nhà thờ.
tr: “Kiliseye de?
es: —Ni a la iglesia.
vi_translation: - Yes, not going to church.
tr_translation: “To the church too?”
es_translation: —Not even to the church.

en: “But you always went to church.”
vi: - Thế sao anh vẫn được đi nhà thờ?
tr: “Ama hep kiliseye gittiğini söylemiştin.
es: —Pero tú siempre vas a la iglesia.
vi_translation: - So why are you still allowed to go to church?
tr_translation: “But you always said you went to church.”
es_translation: —But you always go to church.

en: Well, I was gone up again. I forgot I was the old man’s servant. But next minute I whirled in on a kind of an explanation how a valley was different from a common servant and had to go to church whether he wanted to or not, and set with the family, on account of its being the law. But I didn’t do it pretty good, and when I got done I see she warn’t satisfied. She says:
vi: Tôi lại một lần nữa tắc họng. Tôi quên mất rằng tôi là người hầu hạ của chú cô ta. Nhưng rồi tôi vội vàng giải thích rằng tôi là người hậu thân cận nên muốn đi nhà thờ hay không tùy ý, vì luật pháp cho phép như vậy. Nhưng tôi giải thích không xuôi tai lắm và cô ta tỏ ra không vừa lòng. Cô ta bảo.
tr: Yine batırmıştım. Yaşlı adamın hizmetkârı olduğumu unutmuştum. Ama bir an sonra çark edip uşağın normal hizmetkârlardan farklı olduğunu açıkladım, uşaklar isteseler de istemeseler de kiliseye gitmek zorundaydılar ve yasalara göre aileyle birlikte oturmaları gerekirdi. Ama bu sefer pek iyi kıvıramamıştım, çünkü bana pek inanmadığı belliydi. “Gerçekten mi?” diye sordu, “Bana bir sürü yalan atmadın, değil mi?
es: Bueno, me había vuelto a agarrar. Se me había olvidado que yo era el criado del viejo. Pero al momento siguiente se me ocurrió una especie de explicación de que un vale era diferente de un criado corriente y tenía que ir a la iglesia quisiera o no y sentarse con la familia, porque eso decía la ley. Pero no me salió muy bien y cuando terminé no la vi convencida. Dijo:
vi_translation: Once again, I was at a loss for words. I had forgotten that I was her uncle's servant. But then I hurriedly explained that I was a close servant and thus had the freedom to go to church or not, as the law permitted. However, my explanation wasn't very convincing, and she seemed displeased. She said.
tr_translation: I had messed up again. I had forgotten that I was the old man's servant. But a moment later, I backtracked and explained that the servant was different from the usual servants; whether they wanted to or not, servants had to go to church, and according to the laws, they had to sit with the family. But this time, I hadn't managed it very well, because it was clear that he didn't quite believe me. “Really?” he asked, “You haven't told me a bunch of lies, have you?”
es_translation: Well, he had caught me again. I had forgotten that I was the old man's servant. But the next moment, I came up with a sort of explanation that a valet was different from an ordinary servant and had to go to church whether he wanted to or not and sit with the family, because that was what the law said. But it didn't come out very well, and when I finished, I didn't see her convinced. She said:

en: “Honest injun, now, hain’t you been telling me a lot of lies?”
vi: - Này, từ trước đến giờ, anh toàn lừa dối tôi có phải không?
tr: “Gerçekten mi?” diye sordu, “Bana bir sürü yalan atmadın, değil mi?
es: —La verdad, ahora, ¿no me has estado contando mentiras?
vi_translation: - Hey, have you been deceiving me all this time?
tr_translation: “Really?” he asked, “You haven't told me a bunch of lies, have you?”
es_translation: —The truth, now, haven't you been telling me lies?

en: “Honest injun,” says I.
vi: Tôi đáp:
tr: “Gerçekten,” dedim.
es: —De verdad que no —repliqué.
vi_translation: I replied:
tr_translation: "Really," I said.
es_translation: —Really, no —I replied.

en: “Lay your hand on this book and say it.”
vi: - Anh để tay lên cuốn thánh kinh này và nhắc lại đi.
tr: “Bu kitaba el bas da öyle söyle.
es: —Pon la mano en este libro y repítelo.
vi_translation: - Put your hand on this holy book and repeat after me.
tr_translation: "Swear on this book and say it like that.""
es_translation: —Put your hand on this book and repeat it.

en: I see it warn’t nothing but a dictionary, so I laid my hand on it and said it. So then she looked a little better satisfied, and says:
vi: Với tôi, cuốn kinh hay sách gì đi chăng nữa cũng chẳng khác nhau gì, nên tôi để tay lên và nhắc lại. Cô ta có vẻ thỏa mãn hơn một tí. Cô ta nói:
tr: Kitabın basit bir sözlük olduğunu gördüm, o yüzden elimi üzerine koyup sözlerimi tekrarladım. Bu sefer biraz daha inanmış görünüyordu; şöyle dedi:
es: Vi que no era más que un diccionario, así que puse la mano encima y lo repetí. Entonces pareció un poco más convencida y dijo:
vi_translation: To me, whether it's a scripture or any other book, it makes no difference, so I put my hand on it and repeated. She seemed a bit more satisfied. She said:
tr_translation: I saw that the book was a simple dictionary, so I placed my hand on it and repeated my words. This time, he seemed a bit more convinced; he said:
es_translation: I saw that it was nothing more than a dictionary, so I put my hand on it and repeated it. Then she seemed a bit more convinced and said:

en: “Well, then, I’ll believe some of it; but I hope to gracious if I’ll believe the rest.”
vi: - Được, tôi tin một phần nhưng không phải là tất cả.
tr: “Pekâlâ, bir kısmına inanıyorum; ama geri kalanına inanmam zor.
es: —Bueno, entonces creeré algo de lo que has dicho, pero la verdad es que no me voy a creer el resto.
vi_translation: - Alright, I believe some of it but not all.
tr_translation: “Alright, I believe some of it; but it's hard to believe the rest.”
es_translation: —Well, then I will believe some of what you have said, but the truth is that I am not going to believe the rest.

en: “What is it you won’t believe, Joe?” says Mary Jane, stepping in with Susan behind her. “It ain’t right nor kind for you to talk so to him, and him a stranger and so far from his people. How would you like to be treated so?”
vi: Mary Jane từ ngoài cửa bước vào cùng với Susan lên tiếng: - Joanna, em không tin gì vậy? Cậu ấy là người nơi xa đến đây, em nói thế là không tốt đâu. Nếu người ta đối với em cũng thế thì sao?
tr: “Neye inanman zormuş, Joe?” dedi yanında Susan’la birlikte arkasında beliren Mary Jane. “Onunla böyle konuşman doğru değil, kibarca da değil, çünkü o bir yabancı ve kendi halkından çok uzakta. Ona nasıl böyle muamele edersin?
es: —¿Qué es lo que no te vas a creer, Jo? —preguntó Mary Jane, que entraba con Susan detrás—. No está bien ni es nada amable que le hables así a un forastero que está tan lejos de su casa. ¿Qué te parecería a ti que te trataran así?
vi_translation: Mary Jane walked in from the door with Susan and said: - Joanna, what don't you believe? He's someone who came from afar, it's not good for you to say that. What if people treated you the same way?
tr_translation: “What do you find hard to believe, Joe?” said Mary Jane, who appeared behind him with Susan by her side. “It's not right to talk to him like that, it's not polite either, because he is a stranger and far away from his own people. How can you treat him like this?”
es_translation: —What is it that you won't believe, Jo? —asked Mary Jane, who entered with Susan behind her—. It's neither right nor kind to speak to a stranger who is so far from home like that. How would you feel if you were treated that way?

en: “That’s always your way, Maim—always sailing in to help somebody before they’re hurt. I hain’t done nothing to him. He’s told some stretchers, I reckon, and I said I wouldn’t swallow it all; and that’s every bit and grain I did say. I reckon he can stand a little thing like that, can’t he?”
vi: - Chị lúc nào cũng bênh vực người khác chằm chặp. Em có làm gì anh ấy đâu. Anh ấy bịa ra vài chuyện bịa đặt, và em bảo là em không tin, chỉ có thế thôi. Chắc anh ấy cũng không thể chịu được các vật đó chứ, phải không?
tr: “Sen zaten hep böyle yaparsın, Mary… İnsanlar daha zarar görmeden onlara yardıma koşarsın. Ona hiçbir şey söylemedim. Biraz olmayacak şeyler söyledi, ben de hepsini yutmadığımı söyledim; başka da hiçbir şey demedim. Bu kadar ufak bir şeye dayanabilir herhalde, değil mi?
es: —Eso es lo que dices siempre, Maim: siempre vas en ayuda de alguien antes de que le pase nada. No le he hecho nada. Calculo que ha contado algunas exageraciones y dije que no me las iba a tragar todas, es todo lo que he hecho. Supongo que podrá aguantarlo, ¿no?
vi_translation: - You always defend others unconditionally. I didn't do anything to him. He made up some fabricated stories, and I said I didn't believe them, that's all. He probably couldn't stand those things either, right?
tr_translation: “You always do this, Mary… You rush to help people before they even get hurt. I didn't tell him anything. He said some unreasonable things, and I told him I didn't swallow it all; I didn't say anything else. He can probably handle something this small, can't he?”
es_translation: —That's what you always say, Maim: you always go to help someone before anything happens to them. I haven't done anything to him. I guess he told some exaggerations and I said I wasn't going to swallow all of them, that's all I did. I suppose he can handle it, right?

en: “I don’t care whether ’twas little or whether ’twas big; he’s here in our house and a stranger, and it wasn’t good of you to say it. If you was in his place it would make you feel ashamed; and so you oughtn’t to say a thing to another person that will make them feel ashamed.”
vi: - Dù là chuyện vặt hay chuyện lớn, nhưng cậu ấy là người mới đến nhà mình, nói thế không được. Nếu em ở vào địa vị cậu ấy, em sẽ thấy xấu hổ. Không nên nói những gì làm cho người khác thấy xấu hổ.
tr: “Ufak mı, yoksa büyük mü olduğu umurumda değil, burada bizim konuğumuz ve bir yabancı, senin bunları söylemen doğru değil. Onun yerinde olsaydın aynı şeyler söylenince utanırdın; o yüzden başka birinin utanmasına yol açacak şeyleri söylememelisin.
es: —No me importa que le hayas dicho mucho o poco; está en nuestra casa y es un forastero, y no está bien que digas esas cosas. Si estuvieras tú en su lugar, te daría vergüenza, así que no tienes que decir a otros cosas que les den vergüenza a ellos.
vi_translation: - Whether it's a small matter or a big one, he's a guest in our house, you shouldn't say that. If you were in his position, you would feel embarrassed. You shouldn't say things that make others feel embarrassed.
tr_translation: “I don't care whether it is small or large, here it is our guest and a stranger, it is not right for you to say these things. If you were in its place, you would be ashamed when the same things were said; therefore, you should not say things that would cause someone else to be ashamed.”
es_translation: —I don't care if you told him a lot or a little; he is in our house and he is a stranger, and it is not right for you to say those things. If you were in his place, you would be ashamed, so you shouldn't say things to others that would make them feel ashamed.

en: “Why, Mam, he said—”
vi: - Nhưng mà, anh ấy nói rằng...
tr: “Ama, Mary, dedi ki…
es: —Pero, Maim, ha dicho...
vi_translation: - But, he said that...
tr_translation: “But, Mary, said that...”
es_translation: —But, Maim, he said...

en: “It don’t make no difference what he said—that ain’t the thing. The thing is for you to treat him kind, and not be saying things to make him remember he ain’t in his own country and amongst his own folks.”
vi: - Chị không quan tâm đến cậu ấy nói gì. Điều quan trọng là em phải đối đãi tốt với anh ấy, và để cho anh ấy phải cảm giác rằng mình đang sống ở nước ngoài, giữa những người xa lạ.
tr: “Ne dediğinin bir önemi yok… Mesele o değil. Mesele ona iyi davranman ve kendi ülkesinde olmadığını, kendi insanlarının arasında olmadığını hatırlatacak şeyler yapmaktan kaçınman.
es: —No importa lo que haya dicho; no es eso. Lo que importa es que lo trates con amabilidad, y no andes diciendo cosas que le recuerden que no está en su propio país y entre su propia gente.
vi_translation: - She doesn't care about what he says. The important thing is that you must treat him well, and make him feel like he is living abroad, among strangers.
tr_translation: “It doesn't matter what you said... That's not the issue. The issue is treating him well and avoiding things that would remind him he's not in his own country, not among his own people.”
es_translation: —It doesn't matter what he said; that's not it. What matters is that you treat him with kindness, and don't go around saying things that remind him he's not in his own country and among his own people.

en: I says to myself, this is a girl that I’m letting that old reptile rob her of her money!
vi: Tôi thầm nghĩ: - Một cô gái như thế mà ta nỡ để cho cái lão hèn hạ kia cướp hết tiền của!
tr: Bizim yaşlı sürüngenin soymasına izin verdiğim kız işte böyle biri dedim kendi kendime!
es: Me dije para mis adentros: «¡Y ésta es la muchacha a la que voy a dejar que ese viejo reptil le robe todo su dinero!»
vi_translation: I thought to myself: - A girl like that, and we let that despicable old man take all her money!
tr_translation: This is the kind of girl I let our old reptile strip, I said to myself!
es_translation: I said to myself: "And this is the girl I'm going to let that old reptile steal all her money from!"

en: Then Susan she waltzed in; and if you’ll believe me, she did give Hare-lip hark from the tomb!
vi: Rồi đến cô Susan lại mắng cho cô sứt môi một trận nữa.
tr: Sonra Susan lafa karıştı ve inanın bana tavşan-dudak ondan hayatımda duyduğum en kötü azarı işitti!
es: Entonces entró Susan en el asunto, y podéis creerme que le puso a labio leporino las peras al cuarto.
vi_translation: Then Miss Susan scolded her again, making her lip split.
tr_translation: Then Susan interrupted and, believe me, hare-lip got the worst scolding I've ever heard in my life from her!
es_translation: Then Susan got involved, and you can believe me, she gave harelip a piece of her mind.

en: Says I to myself, and this is another one that I’m letting him rob her of her money!
vi: Tôi thầm nghĩ: - Đây là cô gái thứ hai mà tôi đang để cho lão kia cướp hết tiền của.
tr: Bizimkinin soymasına izin verdiğim bir diğeri dedim kendi kendime!
es: Y yo me dije: «¡Y ésta es otra a la que voy a dejar que le robe su dinero!»
vi_translation: I thought to myself: - This is the second girl that I am letting that old man take all the money from.
tr_translation: Another one I let ours peel, I said to myself!
es_translation: And I said to myself: "And this is another one I'm going to let get her money stolen!"

en: Then Mary Jane she took another inning, and went in sweet and lovely again—which was her way; but when she got done there warn’t hardly anything left o’ poor Hare-lip. So she hollered.
vi: Rồi Mary Jane lại nói nữa, dù giọng vẫn dịu dàng, trìu mến, đó là cách nói của cô ấy. Nói xong, cô sứt môi tội nghiệp kia òa lên khóc tức tưởi.
tr: Ardından Mary Jane nöbeti aldı ve bu kez şirin ve sevgi dolu bir tavır takındı –onun tarzı buydu– ama sözünü bitirdiğinde zavallı Tavşan-dudak’ın tek bir çaresi kalmıştı. Sonunda pes etti.
es: Después Mary Jane pasó a otras cosas y se volvió a poner toda encantadora, que era su verdadero estilo. Pero cuando terminó, la pobre labio leporino estaba prácticamente deshecha. Así que se puso a gritar.
vi_translation: Then Mary Jane spoke again, though her voice remained gentle and affectionate, which was her way of speaking. After speaking, the poor cleft-lipped girl burst into tears.
tr_translation: Then Mary Jane took over the watch and this time adopted a sweet and loving demeanor – that was her style – but when she finished speaking, poor Hare-lip had only one option left. In the end, he gave up.
es_translation: Then Mary Jane moved on to other things and became all charming again, which was her true style. But when she finished, the poor cleft-lip girl was practically devastated. So she started to scream.

en: “All right, then,” says the other girls; “you just ask his pardon.”
vi: Hai cô chị nói: - Bây giờ, em phải xin lỗi cậu ấy đi.
tr: “Peki o zaman,” dedi diğer kızlar; “şimdi ondan özür dile bakalım. Kızcağız benden özür diledi.
es: —Muy bien, pues entonces —dijeron las otras chicasno tienes más que pedirle perdón.
vi_translation: The two older sisters said: - Now, you have to apologize to him.
tr_translation: “Alright then,” said the other girls; “now go ahead and apologize to her.” The poor girl apologized to me.
es_translation: —Very well, then —said the other girls—you just have to apologize to him.

en: She done it, too; and she done it beautiful. She done it so beautiful it was good to hear; and I wished I could tell her a thousand lies, so she could do it again.
vi: Cô em xin lỗi, và xin lỗi rất đáng yêu. Tôi nghe mà cảm động và ước ao có thể kể một nghìn câu chuyện láo toét để lại được nghe cô ấy xin lỗi nữa.
tr: Hem de çok güzel özür diledi. O kadar güzel özür diledi ki işittiğim en tatlı şeydi; ona bin yalan daha söyleyeyim istedim ki benden yine özür dileyebilsin.
es: Y fue lo que hizo, y lo hizo muy bien, tan bien que daba gusto escucharla, y ojalá pudiera volverle a contar mil mentiras para que lo repitiese otra vez.
vi_translation: She apologized, and her apology was very adorable. I was moved when I heard it and wished I could tell a thousand lies just to hear her apologize again.
tr_translation: And she apologized very beautifully. She apologized so beautifully that it was the sweetest thing I had ever heard; I wanted to tell her a thousand more lies so she could apologize to me again.
es_translation: And that's what she did, and she did it very well, so well that it was a pleasure to listen to her, and I wish I could tell her a thousand lies again so she would repeat it once more.

en: I says to myself, this is another one that I’m letting him rob her of her money. And when she got through they all jest laid theirselves out to make me feel at home and know I was amongst friends. I felt so ornery and low down and mean that I says to myself, my mind’s made up; I’ll hive that money for them or bust.
vi: Tôi lại thầm nghĩ: - Đây là cô gái thứ ba mà tôi đang để cho lão kia cướp hết tiền của. Sau đó, họ đi ra ngoài để tôi được tự nhiên và cảm thấy mình sống giữa những người bạn thân. Tôi cảm thấy mình xấu xa, hèn hạ quá, và nghĩ phải tìm cách giầu số tiền kia đi cho các cô ấy mới được.
tr: İşte parasının çalınmasına izin verdiğim kızlardan biri de bu dedim kendi kendime! Tavşan-dudak sözlerini bitirdikten sonra kendimi evimde hissetmem, dostlar arasında olduğumu bilmem için her şeyi yaptılar. Kendimi o kadar aşağılık, hain ve kötü hissettim ki, kendi kendime kesin bir söz verdim; ya parayı onlara geri verecektim ya da ölecektim.
es: Y me dije: «Ésta es otra a la que le estoy dejando que le robe el dinero». Y cuando terminó se pusieron todas ellas a hacer que me sintiera en casa y que supiera que estaba entre amigos. Me sentí tan bajo y tan vil que me dije: «Está decidido; o les consigo ese dinero o reviento».
vi_translation: I silently thought to myself: - This is the third girl that I am letting that old man take all the money from. Then, they went outside so I could be at ease and feel like I was living among close friends. I felt so wicked and despicable, and thought I must find a way to hide that money for them.
tr_translation: This is one of the girls whose money I allowed to be stolen, I said to myself! After Rabbit-lip finished speaking, they did everything to make me feel at home, to make me know I was among friends. I felt so despicable, treacherous, and bad that I made a firm promise to myself; I would either return the money to them or die.
es_translation: And I said to myself: "This is another one I'm letting steal my money." And when it was over, they all started making me feel at home and letting me know I was among friends. I felt so low and vile that I said to myself: "It's decided; either I get them that money or I burst."

en: So then I lit out—for bed, I said, meaning some time or another. When I got by myself I went to thinking the thing over. I says to myself, shall I go to that doctor, private, and blow on these frauds? No—that won’t do. He might tell who told him; then the king and the duke would make it warm for me. Shall I go, private, and tell Mary Jane? No—I dasn’t do it. Her face would give them a hint, sure; they’ve got the money, and they’d slide right out and get away with it. If she was to fetch in help I’d get mixed up in the business before it was done with, I judge. No; there ain’t no good way but one. I got to steal that money, somehow; and I got to steal it some way that they won’t suspicion that I done it. They’ve got a good thing here, and they ain’t a-going to leave till they’ve played this family and this town for all they’re worth, so I’ll find a chance time enough. I’ll steal it and hide it; and by-and-by, when I’m away down the river, I’ll write a letter and tell Mary Jane where it’s hid. But I better hive it tonight if I can, because the doctor maybe hasn’t let up as much as he lets on he has; he might scare them out of here yet.
vi: Tôi bước đi ra ngoài, nghĩ vẩn vơ, rồi đi ngủ. Tỉnh dậy, nằm một mình, tôi lại nghĩ đến chuyện ấy. Tôi tự bảo có nên đến nhà ông bác sĩ kia tố cáo chuyện lừa bịp này ra? Không thể được. Ông ta sẽ khai ai là người tố cáo ra, nhà vua và quận công có thể đánh tôi chết. Hay là tim đến nói riêng với cô Mary Jane? Cũng không ăn thua. Nhỡ cô ấy tỏ ra nghi ngờ và bọn kia biết thóp sẽ lấy tiền chuồn đi mất. Chỉ còn cách này là hay nhất: tôi sẽ lấy cắp số tiền đó, và lấy cắp như thế nào cho họ không nghi ngờ cho tôi. Bọn chúng đang vớ được món hời, chừng nào chúng chưa vơ vét hét thì chúng chưa chịu đi. Như vậy là tôi còn đủ thời giờ tính chuyện ấy. Tôi sẽ lấy cắp bọc tiền và giấu đi. Rồi tôi sẽ bỏ đi, và viết lại cho cô Mary Jane một lá thư, bảo cho cô ấy biết tôi giấu tiền ở chỗ nào. Nếu như đêm nay có thể giấu được thì nên giấu ngay; vì ông bác sĩ kia chưa phải đã thôi đâu mà sẽ còn làm cho ra nhẽ, và bọn này có thể sợ mà chuồn cũng chưa biết chừng.
tr: Sonra ben yatmaya gidiyorum diye mutfaktan çıktım, ama pek de yatmaya gitmiyordum doğrusu. Tek başıma kaldığımda her şeyi enine boyuna düşündüm. Gizlice o doktorun yanına gidip bizim sahtekârları ihbar mı etsem, dedim kendi kendime. Hayır – bu işe yaramazdı. Nereden öğrendiğini söyleyebilirdi, o zaman kral ile dük bana hayatı zindan ederdi. Acaba gizlice gidip Mary Jane’e mi anlatsaydım? Hayır – onu da yapamazdım. Neler olduğunu kızın yüzüne bakar bakmaz anlarlardı; parayı alıp hemen kaçar kurtulurlardı. Kızcağız birilerinden yardım isteseydi bile öyle ya da böyle işin içine karışırdım. Hayır, işe yarayabilecek tek bir yol vardı. Ne yapıp edip parayı çalmalıydım, hem de öyle bir çalmalıydım ki asla benden şüphelenmemeliydiler. Burada iyi bir fırsat yakalamışlardı ve hem bu aileyi hem de kasabayı soyup soğana çevirmeden gitmeye niyetleri yoktu, o yüzden benim de bir şans bekleyecek kadar vaktim vardı. Parayı çalacaktım, bir yere saklayacaktım; sonra nehirden biraz aşağı indikten sonra bir mektup yazıp Mary Jane’e paranın nerede saklı olduğunu söyleyecektim. Ama belki de en iyisi becerebilirsem parayı bu gece almaktı; çünkü doktor göründüğü kadar sakin kalmayabilin bizimkileri korkutup kaçırabilirdi.
es: Así que me largué; a dormir, dije, sin especificar el momento. Cuando me quedé solo me puse a pensar las cosas. Me pregunté: «¿Voy a ver a ese médico, en secreto, y delato a estos sinvergüenzas? No, eso no saldría bien. Podría decir quién se lo había dicho y entonces el rey y el duque se encargarían de mí. ¿Iré a decírselo en secreto a Mary Jane? No... No me atrevo. Seguro que lo revelaría con algún gesto; ellos ya tienen el dinero y se largarían con él. Si fuera en busca de ayuda, seguro que me encontraría metido en el asunto. No, no hay más que una forma. Tengo que robar ese dinero como pueda y de forma que no sospechen de mí. Aquí han encontrado un buen filón y no van a irse hasta que le hayan sacado a esta familia y a este pueblo todo lo que puedan, así que tengo tiempo suficiente para buscar una solución. Voy a robarlo y a esconderlo y después, cuando esté río abajo, escribiré una carta y le diré a Mary Jane dónde está escondido. Pero más vale que lo saque esta noche si puedo, porque a lo mejor el médico no ha renunciado como ha dicho y todavía puede que les meta el miedo en el cuerpo y los eche».
vi_translation: I walked outside, thinking aimlessly, then went to sleep. Waking up, lying alone, I thought about that matter again. I asked myself if I should go to that doctor’s house to expose this deceit? That’s impossible. He would reveal who the accuser is, and the king and the duke might beat me to death. Or should I go and talk privately to Miss Mary Jane? That wouldn’t work either. What if she becomes suspicious and they find out, they would take the money and run away. There’s only one best way: I will steal that money, and steal it in such a way that they won’t suspect me. They are making a good profit, as long as they haven’t taken everything, they won’t leave. So I still have enough time to plan this. I will steal the money bag and hide it. Then I will leave, and write Miss Mary Jane a letter, telling her where I hid the money. If I can hide it tonight, I should do it immediately; because that doctor hasn’t given up and will continue to investigate, and they might get scared and run away, who knows.
tr_translation: Then I said I was going to bed and left the kitchen, but I wasn't really going to bed, to be honest. When I was alone, I thought everything over thoroughly. I wondered to myself if I should secretly go to that doctor and report our fraudsters. No – that wouldn't work. He could say where he learned it from, and then the king and the duke would make my life miserable. Should I secretly go and tell Mary Jane? No – I couldn't do that either. They would understand everything the moment they looked at the girl's face; they would take the money and run away immediately. Even if the poor girl asked someone for help, I would get involved in one way or another. No, there was only one way that could work. I had to steal the money, and I had to do it in such a way that they would never suspect me. They had found a good opportunity here and had no intention of leaving without robbing both this family and the town, so I had enough time to wait for a chance. I would steal the money, hide it somewhere; then after going a bit down the river, I would write a letter to Mary Jane telling her where the money was hidden. But maybe the best thing was to get the money tonight if I could; because the doctor might not stay as calm as he seemed and could scare our guys into running away.
es_translation: So I took off; to sleep, I said, without specifying the moment. When I was left alone, I started thinking things over. I asked myself: "Am I going to see that doctor, in secret, and betray these scoundrels? No, that wouldn't turn out well. He could say who told him and then the king and the duke would take care of me. Should I go and tell Mary Jane in secret? No... I don't dare. She would surely reveal it with some gesture; they already have the money and would take off with it. If I went looking for help, I would surely find myself caught up in the matter. No, there's only one way. I have to steal that money however I can and in a way that they don't suspect me. They've found a good vein here and they're not going to leave until they've squeezed everything they can out of this family and this town, so I have enough time to find a solution. I'm going to steal it and hide it and then, when I'm downriver, I'll write a letter and tell Mary Jane where it's hidden. But I'd better get it out tonight if I can, because maybe the doctor hasn't given up as he said and he might still scare them and drive them away."

en: So, thinks I, I’ll go and search them rooms. Upstairs the hall was dark, but I found the duke’s room, and started to paw around it with my hands; but I recollected it wouldn’t be much like the king to let anybody else take care of that money but his own self; so then I went to his room and begun to paw around there. But I see I couldn’t do nothing without a candle, and I dasn’t light one, of course. So I judged I’d got to do the other thing—lay for them and eavesdrop. About that time I hears their footsteps coming, and was going to skip under the bed; I reached for it, but it wasn’t where I thought it would be; but I touched the curtain that hid Mary Jane’s frocks, so I jumped in behind that and snuggled in amongst the gowns, and stood there perfectly still.
vi: Nghĩ thế, tôi mò đến phòng của họ. Hành lang trên gác tối om, nhưng tôi cũng tìm ra phòng quận công. Tôi đưa tay ra rờ rờ chung quanh, nhưng lúc đó tôi bỗng nhớ ra hình như nhà vua không để cho ai ngoài lão ra được giữ số tiền kia. Tôi lại mò đến phòng lão ta, sờ chung quanh. Tối quá, không có một cái nến nào, mà nếu có, tôi cũng chẳng dắm thắp lên. Tôi đành nằm đây nghe ngóng xem thế nào đã. Vào lúc đó có tiếng chân họ bước tới, tôi bò vào gầm giường, nhưng nghĩ chỗ đó không ổn, đáng băn khoăn thì sờ thấy cái màn che quần áo của Mary Jane, thế là tôi lẩn ngay vào trong màn và nép vào giữa đống quần áo, đứng đó thật im lặng.
tr: O zaman en iyisi gidip odalarını aramak, diye düşündüm. Üst kattaki koridor karanlıktı, ama dükün odasını buldum ve el yordamıyla yoklamaya başladım; ama sonra kralın o kadar parayı başkasına teslim etmeyeceği kafama dank etti; bu yüzden onun odasına gittim ve orayı aramaya başladım. Fakat bir süre sonra ışık olmadan hiçbir şey göremeyeceğimi anladım, üstelik burada mum yakmak akıl kârı değildi. En iyisi diğer yola başvurup onları beklemek ve konuşmalarım dinlemekti. O sırada aşağıdan ayak sesleri geldiğini duydum ve yatağın altına girmeye davrandım; tam girecektim ama yatak tahmin ettiğim yerde değildi, onun yerine Mary Jane’in elbiselerini örten perde elime geldi, hemen perdenin arkasına sıçradım ve geceliklerin arasına sığındım, sonra da hiç kıpırdamadım.
es: «Así que —pensé— voy a buscar en sus habitaciones.» Aunque el pasillo de arriba estaba oscuro, encontré la habitación del duque y empecé a rebuscar con las manos, pero recordé que tal como era el rey, no dejaría que nadie más que él se hiciera cargo del dinero, así que fui a su habitación y empecé a rebuscar. Pero vi que no podía hacer nada sin una vela y, naturalmente, no me atreví a encender una. Así que pensé en hacer lo otro: quedarme a la espera y escuchar lo que decían. Casi en aquel momento oí que subían y decidí esconderme debajo de la cama; fui hacia ella, pero no estaba donde yo creía, toqué la cortina detrás de la que estaban los vestidos de Mary Jane, así que salté detrás, me arrebujé entre los vestidos y me quedé allí muy calladito.
vi_translation: Thinking so, I groped my way to their room. The hallway upstairs was pitch dark, but I still found the duke's room. I reached out and felt around, but then I suddenly remembered that it seemed the king didn't let anyone but the old man keep that money. I groped my way to the old man's room and felt around. It was too dark, there wasn't a single candle, and even if there was, I wouldn't dare light it. I had to lie here and listen to see what would happen. At that moment, I heard their footsteps approaching, so I crawled under the bed, but thinking that spot wasn't safe, I felt worried and then touched Mary Jane's clothes curtain, so I slipped right into the curtain and hid among the clothes, standing there very quietly.
tr_translation: Then I thought, the best thing to do is to go and search their rooms. The corridor upstairs was dark, but I found the duke's room and started feeling around; but then it dawned on me that the king wouldn't entrust that much money to someone else; so I went to his room and started searching there. However, after a while, I realized I couldn't see anything without light, and besides, lighting a candle here wasn't a smart idea. The best thing was to resort to the other way, wait for them, and listen to their conversations. At that moment, I heard footsteps coming from downstairs and made a move to get under the bed; I was just about to get in, but the bed wasn't where I expected it to be, instead, I grabbed the curtain covering Mary Jane's clothes, immediately jumped behind the curtain, and took refuge among the nightgowns, then didn't move at all.
es_translation: “So —I thought— I’m going to search their rooms.” Although the hallway upstairs was dark, I found the duke’s room and started rummaging with my hands, but I remembered that just as the king was, he wouldn’t let anyone but himself handle the money, so I went to his room and started rummaging. But I saw that I couldn’t do anything without a candle and, naturally, I didn’t dare to light one. So I thought of doing the other thing: staying put and listening to what they said. Almost at that moment I heard them coming up and decided to hide under the bed; I went towards it, but it wasn’t where I thought, I touched the curtain behind which Mary Jane’s dresses were, so I jumped behind it, snuggled among the dresses, and stayed there very quietly.

en: They come in and shut the door; and the first thing the duke done was to get down and look under the bed. Then I was glad I hadn’t found the bed when I wanted it. And yet, you know, it’s kind of natural to hide under the bed when you are up to anything private. They sets down then, and the king says:
vi: Chúng tôi vào phòng rồi đứng đóng cửa. Việc đầu tiên quận công làm là cúi xuống nhìn vào gầm giừơng. Cũng may là tôi đã không trốn trong gầm giường. Mỗi khi người ta định dò xét một chuyện riêng của ai thì cứ hay nấp dưới gầm giường. Họ ngồi xuống, nhà vua nói:
tr: İçeri girip kapıyı kapattılar; dükün yaptığı ilk şey eğilip yatağın altına bakmak oldu. O zaman yatağı bulamadığıma memnun oldum. Yine de özel bir şey yapıyorsanız yatağın altına saklanmak çok doğaldır. Ondan sonra oturdular ve kral konuşmaya başladı:
es: Entraron, cerraron la puerta y lo primero que hizo el duque fue agacharse a mirar debajo de la cama. Entonces me alegré de no haberla encontrado cuando la buscaba. Y eso que, ya sabéis, parece que lo natural es esconderse debajo de la cama cuando uno quiere que no lo encuentren. Después se sentaron y el rey dice:
vi_translation: We entered the room and then closed the door. The first thing the duke did was bend down to look under the bed. Fortunately, I was not hiding under the bed. Whenever people intend to investigate someone's private matters, they often hide under the bed. They sat down, and the king said:
tr_translation: They entered and closed the door; the first thing the shopkeeper did was to bend down and look under the bed. At that moment, I was glad I hadn't found the bed. Still, if you're doing something special, hiding under the bed is very natural. After that, they sat down and the king began to speak:
es_translation: They entered, closed the door, and the first thing the duke did was to bend down to look under the bed. Then I was glad I hadn't found it when I was looking for it. And that, you know, it seems natural to hide under the bed when you don't want to be found. Then they sat down and the king says:

en: “Well, what is it? And cut it middlin’ short, because it’s better for us to be down there a-whoopin’ up the mournin’ than up here givin’ ’em a chance to talk us over.”
vi: - Nói gì thì nhanh lên. Chúng mình còn phải xuống đó mà lo đám ma, chứ ngồi mãi đây càng có điều kiện cho họ bàn tán.
tr: “Evet, ne var? Kısa kessen iyi olur, çünkü yukarıda durup bizim hakkımızda konuşmalarına fırsat vermek yerine aşağıda mateme katılmamız daha doğru şu anda.
es: —Bueno, ¿qué pasa?, y no te alargues, porque más vale que nos levantemos bien tempranito por la mañana para que no tengan oportunidad de hablar de nosotros.
vi_translation: - Say what you need to quickly. We still have to go down there and take care of the funeral, sitting here any longer just gives them more reason to gossip.
tr_translation: "Yes, what is it? It would be better if you cut it short, because right now it's more appropriate for us to join the mourning downstairs rather than giving them a chance to stand upstairs and talk about us."
es_translation: —Well, what's going on? And don't go on too long, because it's better if we get up really early in the morning so they don't have a chance to talk about us.

en: “Well, this is it, Capet. I ain’t easy; I ain’t comfortable. That doctor lays on my mind. I wanted to know your plans. I’ve got a notion, and I think it’s a sound one.”
vi: Chúng mình còn phải xuống đó mà lo đám ma, chứ ngồi mãi đây càng có điều kiện cho họ bàn tán. - Tôi thấy lo lắm. Thằng cha bác sĩ ấy rồi sẽ gây sự cho chúng ta mà xem. Tôi vừa nghĩ ra một kế, không biết ý ông thế nào.
tr: “Bu kadarı yeter; Capet. Benim içim rahat değil, kendimi hiç huzurlu hissetmiyorum. Aklım doktorda kaldı. Senin ne planladığını bilmek istiyorum. Aklımda bazı şeyler var ve onlara göre hareket edersek çok iyi olur.
es: —Bueno, se trata de lo siguiente, Capeto. No es fácil; no me siento tranquilo. No logro olvidarme de ese médico. Quería saber qué planes tenías. Tengo una idea y me parece que está bien.
vi_translation: We still have to go down there and take care of the funeral, sitting here any longer just gives them more reason to gossip. - I'm very worried. That doctor will cause trouble for us, just wait and see. I've just thought of a plan, I wonder what you think about it.
tr_translation: "That's enough; Capet. I'm not at ease, I don't feel peaceful at all. My mind is stuck on the doctor. I want to know what you are planning. I have some ideas, and it would be great if we act according to them."
es_translation: —Well, it's about the following, Capeto. It's not easy; I don't feel at ease. I can't forget about that doctor. I wanted to know what plans you had. I have an idea and I think it's good.

en: “What is it, duke?”
vi: - Kế gì?
tr: “Nedir o, Dük?
es: —¿Cuál es, duque?
vi_translation: - What plan?
tr_translation: “What is it, Duke?”
es_translation: —What is it, Duke?

en: “That we better glide out of this before three in the morning, and clip it down the river with what we’ve got. Specially, seeing we got it so easy—given back to us, flung at our heads, as you may say, when of course we allowed to have to steal it back. I’m for knocking off and lighting out.”
vi: - Chúng ta hãy chuồn khỏi chỗ này trước ba giờ sáng, đem theo tất cả những đồ đạc của mình ra bè chạy về xuôi. Lấy được số tiền đó là quá đủ rồi. Tôi sẽ chuồn r trước bố trí.
tr: “En iyisi sabah saat üçten önce buradan görünmeden çıkalım ve elimizdekiyle yetinip nehir aşağı devam edelim. Baksana işi ne kadar kolay hallettik – hepsi bize geri verildi, neredeyse kafamıza attılar; o zaman çalıp götürmemize de izin var demektir. Bana kalırsa basıp gidelim ve bir daha görünmeyelim.
es: —Que más nos vale largarnos de aquí antes de las tres de la mañana y bajar al río con lo que ya tenemos. Sobre todo, dado que lo hemos conseguido tan fácilmente que nos lo han dado, podría decirse que nos lo han metido a la fuerza, cuando nosotros pensábamos que tendríamos que volverlo a robar. Creo que más vale que nos marchemos cuanto antes.
vi_translation: - Let's sneak out of here before three in the morning, taking all our belongings to the raft and heading downstream. Getting that amount of money is more than enough. I'll sneak out first to arrange things.
tr_translation: “The best thing is to leave here before three in the morning without being seen and continue down the river with what we have. Look how easily we handled it – everything was given back to us, almost thrown at our heads; so it means we are allowed to take and go. If you ask me, let's leave and never come back.”
es_translation: —We better get out of here before three in the morning and head down to the river with what we already have. Especially since we got it so easily that it was practically given to us, you could say it was forced upon us, when we thought we would have to steal it again. I think it's best if we leave as soon as possible.

en: “What! And not sell out the rest o’ the property? March off like a passel of fools and leave eight or nine thous’n’ dollars’ worth o’ property layin’ around jest sufferin’ to be scooped in?—and all good, salable stuff, too.”
vi: - Thế còn số tài sản chưa bán, tám chín nghìn đô la chứ ít gì. Mà lại còn tốt cả, toàn những thứ bán được giá cả.
tr: “Ne dedin? Mülkün geri kalanını satmayalım mı yani? İki budala gibi çekip gidelim ve kaymağını yememiz için bekleyen sekiz-dokuz bin dolar değerinde mülk geride mi kalsın yani? Ayrıca satacak daha bir sürü değerli şey var.
es: —¡Cómo! ¿Y no vender el resto de la herencia? ¿Marcharnos como un par de idiotas y dejar ocho o nueve mil dólares en tierras esperando a que alguien se las lleve?; ¡cuando todo se puede vender en un momento!
vi_translation: - And what about the unsold assets, eight or nine thousand dollars, not a small amount. And they're all good, all things that can fetch a good price.
tr_translation: “What did you say? So, we shouldn't sell the rest of the property? Should we just leave like two fools and let property worth eight to nine thousand dollars, which is waiting for us to enjoy the cream, stay behind? Besides, there are still a lot of valuable things to sell.”
es_translation: —What! And not sell the rest of the inheritance? Leave like a couple of idiots and leave eight or nine thousand dollars in land waiting for someone to take it?; when everything can be sold in a moment!

en: The duke he grumbled; said the bag of gold was enough, and he didn’t want to go no deeper—didn’t want to rob a lot of orphans of everything they had.
vi: Quận công càu nhàu, bảo là cái bọc tiền kia cũng đủ rồi, chẳng nên tham quá nữa - và cũng không nên cướp tất cả những gì của mấy cô gái mồ côi nữa.
tr: Dük homurdanmayı sürdürdü; altın torbasının yeterli olduğunu, daha ileri gitmek istemediğini söyledi – kimsesiz çocukların elindeki her şeyi çalıp çırpmak istemiyordu.
es: El duque se puso a gruñir, dijo que con la bolsa de oro ya bastaba y que no quería meterse en más jaleos; que no quería robar a unas huérfanas todo lo que tenían.
vi_translation: The duke grumbled, saying that the bag of money was already enough, there was no need to be too greedy - and they shouldn't take everything from the orphaned girls either.
tr_translation: The Duke continued to grumble; he said that his bag of gold was sufficient and that he did not want to go any further – he did not want to steal everything from the orphaned children.
es_translation: The duke started to grumble, said that the bag of gold was enough and that he didn't want to get into more trouble; that he didn't want to rob some orphans of everything they had.

en: “Why, how you talk!” says the king. “We sha’n’t rob ’em of nothing at all but jest this money. The people that buys the property is the suff’rers; because as soon ’s it’s found out ’at we didn’t own it—which won’t be long after we’ve slid—the sale won’t be valid, and it’ll all go back to the estate. These yer orphans ’ll git their house back agin, and that’s enough for them; they’re young and spry, and k’n easy earn a livin’. They ain’t a-goin to suffer. Why, jest think—there’s thous’n’s and thous’n’s that ain’t nigh so well off. Bless you, they ain’t got noth’n’ to complain of.”
vi: Nhà vua nói: - Anh này nói lạ nhỉ. Chúng ta không cướp cái gì khác ngoài đám tiền này. Cái người nào mua tài sản thì người đó bị lừa thôi, vì khi họ biết tài sản này không phải là của mình thì nó sẽ trở thành tài sản nhà nước. Rồi nhà lại trở về mấy cô gái mồ côi kia. Thế là đủ rồi. Chúng nó còn trẻ, còn khóc, có thể dễ dàng kiếm ăn được. Anh thử nghĩ xem, hàng nghìn, hàng nghìn đồng sắp vào tay mình rồi. Họ chẳng có gì phải kêu ca cả.
tr: “Sen neler saçmalıyorsun!” dedi kral. “Onları tamamen soymuyoruz ki, sadece bu parayı alıyoruz. Asıl bela mülkü satın alanların başına gelecek –biz gittikten kısa süre sonra olay duyulacak– satışlar geçersiz olacak ve tüm mal mülk onlara geri dönecek.
