en: “Honor bright, your majesty, I’m telling you the truth. I hain’t been a-near your room since Miss Mary Jane took you and the duke and showed it to you.”
vi: - Dạ xin thề danh dự tôi nói thật. Từ lúc cô Mary Jane dẫn đức vua và ngài quận công lên phòng, tôi không tới gần đó làm gì cả.
tr: “Yemin ederim, majesteleri. Size doğruyu söylüyorum. Bayan Mary Jane sizi ve dükü alıp size odanızı gösterdiğinden beri odanıza hiçbir şekilde yaklaşmadım.
es: —Mi palabra de honor, vuestra majestad. Le digo la verdad. No he estado cerca de su habitación desde que la señorita Mary Jane le llevó allí con el duque para enseñársela.
vi_translation: - I swear on my honor that I'm telling the truth. Since Miss Mary Jane took the king and the duke upstairs, I haven't gone near there at all.
tr_translation: "I swear, your majesty. I am telling you the truth. Since Miss Mary Jane took you and the duke to show you your room, I have not approached your room in any way."
es_translation: —My word of honor, your majesty. I am telling you the truth. I have not been near your room since Miss Mary Jane took you there with the duke to show it to you.

en: “Have you seen anybody else go in there?”
vi: - Mày có thấy ai đến đó không?
tr: “Peki kimsenin girip çıktığını gördün mü?” diye sordu dük.
es: —¿Has visto entrar en ella a otra persona?
vi_translation: - Did you see anyone come there?
tr_translation: “Well, did you see anyone coming in or going out?” asked the duke.
es_translation: —Have you seen anyone else enter it?

en: “No, your grace, not as I remember, I believe.”
vi: - Thưa ngài, tôi không nhớ rõ lắm
tr: “Hayır ekselansları, kimseyi gördüğümü hatırlamıyorum.
es: —No, vuestra gracia, no que yo recuerde, creo.
vi_translation: - Sir, I don't remember very clearly
tr_translation: “No, Your Excellency, I don't remember seeing anyone.”
es_translation: —No, your grace, not that I remember, I think.

en: “Stop and think.”
vi: - Cố nhớ lại đi.
tr: “Durup biraz düşün.
es: —Piénsalo con calma.
vi_translation: - Try to remember.
tr_translation: "Pause and think a little."
es_translation: —Think about it calmly.

en: I studied awhile and see my chance; then I says:
vi: Tôi im lặng để nghĩ xem có cách gì nói không, rồi đáp.
tr: Bir süre düşünüyormuş gibi yaptım, bu sırada şansımın döndüğünü fark ederek cevap verdim:
es: Estuve pensándolo un momento y al ver mi oportunidad dije:
vi_translation: I remained silent to think if there was any way to speak, then replied.
tr_translation: I pretended to think for a while, and during this time, realizing that my luck had changed, I responded:
es_translation: I was thinking about it for a moment and seeing my opportunity, I said:

en: “Well, I see the niggers go in there several times.”
vi: - Có, tôi thấy mấy người da đen vào đó.
tr: “Zencilerin oraya birkaç kez girdiğini gördüm.
es: —Bueno, he visto entrar allí varias veces a los negros.
vi_translation: - Yes, I saw some black people go in there.
tr_translation: “I saw black people go in there a few times.”
es_translation: —Well, I've seen the black people go in there several times.

en: Both of them gave a little jump, and looked like they hadn’t ever expected it, and then like they had. Then the duke says:
vi: Cả hai giật mình, rồi quận công lại hỏi:
tr: İkisi de farkında olmadan tedirginlikle havaya sıçradı. Sonra benden zaten bu cevabı bekliyorlarmış gibi bir tavır takındılar. “Hepsinin mi girip çıktığım gördün?” diye sordu dük.
es: Los dos dieron un saltito, como si jamás se lo hubieran esperado, y después como si pareciera que sí. Después el duque va y dice:
vi_translation: Both of them were startled, then the duke asked again:
tr_translation: They both jumped into the air with unease without realizing it. Then they adopted an attitude as if they had already been expecting this answer from me. "Did you see me come and go from all of them?" asked the duke.
es_translation: The two of them gave a little jump, as if they had never expected it, and then as if it seemed like they had. Then the duke goes and says:

en: “No—leastways, not all at once—that is, I don’t think I ever see them all come out at once but just one time.”
vi: - Không, không phải phải tất cả cùng vào lúc, tôi trông thấy một lần thôi.
tr: En azından hepsini aynı anda görmedim. Yani hepsinin birden çıktığını hiç hatırlamıyorum, bir keresi hariç.
es: —No, o sea, por lo menos no todos de una vez; creo que nunca los vi salir juntos, más que una vez.
vi_translation: - No, not all at once, I only saw it once.
tr_translation: At least I didn't see them all at once. I mean, I don't ever remember them all coming out at the same time, except for one time.”
es_translation: —No, I mean, at least not all at once; I think I never saw them leave together, except for once.

en: “Hello! When was that?”
vi: - Lúc nào?
tr: “Peki ne zamanmış o?
es: —¡Vaya! ¿Cuándo fue eso?
vi_translation: - When?
tr_translation: “So, when was that?””
es_translation: —Wow! When was that?

en: “It was the day we had the funeral. In the morning. It warn’t early, because I overslept. I was just starting down the ladder, and I see them.”
vi: - Hôm đưa ma, nhưng không phải lúc sáng sớm đâu, tôi cũng ngủ dậy muộn. Tôi vừa bước xuống cầu thang thì thấy họ.
tr: “Cenaze günü. Sabahleyin. Saat çok erken değildi, çünkü uyuyakalmışım. Tam merdivenden aşağı inerken onları gördüm.
es: El día del funeral, por la mañana. No fue temprano porque yo dormí hasta tarde. Estaba empezando a bajar las escaleras cuando los vi.
vi_translation: - On the day of the funeral, but not early in the morning, I also woke up late. As I was stepping down the stairs, I saw them.
tr_translation: “The day of the funeral. In the morning. It wasn't very early, because I had overslept. Just as I was going down the stairs, I saw them.”
es_translation: The day of the funeral, in the morning. It wasn't early because I slept in late. I was starting to go down the stairs when I saw them.

en: “Well, go on, go on! What did they do? How’d they act?”
vi: - Cứ nói đi! Chúng làm gì nữa? Chúng làm như thế nào?
tr: “Anlatmaya devam et, anlatsana… Ne yaptılar?
es: —Bueno, sigue, ¡sigue! ¿Qué hicieron? ¿Qué pasó después?
vi_translation: - Go ahead! What else did they do? How did they do it?
tr_translation: "Keep telling, go on... What did they do?"
es_translation: —Well, go on, go on! What did they do? What happened next?

en: “It does beat all how neat the niggers played their hand. They let on to be sorry they was going out of this region! And I believed they was sorry, and so did you, and so did everybody. Don’t ever tell me any more that a nigger ain’t got any histrionic talent. Why, the way they played that thing it would fool anybody. In my opinion, there’s a fortune in ’em. If I had capital and a theater, I wouldn’t want a better lay-out than that—and here we’ve gone and sold ’em for a song. Yes, and ain’t privileged to sing the song yet. Say, where is that song—that draft?”
vi: - Bọn da đen chơi một vố cao tay đấy. Chúng nó giả bộ như đau khổ lắm trước khi chúng nó đi khỏi nơi này. Tôi, ông và tất cả mọi người đều nghĩ như thế cả. Đừng tưởng bọn da đen không có tài cán gì. Tôi mà có vốn và có một cái rạp hát thì tôi sẽ tuyển ngay bọn này vào làm diễn viên. Thôi thế là bây giờ chúng mình đã đem bán họ đi đổi lấy một bài hát. Thế mà mình lại cũng chưa được hát cái bài hát đó cơ chứ. à này, thế cái bài hát đó đâu rồi nhỉ, cái bản giao kèo ấy m à?
tr: “El elden üstündür demişler zenciler yapacağını yaptı. Buralardan gidecekleri için nasıl da üzgün görünüyorlardı! Ben de hakikaten üzgün olduklarına inandım. Sen de inandın, herkes inandı. Kimse bana zencilerin oyunculuk yeteneği yok demesin artık. Öyle güzel oynadılar ki herkesi kandırabilirlerdi. Bana kalırsa o zenciler hazine değerinde. Biraz sermayem ve bir tiyatrom olsaydı, oyuncu olarak sadece onlar yeterdi… Biz de gidip onları üç kuruşa sattık. Evet, üstelik elimizde nakit de yok, altı üstü bir senet. Ne yaptın bakalım senedi?
es: —Es fabuloso cómo han jugado su baza esos negros. ¡Hicieron como que estaban tan tristes por marcharse de esta región! Y yo creí que lo estaban de verdad, igual que tú e igual que todo el mundo. Que nadie me vuelva a decir que los negros no tienen talento histriónico. Han hecho una interpretación que engañaría a cualquiera. Para mí que valen una fortuna. Si yo tuviera capital y un teatro no querría mejores actores... Y los hemos vendido por una ganga. Sí, y ni siquiera podemos tocar esa ganga todavía. Oye, ¿dónde está esa ganga... esa letra?
vi_translation: - The black folks played a high-level trick. They pretended to be very miserable before they left this place. I, you, and everyone else thought so. Don't think that the black folks don't have any talent. If I had the capital and a theater, I would immediately hire them as actors. So now we have sold them in exchange for a song. And yet we haven't even sung that song. By the way, where is that song, that contract? Where?
tr_translation: “They say 'a hand is superior to another,' and the blacks did what they had to do. They looked so sad because they were going to leave these places! I truly believed that they were sad. You believed it too, everyone did. No one should tell me anymore that blacks don't have acting talent. They acted so well that they could have fooled everyone. In my opinion, those blacks are worth a treasure. If I had some capital and a theater, they alone would be enough as actors… And we went and sold them for a pittance. Yes, and on top of that, we don't even have cash, just a promissory note. What did you do with the note?”
es_translation: —It's fabulous how those blacks have played their hand. They acted as if they were so sad to leave this region! And I believed they really were, just like you and everyone else. Don't ever tell me again that blacks don't have acting talent. They gave a performance that would fool anyone. To me, they are worth a fortune. If I had capital and a theater, I wouldn't want better actors... And we sold them for a bargain. Yes, and we can't even touch that bargain yet. Hey, where is that bargain... that note?

en: “In the bank for to be collected. Where would it be?”
vi: - Phải ra ngân hàng mà lấy chứ!
tr: “Bankaya verdim elbette, karşılığı gelince alacağız. Nerede olacaktı ki?
es: —En el banco esperando al cobro. ¿Dónde iba a estar?
vi_translation: - You have to go to the bank to get it!
tr_translation: “I gave it to the bank, of course, we'll get it when the return comes. Where else would it be?”
es_translation: —At the bank waiting to get paid. Where else would I be?

en: “Well, that’s all right then, thank goodness.”
vi: - Thôi thế cũng còn may chán.
tr: “Tamam, iyi o zaman, Tanrıya şükür.
es: —Bueno, entonces no importa, gracias a Dios.
vi_translation: - Well, that's still quite fortunate.
tr_translation: “Alright, good then, thank God.”
es_translation: —Well, then it doesn't matter, thank God.

en: Says I, kind of timid-like:
vi: Tôi ra bộ rụt rè hỏi:
tr: Biraz çekingence araya girdim:
es: Yo pregunté, como tímido:
vi_translation: I timidly asked:
tr_translation: I interjected a bit timidly:
es_translation: I asked, somewhat shyly:

en: “Is something gone wrong?”
vi: - Có chuyện gì thế?
tr: “Bir sorun mu var?
es: —¿Ha pasado algo?
vi_translation: - What's going on?
tr_translation: "Is there a problem?""
es_translation: —Has something happened?

en: The king whirls on me and rips out:
vi: Nhà vua nhìn tôi bực mình nói:
tr: Kral hırsla bana dönerek haykırdı:
es: El rey se volvió hacia mí y exclamó:
vi_translation: The king looked at me annoyed and said:
tr_translation: The king turned to me angrily and shouted:
es_translation: The king turned to me and exclaimed:

en: “None o’ your business! You keep your head shet, and mind y’r own affairs—if you got any. Long as you’re in this town don’t you forgit that—you hear?” Then he says to the duke, “We got to jest swaller it and say noth’n’: mum’s the word for us.”
vi: - Không việc gì đến mày! Đừng có cõ mõm vào chuyện của ngừơi khác. Chừng nào còn ở trong cái thị trấn này thì mày phải biết giữ kín mồm miệng, nghe không? Rồi lão quay ra nói với quận công: - Chúng ta đừng có gì cả, cứ im lặng thôi.
tr: “Seni ilgilendiren bir şey yok! Sen çeneni kapalı tut ve kendi işine bak… Yani işin varsa. Bu kasabada olduğun sürece bunu asla unutma, duydun mu?” Sonra tekrar düke döndü: “Üstüne bir bardak soğuk su içmekten başka yol yok, sesimizi çıkarmayalım.
es: —¡No es asunto tuyo! Tú cierra la boca y métete en tus cosas... Si es que las tienes. Y mientras estés en este pueblo, que no se te olvide, ¿entiendes? —y después dice al duque—: tenemos que aguantar y no decir nada; tenemos que mantenernos callados.
vi_translation: - None of your business! Don't stick your nose into other people's affairs. As long as you're in this town, you better keep your mouth shut, got it? Then the old man turned around and said to the duke: - Let's not have anything, just stay silent.
tr_translation: “This is none of your business! Keep your mouth shut and mind your own business… If you have any, that is. Never forget this as long as you are in this town, do you hear me?” Then he turned to the duke again: “There is no other way but to drink a glass of cold water and keep quiet.”
es_translation: —It's none of your business! You shut your mouth and mind your own business... If you have any. And while you're in this town, don't forget it, understand? —and then he says to the duke—: we have to endure and say nothing; we have to keep quiet.

en: As they was starting down the ladder the duke he chuckles again, and says:
vi: Họ bước xuống cầu thang, quận công còn thì thầm nói:
tr: Tam merdivenlerden aşağı inerlerken dük bir kahkaha daha attı:
es: Cuando empezaron a bajar la escalera, el duque volvió a reírse y dijo:
vi_translation: They walked down the stairs, the duke still whispering:
tr_translation: As they were descending the stairs, the duke let out another laugh:
es_translation: When they started to go down the stairs, the duke laughed again and said:

en: “Quick sales and small profits! It’s a good business—yes.”
vi: - Bán cho nhanh, lãi ít cũng được.
tr: “Hızlı satışlar; küçük kârlar! Ne ticaret ama…
es: —¡Ventas rápidas y pequeños beneficios! Es un buen negocio.
vi_translation: - Sell quickly, even if the profit is small.
tr_translation: “Quick sales; small profits! What a trade...”
es_translation: —Quick sales and small profits! It's a good business.

en: The king snarls around on him and says:
vi: Nhà vua nhe răng cười, nhìn quận công nói:
tr: Kral öfkeyle cevap verdi:
es: El rey le soltó un bufido y le dijo:
vi_translation: The king grinned, looking at the duke and said:
tr_translation: The king replied angrily:
es_translation: The king let out a snort and said to him:

en: “I was trying to do for the best in sellin’ ’em out so quick. If the profits has turned out to be none, lackin’ considable, and none to carry, is it my fault any more’n it’s yourn?”
vi: - Tôi đang tính cố gắng bán cả đi cho nhanh với số lãi tối đa. Nếu không được nhiều, hay chẳng được tí nào, thì cái đó là lỗi tại tôi hay tại anh?
tr: “Onları hızla elden çıkarmak için elimden geleni yapıyordum. Hiç kâr edemediysek, elimizde hiçbir şey kalmadıysa benim olduğu kadar senin de suçun değil mi?
es: —Cuando los vendí tan rápido estaba tratando de hacer lo que más nos convenía. Si resulta que no hay beneficios, que no sacamos nada y no nos llevamos nada, ¿tengo más culpa yo que tú?
vi_translation: - I'm planning to try to sell everything quickly for the maximum profit. If it doesn't make much, or doesn't make anything at all, then is that my fault or yours?
tr_translation: “I was doing my best to get rid of them quickly. If we never made a profit, if we have nothing left, isn't it as much your fault as it is mine?”
es_translation: —When I sold them so quickly, I was trying to do what was best for us. If it turns out there are no profits, that we gain nothing and get nothing, am I more to blame than you?

en: “Well, they’d be in this house yet and we wouldn’t if I could a got my advice listened to.”
vi: - Nếu ngài chịu nghe lời tôi, thì bây giờ lũ da đen vẫn còn trong nhà và chúng ta đã chuồn với bọc tiền to rồi.
tr: “Benim öğütlerime kulak verseydin onlar hâlâ bu evde olacaktı, ama biz olmayacaktık.
es: —Bueno, si se me hubiera escuchado, ellos seguirían en esta casa y nosotros no.
vi_translation: - If you had listened to me, the blacks would still be in the house and we would have already escaped with the big bag of money.
tr_translation: “If you had listened to my advice, they would still be in this house, but we would not be.””
es_translation: —Well, if they had listened to me, they would still be in this house and we wouldn't.

en: The king sassed back as much as was safe for him, and then swapped around and lit into me again. He give me down the banks for not coming and telling him I see the niggers come out of his room acting that way—said any fool would a knowed something was up. And then waltzed in and cussed himself awhile, and said it all come of him not laying late and taking his natural rest that morning, and he’d be blamed if he’d ever do it again. So they went off a-jawing; and I felt dreadful glad I’d worked it all off on to the niggers, and yet hadn’t done the niggers no harm by it.
vi: Nhà vua sợ lộ chuyện nên chạy vòng lên chỗ tôi để đe tôi là không được nói với ai về chuyện tôi trông thấy anh da đen ở trong phòng lão đi ra, bởi vì như thế thì ai cũng biết ngay là có chuyện. Rồi lão thất thểu đi về phòng, tự chửi rửa mình một hồi và nói rằng đầu đuôi cũng là tại lão cả, không chịu nằm nán lại trong phòng như mọi sáng, rồi thề rằng từ lần sau trở đi không có dại như thế. Rồi họ đi bàn tán gì với nhau nữa. Còn tôi thì mừng thầm trong bụng vì đã độ tội cho những người da đen mà lại không làm hại gì đến họ cả.
tr: Kral da çevreye duyurmamaya çalışarak ona cevap verdi, ardından lafı tekrar bana getirdi. Zencilerin öyle sessizce odasından çıktığını görmeme rağmen gidip ona söylemediğim için bir sürü sayıp sövdü – en beyinsiz adamın bile bir şeyler döndüğünü anlayabileceğini söyledi. Sonra tekrar dönüp biraz da kendisine sövdü; geç vakte kadar oturduğu ve o sabah yeterince dinlenemediği için tüm bunların olduğunu söyledi, bir daha asla böyle bir şey yapmayacağına yemin etti. Böyle çene çalarak uzaklaştılar ve ben de suçu zencilere attığım, ama zenciler bundan hiçbir zarar görmeyeceği için müthiş sevinçliydim.
es: El rey le respondió lo mejor que pudo y después se dio la vuelta y volvió a meterse conmigo. Me pegó un rapapolvo por no decirle que había visto a los negros salir de su habitación de aquella manera, que hasta un idiota habría comprendido que pasaba algo. Y después volvió a cambiar y se maldijo sobre todo a sí mismo durante un rato, y dijo que todo había pasado por no haberse quedado en la cama hasta tarde y haber descansado todo lo que necesitaba aquella mañana, y que maldito si volvía a hacerlo en su vida. Así que se marcharon de charla y yo me sentí contentísimo de haberle echado toda la culpa a los negros sin por eso haberles hecho ningún daño.
vi_translation: The king, afraid of the secret getting out, ran over to me to threaten me not to tell anyone about seeing the black man coming out of the old man's room, because if I did, everyone would immediately know something was up. Then the old man staggered back to his room, cursing himself for a while and saying that it was all his fault for not staying in his room longer like every morning, and swore that from then on he wouldn't be so foolish. Then they went on to discuss something else with each other. As for me, I was secretly glad that I had exonerated the black men without causing them any harm.
tr_translation: The king replied to him, trying not to let anyone else hear, and then brought the conversation back to me. Even though I saw the blacks quietly leaving the room, he cursed and swore at me for not telling him – he said even the most brainless person could understand that something was going on. Then he turned back and cursed himself a bit; he said all this happened because he stayed up late and didn't get enough rest that morning, and he swore he would never do such a thing again. They walked away chatting like that, and I was extremely happy because I blamed the blacks, but they wouldn't suffer any harm from it.
es_translation: The king responded to him as best he could and then turned around and went back to dealing with me. He gave me a scolding for not telling him that I had seen the blacks leaving his room in that manner, which even an idiot would have understood meant something was up. And then he changed again and cursed himself above all for a while, saying that everything had happened because he hadn't stayed in bed until late and rested as much as he needed that morning, and that damned if he would ever do it again in his life. So they went off chatting and I felt very happy to have put all the blame on the blacks without having done them any harm.

en: CHAPTER XXVIII.
vi: Chương XXXVIII
tr: Yirmi Sekizinci Bölüm
es: Capítulo 28
vi_translation: Chapter XXXVIII
tr_translation: Twenty-Eighth Chapter
es_translation: Chapter 28

en: “Yes; Mr. Lothrop’s. Why?”
vi: - Jim nói đúng đấy. Anh ta không có huy hiệu nào đâu.
tr: “Evet… mr Lothrop’un evi. Niye?”
es: —Sí; en casa del señor Lothrop. ¿Por qué?
vi_translation: - Jim is right. He doesn't have any badges.
tr_translation: "Yes... Mr. Lothrop's house. Why?"
es_translation: —Yes; at Mr. Lothrop's house. Why?

en: Then I come back and set down again, and says:
vi: Cuối cùng, nó chọn lấy một kiểu và bảo:
tr: Kapıyı kilitledikten sonra gelip tekrar oturdum ve anlatmaya başladım:
es: Después volví a sentarme y dije:
vi_translation: Finally, he picked a design and said:
tr_translation: After locking the door, I came back, sat down again, and started to tell:
es_translation: Then I sat down again and said:

en: “Miss Mary Jane, I’ll tell you what we’ll do, and you won’t have to stay at Mr. Lothrop’s so long, nuther. How fur is it?”
vi: - Viết lên gỗ thì không ổn rồi, vì trong tháp giam làm gì có tường bằng gỗ. Chúng mình phải khắc chữ vào đá mới đúng.
tr: “mr Lothrop’un evinde o kadar uzun süre kalmanıza gerek olmayacak. Orası ne kadar uzaklıkta?
es: —Señorita Mary Jane, le voy a decir lo que vamos a hacer y tampoco tendrá usted que quedarse tanto tiempo en casa del señor Lothrop. ¿A qué distancia está?
vi_translation: - Writing on wood won't work, because there are no wooden walls in the tower prison. We have to carve the letters into the stone instead.
tr_translation: "You won't need to stay at Mr. Lothrop's house for too long. How far is it?"
es_translation: —Miss Mary Jane, I'm going to tell you what we're going to do and you won't have to stay so long at Mr. Lothrop's house either. How far is it?

en: “Good,” she says, “I’ll do it.”
vi: Jim bảo khắc trên đá còn khó hơn trên gỗ, như vậy còn lâu hắn mới khắc xong mà trốn ra được.
tr: “Tamam,” dedi, “aynen öyle yapacağım.
es: —Muy bien —respondió—, eso haré.
vi_translation: Jim said that carving on stone is even harder than on wood, so it would take him a long time to finish and escape.
tr_translation: “Okay,” he said, “I will do exactly that.”
es_translation: —Very well —he responded—, I will do that.

en: I judged we had got everything fixed about right now. So I says:
vi: Thật là một ý tưởng kì quái, nhưng chúng tôi nghĩ có thể làm được.
tr: Artık her şeyi kararlaştırdığımıza karar verdim. Bu yüzden devam ettim:
es: Calculé que ya lo teníamos todo encaminado y dije:
vi_translation: It was a bizarre idea, but we thought we could do it.
tr_translation: I have decided that we have now settled everything. So I continued:
es_translation: I figured that we already had everything on track and said:

en: “Well,” she says, “I’ll run down to breakfast now, and then I’ll start straight for Mr. Lothrop’s.”
vi: Lúc đó chưa đến nửa đêm, chúng tôi ra ngoài và lần xuống xưởng, chỉ còn để Jim ở lại làm việc của hắn.
tr: “Tamam o zaman,” dedi, “Şimdi inip kahvaltıyı hazırlayayım, sonra doğruca mr Lothrop’lara giderim.
es: —Bueno —respondió ella—, voy a bajar a desayunar y después me iré directamente a casa del señor Lothrop.
vi_translation: It was not yet midnight, we went outside and headed down to the workshop, leaving only Jim to do his work.
tr_translation: “Alright then,” she said, “I’ll go down and prepare breakfast now, then I’ll head straight to Mr. Lothrop’s.”
es_translation: —Well —she replied—, I'm going to go down for breakfast and then I'll go straight to Mr. Lothrop's house.

en: “’Deed, that ain’t the ticket, Miss Mary Jane,” I says, “by no manner of means; go before breakfast.”
vi: Lúc đó chưa đến nửa đêm, chúng tôi ra ngoài và lần xuống xưởng, chỉ còn để Jim ở lại làm việc của hắn.
tr: “İşte bu kesinlikle olmaz, Bayan Mary Jane,” dedim, “bütün işi mahvedersiniz; kahvaltıdan önce gidin.
es: —Eso no puede ser, señorita Mary Jane —le indiqué—, en absoluto; váyase antes del desayuno.
vi_translation: It was not yet midnight, we went outside and headed down to the workshop, leaving only Jim to do his work.
tr_translation: “This is absolutely not possible, Miss Mary Jane,” I said, “you will ruin the whole thing; go before breakfast.”
es_translation: —That can't be, Miss Mary Jane —I indicated—, not at all; go before breakfast.

en: “What did you reckon I wanted you to go at all for, Miss Mary?”
vi: Lúc đó chưa đến nửa đêm, chúng tôi ra ngoài và lần xuống xưởng, chỉ còn để Jim ở lại làm việc của hắn.
tr: “En başından beri neden gitmenizi istediğimi sanıyorsunuz, Bayan Mary?
es: —¿Por qué cree usted que quería yo que hiciera todo esto, señorita Mary Jane?
vi_translation: It was not yet midnight, we went outside and headed down to the workshop, leaving only Jim to do his work.
tr_translation: “Why do you think I wanted you to leave from the very beginning, Miss Mary?”
es_translation: —Why do you think I wanted you to do all this, Miss Mary Jane?

en: “Gone to see a friend is all right, but I won’t have my love given to them.”
vi: Nó bảo Jim làm đến khi nào nến tắt thì hãy đi ngủ, đem giấu hòn đá xuống dưới ổ rồi nằm lên đó mà ngủ.
tr: “Bir arkadaşımı görmeye gittiğimi söylemende sorun yok, ama onlara sevgilerimi filan gönderecek değilim.
es: —Está bien lo de que he ido a ver a unos amigos, pero no quiero que los salude de mi parte.
vi_translation: He told Jim to keep working until the candle went out, then hide the rock under the bed and sleep on top of it.
tr_translation: “There's no problem in saying that I went to see a friend, but I'm not going to send them my regards or anything.”
es_translation: —It's fine that I went to see some friends, but I don't want you to greet them on my behalf.

en: “No, you’re out, there. They hain’t got it.”
vi: - Không có, cậu ạ. - Được, để tôi đi kiếm một ít cho.
tr: “Hiç de öyle hissetmeyin. Torba onlarda değil.
es: —No, ahí se equivoca. No la tienen.
vi_translation: - No, there isn't, my friend. - Okay, let me go get some for you.
tr_translation: “Don't feel that way at all. The bag is not with them.”
es_translation: —No, you are mistaken there. They don't have it.

en: “Why, who’s got it?”
vi: - Ôi, tôi sợ lắm.
tr: “Neden, kimde?
es: —Pues, ¿quién la tiene?
vi_translation: - Oh, I'm very scared.
tr_translation: “Why, with whom?”
es_translation: —Well, who has it?

en: Well, Mary Jane she lit out the back way, I reckon; because nobody see her go. When I struck Susan and the hare-lip, I says:
vi: - Cậu Tom ơi, tôi không muốn cái vẻ vang ấy. Con rắn sẽ mổ vào tôi. Không, cậu ạ, tôi không muốn làm cái chuyện đó.
tr: Mary Jane böylece çıktı gitti, galiba arka kapıyı kullanmıştı, çünkü kimse gittiğini fark etmedi. Susan ve Tavşan-dudak’a rastladığımda şöyle dedim:
es: Bueno, calculo que Mary Jane se fue por la puerta de atrás, porque nadie la vio salir. Cuando me encontré con Susan y la del labio leporino les dije:
vi_translation: - Tom, I don't want that glory. The snake will bite me. No, I don't want to do that.
tr_translation: Mary Jane thus went out, probably using the back door, because no one noticed she had left. When I ran into Susan and Harelip, I said:
es_translation: Well, I guess Mary Jane went out the back door, because no one saw her leave. When I met Susan and the girl with the cleft lip, I told them:

en: “There’s several; but it’s the Proctors, mainly.”
vi: Nếu anh không thích thì không cần phải giữ nó mãi cơ mà!
tr: “Ama çoğunlukla Proctor’lara gideriz.
es: —Hay varias; pero sobre todo la familia Proctor.
vi_translation: If you don't like it, you don't have to keep it forever!
tr_translation: “But we mostly go to the Proctors.”
es_translation: —There are several; but above all, the Proctor family.

en: “Sakes alive, I hope it ain’t Hanner?”
vi: - Tôi cũng không chịu được, cậu Tom ạ.
tr: “Yüce Tanrım, umarım Hanner değildir!
es: —Dios mío. ¡Espero que no sea Hanna!
vi_translation: - I can't stand it either, Tom.
tr_translation: “Oh my God, I hope it's not Hanner!”
es_translation: —My God. I hope it's not Hanna!

en: “I’m sorry to say it,” I says, “but Hanner’s the very one.”
vi: Tôi nói thật với cậu, chưa bao giờ tôi thấy lo ngại và khổ như thế này.
tr: “Bunu söylediğim için üzgünüm, ama ismi Hanner diye hatırlıyorum.
es: —Siento decirlo —añadí—, pero es precisamente ella.
vi_translation: I'm telling you the truth, I've never felt so worried and miserable like this.
tr_translation: “I'm sorry for saying this, but I remember the name as Hanner.”
es_translation: —I'm sorry to say it —I added—, but it's precisely her.

en: “My goodness, and she so well only last week! Is she took bad?”
vi: Tôi nói thật với cậu, chưa bao giờ tôi thấy lo ngại và khổ như thế này. - Thế ở đây có chuột không?
tr: “Eyvahlar olsun, daha geçen hafta toparlanmıştı! Durumu çok mu kötüymüş?
es: —¡Dios mío, con lo bien que estaba la semana pasada! ¿Está muy enferma?
vi_translation: I'm telling you the truth, I've never felt so worried and miserable like this. - So, are there any mice here?
tr_translation: “Oh no, it had just recovered last week! Is its condition very bad?”
es_translation: —My God, she was doing so well last week! Is she very sick?

en: “Mumps your granny! They don’t set up with people that’s got the mumps.”
vi: - Nhưng mà anh phải có chuột chứ. Anh đừng lo ngại, họ đều làm như thế cả.
tr: “Senin ninendir kabakulak! Kabakulak olanın başında bütün gece dikilirler mi hiç?
es: —¡Paperas tu abuela! La gente no se queda a acompañar a las personas con paperas.
vi_translation: - But you must have a mouse. Don't worry, they all do it that way.
tr_translation: "Your grandmother is mumps!" "Do they ever stand by the head of someone with mumps all night?""
es_translation: —Mumps, your grandmother! People don't stay to keep company with those who have mumps.

en: “They don’t, don’t they? You better bet they do with these mumps. These mumps is different. It’s a new kind, Miss Mary Jane said.”
vi: Anh đừng lo ngại, họ đều làm như thế cả. Tù nhân không bao giờ có chuột, họ huấn luyện nó nhiều mưu mẹo, rồi những con chuột đó trở thành gần gũi như con ruồi vậy.
tr: “Dikilmezler; niye dikilsinler ki? Ama işte böyle bir kabakulak geçirenin başında dikilmek gerekiyor. Farklı bir kabakulak olmuş. Yeni bir türmüş, dedi Bayan Mary Jane.
es: —¿Conque no, eh? Pues apuesto a que sí cuando son paperas como las suyas. Estas paperas son diferentes. Son de un tipo nuevo, me dijo la señorita Mary Jane.
vi_translation: Don't worry, they all do it that way. Prisoners never have mice, they train them with many tricks, and then those mice become as familiar as flies.
tr_translation: “They don't stand; why would they stand? But you see, it's necessary to stand by someone who has mumps like this. It's a different kind of mumps. It's a new type, said Mrs. Mary Jane.”
es_translation: —So, no, eh? Well, I bet it's yes when it's mumps like yours. These mumps are different. They're a new kind, Miss Mary Jane told me.

en: “Because it’s mixed up with other things.”
vi: Mà anh lại còn phải chơi âm nhạc cho chúng nghe nữa chứ. Anh có cái gì để chơi âm nhạc không?
tr: “Başka şeylerle karışık bir kabakulakmış.
es: —Mezcladas con otras cosas.
vi_translation: And you also have to play music for them.
tr_translation: “It was a mumps mixed with other things.”
es_translation: —Mixed with other things.

en: “My land! And they call it the mumps?”
vi: Nhưng tôi chắc chắn chúng nó không thích đàn búng.
tr: “Yok artık! Bütün bunlara kabakulak mı diyorlar?
es: —¡Dios mío! ¿Y a eso lo llaman paperas?
vi_translation: But I'm sure they don't like plucked instruments. - Yes, they do.
tr_translation: “No way! Do they call all of this mumps?”
es_translation: —My God! And they call that mumps?

en: “That’s what Miss Mary Jane said.”
vi: - Có chứ. Chúng nó không phân biệt thứ âm nhạc nào.
tr: “Bayan Mary Jane öyle dedi.
es: —Es lo que dijo la señorita Mary Jane.
vi_translation: They don't discriminate against any kind of music.
tr_translation: “Miss Mary Jane said so.”
es_translation: —That's what Miss Mary Jane said.

en: “Well, what in the nation do they call it the mumps for?”
vi: - Có chứ. Chúng nó không phân biệt thứ âm nhạc nào.
tr: “İyi ama hangi akla hizmet kabakulak diyorlar buna?
es: —Bueno, y, ¿por qué diablo lo llaman paperas?
vi_translation: They don't discriminate against any kind of music.
tr_translation: “Alright, but what sense does it make to call this mumps?”
es_translation: —Well, and, why the devil do they call it mumps?

en: “Why, because it is the mumps. That’s what it starts with.”
vi: Đàn búng đối với chuột là tốt lắm rồi.
tr: “Çünkü kabakulak işte. Her şey kabakulakla başlamış.
es: —Bueno, porque son las paperas. Empieza por ahí.
vi_translation: Plucking the instrument is already good enough for the mice.
tr_translation: “Because it's the mumps. Everything started with the mumps.”
es_translation: —Well, because it's the mumps. Start there.

en: “Well, it’s awful, I think,” says the hare-lip. “I’ll go to Uncle Harvey and—”
vi: -Vâng, tôi cũng nghĩ thế.
tr: Öyle feci bulaşıyor yani. Üstelik çürük çarık bir tırmığa da benzetmeyesin, bir bulaştı mı pir bulaşır. “Çok korkunç doğrusu,” dedi Tavşan-dudak. “Hemen Harvey Amca’ya gideyim…
es: —Bueno, pues me parece horrible —dijo la del labio leporino—; voy a ver al tío Harvey y...
vi_translation: -Yes, I think so too.
tr_translation: It spreads that badly. And don't think it's like a broken, old rake; once it spreads, it spreads thoroughly.” “It's really terrible,” said Harelip. “I should go to Uncle Harvey right away...”
es_translation: —Well, I think it's horrible —said the one with the cleft lip—; I'm going to see Uncle Harvey and...

en: “Oh, yes,” I says, “I would. Of course I would. I wouldn’t lose no time.”
vi: -Vâng, tôi cũng nghĩ thế. Nhưng lúc này tôi chẳng hiểu gì cả, tôi sẽ cố gắng làm theo nếu như tôi phải làm.
tr: “Git tabii,” dedim, “ben olsam hemen giderdim. Muhakkak onun yanına gitmek gerek. Ben olsam hiç vakit kaybetmezdim.
es: —Ah, sí —dije—. Es lo que haría yo. Naturalmente que sí. No perdería ni un momento.
vi_translation: -Yes, I think so too. But right now I don't understand anything, I will try to follow if I have to do it.
tr_translation: "Go ahead," I said, "if it were me, I would go immediately. It is absolutely necessary to go to him. If it were me, I wouldn't waste any time."
es_translation: —Ah, yes —I said—. That's what I would do. Of course. I wouldn't waste a moment.

en: “Shucks, and stay fooling around here when we could all be having good times in England whilst we was waiting to find out whether Mary Jane’s got it or not? Why, you talk like a muggins.”
vi: Chúng tôi sẽ tìm cho anh một cây con, và anh trồng nó vào góc nhà kia kìa. Đừng gọi nó lá hoa đuôi mèo, phải gọi nó là Pitchiola mới đúng.
tr: “Yok canım! İngiltere’de gezip hoş vakit geçirmek varken burada oyalanıp Mary Jane’in hastalanıp hastalanmadığını görmeyi mi bekleyeceğiz? Tam bir enayi gibi konuştun şimdi.
es: —Eso, y quedarnos aquí haciendo el tonto cuando podríamos estar divirtiéndonos en Inglaterra mientras esperábamos si a Mary Jane le habían dado o no. Qué tonterías dices.
vi_translation: We will find you a sapling, and you will plant it in that corner of the house over there. Don't call it a cat's tail flower, you must call it Pitchiola.
tr_translation: While we could be traveling and having a good time in England, are we going to hang around here waiting to see if Mary Jane gets sick or not? Now you talked like a complete fool.”
es_translation: —That, and staying here doing nothing when we could be having fun in England while we waited to see if Mary Jane got it or not. What nonsense you speak.

en: “Well, anyway, maybe you’d better tell some of the neighbors.”
vi: Và anh phải tưới cho nó bằng nước mắt.
tr: “Yine de belki komşulardan birine söyleseniz iyi olur.
es: —Bueno, en todo caso, a lo mejor tendríais que decírselo a alguno de los vecinos.
vi_translation: And you must water it with your tears.
tr_translation: “Still, it might be good to tell one of the neighbors.””
es_translation: —Well, in any case, maybe you should tell one of the neighbors.

en: “Well, maybe you’re right—yes, I judge you are right.”
vi: - Cậu Tom ơi, thế thì cây hoa ấy sẽ chết mất thôi, vì chẳng mấy khi tôi khóc.
tr: “Hımm, belki de haklısın… Evet, kesinlikle hakkın var.
es: —Bueno, a lo mejor tienes razón... Sí, creo que tienes razón.
vi_translation: - Uncle Tom, then that flower will surely die, because I rarely cry.
tr_translation: "Hmm, maybe you're right... Yes, you're definitely right."
es_translation: —Well, maybe you're right... Yes, I think you're right.

en: “All right,” they said, and cleared out to lay for their uncles, and give them the love and the kisses, and tell them the message.
vi: Nó hứa rằng sẽ nhặt một củ hành rồi buổi sáng sẽ ngầm bỏ vào trong bình cà phê của Jim, Jim bảo như thế thì sẽ có mùi hành ở trong cà phê, rồi Jim kêu ca các kế hoạch của Tom, nào là trồng cây hoa đuôi mèo, đánh đàn cho chuột nghe, vuốt ve rắn, nhện, ngoài ra lại còn phải mài bút, rồi khắc chữ vào đá, rồi viết nhật ký v... v... thật là rắc rối, phiền nhiễu.
tr: “Tamam o zaman,” dediler ve hemen amcalarının yanına koştular, onlara sevgileri ve öpücükleri ilettiler ablalarının mesajını da verdiler.
es: —Muy bien —dijeron, y se marcharon a buscar a sus tíos y a darles los saludos y los besos y contarles el recado.
vi_translation: Jim said that would make the coffee smell like onions, and then Jim complained about Tom's plans, such as planting cattail flowers, playing music for the mice, petting snakes and spiders, and also having to sharpen pencils, carve letters into stone, and write a diary, etc.
tr_translation: "Alright then," they said and immediately ran to their uncle, conveyed their love and kisses, and delivered their sister's message.
es_translation: —Very well —they said, and they went off to find their uncles and give them greetings and kisses and deliver the message.

en: CHAPTER XXIX.
vi: Chương XXIX
tr: Yirmi Dokuzuncu Bölüm
es: Capítulo 29
vi_translation: Chapter XXIX
tr_translation: Twenty-Ninth Chapter
es_translation: Chapter 29

en: They was fetching a very nice-looking old gentleman along, and a nice-looking younger one, with his right arm in a sling. And, my souls, how the people yelled and laughed, and kept it up. But I didn’t see no joke about it, and I judged it would strain the duke and the king some to see any. I reckoned they’d turn pale. But no, nary a pale did they turn. The duke he never let on he suspicioned what was up, but just went a goo-gooing around, happy and satisfied, like a jug that’s googling out buttermilk; and as for the king, he just gazed and gazed down sorrowful on them new-comers like it give him the stomach-ache in his very heart to think there could be such frauds and rascals in the world. Oh, he done it admirable. Lots of the principal people gethered around the king, to let him see they was on his side. That old gentleman that had just come looked all puzzled to death. Pretty soon he begun to speak, and I see straight off he pronounced like an Englishman—not the king’s way, though the king’s was pretty good for an imitation. I can’t give the old gent’s words, nor I can’t imitate him; but he turned around to the crowd, and says, about like this:
vi: Họ kéo đến một ông già trông rất lịch sự cùng với một người trẻ hơn, trông cũng khá chững chặc, cánh tay phải đeo một cái băng. Hình như chuyện này không phải là đùa. Có lẽ nhà vua với quận công cũng đang chột dạ. Tôi chắc họ sẽ sợ tái mặt. Nhưng không, họ chẳng tỏ vẻ gì cả. Quận công vẫn cứ điểm nhiên đi ú ở quanh đó, vẻ thỏa mãn. Còn nhà vua thì nhìn lên nhìn xuống, vẻ ngần ngại lo lắng; hình như cái đó làm cho lão đau lòng vì nghĩ rằng trên đời làm gì lại có những tên lừa bịp xỏ lá như vậy. Rất nhiều người đứng chung quanh nhà vua để ủng hộ lão. Một lát sau, ông già sang trọng bắt đầu nói. Tôi nhận thấy ngay rằng ông ta nói đúng như một người Anh thực sự chứ không giống với kiểu của nhà vua. Ông ta nói đại khái thế này:
tr: Yanlarında çok şık bir yaşlı beyefendiyi getiriyorlardı, bir de sağ kolu askıda olan, yine şık daha genç bir adam vardı. Tanrım, insanlar nasıl da bağırıyor; gülüyor ve şamata çıkarıyordu. Ama ben durumu hiç komik bulmuyordum, dükün ve kralın da onları görünce korkacağını düşünmüştüm. İkisi de bembeyaz kesilir sanıyordum. Ama yok, hiç de bembeyaz kesilmediler. Dük neler olduğunu anladığını hiç çaktırmadı, etrafta mutlu mesut dolanmaya ve etrafa krema saçan süt güğümü gibi uuu-uuu yapmaya devam etti; kral ise dünyada böyle sahtekârlar ve alçaklar olması onu derinden yaralamış gibi acılı ve üzüntülü bir ifadeyle oraya baktı. Ah, gerçekten hayran olunacak bir oyunculuktu. Kasabadaki insanların çoğu kralın etrafına toplanarak onun yanında olduklarını göstermeye çalıştılar. Yaşlı beyefendi şaşkınlıktan küçük dilini yutmuş bir halde geldi. Çok geçmeden de konuşmaya başladı, doğrusu tam bir İngiliz gibi konuşuyordu, kralın konuşmasından çok farklıydı, ama kralın konuşması da bir taklit için epeyce iyiydi doğrusu. Yaşlı adamın nasıl konuştuğunu anlatamam, onu taklit de edemem; ama kalabalığa dönerek aşağı yukarı şöyle bir şey söyledi:
es: TRAÍAN A UN CABALLERO anciano de muy buen aspecto y a otro más joven también de buen aspecto, con el brazo derecho en cabestrillo. ¡Dios mío, cómo gritaba y reía aquella gente, sin parar un momento! Pero yo no le veía la gracia y supuse que al duque y al rey también les costaría trabajo verla. Me daba la sensación de que se iban a poner pálidos. Pero no, ellos no palidecieron. El duque no dejó ver que sospechaba lo que pasaba, sino que siguió haciendo «gu-gu» a la gente, feliz y contento, como un cántaro del que se vierte la leche, y en cuanto al rey, no hizo más que mirar con pena a los recién llegados, como si le doliese el estómago sólo de pensar que podía haber en el mundo gente con tan poca vergüenza. ¡Ah!, lo hizo admirablemente. Muchos de los personajes del pueblo fueron junto al rey para demostrarle que estaban de su parte. El viejo caballero que acababa de llegar parecía muerto de confusión. En seguida empezó a hablar y vi inmediatamente que tenían un acento igual que el de un inglés, no al estilo del rey, aunque el rey hacía muy bien las imitaciones. No sé escribir exactamente lo que dijo el anciano, ni puedo imitarlo, pero se volvió hacia la gente y va y dice algo así:
vi_translation: They approached an old man who looked very polite along with a younger man, who also looked quite mature, with a bandage on his right arm. It seemed like this matter was not a joke. Perhaps the king and the duke were also feeling uneasy. I'm sure they would be scared pale. But no, they didn't show any signs of it. The duke still calmly wandered around there, looking satisfied. And the king looked up and down, appearing hesitant and worried; it seemed that it pained him to think that there could be such deceitful swindlers in the world. Many people stood around the king to support him. A moment later, the dignified old man began to speak. I immediately noticed that he spoke exactly like a real Englishman, unlike the king's manner of speaking. He spoke roughly like this:
tr_translation: They were bringing along a very elegant elderly gentleman, and also a younger man, equally elegant, with his right arm in a sling. My God, how people were shouting; laughing and making a racket. But I didn't find the situation funny at all, and I thought the duke and the king would be scared when they saw them. I thought both of them would turn pale as a sheet. But no, they didn't turn pale at all. The duke didn't let on that he understood what was happening, he continued to wander around happily and making a "uuu-uuu" sound like a milk churn spraying cream everywhere; the king, on the other hand, looked at the scene with a pained and sorrowful expression, as if deeply wounded by the existence of such frauds and scoundrels in the world. Ah, it was truly an admirable performance. Most of the people in the town gathered around the king, trying to show their support for him. The elderly gentleman came in, utterly dumbfounded. Soon enough, he started to speak, and indeed, he spoke just like an Englishman, very different from the king's speech, although the king's speech was quite good for an imitation. I can't describe how the old man spoke, nor can I imitate it; but turning to the crowd, he said something along these lines:
es_translation: THEY BROUGHT AN elderly gentleman of very good appearance and another younger one, also of good appearance, with his right arm in a sling. My God, how those people shouted and laughed, without stopping for a moment! But I didn't see the humor in it and supposed that the duke and the king would also find it hard to see. I had the feeling they were going to turn pale. But no, they did not turn pale. The duke did not let on that he suspected what was happening, but continued making "goo-goo" sounds to the people, happy and content, like a pitcher pouring out milk, and as for the king, he just looked sadly at the newcomers, as if his stomach hurt just thinking that there could be people in the world with so little shame. Ah, he did it admirably. Many of the town's characters went to the king to show him they were on his side. The old gentleman who had just arrived seemed dead with embarrassment. He immediately began to speak and I saw right away that they had an accent just like an Englishman's, not like the king's, although the king did very well with imitations. I can't write exactly what the old man said, nor can I imitate it, but he turned to the people and said something like this:

en: “This is a surprise to me which I wasn’t looking for; and I’ll acknowledge, candid and frank, I ain’t very well fixed to meet it and answer it; for my brother and me has had misfortunes; he’s broke his arm, and our baggage got put off at a town above here last night in the night by a mistake. I am Peter Wilks’ brother Harvey, and this is his brother William, which can’t hear nor speak—and can’t even make signs to amount to much, now’t he’s only got one hand to work them with. We are who we say we are; and in a day or two, when I get the baggage, I can prove it. But up till then I won’t say nothing more, but go to the hotel and wait.”
vi: - Đây thật là một điều kỳ lạ mà tôi không thể ngờ tới được. Em tôi và tôi gặp chuyện không may; em tôi bị gãy tay, và hành lý của chúng tôi bị đưa nhầm lên thị trấn khác. Tôi là Harvey, em của Peter Wilks; còn đây là người em William. William không nghe thấy gì và không nói được, cũng không làm dấu hiệu được nhiều lắm vì chú ấy đã gãy mất một cánh tay. Trong một vài ngày nữa lấy được hành lý về, chúng tôi sẽ có đủ bằng chứng. Nhưng từ nay đến lúc đó, tôi không muốn nói gì thêm nữa, chúng tôi về khách sạn và chở ở đó. Rồi hai người bước đi.
tr: “Burada hiç beklemediğim, çok şaşırtıcı bir durumla karşılaştım; dürüstçe söylemeliyim ki böyle bir şeyi göğüslemeye ve mücadele etmeye de pek hazırlıklı değilim; zira kardeşim ve ben bazı talihsizlikler yaşadık, o kolunu kırdı, eşyalarımız dün gece yanlışlıkla buradan yukarıda bir kasabaya indirildi. Ben Peter Wilks’in ağabeyi Harvey’yim, bu da kardeşi William, kendisi sağır ve dilsizdir – üstelik şimdi bir kolu askıda olduğundan işaret dilini bile kullanamayacak halde. Biz söylediğimiz kişileriz ve bir-iki gün içinde eşyalarım gelince bunu kanıtlayacağım. Ama o zamana kadar başka bir şey demeyeceğim ve otele gidip bekleyeceğim.
es: —Ésta es una sorpresa que no me esperaba, y reconozco con toda sinceridad que no estoy muy bien preparado para reaccionar a ella y responder, pues mi hermano y yo hemos sufrido algunas desgracias; él se ha roto el brazo y anoche dejaron nuestro equipaje en un pueblo más arriba por equivocación. Soy Harvey, el hermano de Peter Wilks, y éste, su hermano William, que es sordomudo, y ahora ni siquiera puede hablar mucho por señas, dado que sólo tiene una mano libre. Somos quienes decimos que somos, y dentro de un día o dos, cuando llegue el equipaje, podré demostrarlo. Pero hasta entonces no voy a decir más, sino que me voy al hotel a esperar.
vi_translation: - This is truly a strange thing that I could not have anticipated. My brother and I had an unfortunate incident; my brother broke his arm, and our luggage was mistakenly sent to another town. I am Harvey, the brother of Peter Wilks; and this is my brother William. William cannot hear or speak, and he can't make many signs because he has broken an arm. In a few days, when we retrieve our luggage, we will have enough evidence. But until then, I don't want to say anything more, we will go to the hotel and wait there. Then the two people walked away.
tr_translation: “I encountered a very surprising situation here that I did not expect at all; I must honestly say that I am not very prepared to face and fight such a thing; because my brother and I had some misfortunes, he broke his arm, and our belongings were mistakenly taken to a town up here last night. I am Harvey, the older brother of Peter Wilks, and this is his brother William, who is deaf and mute – moreover, since his arm is in a sling now, he cannot even use sign language. We are the people we claim to be, and I will prove it when my belongings arrive in a day or two. But until then, I will not say anything else and will go to the hotel to wait.”
es_translation: —This is a surprise I did not expect, and I sincerely admit that I am not very well prepared to react to it and respond, as my brother and I have suffered some misfortunes; he has broken his arm and last night our luggage was left in a town further up by mistake. I am Harvey, Peter Wilks' brother, and this is his brother William, who is deaf-mute, and now he can't even communicate much through signs, given that he only has one free hand. We are who we say we are, and within a day or two, when the luggage arrives, I will be able to prove it. But until then I will not say more, and I am going to the hotel to wait.

en: So him and the new dummy started off; and the king he laughs, and blethers out:
vi: Nhà vua cười, lải nhải một hồi:
tr: Böylece yanında yeni sağır-dilsizle birlikte yürüyüp gitti, kral da arkasından bir kahkaha atarak seslendi:
es: Así que él y el nuevo mudo se pusieron en marcha, y el rey se echa a reír y suelta: —Conque se ha roto el brazo, vaya, justo a tiempo, ¿no?
vi_translation: The king laughed and muttered for a while:
tr_translation: Thus, he walked away with the new deaf-mute by his side, and the king called out after him with a laugh:
es_translation: So he and the new mute set off, and the king burst out laughing and said: —So, you've broken your arm, huh, just in time, right?

en: “Broke his arm—very likely, ain’t it?—and very convenient, too, for a fraud that’s got to make signs, and ain’t learnt how. Lost their baggage! That’s mighty good!—and mighty ingenious—under the circumstances!”
vi: - Gẫy tay, ừ điều đó là có thể, phải không các vị? Và lại tiện lợi đối với một anh bịp mà phải làm dấu hiệu. Mất hành lý, đây mới là một mưu mẹo thông minh!
tr: “Kolunu kırmış… ona ne şüphe! Tam da zamanında kırmış doğrusu, işaret dilini kullanması gereken, ama nasıl kullanacağını öğrenememiş üçkâğıtçılar için çok uygun bir zamanda. Eşyalarını kaybetmişler! Bu daha da şahane!.. Üstelik çok zekice… Yani koşullar düşünülürse!
es: Y muy cómodo para un mentiroso que tiene que hablar por señas y que no se las ha aprendido. ¡Han perdido su equipaje! ¡Ésa sí que es buena! Y resulta muy ingenioso, en estas circunstancias.
vi_translation: - A broken arm, yes, that's possible, isn't it, gentlemen? And it's convenient for a trickster who needs to make a signal. Losing luggage, now that's an intelligent ruse!
tr_translation: “He broke his arm... no doubt about it! He broke it at just the right time, truly, at a very convenient time for those tricksters who need to use sign language but haven't learned how to use it. They lost their belongings! This is even more marvelous!.. Moreover, very clever... Considering the circumstances!”
es_translation: And very convenient for a liar who has to speak in signs and hasn't learned them. They've lost their luggage! That's a good one! And it turns out to be very clever, in these circumstances.

en: So he laughed again; and so did everybody else, except three or four, or maybe half a dozen. One of these was that doctor; another one was a sharp-looking gentleman, with a carpet-bag of the old-fashioned kind made out of carpet-stuff, that had just come off of the steamboat and was talking to him in a low voice, and glancing towards the king now and then and nodding their heads—it was Levi Bell, the lawyer that was gone up to Louisville; and another one was a big rough husky that come along and listened to all the old gentleman said, and was listening to the king now. And when the king got done this husky up and says:
vi: Rồi lão ta cười hô hố, mọi người khác cũng cười theo, chỉ trừ có ba bốn người là không tán thành. Một trong những người ấy là ông bác sĩ. Người thứ hai là một ông trông rất lịch sự, tay xách vali,vừa mới ở tàu thủy bước xuống lúc nãy và đang nói chuyện nhỏ với ông bác sĩ, thỉnh thoảng nhìn lên nhà vua và hai người lại gật gật cái đầu. Đó là trạng sư Levi Ben vừa từ Louisville trở về. Người thứ ba to lớn, vạm vỡ, vừa mới bước tới, nghe ông già lúc nãy nói bây giờ đang nghe nhà vua nói. Nhà vua nói xong, người đó nhìn lên hỏi:
tr: Yine bir kahkaha attı; diğerleri de ona katıldılar, ama üç-dört kişi, belki de altı kişi filan gülmedi. Bunlardan biri doktordu; diğeri kilimden yapılmış eski moda bir bez çanta taşıyan sert görünüşlü bir beydi. Vapurdan yeni inmişti ve doktorla fısıldaşıyordu; arada krala bakıyor ve başlarını sallıyorlardı – bu adam Levi Bell’di, yani Louisville’e gitmiş olan avukat; bir de gelip yaşlı beyefendinin söylediği her şeyi dinleyen iriyarı başka bir adam daha vardı, şimdi de kralın söylediklerini dinliyordu. Kral sözlerini bitirdiğinde iriyarı adam yüksek sesle ona seslendi:
es: Así que volvió a reírse, igual que todo el mundo, salvo tres o cuatro, o quizá media docena. Uno de ellos era el médico, otro un caballero de aspecto astuto, con una bolsa de tela de esas anticuadas, hecha de tejido para alfombra, que acababa de desembarcar del barco de vapor y que hablaba con el médico en voz baja, mientras miraban al rey de vez en cuando y hacían gestos con la cabeza: era Levi Bell, el abogado que había ido a Louisville, y otro era un tipo alto y robusto que se había acercado a oír lo que decía el anciano y que ahora escuchaba al rey. Y cuando terminó el rey, el tipo robusto va y dice:
vi_translation: Then the old man laughed loudly, and everyone else laughed along, except for three or four people who did not agree. One of those people was the doctor. The second person was a very polite man, carrying a suitcase, who had just disembarked from the ship earlier and was speaking quietly with the doctor, occasionally looking up at the king and nodding their heads. That was lawyer Levi Ben, who had just returned from Louisville. The third person was large and muscular, who had just arrived and was listening to the old man earlier and now listening to the king. After the king finished speaking, that person looked up and asked:
tr_translation: He laughed again; the others joined him, but three or four people, maybe six or so, did not laugh. One of them was a doctor; the other was a stern-looking man carrying an old-fashioned cloth bag made of kilim. He had just gotten off the ferry and was whispering with the doctor; occasionally they would look at the king and nod their heads – this man was Levi Bell, the lawyer who had gone to Louisville; there was also a burly man who came and listened to everything the old gentleman said, and now he was listening to what the king was saying. When the king finished his words, the burly man called out to him loudly:
es_translation: So he laughed again, just like everyone else, except three or four, or maybe half a dozen. One of them was the doctor, another a gentleman with a shrewd appearance, carrying one of those old-fashioned carpet bags, who had just disembarked from the steamboat and was speaking quietly with the doctor, while they occasionally glanced at the king and nodded: it was Levi Bell, the lawyer who had gone to Louisville, and another was a tall, sturdy fellow who had approached to hear what the old man was saying and was now listening to the king. And when the king finished, the sturdy fellow goes and says:

en: “Say, looky here; if you are Harvey Wilks, when’d you come to this town?”
vi: - Nếu ông là Harvey Wilks thì hỏi ông đến thị trấn này từ bao giờ?
tr: “Bana baksana sen, eğer Harvey Wilks sensen kasabaya ne zaman geldin?
es: —Oiga, una cosa: si es usted Harvey Wilks, ¿cuándo llegó usted al pueblo?
vi_translation: - If you are Harvey Wilks, then when did you arrive in this town?
tr_translation: "Hey, look at me, if you are Harvey Wilks, when did you arrive in town?"
es_translation: —Listen, one thing: if you are Harvey Wilks, when did you arrive in town?

en: “The day before the funeral, friend,” says the king.
vi: - Trước hôm đưa tang, thưa ông.
tr: “Cenazeden bir gün önce geldim, dostum,” dedi kral.
es: —El día antes del funeral, amigo mío —dice el rey.
vi_translation: - The day before the funeral, sir.
tr_translation: “I arrived the day before the funeral, my friend,” said the king.
es_translation: —The day before the funeral, my friend —says the king.

en: “But what time o’ day?”
vi: - Nhưng mà vào lúc mấy giờ?
tr: “Peki saat kaç gibi geldin?
es: —Pero, ¿a qué hora?
vi_translation: - But at what time?
tr_translation: “So, what time did you arrive?”
es_translation: —But, at what time?

en: “In the evenin’—’bout an hour er two before sundown.”
vi: - Vào buổi chiều, khoảng một hai tiếng đồng hồ trước lúc mặt trời lặn.
tr: “Akşam geldim… Güneş batmadan bir-iki saat kadar önce.
es: —Por la tarde, una hora o dos antes del anochecer.
vi_translation: - In the afternoon, about one or two hours before sunset.
tr_translation: “I came in the evening... About an hour or two before sunset.”
es_translation: —In the afternoon, an hour or two before dusk.

en: “How’d you come?”
vi: - Ông đến bằng cách gì?
tr: “Nasıl geldin?
es: —¿Cómo Legó?
vi_translation: - How did you get here?
tr_translation: “How did you come?”
es_translation: —How did he arrive?

en: “I come down on the Susan Powell from Cincinnati.”
vi: - Tôi đi tàu Susan Powell từ Cincinati đến.
tr: “Cincinnati’den Susan Powell’la geldim.
es: —Vine en el Susan Powell desde Cincinnati.
vi_translation: - I took the Susan Powell train from Cincinnati to here.
tr_translation: “I came with Susan Powell from Cincinnati.”
es_translation: —I came on the Susan Powell from Cincinnati.

en: “Well, then, how’d you come to be up at the Pint in the mornin’—in a canoe?”
vi: - Thế ông làm thế nào lại lên bến tàu vào buổi sáng được, ông đi xuồng à
tr: “Peki o zaman sabahleyin yukarıda Pint’te ne işin vardı… Niçin bir kanodaydın?
es: —Entonces, ¿cómo es que estaba usted aquella mañana en la Punta, en una canoa?
vi_translation: - So how did you manage to get to the dock in the morning, did you take a boat?
tr_translation: “Well then, what were you doing up at Pint in the morning... Why were you in a canoe?”
es_translation: —So, how is it that you were at La Punta that morning, in a canoe?

en: “I warn’t up at the Pint in the mornin’.”
vi: - Tôi không lên bến tàu vào buổi sáng.
tr: “Sabahleyin Pint’te değildim ki.
es: —Aquella mañana yo no estaba en la Punta.
vi_translation: - I do not go to the dock in the morning.
tr_translation: “I wasn't in Pint in the morning.”
es_translation: —That morning I wasn't at the Punta.

en: “It’s a lie.”
vi: - Nói bậy.
tr: “Yalan söylüyorsun.
es: —Miente.
vi_translation: - Nonsense.
tr_translation: "You are lying."
es_translation: —He lies.

en: Several of them jumped for him and begged him not to talk that way to an old man and a preacher.
vi: Nhiều người bước đến yêu cầu người kia không được nói năng như vậy đối với một mục sư. - Mục sư à?
tr: Birkaç kişi hemen yanına gidip yaşlı bir adamla ve bir rahiple böyle konuşmaması için ona yalvardılar.
es: Unos cuantos se le echaron encima y le dijeron que no hablara así a un viejo que además era predicador.
vi_translation: Many people came forward and demanded that the other person not speak in such a manner to a pastor. - Pastor?
tr_translation: A few people immediately went to him and begged him not to speak like that to an old man and a priest.
es_translation: A few of them jumped on him and told him not to talk like that to an old man who was also a preacher.

en: “Preacher be hanged, he’s a fraud and a liar. He was up at the Pint that mornin’. I live up there, don’t I? Well, I was up there, and he was up there. I see him there. He come in a canoe, along with Tim Collins and a boy.”
vi: Treo cổ nó lên, nó là một thằng lừa bịp. Nó lên bến tày sáng hôm đó. Chính tôi ở đó chứ đâu và trông thấy nó. Nó đi xuồng, đi cùng với Tim Collins và một thằng bé nữa.
tr: “Yemişim rahibini, sahtekârın ve yalancının teki o. Sabahleyin Pint’teydi. Orada oturduğumu bilmiyor musunuz? Ben evin önündeyken o da oradaydı. Onu gördüğümden eminim. Bir kanodaydı, yanında Tim Collins ve bir oğlan vardı.
es: —De predicador, nada; es un mentiroso y un estafador. Aquella mañana estaba en la Punta. Yo vivo allí, ¿no? Bueno pues allí estaba yo y allí estaba él, y yo lo vi. Llegó en una canoa, con Tim Collins y un muchacho.
vi_translation: Hang him up, he's a fraud. He arrived at the dock that morning. I was there myself and saw him. He went by boat, along with Tim Collins and another boy.
tr_translation: “To hell with the priest, he's nothing but a fraud and a liar. He was at Pint in the morning. Don't you know I sit there? He was there while I was in front of the house. I'm sure I saw him. He was in a canoe, with Tim Collins and a boy beside him.”
es_translation: —As a preacher, nothing; he's a liar and a fraud. That morning he was at the Point. I live there, don't I? Well, I was there and he was there, and I saw him. He arrived in a canoe, with Tim Collins and a boy.

en: The doctor he up and says:
vi: Bác sĩ kia hỏi:
tr: Doktor araya girip sordu: “O oğlanı tekrar görsen tanır mısın, Hines?
es: El médico va y dice:
vi_translation: The doctor asked:
tr_translation: The doctor intervened and asked, "Would you recognize that boy if you saw him again, Hines?"
es_translation: The doctor goes and says:

en: “Would you know the boy again if you was to see him, Hines?”
vi: - Nếu anh trông thấy thằng bé ấy nữa thì anh có nhận được ra nó không, Hines?
tr: Doktor araya girip sordu: “O oğlanı tekrar görsen tanır mısın, Hines?
es: —¿Reconocería usted al muchacho si volviera a verlo, Hines?
vi_translation: - If you see that boy again, would you recognize him, Hines?
tr_translation: The doctor intervened and asked, "Would you recognize that boy if you saw him again, Hines?"
es_translation: —Would you recognize the boy if you saw him again, Hines?

en: “I reckon I would, but I don’t know. Why, yonder he is, now. I know him perfectly easy.”
vi: - Nhận ra chứ. A, nó kia rồi. Người đó chỉ đúng vào tôi.
tr: “Tanırım herhalde, tam bilemiyorum. Ama durun, işte şurada. Hemen tanıdım.
es: —Calculo que sí, pero no lo sé. Vaya, ahí está. Lo reconozco perfectamente.
vi_translation: - Recognize it? Ah, there it is. That person pointed directly at me.
tr_translation: “I probably know him, but I'm not sure. But wait, there he is. I recognized him immediately.”
es_translation: —I suppose so, but I don't know. Well, there it is. I recognize it perfectly.

en: It was me he pointed at. The doctor says:
vi: Người đó chỉ đúng vào tôi. Bác sĩ nói:
tr: Beni işaret etmişti. Doktor diğerlerine döndü:
es: Y me señaló. El médico dice:
vi_translation: That person pointed directly at me. The doctor said:
tr_translation: He had pointed at me. The doctor turned to the others:
es_translation: And he pointed at me. The doctor says:

en: “Neighbors, I don’t know whether the new couple is frauds or not; but if these two ain’t frauds, I am an idiot, that’s all. I think it’s our duty to see that they don’t get away from here till we’ve looked into this thing. Come along, Hines; come along, the rest of you. We’ll take these fellows to the tavern and affront them with t’other couple, and I reckon we’ll find out something before we get through.”
vi: - Thưa các vị, tôi chưa dám chắc hai người vừa tới lúc nãy có phải là bịp hay không, nhưng còn hai thằng cha ở đây mà không phải là những tên lừa bịp thì tôi chỉ là một thằng ngốc. Tôi nghĩ rằng bổn phận của chúng ta là phải giữ không để nó chạy khỏi nơi này cho đến khi nào chúng ta rõ được sự tình. Mọi người đi theo tôi đến khách sạn và cho đối chất với hai người mới tới kia; tôi chắc chúng ta có thể tìm được cái gì đó. Mọi người tỏ vẻ giận dữ trừ những kẻ đứng về phe nhà vua.
tr: “Yeni gelenlerin sahtekâr olup olmadığını bilmiyorum, dostlarım; ama bu ikisi sahtekâr değilse ben aptalın tekiyim demektir. Bence bu iş bir çözüme kavuşuncaya kadar bir yere kaçmalarını engellemek en başta gelen görevimiz. Haydi yürü, Hines; geri kalanlar da gelsin. Bu adamları hana götürelim ve diğer ikisiyle yüzleştirelim, belki o zaman bir şeyler öğrenebiliriz.
es: —Vecinos, no sé si estos nuevos son dos mentirosos o no, pero si no lo son, es que yo soy idiota, es lo que digo. Creo que tenemos que impedir que se vayan de aquí hasta que lo hayamos aclarado todo. Vamos, Hines; venid todos vosotros. Vamos a llevar a estos tipos a la taberna a enfrentarlos con los otros dos y seguro que antes de terminar habremos averiguado algo.
vi_translation: - Ladies and gentlemen, I am not yet sure if the two people who just arrived are frauds or not, but if these two guys here are not swindlers, then I am just a fool. I think it is our duty to keep them from leaving this place until we understand the situation. Everyone, follow me to the hotel and confront the two newcomers; I am sure we can find something. Everyone appeared angry except for those who sided with the king.
tr_translation: “I don't know if the newcomers are frauds, my friends; but if these two are not frauds, then I must be a fool. I think our primary duty is to prevent them from escaping until this matter is resolved. Come on, Hines; the rest of you, follow. Let's take these men to the inn and confront them with the other two, maybe then we can learn something.”
es_translation: —Neighbors, I don't know if these new ones are two liars or not, but if they're not, then I'm an idiot, that's what I say. I think we need to stop them from leaving here until we've cleared everything up. Come on, Hines; all of you, come along. Let's take these guys to the tavern to confront them with the other two and surely before we're done we'll have figured something out.

en: It was nuts for the crowd, though maybe not for the king’s friends; so we all started. It was about sundown. The doctor he led me along by the hand, and was plenty kind enough, but he never let go my hand.
vi: Thế là tất cả chúng tôi phải đi. Lúc ấy mặt trời sắp lặn. Ông bác sĩư nắm lấy tay tôi dắt đi, nắm nhẹ thôi, nhưng không chịu buông tôi ra một chút nào.
tr: Kalabalığı bir heyecan sarmıştı, gerçi kralın dostları pek memnun olmamıştı herhalde; yine de hep beraber yola koyulduk. Güneş batmak üzereydi. Doktor yol boyunca beni elimden tutup götürdü, gayet iyi davranıyordu ama elimi kesinlikle bırakmıyordu.
es: A la gente le encantó aquello, aunque quizá no a los amigos del rey; así que nos pusimos en marcha. Era hacia el atardecer. El médico me llevó de la mano y estuvo muy amable, pero nunca me soltó.
vi_translation: So, we all had to go. At that time, the sun was about to set. The doctor took my hand and led me, gently, but he didn't let go of me for a moment.
tr_translation: The crowd was filled with excitement, although the king's friends were probably not very pleased; still, we all set off together. The sun was about to set. The doctor held my hand and led me along the way, he was behaving very well but he definitely did not let go of my hand.
es_translation: The people loved it, although perhaps not the king's friends; so we set off. It was towards the evening. The doctor took me by the hand and was very kind, but he never let go.

en: We all got in a big room in the hotel, and lit up some candles, and fetched in the new couple. First, the doctor says:
vi: Mọi người bước vào một căn phòng rộng lớn trong khách sạn, rồi cho mời hai người lúc nãy tới. Ông bác sĩ lên tiếng trước:
tr: Hepimiz otelin büyük salonuna toplandık, kandiller yakıldı ve yeni çift getirildi. Önce doktor konuştu:
es: Entramos todos en una gran habitación del hotel y encendieron unas velas e hicieron venir a los dos nuevos. Primero el médico dice:
vi_translation: Everyone entered a large room in the hotel, then summoned the two people from earlier. The doctor spoke first:
tr_translation: We all gathered in the hotel's large hall, the lamps were lit, and the new couple was brought in. First, the doctor spoke:
es_translation: We all entered a large room in the hotel, lit some candles, and brought in the two newcomers. First, the doctor says:

en: “I don’t wish to be too hard on these two men, but I think they’re frauds, and they may have complices that we don’t know nothing about. If they have, won’t the complices get away with that bag of gold Peter Wilks left? It ain’t unlikely. If these men ain’t frauds, they won’t object to sending for that money and letting us keep it till they prove they’re all right—ain’t that so?”
vi: - Tôi không muốn làm gì quá đáng đối với hai người này, nhưng vì tôi nghĩ họ là những tên lừa bịp, và họ có thể có những âm mưu mà ta không biết. Liệu chúng có dám chuồn đi mà lại để lại cái bọc tiền của Peter Wilks không? Chắc không đâu. Nếu những tên này không phải là những tay lừa bịp thì chắc sẽ lấy bọc tiền đó ra đây để chúng ta giữ cho đến lúc nào chứng minh được họ là lương thiện, mọi người có đồng ý thế không?
tr: “Bu iki adama haksızlık etmek istemiyorum, ama bana kalırsa onlar dolandırıcı, üstelik bizim bilmediğimiz suç ortakları da olabilir. Suç ortakları varsa Peter Wilks’in altınlarıyla torbayı alıp çoktan tüymüşlerdir? Buna izin veremeyiz. Bu ikisi sahtekâr değilse, o parayı getirtmeye ve doğruyu söylediklerini ispat edinceye kadar parayı bizim saklamamıza karşı çıkmayacaklardır… Haksız mıyım?
es: —No quiero ser demasiado duro con estos dos hombres, pero yo creo que son unos estafadores y quizá tengan cómplices de los que no sabemos nada. En tal caso, ¿no se escaparán los cómplices con el saco de oro que dejó Peter Wilks? No sería raro. Si estos hombres no son estafadores, no se opondrán a que vayamos a buscar el dinero y lo guardemos hasta que demuestren que no lo son; ¿no os parece?
vi_translation: - I don't want to do anything excessive to these two people, but because I think they are swindlers, and they might have schemes that we don't know about. Would they dare to slip away and leave Peter Wilks' bundle of money behind? Probably not. If these guys aren't swindlers, they would probably take out that bundle of money for us to keep until they can prove they are honest, wouldn't everyone agree?
tr_translation: “I don't want to wrong these two men, but if you ask me, they are swindlers, and they might have accomplices we don't know about. If they have accomplices, they would have already taken the bag with Peter Wilks' gold and fled? We cannot allow this. If these two are not frauds, they will not object to bringing the money and letting us keep it until they prove they are telling the truth… Am I wrong?”
es_translation: —I don't want to be too harsh on these two men, but I believe they are swindlers and might have accomplices we know nothing about. In that case, won't the accomplices escape with the sack of gold that Peter Wilks left? It wouldn't be surprising. If these men are not swindlers, they won't object to us going to fetch the money and keeping it until they prove they aren't; don't you think?

en: Everybody agreed to that. So I judged they had our gang in a pretty tight place right at the outstart. But the king he only looked sorrowful, and says:
vi: Mọi người trả lời đồng ý. Tôi nghĩ thế là họ đã dồn được bọn tôi vào chỗ kẹt ngay từ lúc đầu. Nhưng nhà vua chỉ tỏ ra hơi buồn. Lão nói:
tr: Herkes buna katıldı. Artık bizim çetenin köşeye sıkıştığına karar vermiştim. Daha baştan kaybetmişlerdi. Ama kral kederle cevap verdi:
es: Todo el mundo estuvo de acuerdo. Así que pensé que desde el primer momento habían metido a nuestra banda en un apuro bien serio. Pero el rey no hizo más que poner cara de pena y decir:
vi_translation: Everyone answered in agreement. I think they had cornered us right from the start. But the king only showed a hint of sadness. He said:
tr_translation: Everyone agreed to this. I had already decided that our gang was cornered. They had lost from the start. But the king replied with sorrow:
es_translation: Everyone agreed. So I thought that from the very beginning they had put our band in serious trouble. But the king only put on a sad face and said:

en: “Gentlemen, I wish the money was there, for I ain’t got no disposition to throw anything in the way of a fair, open, out-and-out investigation o’ this misable business; but, alas, the money ain’t there; you k’n send and see, if you want to.”
vi: - Thưa các vị, tôi cũng mong rằng bọc tiền còn đó, vì tôi không muốn ngăn trở việc tìm ra đầu đuôi câu chuyện này. Nhưng bọc tiền không còn đó. Không tin các vị cứ cho người đi lục soát.
tr: “Beyler; para keşke evde olsaydı, çünkü bu pis işin adilce, açıkça ve ayrıntısıyla soruşturulmasının önüne herhangi bir engel çıkarmaya niyetim yok; ama ne yazık ki para orada değil; isterseniz birilerini gönderip bakabilirsiniz.
es: —Caballeros, ojalá estuviera ahí el dinero, pues yo no soy de los que ponen obstáculos a una investigación justa, abierta y a fondo de este triste asunto; pero, por desgracia, el dinero no está; pueden enviar a buscarlo, si quieren.
vi_translation: - Dear sirs, I also hope that the money pouch is still there, because I do not want to hinder the discovery of the whole story. But the money pouch is no longer there. If you don't believe me, you can send someone to search.
tr_translation: “Gentlemen; I wish the money were at home, because I have no intention of obstructing the fair, transparent, and detailed investigation of this dirty business; but unfortunately, the money is not there; you can send someone to check if you want.”
es_translation: —Gentlemen, I wish the money were there, for I am not one to put obstacles in the way of a fair, open, and thorough investigation of this sad matter; but, unfortunately, the money is not there; you can send to look for it, if you wish.

en: “Where is it, then?”
vi: - Ông để tiền ở đâu?
tr: “Peki nerede para?
es: —¿Dónde está, pues?
vi_translation: - Where did you put the money?
tr_translation: “So where is the money?”
es_translation: —Where is it, then?

en: “Well, when my niece give it to me to keep for her I took and hid it inside o’ the straw tick o’ my bed, not wishin’ to bank it for the few days we’d be here, and considerin’ the bed a safe place, we not bein’ used to niggers, and suppos’n’ ’em honest, like servants in England. The niggers stole it the very next mornin’ after I had went down stairs; and when I sold ’em I hadn’t missed the money yit, so they got clean away with it. My servant here k’n tell you ’bout it, gentlemen.”
vi: - Khi có cháu gái đưa cho, tôi đem giấu xuống dưới đệm ở giường ngủ của tôi, vì ở đây ở ít ngày nên không muốn đêm tiền đó gửi vào nhà băng. Tôi cứ ngỡ những người da đen lương thiện như những người hầu của tôi, ai ngờ cũng đã cuỗm hết số tiền đó trước khi rời khỏi nơi này. Người hầu của tôi đây có thể nói rõ cái đó để các ngài biết.
tr: “Yeğenim parayı saklamam için bana vermişti, burada en fazla birkaç gün kalacağız diye hepsini bankaya yatırmaya gerek görmeyip yatağımın altındaki saman şiltenin içine yerleştirdim; yatağın güvenli bir yer olduğunu düşünmüştüm, zencilere pek alışkın değiliz, İngiltere’deki dürüst hizmetkârlar gibi olduklarını düşünmüştük. Ertesi sabah ben merdivenlerden iner inmez zenciler parayı çalmış; onları sattığımda paranın gittiğinden henüz haberim yoktu, o yüzden onları yakalayamadık. Hizmetkârım bu söylediklerimi doğrulayabilir.
es: —Bueno, cuando mi sobrina me lo dio para que se lo guardara, lo escondí en el colchón de mi cama, porque no quería llevarlo al banco sólo para unos días y pensé que la cama sería un lugar seguro, pues no estamos acostumbrados a los negros y supuse que eran honestos, igual que los criados ingleses. Los negros lo robaron ala mañana siguiente, cuando yo bajé, y cuando los vendí todavía no me había dado cuenta de que faltaba, así que se fueron con él. Aquí mi criado se lo puede confirmar, caballeros.
vi_translation: - When my granddaughter gave it to me, I hid it under the mattress of my bed, because I was staying here for a few days and didn't want to deposit that money into the bank. I thought black people were as honest as my servants, but who would have thought they would take all that money before leaving this place. My servant here can explain this clearly for you to understand.
tr_translation: “My nephew had given me the money to keep, thinking we would stay here for at most a few days, I didn't see the need to deposit it all in the bank and placed it inside the straw mattress under my bed; I thought the bed was a safe place, we are not very accustomed to negroes, we thought they were like the honest servants in England. The next morning, as soon as I came down the stairs, the negroes had stolen the money; I didn't know the money was gone when I sold them, so we couldn't catch them. My servant can confirm what I have said.”
es_translation: —Well, when my niece gave it to me to keep it for her, I hid it in the mattress of my bed, because I didn't want to take it to the bank just for a few days and I thought the bed would be a safe place, since we are not used to black people and I assumed they were honest, just like English servants. The black people stole it the next morning, when I went downstairs, and when I sold them I still hadn't realized it was missing, so they left with it. Here my servant can confirm it, gentlemen.

en: The doctor and several said “Shucks!” and I see nobody didn’t altogether believe him. One man asked me if I see the niggers steal it. I said no, but I see them sneaking out of the room and hustling away, and I never thought nothing, only I reckoned they was afraid they had waked up my master and was trying to get away before he made trouble with them. That was all they asked me. Then the doctor whirls on me and says:
