vi: Ông bác sĩ với nhiều người khác cũng nói: - Thôi đi! Chẳng ai tin lời lão ta cả. Có một người hỏi tôi rằng tôi có trông thấy những người da đen đánh cắp tiền không. Tôi nói rằng chỉ thấy họ ở trong buồng vội vã đi ra. Tôi tưởng rằng họ sợ đánh thức ông chủ tôi nên họ phải bước ra ngoài. Nhưng ông bác sĩ sừng sỡ hỏi tôi:
tr: Doktor ve birkaç kişi daha, “Saçmalık!” dediler ve kimsenin krala tam anlamıyla inanmadığını gördüm. Adamlardan biri bana dönüp parayı zencilerin çalıp çalmadığını sordu. Görmediğimi söyledim, ama onları odadan sessizce çıkarken görmüştüm ve aklıma hiçbir şey gelmemişti, beyefendiyi uyandırmaktan korktuklarını ve başları derde gitmeden uzaklaşmaya çalıştıklarını düşünmüştüm. Bana sadece bunu sordular. Ardından doktor aniden bana dönüp sordu:
es: El médico y varios dijeron «¡vaya!», y vi que nadie se lo creía del todo. Un hombre me preguntó si había visto a los negros robarlo. Dije que no, pero que los había visto salir a escondidas de la habitación y marcharse y que nunca había pensado nada malo, porque creí que se habían asustado de haber despertado a mi amo y trataban de marcharse antes de que él los reprendiera. No me preguntaron nada más. Entonces el médico se volvió hacia mí y preguntó:
vi_translation: The doctor, along with many others, also said: - Stop it! Nobody believes what that old man says. Someone asked me if I saw the black people stealing money. I said that I only saw them hurrying out of the room. I thought they were afraid of waking up my boss, so they had to step outside. But the doctor angrily asked me:
tr_translation: The doctor and a few others said, "Nonsense!" and I saw that no one fully believed the king. One of the men turned to me and asked if the money had been stolen by the black people. I said I hadn't seen it, but I had seen them quietly leaving the room and nothing had occurred to me; I thought they were afraid of waking the gentleman and were trying to get away without getting into trouble. They only asked me this. Then the doctor suddenly turned to me and asked:
es_translation: The doctor and several others said "wow!", and I saw that no one completely believed it. A man asked me if I had seen the black men steal it. I said no, but that I had seen them sneak out of the room and leave and that I had never thought anything bad, because I believed they had been scared of waking my master and were trying to leave before he reprimanded them. They didn't ask me anything else. Then the doctor turned to me and asked:

en: “Are you English, too?”
vi: - Mày có phải là người Anh không?
tr: “Sen de mi İngilizsin?
es: —¿Tú también eres inglés?
vi_translation: - Are you English?
tr_translation: “Are you English too?”
es_translation: —Are you English too?

en: I says yes; and him and some others laughed, and said, “Stuff!”
vi: Tôi bảo phải, rồi ông ta và mọi người cùng cười, nói: - Lại một tên bịp!
tr: Evet, dedim; doktor ve birkaç kişi daha kahkahalarla güldü, “Zırvalık!” dediler.
es: Dije que sí y él y otros se echaron a reír y dijeron: «¡Bobadas!»
vi_translation: I said yes, then he and everyone laughed and said: - Another con artist!
tr_translation: Yes, I said; the doctor and a few others laughed out loud, saying, "Nonsense!"
es_translation: I said yes and he and others burst out laughing and said: "Nonsense!"

en: Well, then they sailed in on the general investigation, and there we had it, up and down, hour in, hour out, and nobody never said a word about supper, nor ever seemed to think about it—and so they kept it up, and kept it up; and it was the worst mixed-up thing you ever see. They made the king tell his yarn, and they made the old gentleman tell his’n; and anybody but a lot of prejudiced chuckleheads would a seen that the old gentleman was spinning truth and t’other one lies. And by-and-by they had me up to tell what I knowed. The king he give me a left-handed look out of the corner of his eye, and so I knowed enough to talk on the right side. I begun to tell about Sheffield, and how we lived there, and all about the English Wilkses, and so on; but I didn’t get pretty fur till the doctor begun to laugh; and Levi Bell, the lawyer, says:
vi: Chúng tôi bị nói lên nói xuống hàng vài giờ mà không thấy ai nói gì đến việc ăn uống nữa. Họ bắt nhà vua kể lại đầu đuôi câu chuyện của lão, rồi lại bảo ông già sang trọng kia cũng kể đầu đuôi câu chuyện của mình. Nhưng chẳng ai dám khẳng định ông già kia nói thật hay nhà vua này nói dối cả. Lát sau, họ bảo tôi đứng ra nói lại tất cả những gì tôi biết. Nhà vua đưa mắt liếc nhìn tôi, do đó tôi cũng biết là nên nói thế nào cho phải.
tr: Ardından genel soruşturmaya geri döndüler; sözü kâh biri kâh öteki aldı, saatler geçti ve kimse yemek yemekten bahsetmedi, yemek akıllarına bile gelmemiş gibi görünüyorlardı – tartıştıkça tartıştılar; görüp görebileceğiniz en karmaşık durumdu bu. Krala kendi hikâyesini anlattırdılar, yaşlı beyefendiye kendi hikâyesini anlattırdılar; yaşlı beyefendinin doğruyu söylediğini, kralın da yalan söylediğini önyargılı mankafalar dışında herkes fark etti. Bir ara benden de bildiğim her şeyi anlatmamı istediler. Kral göz ucuyla yan yan baktı, kendi tarafını tutmamı bekliyordu elbette. Sheffield’den ve orada nasıl yaşadığımızdan bahsetmeye başladım; İngiliz Wilks’lerden filan da bahsettim; ama çok fazla anlatamadım, çünkü Doktor gülmeye başladı ve avukat Levi Bell de şöyle dedi:
es: Bueno, entonces siguieron con la investigación general, que continuó con sus altibajos, hora tras hora, y nadie dijo ni palabra de cenar, parecía que ni siquiera se acordaban de ello, así que siguieron y siguieron y resultó de lo más complicado. Hicieron que el rey contara su versión, y después que el anciano contara la suya, y cualquiera que no hubiera sido una mula llena de prejuicios habría visto que el caballero anciano decía la verdad y el otro mentiras. Y luego me obligaron a contar lo que yo sabía. El rey me miró de reojo y me di cuenta de qué era lo que me convenía decir. Empecé a hablar de Sheffield y de cómo vivíamos allí y de todos los Wilks que había en Inglaterra, y todo eso; pero no había dicho gran cosa cuando el médico se echó a reír y después Levi Bell, el abogado, va y dice:
vi_translation: We were being talked up and down for several hours without anyone mentioning anything about eating or drinking. They made the king recount the whole story of the old man, and then they asked that distinguished old man to also recount his whole story. But no one dared to assert whether the old man was telling the truth or the king was lying. After a while, they told me to step forward and recount everything I knew. The king glanced at me, so I knew how to speak appropriately. I began to talk about the city of Sheffield, how we lived there, and everything about the Wilks family in England.
tr_translation: Then they returned to the general inquiry; one spoke, then the other, hours passed, and no one mentioned eating, it seemed as if food hadn't even crossed their minds – they argued and argued; it was the most complicated situation you could ever see. They made the king tell his own story, they made the old gentleman tell his own story; everyone except the biased fools realized that the old gentleman was telling the truth and the king was lying. At one point, they asked me to tell everything I knew. The king glanced sideways, obviously expecting me to take his side. I started talking about Sheffield and how we lived there; I also mentioned the English Wilkses; but I couldn't say much, because the Doctor started laughing and the lawyer Levi Bell said:
es_translation: Well, then they continued with the general investigation, which went on with its ups and downs, hour after hour, and no one said a word about dinner, it seemed like they didn't even remember it, so they kept going and going and it turned out to be very complicated. They made the king tell his version, and then the old man tell his, and anyone who wasn't a mule full of prejudices would have seen that the old gentleman was telling the truth and the other was lying. And then they forced me to tell what I knew. The king looked at me out of the corner of his eye and I realized what it was convenient for me to say. I started talking about Sheffield and how we lived there and all the Wilks there were in England, and all that; but I hadn't said much when the doctor started laughing and then Levi Bell, the lawyer, goes and says:

en: “Set down, my boy; I wouldn’t strain myself if I was you. I reckon you ain’t used to lying, it don’t seem to come handy; what you want is practice. You do it pretty awkward.”
vi: Tôi bắt đầu nói về thành phố Sheffield, chúng tôi sống ở đó thế nào, nói mọi thứ về họ nhà Wilks ở bên Anh. Nhưng tôi chưa nói xong thì ông bác sĩ kia đã phá lên cười, rồi Levi Ben, ông trạng sư nữa họ nói: - Thôi, chú máy không quen nói dối nên nói chối lại lắm. Tôi chẳng để ý đến lời khen, thấy được thoát là mừng lắm rồi.
tr: “Otur şuraya, evlat. Yerinde olsam kendimi o kadar sıkmazdım. Herhalde yalan söylemeye alışkın değilsin, hemen kafadan atamıyorsun, biraz pratiğe ihtiyacın var. Çok kötü bir yalancısın.
es: —Siéntate, muchacho; yo que tú no me cansaría. Calculo que no estás acostumbrado a mentir y no te resulta fácil; te falta práctica. Lo haces bastante mal.
vi_translation: But before I could finish, that doctor burst out laughing, and then Levi Ben, the lawyer, also spoke: - Well, the machine isn't used to lying, so it often stumbles over its words. I didn't pay attention to the compliment; I was just very happy to have escaped.
tr_translation: “Sit here, child. If I were you, I wouldn't stress myself so much. You're probably not used to lying, you can't make things up on the spot, you need some practice. You're a very bad liar.”
es_translation: —Sit down, boy; if I were you, I wouldn't tire myself out. I figure you're not used to lying and it's not easy for you; you lack practice. You're doing it quite poorly.

en: I didn’t care nothing for the compliment, but I was glad to be let off, anyway.
vi: Tôi chẳng để ý đến lời khen, thấy được thoát là mừng lắm rồi.
tr: Adamın övgüsünü umursayacak durumda değildim, rahat bırakıldığıma çok memnun olmuştum.
es: Aquel cumplido no me agradó mucho, pero en todo caso celebré que me dejaran en paz.
vi_translation: I didn't pay attention to the compliment; I was just very happy to have escaped.
tr_translation: I was in no condition to care about the man's praise; I was very pleased to be left alone.
es_translation: I didn't like that compliment very much, but in any case, I was glad they left me alone.

en: The doctor he started to say something, and turns and says:
vi: Bây giờ, ông bác sĩ lại quay sang bên, nói:
tr: Doktor bir şeyler anlatmaya başladı, ama sonra dönüp şöyle dedi:
es: El médico empezó a decir algo y luego se da la vuelta y dice:
vi_translation: Now, the doctor turned to the side and said:
tr_translation: The doctor started to explain something, but then turned and said:
es_translation: The doctor started to say something and then turns around and says:

en: “If you’d been in town at first, Levi Bell—” The king broke in and reached out his hand, and says:
vi: - Giá như ông có mặt ở thị trấn này ngay từ những hôm đầu thì có hay không, ông Levi Ben? Nhà vua giơ tay ra nói xen vào:
tr: “Keşke kasabaya geldiklerinde sen de burada olsaydın, Levi Bell… Kral hemen araya girip elini uzattı.
es: —Si hubieras estado en el pueblo desde el principio, Levi Bell... El rey interrumpió, alargó la mano y dijo:
vi_translation: - If only you had been in this town from the very beginning, wouldn't that be better, Mr. Levi Ben? The king raised his hand and interjected:
tr_translation: "I wish you had been here when they came to town, Levi Bell..."" The king immediately intervened and extended his hand.
es_translation: —If you had been in the town from the beginning, Levi Bell... The king interrupted, reached out his hand, and said:

en: “Why, is this my poor dead brother’s old friend that he’s wrote so often about?”
vi: - Thế ra đây là người bạn mà ông anh của tôi vẫn thường nói đến trong thư đấy ư?
tr: “Zavallı müteveffa kardeşimin sık sık hakkında mektup yazdığı eski dostu siz değil misiniz?
es: —Pero, ¿éste es el viejo amigo de mi pobre hermano que en paz descanse, del que me decía tantas cosas en sus cartas?
vi_translation: - So this is the friend that my brother often mentioned in his letters?
tr_translation: “Aren't you the old friend my poor deceased brother often wrote letters about?”
es_translation: —But, is this the old friend of my poor brother, may he rest in peace, whom he told me so much about in his letters?

en: The lawyer and him shook hands, and the lawyer smiled and looked pleased, and they talked right along awhile, and then got to one side and talked low; and at last the lawyer speaks up and says:
vi: Ông trạng sư bắt tay lão ra, mỉm cười có vẻ hài lòng, rồi hai người chào hỏi nhau một tí, rồi đứng lại sang bên nói nhỏ.
tr: Avukatla tokalaştılar, avukat gülümsedi, memnun olmuş görünüyordu. Bir süre konuştuktan sonra kenara geçip biraz fısıldaştılar. Nihayet avukat yüksek sesle şöyle dedi:
es: El abogado y él se dieron la mano y el abogado sonrió con aire satisfecho y estuvieron charlando un rato y después se apartaron a un lado y hablaron en voz baja, y por fin el abogado habla en voz alta y dice:
vi_translation: The lawyer shook hands with the old man, smiling with satisfaction, then the two exchanged a few words, and stepped aside to speak quietly.
tr_translation: They shook hands with the lawyer, the lawyer smiled, he seemed pleased. After talking for a while, they stepped aside and whispered a bit. Finally, the lawyer said loudly:
es_translation: The lawyer and he shook hands and the lawyer smiled with a satisfied air and they chatted for a while and then they moved to the side and spoke in low voices, and finally the lawyer speaks out loud and says:

en: “That’ll fix it. I’ll take the order and send it, along with your brother’s, and then they’ll know it’s all right.”
vi: Lúc sau ông trạng sư nói to lên: - Được rồi, tôi sẽ cầm giấy tờ của hai bên đây để biết rõ thực hư thế nào.
tr: “O zaman hallolur. Siz ve kardeşiniz yazılı talimat verirseniz hiç sorun kalmaz.
es: —Así se arreglarán las cosas. Hacemos el pedido y lo enviamos, junto con el de su hermano, y así verán que todo está en orden.
vi_translation: A moment later, the lawyer spoke up: - Alright, I will take the documents from both sides to understand the truth of the matter.
tr_translation: “Then it will be resolved. If you and your brother provide written instructions, there will be no problem.”
es_translation: —That's how things will be sorted out. We place the order and send it, along with your brother's, and that way you'll see that everything is in order.

en: So they got some paper and a pen, and the king he set down and twisted his head to one side, and chawed his tongue, and scrawled off something; and then they give the pen to the duke—and then for the first time the duke looked sick. But he took the pen and wrote. So then the lawyer turns to the new old gentleman and says:
vi: Thế là họ lấy giấy bút ra. Nhà vua ngồi xuống vẹo đầu sang một bên, viết nguệch ngoạc cái gì trên đó. Rồi họ lại đưa bút cho quận công, anh ta có vẻ lo sợ. Nhưng anh ta vẫn cầm lấy bút viết. Rồi ông trạng sư lại quay sang phía ông già kia nói:
tr: Böylece birer kâğıt ve kalem buldular; kral oturup başını bir yana kaydırdı, dilini yarım dışarı çıkardı ve bir şeyler karaladı; sonra da kalemi düke uzattı – dük ilk defa cidden diken üstünde görünüyordu. Ama yine de kalemi alıp yazdı. Avukat bu sefer yeni yaşlı beyefendiye döndü:
es: Así que trajeron un papel y una pluma, y el rey se sentó, hizo la cabeza a un lado, se mordió la lengua y garrapateó algo; después le pasaron la pluma al duque, y por primera vez puso cara de apuro. Pero tomó la pluma y escribió. Entonces el abogado se vuelve al anciano recién llegado y le dice:
vi_translation: So they took out paper and pen. The king sat down, tilted his head to one side, and scribbled something on it. Then they handed the pen to the duke, who seemed fearful. But he still took the pen and wrote. Then the lawyer turned to the old man and said:
tr_translation: Thus, they found a piece of paper and a pen; the king sat down, tilted his head to one side, stuck his tongue out halfway, and scribbled something; then he handed the pen to the duke – the duke looked genuinely on edge for the first time. But still, he took the pen and wrote. The lawyer then turned to the new elderly gentleman:
es_translation: So they brought a paper and a pen, and the king sat down, tilted his head to one side, bit his tongue, and scribbled something; then they handed the pen to the duke, and for the first time, he looked troubled. But he took the pen and wrote. Then the lawyer turns to the newly arrived old man and says to him:

en: “You and your brother please write a line or two and sign your names.”
vi: - Ông và em ông, xin viết cho một vài dòng chữ vào đây và ký tên ở dưới.
tr: “Siz ve kardeşiniz lütfen birer ikişer satır yazı yazın ve imzalarınızı atın.
es: —Usted y su hermano escriban, por favor, una línea o dos y firmen con su nombre.
vi_translation: - You and your brother, please write a few lines here and sign your names below.
tr_translation: “Please, you and your brother each write a few lines and sign them.””
es_translation: —You and your brother, please write a line or two and sign with your name.

en: The old gentleman wrote, but nobody couldn’t read it. The lawyer looked powerful astonished, and says:
vi: Ông già kia viết nhưng không ai đọc được chữ gì. Ông trạng sư rút ở trong túi ra một tập thư cũ, nhìn kỹ trong đó rồi lại nhìn chữ viết của ông già kia, rồi nhìn sang chữ viết của nhà vua với quận công, tỏ vẻ rất ngạc nhiên nói:
tr: Yaşlı beyefendi yazdı, ama kimse ne yazdığını okuyamadı. Avukat bu işe çok şaşırmıştı.
es: El anciano caballero escribió, pero nadie logró leer lo que decía. El abogado pareció asombradísimo y dijo:
vi_translation: The old man wrote, but no one could read a single word. The lawyer took an old bundle of letters from his pocket, examined them carefully, then looked at the old man's handwriting, and then at the handwriting of the king and the duke, showing great surprise, he said:
tr_translation: The elderly gentleman wrote, but no one could read what he had written. The lawyer was very surprised by this.
es_translation: The elderly gentleman wrote, but no one managed to read what it said. The lawyer seemed extremely astonished and said:

en: The new old gentleman says:
vi: Ông già kia ngắt lời:
tr: Yeni yaşlı beyefendi lafa karıştı:
es: El anciano nuevo va y dice:
vi_translation: The old man interrupted:
tr_translation: The new elderly gentleman interjected:
es_translation: The new old man goes and says:

en: “If you please, let me explain. Nobody can read my hand but my brother there—so he copies for me. It’s his hand you’ve got there, not mine.”
vi: - Tôi xin có lời giải thích. Không ai có thể đọc được chữ của tôi, trừ có ông em tôi kia mà thôi. Vì thế ông em vẫn chép lại thư tôi viết. Những lá thư mà ông cầm đều là chữ của em tôi, không phải chữ của tôi.
tr: “Müsaade ederseniz açıklayayım. Benim el yazımı kardeşimden başkası okuyamaz… Bu yüzden mektuplarımı temize çeker. Sizin mektuplarda gördükleriniz benim değil onun el yazısı.
es: —Por favor, permítanme explicarlo. Mi letra no la entiende nadie, pero aquí mi hermano me copia las cartas. Lo que está usted enseñando es su letra, no la mía.
vi_translation: - I would like to offer an explanation. No one can read my handwriting, except for my younger brother. Therefore, my brother always transcribes the letters I write. The letters you are holding are all in my brother's handwriting, not mine.
tr_translation: "If you allow me, I will explain. No one but my brother can read my handwriting... That's why he transcribes my letters. The handwriting you see in your letters is not mine but his."
es_translation: —Please, allow me to explain it. No one can understand my handwriting, but here my brother copies the letters for me. What you are showing is his handwriting, not mine.

en: “Well!” says the lawyer, “this is a state of things. I’ve got some of William’s letters, too; so if you’ll get him to write a line or so we can com—”
vi: - Ra thế, - Ông trạng sư nói - Tôi cũng có một số thư của William nữa đây. Vậy nếu ông để ông ấy viết cho một vài dòng thì ta có thể... .
tr: “Pekâlâ!” dedi avukat, “Makul bir iddiaya benziyor. William’in mektuplarından bazıları da yanımda; ona birkaç satır yazdırabilirseniz kesin bir sonuç alabi…
es: —¡Bien! —dice el abogado—. Así están las cosas. Aquí tengo también algunas de las cartas de William, de manera que si puede usted decirle que escriba una línea o dos, entonces podemos compa...
vi_translation: - In that case, - the lawyer said - I also have some letters from William here. So if you let him write a few lines, we can... .
tr_translation: “Alright!” said the lawyer, “It sounds like a reasonable claim. I also have some of William's letters with me; if you can get him to write a few lines, we can get a definite result...”
es_translation: —Good! —says the lawyer—. That's how things stand. I also have some of William's letters here, so if you could tell him to write a line or two, then we can compa...

en: “He can’t write with his left hand,” says the old gentleman. “If he could use his right hand, you would see that he wrote his own letters and mine too. Look at both, please—they’re by the same hand.”
vi: - Em tôi không viết tay trái được, nếu tay phải của ông em tôi không bị gẫy thì các ngài có thể thấy rõ là ông hai thứ thư mà xem - cùng một người viết cả.
tr: “Sol eliyle yazamaz,” diye sözünü kesti yaşlı beyefendi. “Sağ elini kullanabilseydi hem kendi mektuplarını hem de benimkileri onun yazdığını görebilirdiniz. Lütfen mektuplardaki el yazılarını karşılaştırın… Aynı olduklarını göreceksiniz.
es: —No puede escribir con la mano izquierda —dice el caballero anciano—. Si pudiera utilizar la mano derecha, verían que escribía sus propias cartas y también las mías. Por favor, compárelas usted y verá que están escritas con la misma letra.
vi_translation: - My brother cannot write with his left hand. If my brother's right hand had not been broken, you would clearly see that both letters were written by the same person.
tr_translation: “He cannot write with his left hand,” the elderly gentleman interrupted. “If he could use his right hand, you would see that he wrote both his own letters and mine. Please compare the handwriting in the letters... You will see that they are the same.”
es_translation: —He cannot write with his left hand —says the elderly gentleman—. If he could use his right hand, you would see that he wrote his own letters and also mine. Please compare them yourself and you will see that they are written in the same handwriting.

en: The lawyer done it, and says:
vi: Ông trạng sư xem rồi nói:
tr: Avukat mektupları karşılaştırdı ve şöyle dedi: “Gerçekten aynı kişi yazmış…
es: El abogado las comparó, y dice:
vi_translation: The lawyer looked at it and said:
tr_translation: The lawyer compared the letters and said: “Indeed, the same person wrote it...
es_translation: The lawyer compared them, and says:

en: Well, what do you think? That muleheaded old fool wouldn’t give in then! Indeed he wouldn’t. Said it warn’t no fair test. Said his brother William was the cussedest joker in the world, and hadn’t tried to write—he see William was going to play one of his jokes the minute he put the pen to paper. And so he warmed up and went warbling and warbling right along till he was actuly beginning to believe what he was saying himself; but pretty soon the new gentleman broke in, and says:
vi: Vừa nói, ông tă vừa quay sang phía nhà vua và quận công. Đến nước này mà lão ta vẫn không chịu thua. Lão bảo rằng William là một người bướng bỉnh và hay đùa, rằng lúc hắn đặt bút lên giấy cũng chỉ là làm một trò đùa nghịch của hắn. Rồi lão ta lại lảm nhảm một hồi cho đến lúc lão tưởng rằng chính lão đang nói đến mình thật.
tr: Evet, bu durumda bizim katır beyinli yaşlı budala ne yapsa beğenirsiniz? Yine de vazgeçmez, diyorsunuz, değil mi? Gerçekten de vazgeçmedi. Bunun haksız bir sınav olduğunu söyledi. Kardeşi William’in dünyanın en uslanmaz maskarası olduğunu söyledi, doğru düzgün yazmaya bile çalışmamıştı… William’in önüne kalem kâğıt konduğu anda yine şakalarından birini yapacağını sezmişti aslında. Giderek açıldı ve zırvalamaya devam etti, en sonunda kendisi bile söylediklerine inanmaya başlamıştı – ama çok geçmeden yeni yaşlı beyefendi lafa girdi:
es: Bueno, ¿qué os voy a contar? El tozudo del viejo idiota no estaba dispuesto a confesar ni entonces. De verdad que no. Dijo que aquella prueba no era justa. Dijo que su hermano William se pasaba el tiempo bromeando y no había intentado escribir, y que estaba seguro de que William iba a gastar una de sus bromas en cuanto cogiera el papel. Y se fue calentando y dándole a la lengua hasta el punto de que empezaba a creerse él mismo lo que decía; pero en seguida el nuevo caballero lo interrumpió, y dice:
vi_translation: As he spoke, he turned towards the king and the duke. At this point, the old man still wouldn't admit defeat. He said that William was a stubborn and playful person, that when he put pen to paper it was just one of his pranks. Then the old man rambled on for a while until he thought he was actually talking about himself.
tr_translation: Yes, in this situation, what do you think our mule-brained old fool did? He still wouldn't give up, you say, right? Indeed, he didn't give up. He said this was an unfair test. He said his brother William was the most incorrigible jester in the world, he hadn't even tried to write properly... In fact, he had sensed that the moment a pen and paper were placed in front of William, he would make one of his jokes again. He gradually opened up and continued to babble, eventually even starting to believe what he was saying himself – but soon the new old gentleman interrupted:
es_translation: Well, what can I tell you? The stubborn old fool wasn't willing to confess even then. Really, he wasn't. He said that the test wasn't fair. He said that his brother William spent his time joking around and hadn't tried to write, and that he was sure William was going to play one of his jokes as soon as he picked up the paper. And he kept getting more heated and talking so much that he started to believe what he was saying himself; but soon the new gentleman interrupted him, and said:

en: “I’ve thought of something. Is there anybody here that helped to lay out my br—helped to lay out the late Peter Wilks for burying?”
vi: Nhưng ông già kia ngắt lời: - Tôi nghĩ ra một cách, ở đây có vị nào đã đến giúp việc khâm liệm cho ông Peter Wilks trước khi đem chôn cất không?
tr: “Aklıma bir şey geldi. Kardeşi… yani rahmetli Peter Wilks’i gömme işlemlerine yardım eden var mı aranızda?
es: —Se me acaba de ocurrir algo. ¿Hay alguien aquí que ayudase a vestir a mi her... que ayudase a vestir al difunto señor Peter Wilks para el entierro?
vi_translation: But the other old man interrupted: - I have an idea, is there anyone here who helped with the shrouding of Mr. Peter Wilks before his burial?
tr_translation: “I just thought of something. His brother… I mean, was there anyone among you who helped with the burial of the late Peter Wilks?”
es_translation: —I just thought of something. Is there anyone here who helped dress my her... who helped dress the late Mr. Peter Wilks for the burial?

en: “Yes,” says somebody, “me and Ab Turner done it. We’re both here.”
vi: Có tiếng người nói: - Cớ! Tôi và Ab Tunrner làm việc đó. Cả hai chúng toi đến ở đấy
tr: Birisi, “Evet, ben ve Ab Turner yaptık,” dedi. “İkimiz de buradayız.
es: —Sí —dijo alguien—, Ab Turner y yo. Aquí estamos los dos.
vi_translation: There was a voice speaking: - What! Ab Turner and I did that. Both of us went there.
tr_translation: Someone said, "Yes, Ab Turner and I did it." "We are both here."
es_translation: —Yes —someone said—, Ab Turner and I. Here we both are.

en: Then the old man turns towards the king, and says:
vi: Rồi ông già đó quay sang hỏi nhà vua:
tr: Bunun üzerine yaşlı adam krala dönerek sordu:
es: Entonces el anciano se vuelve hacia el rey y dice:
vi_translation: Then the old man turned to ask the king:
tr_translation: Upon this, the old man turned to the king and asked:
es_translation: Then the old man turns to the king and says:

en: “Perhaps this gentleman can tell me what was tattooed on his breast?”
vi: - Ông có thêt cho tôi biết là ở trên ngực Peter có xăm hình gì không?
tr: “Belki bu beyefendi rahmetlinin göğsünde ne dövmesi olduğunu söyleyebilir ne dersiniz?
es: —¿Podría este caballero decirme lo que llevaba tatuado en el pecho?
vi_translation: - Could you tell me what tattoo Peter has on his chest?
tr_translation: "Maybe this gentleman can tell us what tattoo the deceased had on his chest, what do you think?"
es_translation: —Could this gentleman tell me what he had tattooed on his chest?

en: “Mf! It’s a very tough question, ain’t it! Yes, sir, I k’n tell you what’s tattooed on his breast. It’s jest a small, thin, blue arrow—that’s what it is; and if you don’t look clost, you can’t see it. Now what do you say—hey?”
vi: Lão vẫn ngồi đó đàng hoàng, lát sau lão ta mỉm cười và trả lời: - Đó thật là một câu hỏi khó trả lời. Vâng, thưa ngài, tôi có thể nói cho ngài biết là trên ngực người chết có xăm hình gì. Đó chỉ là một mũi tên rất nhỏ, màu xanh, nếu như không nhìn thật gần thì không thể thấy. Nào, ngài nghĩ sao?
tr: “Doğrusu zor bir soru bu, öyle değil mi! Size merhumun göğsünde ne dövmesi olduğunu söyleyeyim, bayım. Sadece küçük, ince bir mavi ok – işte dövme bu kadar; ama yakından bakmazsanız göremezsiniz. Peki sence ne var göğsünde… ha?
es: —¡Hum! ¡Vaya una pregunta más difícil! Sí, señor, puedo decirle lo que llevaba tatuado en el pecho. Era una flecha pequeña, muy fina, de color azul... Eso era; y si no se mira muy de cerca no se ve. Y ahora, ¿qué me dice usted?
vi_translation: He still sat there confidently, and after a while, he smiled and answered: - That is indeed a difficult question to answer. Yes, sir, I can tell you what tattoo was on the chest of the deceased. It was just a very small, blue arrow, which could not be seen unless looked at very closely. So, what do you think?
tr_translation: "This is truly a difficult question, isn't it! Let me tell you what tattoo the deceased had on his chest, sir. Just a small, thin blue arrow – that's all the tattoo is; but you can't see it unless you look closely. So what do you think is on his chest... huh?"
es_translation: —Hmm! What a difficult question! Yes, sir, I can tell you what he had tattooed on his chest. It was a small, very fine, blue arrow... That was it; and if you don't look very closely, you can't see it. And now, what do you say?

en: Well, I never see anything like that old blister for clean out-and-out cheek.
vi: Tôi chưa bao giờ thấy ai trơ tráo như hắn.
tr: Bu yaşlı üçkâğıtçı kadar arsızını, kösele suratlısını görmemiştim doğrusu.
es: La verdad es que en mi vida he visto a nadie con tanta cara dura como aquel desaprensivo.
vi_translation: I've never seen anyone as brazen as him.
tr_translation: I had truly never seen anyone as brazen and leather-faced as this old trickster.
es_translation: The truth is that in my life I have never seen anyone as shameless as that unscrupulous person.

en: The new old gentleman turns brisk towards Ab Turner and his pard, and his eye lights up like he judged he’d got the king this time, and says:
vi: Ông già kia quay ngay sang phía Ab Turner và người bạn của Ab Turner, đôi mắt sáng lên vì trong bụng nghĩ rằng lần này thì tóm được nhà vua rồi. Ông già hỏi:
tr: Yeni yaşlı beyefendi hemen Ab Turner ile arkadaşına döndü. Bu sefer kralı enselediğini düşündüğü gözlerindeki parıltıdan anlaşılıyordu.
es: El anciano, con la mirada encendida, se da la vuelta inmediatamente hacia Ab Turner y su compañero, como pensando que esta vez sí que tiene atrapado al rey, y va y dice:
vi_translation: The old man immediately turned towards Ab Turner and Ab Turner's friend, his eyes lighting up because he thought to himself that this time he had caught the king. The old man asked:
tr_translation: The new elderly gentleman immediately turned to Ab Turner and his friend. This time, it was clear from the sparkle in his eyes that he thought he had caught the king.
es_translation: The old man, with a fiery gaze, immediately turns towards Ab Turner and his companion, as if thinking that this time he has indeed caught the king, and then says:

en: “There—you’ve heard what he said! Was there any such mark on Peter Wilks’ breast?”
vi: - Đó, các ông đã nghe thấy ông kia nói gì rồi! Vậy thì trên ngực Peter Wilks có xăm như vậy không?
tr: “İşte, ne dediğini duydunuz!” dedi. “Peter Wilks’in göğsünde öyle bir işaret var mıydı?
es: —¡Bien, ya han oído lo que ha dicho! ¿Había un tatuaje así en el pecho de Peter Wilks?
vi_translation: - There, you all heard what that man just said! So, does Peter Wilks have such a tattoo on his chest?
tr_translation: “So, you heard what he said!” he said. “Was there such a mark on Peter Wilks' chest?”
es_translation: —Well, you have heard what he said! Was there such a tattoo on Peter Wilks' chest?

en: Both of them spoke up and says:
vi: Cả hai người cùng trả lời:
tr: Adamların ikisi birden cevap verdi:
es: Los dos respondieron:
vi_translation: Both of them answered together:
tr_translation: Both men answered at once:
es_translation: Both of them replied:

en: “We didn’t see no such mark.”
vi: - Chúng tôi không thấy có dấu nào như thế cả
tr: “Öyle bir işaret görmedik.
es: —No vimos nada parecido.
vi_translation: - We did not see any such signs
tr_translation: "We did not see such a sign."
es_translation: —We didn't see anything like it.

en: “Good!” says the old gentleman. “Now, what you did see on his breast was a small dim P, and a B (which is an initial he dropped when he was young), and a W, with dashes between them, so: P—B—W”—and he marked them that way on a piece of paper. “Come, ain’t that what you saw?”
vi: - Hay lắm, - Ông già kia nói tiếp - Trên ngực Peter, các ông thấy có mấy chữ nhỏ P và B với chữ W, giữă ba chữ có gạch, tức là P - B - W như thế này không? Hai tên kia lại nói:
tr: “Pekâlâ!” dedi yaşlı beyefendi. “Göğsünde gördüğünüz dövmede minik koyu renkli bir P ve bir B (gençken kullandığı baş harf buydu) ve bir W vardı, aralarına da tireler konmuştu: P – B – W” – ardından dövmenin kopyasını bir kâğıda yaptı. “Bakın… Gördüğünüz dövme böyle değil miydi?
es: —¡Bien! —dice el anciano caballero—. Lo que sí vieron que llevaba tatuado en el pecho era una P mayúscula pequeña medio borrada y una B mayúscula (que es una inicial que dejó de usar cuando era joven) y una W mayúscula, con guiones entre ellas puestas así: P—B—W. Y lo escribió en una hoja de papel. Vamos, ¿no fue eso lo que vieron?
vi_translation: - Very good, - The old man continued - On Peter's chest, do you see a few small letters P and B with the letter W, with dashes between the three letters, like this P - B - W? The two men said again:
tr_translation: “Alright!” said the elderly gentleman. “On the tattoo you saw on his chest, there was a small dark-colored P and a B (these were the initials he used when he was young) and a W, with dashes in between: P – B – W” – then he made a copy of the tattoo on a piece of paper. “Look… Wasn't the tattoo you saw like this?”
es_translation: —Good! —says the elderly gentleman—. What they did see tattooed on his chest was a small, partially erased capital P and a capital B (which is an initial he stopped using when he was young) and a capital W, with dashes between them arranged like this: P—B—W. And he wrote it on a sheet of paper. Come on, wasn't that what they saw?

en: Both of them spoke up again, and says:
vi: Hai tên kia lại nói:
tr: Adamların yine ikisi birden cevapladı:
es: Los otros dos volvieron a hablar y dijeron:
vi_translation: The two men said again:
tr_translation: The men both answered again:
es_translation: The other two started talking again and said:

en: “No, we didn’t. We never seen any marks at all.”
vi: - Không, chúng tôi không thấy. Chẳng có dấu hiệu gì cả
tr: “Hayır, değildi. Bu işaretleri hiç görmedik.
es: —No, no lo vimos. No vimos ningún tatuaje en absoluto.
vi_translation: - No, we didn't see anything. There were no signs at all.
tr_translation: “No, it wasn't. We never saw these signs.”
es_translation: —No, we didn't see it. We didn't see any tattoo at all.

en: Well, everybody was in a state of mind now, and they sings out:
vi: Lúc đó thì mọi người hoang mang, rồi họ hét lên:
tr: Bu sefer herkesin kafası karışmıştı; bağırmaya başladılar:
es: Bueno, ahora todo el mundo estaba de pésimo humor y empezaron a gritar:
vi_translation: At that moment, everyone was confused, then they screamed:
tr_translation: This time, everyone was confused; they started shouting:
es_translation: Well, now everyone was in a terrible mood and they started shouting:

en: “The whole bilin’ of ’m ’s frauds! Le’s duck ’em! le’s drown ’em! le’s ride ’em on a rail!” and everybody was whooping at once, and there was a rattling powwow. But the lawyer he jumps on the table and yells, and says:
vi: - Toàn những tên lừa bịp cả! Đem vứt cả chúng xuống sông đi! Nhưng ông trạng sư nhảy lên bàn hét to:
tr: “Bunların hepsi dolandırıcı! Onları bir güzel ıslatalım! Nehre atıp boğalım, bir direğe bağlayalım!” Herkes bir ağızdan bağırıp çağırdığı için epeyce gürültü çıkmıştı. Ama avukat masanın üzerine çıkıp bağırarak şöyle dedi:
es: —¡Son todos unos estafadores! ¡Al estanque con ellos! ¡Vamos a ahogarlos! ¡Vamos a sacarlos en un raíl! —Todo el mundo gritaba a la vez, con un escándalo imponente. Pero el abogado se sube a la mesa de un salto y dice a gritos:
vi_translation: - They're all just a bunch of swindlers! Throw them all into the river! But the lawyer jumped onto the table and shouted loudly:
tr_translation: “They are all swindlers! Let's give them a good soaking! Throw them into the river and drown them, tie them to a post!” There was quite a commotion as everyone was shouting and yelling in unison. But the lawyer climbed onto the table and shouted:
es_translation: —They are all swindlers! To the pond with them! Let's drown them! Let's run them out on a rail! —Everyone was shouting at once, with an overwhelming uproar. But the lawyer jumps onto the table and shouts:

en: “Gentlemen—gentlemen! Hear me just a word—just a single word—if you PLEASE! There’s one way yet—let’s go and dig up the corpse and look.”
vi: - Các vị, xin hãy nghe tôi nói một câu, chỉ một câu thôi. Còn một cách duy nhất, ta hãy đi đào cái xác lên xem.
tr: “Beyler… beyler! Beni biraz dinleyin, sadece tek bir şey söyleyeceğim – eğer isterseniz! Bunun bir yolu daha var… Haydi gidip cenazeyi çıkaralım ve bakalım.
es: —¡Caballeros... Caballeros! Permítanme un palabra: una sola palabra... ¡POR FAVOR! Todavía podemos verlo: vamos a desenterrar el cadáver para ver el tatuaje.
vi_translation: - Everyone, please listen to me, just one sentence, only one sentence. There is only one way left, let's go dig up the corpse and see.
tr_translation: “Gentlemen… gentlemen! Listen to me for a moment, I will say just one thing – if you want! There is another way… Let's go and exhume the body and see.”
es_translation: —Gentlemen... Gentlemen! Allow me a word: just one word... PLEASE! We can still see it: let's exhume the corpse to see the tattoo.

en: “Hooray!” they all shouted, and was starting right off; but the lawyer and the doctor sung out:
vi: Mọi người đồng tình, muốn đi ngay, nhưng ông trạng sư và bác sĩ nói lớn:
tr: İnsanlar “Hurraa!” diye bağırarak salondan çıkmaya başladılar; ama avukat ve doktor onları durdurdu:
es: —¡Hurra! —gritaron todos, y se pusieron en marcha, pero el abogado y el médico exclamaron:
vi_translation: Everyone agreed, wanting to leave immediately, but the lawyer and the doctor spoke loudly:
tr_translation: People started to leave the hall shouting "Hurrah!"; but the lawyer and the doctor stopped them:
es_translation: —Hurray! —everyone shouted, and they set off, but the lawyer and the doctor exclaimed:

en: “Hold on, hold on! Collar all these four men and the boy, and fetch them along, too!”
vi: - Khoan đã! Tóm cổ cả bốn người với thằng bế này dẫn đi nữa.
tr: “Bekleyin biraz! Önce şu dördünü ve oğlanı sıkıca tutun, onları da götürüyoruz!
es: —¡Calma, calma! Agarrad fuerte a estos cuatro hombres y al muchacho para que también vengan ellos.
vi_translation: - Wait a minute! Grab all four people and this guy carrying the baby and take them away.
tr_translation: “Wait a moment! First, hold these four and the boy tightly, we're taking them too!”
es_translation: —Calm down, calm down! Grab hold of these four men and the boy so they can come too.

en: “We’ll do it!” they all shouted; “and if we don’t find them marks we’ll lynch the whole gang!”
vi: Mọi người kêu lên: - Được, và nếu không thấy những hình xăm đó thì chúng tôi sẽ đem treo cổ cả bọn.
tr: “Evet tutalım!” diye bağırdı kalabalık, “Hiç dövme olmadığını görürsek hepsini birden linç ederiz!
es: —¡Eso es! —gritaron todos—, y si no encontramos el tatuaje vamos a linchar a toda la banda.
vi_translation: Everyone shouted: - Alright, and if we don't see those tattoos, we'll hang the whole bunch of you.
tr_translation: “Yes, let's catch him!” shouted the crowd, “If we see that he has no tattoos, we will lynch them all at once!”
es_translation: —That's it! —they all shouted—, and if we don't find the tattoo, we're going to lynch the whole gang.

en: I was scared, now, I tell you. But there warn’t no getting away, you know. They gripped us all, and marched us right along, straight for the graveyard, which was a mile and a half down the river, and the whole town at our heels, for we made noise enough, and it was only nine in the evening.
vi: Tôi sợ quá, không thoát được nữa rồi. Họ nắm chặt lấy chúng tôi dẫn đi ra thẳng nghĩa địa ở phía dưới sông độ hơn một dặm. Cả thị trấn chạy theo sau, om xòm cả lên. Lúc đó mới chín giờ tối.
tr: İşte o zaman cidden korkmaya başladım. Ama bu işten yakayı sıyırmanın da bir yolu yoktu. Hepimizi sıkıca tuttular ve bizi nehrin bir buçuk mil aşağısındaki mezarlığa götürdüler. Kasabanın tamamı peşimize takılmıştı, çünkü çıkardığımız şamata bütün kasabayı tutmuştu ve daha saat akşamın dokuzuydu.
es: Os aseguro que ahora yo tenía miedo. Pero no había forma de escaparse. Nos agarraron a todos y nos hicieron ir con ellos directamente al cementerio, que estaba a una milla y media río abajo, y nos seguía todo el pueblo, porque hacíamos mucho ruido y no eran más que las nueve de la noche.
vi_translation: I was so scared, I couldn't escape anymore. They grabbed us tightly and led us straight to the cemetery about a mile down by the river. The whole town followed behind, making a lot of noise. It was only nine o'clock in the evening then.
tr_translation: That's when I really started to get scared. But there was no way to get out of this situation. They held us tightly and took us to the cemetery a mile and a half down the river. The whole town was following us, because the commotion we caused had caught everyone's attention, and it was only nine in the evening.
es_translation: I assure you that now I was scared. But there was no way to escape. They grabbed all of us and made us go with them directly to the cemetery, which was a mile and a half downstream, and the whole town followed us because we were making a lot of noise and it was only nine at night.

en: As we went by our house I wished I hadn’t sent Mary Jane out of town; because now if I could tip her the wink she’d light out and save me, and blow on our dead-beats.
vi: Khi đi qua nhà, tôi nghĩ gía đừng bảo cô Mary Jane đi ra ngoại ô, nếu không thì bây giờ cô ấy đã ra cứu tôi và vạch mặt mấy tên khốn kiếp kia.
tr: Bizim evin oradan geçerken, Mary Jane’i kasaba dışına gönderdiğime pişman oldum; çünkü ona bir işaret çakarsam hemen dışarı çıkıp beni kurtarabilip sahtekârları da içeri artırabilirdi.
es: Al pasar junto a nuestra casa sentí haber mandado fuera del pueblo a Mary Jane, porque si ahora le pudiera hacer una seña vendría a salvarme y podría denunciar a nuestros estafadores.
vi_translation: When passing by the house, I thought if only I hadn't told Miss Mary Jane to go to the suburbs, she would have come to rescue me and expose those scoundrels by now.
tr_translation: As I was passing by our house, I regretted sending Mary Jane out of town; because if I gave her a signal, she could immediately come out and save me and also expose the fraudsters.
es_translation: As I passed by our house, I regretted having sent Mary Jane out of town, because if I could signal her now, she would come to save me and could expose our swindlers.

en: I couldn’t bear to think about it; and yet, somehow, I couldn’t think about nothing else. It got darker and darker, and it was a beautiful time to give the crowd the slip; but that big husky had me by the wrist—Hines—and a body might as well try to give Goliar the slip. He dragged me right along, he was so excited, and I had to run to keep up.
vi: Nghĩ đến cái chết sờ sờ trước mắt, tôi không thể nào chịu được. Trời mỗi lúc một tối, rất thuận tiện để trốn, nhưng Hines nắm chặt cổ tay tôi. Anh ta tức giận, lôi tôi đi xềnh xệch, tôi phải bước nhanh lên để khỏi bị hắn kéo.
tr: Konuyu düşünmeye katlanamıyordum; ama yine de başka hiçbir şey düşünemiyordum. Hava karardıkça karardı. Fırsatını bulsam fırlayıp kaçacaktım, ama o çam yarması –Hines– beni bileğimden yakalamıştı. Herhalde bir devin elinden kaçmaya çalışmak daha kolay olurdu. Beni adeta sürüklüyordu, çok heyecanlıydı; ona yetişmek için koşmak zorunda kalıyordum.
es: No podía soportar pensar en aquello y, sin embargo, no sé por qué no podía pensar en otra cosa. Cada vez se iba poniendo más oscuro y era un momento estupendo para escaparme de aquella gente, pero el fortachón (Hines) me tenía agarrado de la muñeca y era como tratar de escaparse de Goliás. Prácticamente me llevaba a rastras, de nervioso que estaba, y para no caerme tenía que correr tras él.
vi_translation: Thinking about the imminent death, I couldn't bear it. The sky was getting darker, making it very convenient to escape, but Hines held my wrist tightly. He was angry, dragging me along roughly, I had to walk faster to avoid being pulled by him.
tr_translation: I couldn't bear to think about the matter; but still, I couldn't think of anything else. The sky grew darker and darker. If I had the chance, I would have bolted and run away, but that giant – Hines – had grabbed me by the wrist. It would probably be easier to try to escape from a giant's hand. He was practically dragging me, he was very excited; I had to run to keep up with him.
es_translation: I couldn't bear to think about it and, yet, I don't know why I couldn't think about anything else. It was getting darker and darker and it was a great moment to escape from those people, but the strongman (Hines) had me by the wrist and it was like trying to escape from Goliath. He was practically dragging me along, he was so nervous, and to avoid falling I had to run after him.

en: When they got there they swarmed into the graveyard and washed over it like an overflow. And when they got to the grave they found they had about a hundred times as many shovels as they wanted, but nobody hadn’t thought to fetch a lantern. But they sailed into digging anyway by the flicker of the lightning, and sent a man to the nearest house, a half a mile off, to borrow one.
vi: Đoàn người kéo ra nghĩa địa đông như kiến, mang theo hàng trăm cái xẻng, nhưng không người nào nghĩ đến mang theo một cái đèn. Nhưng họ cứ đào theo những ánh đèn lấp lánh ở xa chiếu đến, trong khi đó, một người chạy đến căn nhà gần nhất ở nghĩa địa chừng nửa dặm để mượn đèn. Họ cứ đào mãi.
tr: Kalabalık mezarlığa vardığında içeriye doluştu ve taşkın gibi mezarların arasına yayıldı. Mezara varıldığında gerekenden yüz kat fazla kürek getirildiğini, ama hiç kimsenin fener getirmediğini fark ettiler. Yine de şimşeklerin ışığında kazmaya başladılar ve yarım mil ötedeki en yakın evden fener ödünç alması için birini gönderdiler.
es: Cuando llegaron se metieron en el cementerio y lo llenaron de una oleada. Y al llegar a la tumba vieron que tenían cien veces más palas de las que necesitaban, pero a nadie se le había ocurrido traer un farol. Pero de todos modos se pusieron a cavar a la luz de los relámpagos y enviaron a alguien a la casa más cercana, que estaba a media milla, a buscar una luz.
vi_translation: The crowd of people swarmed to the cemetery like ants, carrying hundreds of shovels, but no one thought to bring a light. However, they kept digging by the distant glimmering lights, while one person ran to the nearest house about half a mile from the cemetery to borrow a lamp. They kept digging.
tr_translation: When the crowd arrived at the cemetery, they poured inside and spread among the graves like a flood. Upon reaching the grave, they realized that they had brought a hundred times more shovels than needed, but no one had brought a lantern. Nevertheless, they began digging by the light of the lightning and sent someone to borrow a lantern from the nearest house half a mile away.
es_translation: When they arrived, they entered the cemetery and filled it with a surge. And upon reaching the grave, they saw that they had a hundred times more shovels than they needed, but no one had thought to bring a lantern. But anyway, they started digging by the light of the lightning and sent someone to the nearest house, which was half a mile away, to fetch a light.

en: At last they got out the coffin and begun to unscrew the lid, and then such another crowding and shouldering and shoving as there was, to scrouge in and get a sight, you never see; and in the dark, that way, it was awful. Hines he hurt my wrist dreadful pulling and tugging so, and I reckon he clean forgot I was in the world, he was so excited and panting.
vi: Sau cùng, họ lấy được quan tài lên và nậy đinh đóng nắp ra. Ai cũng cố chen chúc nhau để lách vào nhìn. Thật là kinh khủng, Hines vẫn cứ nắm chặt lấy cổ tay tôi kéo đi. Tôi cứ tưởng hắn sẽ quên tôi ở đó, vì hắn cũngư đang chăm chú theo dõi.
tr: En sonunda tabuta ulaştılar ve kapağı sökmeye başladılar. Kalabalıkta yeni bir sıkışma, dirsekleşme ve itişme yaşandı; herkes yaklaşıp tabutu görmek istiyordu; o karanlıkta korkunç bir haldeydik. Hines bileğimi çekiştirirken canımı çok yakıyordu; herhalde benim var olduğumu bile unutacak kadar heyecanlanmış ve meraklanmıştı.
es: Por fin sacaron el ataúd y empezaron a desatornillar la tapa, y la gente se amontonó tanto dándose codazos y empujones para coger sitio y mirar lo que pasaba como nunca he visto en mi vida, y aquello, en medio de la oscuridad, resultaba terrible. Hines me hizo mucho daño en la muñeca a fuerza de tirar de ella, y calculo que se había olvidado de mi existencia, de nervioso y jadeante que estaba.
vi_translation: Finally, they managed to lift the coffin and pry out the nails sealing the lid. Everyone tried to jostle each other to get a look inside. It was horrifying; Hines kept gripping my wrist and pulling me along. I thought he would forget about me there, as he was also intently watching.
tr_translation: Finally, they reached the coffin and began to remove the lid. In the crowd, there was a new wave of squeezing, elbowing, and pushing; everyone wanted to get closer and see the coffin; we were in a terrible state in that darkness. Hines was pulling my wrist so hard that it hurt a lot; he was probably so excited and curious that he had forgotten I even existed.
es_translation: They finally took out the coffin and began to unscrew the lid, and the crowd jostled and shoved so much to get a spot and see what was happening like I had never seen in my life, and that, in the middle of the darkness, was terrifying. Hines hurt my wrist a lot by pulling on it, and I reckon he had forgotten about my existence, as nervous and panting as he was.

en: All of a sudden the lightning let go a perfect sluice of white glare, and somebody sings out:
vi: Bỗng có một tí chớp soi sáng rực cả một vùng, và có tiếng người kêu lên.
tr: Aniden bir şimşek çaktı ve her şey bembeyaz aydınlandı. Birisi bağırdı:
es: De pronto, los relámpagos lo iluminaron todo con una luz blanca y alguien gritó:
vi_translation: Suddenly, a flash of lightning lit up the entire area, and there was a shout.
tr_translation: Suddenly, a lightning bolt flashed, and everything was illuminated in bright white. Someone shouted:
es_translation: Suddenly, the lightning illuminated everything with a white light and someone shouted:

en: “By the living jingo, here’s the bag of gold on his breast!”
vi: - Lạy Chúa, bọc tiền nằm trên ngực người chết này!
tr: “Yüce Tanrım, şuraya bakın, altın torbası burada göğsünün üstündeymiş!
es: —¡Por Dios vivo, ahí está la bolsa de oro, en el pecho!
vi_translation: - Oh Lord, the money pouch is lying on the chest of this dead person!
tr_translation: “Oh my God, look over there, the bag of gold was right here on his chest!”
es_translation: —By the living God, there is the bag of gold, on the chest!

en: Hines let out a whoop, like everybody else, and dropped my wrist and give a big surge to bust his way in and get a look, and the way I lit out and shinned for the road in the dark there ain’t nobody can tell.
vi: Hines rú lên một tiếng như mọi người, bỗng cổ tay tôi ra rồi xô một cái thật nhanh, chen vào giữa đám người để nhìn; tôi thừa cơ lách ra ngoài, chạy ra đường mà không ai nhìn thấy.
tr: Hines’dan tıpkı diğer herkes gibi bir hayret çığlığı yükseldi. Bileğimi bıraktı ve kalabalığı yarıp bir göz atmak için önündekileri itmeye başladı; benim hemen toz olduğumu ve karanlıkta yola doğru koştuğumu kimse görmedi.
es: Hines lanzó un aullido, igual que todos los demás, y me soltó la muñeca mientras pegaba un empujón para abrirse camino a mirar, y os aseguro que nunca se ha visto a nadie salir disparado como yo en busca del camino en la oscuridad.
vi_translation: Hines screamed like everyone else, suddenly grabbed my wrist and pushed quickly, squeezing into the crowd to see; I took the opportunity to slip out, ran to the street without anyone noticing.
tr_translation: A cry of astonishment rose from Hines just like everyone else. He let go of my wrist and started pushing through the crowd to get a look; no one saw that I had immediately disappeared and was running towards the road in the dark.
es_translation: Hines let out a howl, just like everyone else, and released my wrist while giving a shove to make his way to look, and I assure you that no one has ever been seen to shoot off like I did in search of the path in the darkness.

en: I had the road all to myself, and I fairly flew—leastways, I had it all to myself except the solid dark, and the now-and-then glares, and the buzzing of the rain, and the thrashing of the wind, and the splitting of the thunder; and sure as you are born I did clip it along!
vi: Tôi chạy như bay trên đường. ít nhất là tôi cũng thấy chỉ có một mình tôi với bóng tối, và thỉnh thoảng có chớp với tiếng mưa rào rào, tiếng gió rít, tiếng sấm rền.
tr: Yolda benden başkası yoktu, adeta uçuyordum – en azından yolda koyu karanlıktan, zaman zaman her yeri aydınlatan şimşekten, yağmurun şıkırtısından, rüzgârın uğultusundan ve gök gürültüsünden başka bir şey yoktu; ben de yolu tutturmuş çılgınca koşuyordum!
es: Tenía el camino para mí solo y prácticamente fui volando; por lo menos lo tenía para mí solo, salvo aquellas tinieblas densas y los relámpagos de vez en cuando y el golpeteo de la lluvia y las ráfagas de viento y el cañonazo de los truenos, ¡y podéis creerme si digo que corrí con toda mi alma!
vi_translation: I ran like the wind on the road. At least, I felt like it was just me and the darkness, with occasional flashes of lightning, the sound of pouring rain, the howling wind, and the rumbling thunder.
tr_translation: There was no one else on the road but me, I was practically flying – at least on the road, there was nothing but the pitch darkness, the occasional lightning illuminating everything, the patter of the rain, the howl of the wind, and the thunder; I was wildly running along the road!
es_translation: I had the road all to myself and I practically flew; at least I had it all to myself, except for those dense darknesses and the occasional lightning and the pounding rain and the gusts of wind and the cannonade of thunder, and you can believe me when I say that I ran with all my soul!

en: When I struck the town I see there warn’t nobody out in the storm, so I never hunted for no back streets, but humped it straight through the main one; and when I begun to get towards our house I aimed my eye and set it. No light there; the house all dark—which made me feel sorry and disappointed, I didn’t know why. But at last, just as I was sailing by, flash comes the light in Mary Jane’s window! and my heart swelled up sudden, like to bust; and the same second the house and all was behind me in the dark, and wasn’t ever going to be before me no more in this world. She was the best girl I ever see, and had the most sand.
vi: Về đến thị trấn, tôi không thấy một bóng người vì vậy tôi cứ đàng hoàng đi ở giữa phố chính. Đi gần đến nhà, tôi để ý nhìn xem có thấy gì chăng. Chẳng có đèn đóm gì cả, nhà tối om, tôi buồn nản, thất vọng, không hiểu tại sao. Nhưng rồi tôi vừa qua cửa nhà thì thấy có ánh lửa lóe lên ở cửa buồng của Mary Jane. Tim tôi như muốn vỡ tung ra. Ngay sau lúc đó, căn nhà trở lại tối đen ở phía sau lưng tôi, rồi không thấy gì nữa. Tôi nghĩ cô ấy thật là một người con gái có nhiều nghị lực nhất mà tôi đã từng gặp.
tr: Kasabaya vardığımda fırtına yüzünden sokaklarda kimsenin kalmadığını gördüm, o yüzden hiç arka sokaklara dolanmadım, doğrudan anacaddeden gittim ve bizim eve yaklaştığım zaman gözlerimi kısıp dikkatle baktım. Işık göremedim; ev karanlığa gömülmüştü – bunu görünce hüsrana boğulduğumu hissettim, neden bilmiyorum. Ama tam evi gözden kaybetmek üzereyken Mary Jane’in penceresinde bir ışık yandı! Aniden kalbim heyecanla çarpmaya başladı; aynı anda ev ve geri kalan her şey arkamdaki karanlıkta kaldı, bir daha hayatım boyunca o evi görmeyecektim. O güne kadar gördüğüm en iyi ve en mert kızdı Mary Jane.
es: Cuando llegué al pueblo, vi que no había nadie con aquella tormenta, así que no busqué callejas escondidas, sino que seguí corriendo por la calle principal, y cuando empecé a llegar hacia donde estaba nuestra casa guiñé los ojos y la vi. Ni una luz; la casa estaba toda oscura, lo que me hizo sentir triste y desencantado, no sé por qué. Pero por fin, justo cuando pasaba al lado, ¡se enciende de repente la luz en la ventana de Mary Jane! Y me empezó a palpitar el corazón como si me fuera a reventar, y un segundo después la casa y todo lo demás habían quedado detrás de mí en la oscuridad y ya nunca volvería a verla en este mundo. Era la mejor chica que he visto en mi vida, y la más valiente.
vi_translation: Upon arriving at the town, I didn't see a single soul, so I confidently walked down the middle of the main street. As I got closer to home, I kept an eye out to see if I noticed anything. There were no lights at all, the house was pitch dark, and I felt disheartened and disappointed, not understanding why. But then, just as I passed the house, I saw a flash of light at Mary Jane's room door. My heart felt like it was going to burst. Right after that moment, the house returned to complete darkness behind me, and I saw nothing more. I thought she was truly the most resilient girl I had ever met.
tr_translation: When I arrived in the town, I saw that no one was left on the streets because of the storm, so I didn't wander through the back streets at all; I went straight down the main street, and as I approached our house, I squinted my eyes and looked carefully. I couldn't see any light; the house was shrouded in darkness – seeing this, I felt overwhelmed with disappointment, though I didn't know why. But just as I was about to lose sight of the house, a light turned on in Mary Jane's window! Suddenly, my heart started pounding with excitement; at the same time, the house and everything else remained behind me in the darkness, and I would never see that house again in my life. Mary Jane was the best and most honest girl I had ever seen until that day.
es_translation: When I arrived at the village, I saw that there was no one around because of the storm, so I didn't look for hidden alleys; instead, I kept running down the main street, and when I started to reach where our house was, I squinted my eyes and saw it. Not a single light; the house was completely dark, which made me feel sad and disenchanted, I don't know why. But finally, just as I was passing by, the light in Mary Jane's window suddenly turned on! And my heart started pounding as if it were going to burst, and a second later the house and everything else had been left behind in the darkness, and I would never see it again in this world. She was the best girl I have ever seen in my life, and the bravest.

en: “Out with you, Jim, and set her loose! Glory be to goodness, we’re shut of them!”
vi: - Jim, ra đây, thả bè đi ngay thôi! May quá, chúng minh thoát được bọn nó rồi.
tr: “Hemen gidiyoruz Jim, halatları çöz! Tamı yardımcımız olsun, galiba onlardan kurtulduk!
es: —¡Sal, Jim, y suelta amarras! ¡Bendito sea Dios, nos hemos librado de ellos!
vi_translation: - Jim, come here, let's set the raft off right away! We're so lucky, we've escaped from them.
tr_translation: "We're leaving immediately, Jim, untie the ropes!" "May God help us, I think we've escaped from them!""
es_translation: —Get out, Jim, and cast off the lines! Thank God, we've gotten rid of them!

en: Jim lit out, and was a-coming for me with both arms spread, he was so full of joy; but when I glimpsed him in the lightning my heart shot up in my mouth and I went overboard backwards; for I forgot he was old King Lear and a drownded A-rab all in one, and it most scared the livers and lights out of me. But Jim fished me out, and was going to hug me and bless me, and so on, he was so glad I was back and we was shut of the king and the duke, but I says:
vi: Jim chui ra, dang rộng hai cánh tay định ôm tôi vào lòng. Hắn vô cùng mừng rỡ, nhưng khi có ánh sáng chớp, tôi bỗng im bặt, nhìn hắn và giật lùi. Tôi quên mất rằng hắn đang đóng giả anh ả rập chết rồi. Nhưng Jim mặc kệ, cứ ôm chặt lấy tôi, mừng cho tôi. Hắn sung sướng quá vì thấy tôi đã trở về đã thoát được hai tên lừa bịp. Nhưng tôi nói:
tr: Jim hemen ortaya çıktı ve neşeyle kollarını açarak bana doğru yaklaştı; ama şimşeğin ışığında onu görünce yüreğim ağzıma geldi ve geri geri gidip saldan düştüm; çünkü onun hem yaşlı Kral Lear hem de boğulmuş Arap kılığında olduğunu unutmuştum, korkudan neredeyse küçük dilimi yutacaktım. Neyse ki Jim beni sudan çıkardı, beni kucaklamak, dualar etmek istiyordu, döndüğüme ve kral ile dükten kurtulduğuma çok sevinmişti, ama onu durdurdum:
es: Jim salió corriendo y se me acercaba con los brazos abiertos de alegría, pero cuando lo vi a la luz de un relámpago se me subió el corazón a la boca y me caí al agua de espaldas, pues se me había olvidado que era el rey Lear y un árabe ahogado, todo al mismo tiempo, y me dio un susto mortal. Pero Jim me sacó del agua e iba a abrazarme y a bendecirme, y todo eso de alegría al ver que había vuelto y que nos habíamos librado del rey y el duque, pero voy y digo:
vi_translation: Jim came out, spreading his arms wide to hug me. He was extremely happy, but when there was a flash of light, I suddenly fell silent, looked at him, and stepped back. I had forgotten that he was pretending to be the dead Arab. But Jim didn't care, he just hugged me tightly, happy for me. He was overjoyed to see that I had returned and escaped from the two swindlers. But I said:
tr_translation: Jim suddenly appeared and approached me with open arms joyfully; but when I saw him in the lightning's flash, my heart leapt into my mouth and I stepped back and fell off the raft; because I had forgotten that he was in the guise of both the old King Lear and the drowned Arab, I was almost scared out of my wits. Luckily, Jim pulled me out of the water, he wanted to hug me and pray, he was so happy that I had returned and escaped from the king and the duke, but I stopped him:
es_translation: Jim came running and was approaching me with open arms of joy, but when I saw him in the light of a lightning bolt, my heart jumped into my mouth and I fell into the water on my back, for I had forgotten that he was King Lear and a drowned Arab, all at the same time, and it gave me a mortal fright. But Jim pulled me out of the water and was about to hug me and bless me, and all that out of joy at seeing that I had returned and that we had gotten rid of the king and the duke, but I went and said:

en: “Not now; have it for breakfast, have it for breakfast! Cut loose and let her slide!”
vi: - Để lúc khác nói chuyện! Hãy tháo dây bè và đi đã!
tr: “Jim, bunların hepsini sabaha sakla, her şeyi sabaha sakla! Halatı çöz de buradan gidelim!
es: —Ahora no, dejémoslo para el desayuno, ¡para el desayuno! ¡Corta amarras y deja que se deslice la balsa!
vi_translation: - Let's talk later! Untie the raft and let's go!
tr_translation: “Jim, save all of this for the morning, save everything for the morning! Untie the rope so we can get out of here!”
es_translation: —Not now, let's leave it for breakfast, for breakfast! Cut the moorings and let the raft slide!

en: So in two seconds away we went a-sliding down the river, and it did seem so good to be free again and all by ourselves on the big river, and nobody to bother us. I had to skip around a bit, and jump up and crack my heels a few times—I couldn’t help it; but about the third crack I noticed a sound that I knowed mighty well, and held my breath and listened and waited; and sure enough, when the next flash busted out over the water, here they come!—and just a-laying to their oars and making their skiff hum! It was the king and the duke.
vi: Thế là chỉ hai giây đồng hồ sau chúng tôi đã xuôi dòng sông, cảm thấy sung sướng lại được tự do, trên sông lớn chỉ có mình, mà không còn ai quấy rầy nữa! Tôi đã phải nhảy lên mấy cái và đập gót chân cho sướng một lúc vì không thể nhìn được. Nhưng khi tôi đập gót chân đến lần thứ ba thì tôi nghe thấy một tiếng động quen quen. Tôi nín thở lắng nghe và đợi xem. Đúng lúc một tia chớp sáng lên chiếu rõ trên mặt nước, tôi nhìn thấy họ ngồi cầm mái chèo và đang đẩy thuyền tới. Đó là nhà vua với quận công.
tr: İki saniye sonra nehir aşağı salınmaya başlamıştık, tekrar özgür olmak, koca nehirde kendi başımıza kalmak ve kimsenin bizi rahatsız etmemesi ne güzeldi. Sevincimden yerimde duramıyordum, salın üstünde dönmeye, hoplayıp havada topuklarımı birbirine vurmaya başladım, ama topuklarımı üçüncü kez birbirine vurduğumda gayet iyi bildiğim bir ses duydum –hemen nefesimi tuttum ve dinlemeye başladım– gayet açıktı, bir somaki şimşek suyun yüzünü aydınlattı, işte geliyorlardı! – küreklere bütün güçleriyle asılıyor, kayığı adeta uçuruyorlardı! Kral ve dük hemen arkamızdaydı.
es: Así que en dos segundos fuimos bajando por el río y la verdad era que daba gusto volver a ser libres y estar solos en el gran río sin nadie que nos molestase. Me puse a dar saltos y carreritas y a chocar los talones en el aire unas cuantas veces, porque no podía evitarlo; pero hacia la tercera vez oí un ruido que conocía muy bien, y contuve el aliento y escuché a ver qué pasaba, y claro, cuando estalló el siguiente relámpago encima del agua, ¡ahí llegaban!, ¡venga de darle a los remos de forma que su bote corría como una bala! Eran el rey y el duque.
vi_translation: So, just two seconds later, we were drifting down the river, feeling happy to be free again, alone on the big river, without anyone disturbing us anymore! I had to jump up a few times and click my heels for a bit because I couldn't see. But when I clicked my heels for the third time, I heard a familiar sound. I held my breath, listened, and waited to see. Just as a flash of lightning lit up the water, I saw them sitting with oars in hand, pushing the boat forward. It was the king with the duke.
tr_translation: Two seconds later, we had started drifting down the river; how wonderful it was to be free again, to be on our own in the vast river, and for no one to disturb us. I was so excited that I couldn't stay still; I started spinning on the raft, jumping and clicking my heels together in the air, but when I clicked my heels together for the third time, I heard a very familiar sound – I immediately held my breath and started listening – it was very clear, the next flash of lightning illuminated the surface of the water, here they were coming! – they were rowing with all their might, practically making the boat fly! The king and the duke were right behind us.
es_translation: So in two seconds we were going down the river and the truth was that it felt good to be free again and alone on the great river without anyone bothering us. I started jumping and running around and clicking my heels in the air a few times, because I couldn't help it; but by the third time I heard a noise I knew very well, and I held my breath and listened to see what was happening, and sure enough, when the next flash of lightning burst over the water, there they were!, rowing so hard that their boat was speeding like a bullet! They were the king and the duke.

en: So I wilted right down on to the planks then, and give up; and it was all I could do to keep from crying.
vi: Tôi ngã khụy xuống ván bè. Tôi làm như vậy để khỏi bật lên tiếng khóc mà thôi.
tr: O anda dizlerimin bağı çözüldü, kalasların üzerine çöküp teslim oldum. Hüngür hüngür ağlamamak için büyük çaba harcadım.
es: Así que me caí deshecho entre los troncos y renuncié a todo; tuve que aguantarme mucho para no echarme a llorar.
vi_translation: I collapsed onto the raft. I did so just to keep myself from bursting into tears.
tr_translation: At that moment, my knees gave way, I collapsed onto the planks and surrendered. I made a great effort not to sob uncontrollably.
es_translation: So I collapsed in a heap among the trunks and gave up on everything; I had to hold back a lot to keep from bursting into tears.

en: CHAPTER XXX.
vi: Chương XXX
tr: Otuzuncu Bölüm
es: Capítulo 30
vi_translation: Chapter XXX
tr_translation: Thirtieth Chapter
es_translation: Chapter 30

en: When they got aboard the king went for me, and shook me by the collar, and says:
vi: Vừa lên tới bè. nhà vua bước ngay đến chỗ tôi, túm lấy cổ áo tôi và hỏi:
tr: Sala çıktıklarında kral hemen boğazıma sarılıp beni sarsmaya başladı:
es: CUANDO SUBIERON a bordo, el rey se me echó encima, me agarró del cuello de la camisa y dijo:
vi_translation: As soon as he got onto the raft, the king immediately came to me, grabbed my collar, and asked:
tr_translation: When they left the room, the king immediately grabbed my throat and started shaking me:
es_translation: WHEN THEY GOT on board, the king threw himself at me, grabbed me by the collar of my shirt, and said:

en: “Tryin’ to give us the slip, was ye, you pup! Tired of our company, hey?”
vi: - Mày định bỏ rơi chúng tao hả, chớ con? Mày chán chúng tao rồi ư?
tr: “Demek bizden kurtulmaya çalışıyordun, köpoğlu köpek seni! Sıkıldın mı yoksa bizden, ha?
es: —¡Conque tratando de huir, muchachito! Te habías cansado de nosotros, ¿verdad?
vi_translation: - Are you planning to abandon us, child? Are you tired of us already?
tr_translation: “So you were trying to get rid of us, you son of a dog! Were you getting tired of us, huh?”
es_translation: —So, trying to escape, little boy! You had gotten tired of us, hadn't you?

en: “No, your majesty, we warn’t—please don’t, your majesty!”
vi: - Dạ, thưa ngàim, không ạ. Tôi xin ngài
tr: “Sizden sıkılmadık… Ne olur yapmayın majesteleri!
es: —No, majestad, no es así... ¡Por favor, pare, majestad!
vi_translation: - Yes, sir, no. I beg you, sir
tr_translation: "We are not bored with you... Please don't do it, your majesty!"
es_translation: —No, Your Majesty, it is not like that... Please, stop, Your Majesty!

en: “Quick, then, and tell us what was your idea, or I’ll shake the insides out o’ you!”
vi: - Thế thì mày định giở trò gì? Nói mau, nếu không tao lột da mày ngay bây giờ.
tr: “O zaman aklında ne vardı, çabuk söyle, yoksa ciğerini sökerim senin!
es: —Entonces, ¡cuéntanos rápido qué pensabas hacer, o te saco las tripas a pedazos!
vi_translation: - So, what are you planning to do? Speak quickly, or I'll skin you right now.
tr_translation: “Then what was on your mind, quickly tell me, or I'll rip your liver out!”
es_translation: —Then, quickly tell us what you were planning to do, or I'll rip your guts out piece by piece!

en: “Honest, I’ll tell you everything just as it happened, your majesty. The man that had a-holt of me was very good to me, and kept saying he had a boy about as big as me that died last year, and he was sorry to see a boy in such a dangerous fix; and when they was all took by surprise by finding the gold, and made a rush for the coffin, he lets go of me and whispers, ‘Heel it now, or they’ll hang ye, sure!’ and I lit out. It didn’t seem no good for me to stay—I couldn’t do nothing, and I didn’t want to be hung if I could get away. So I never stopped running till I found the canoe; and when I got here I told Jim to hurry, or they’d catch me and hang me yet, and said I was afeard you and the duke wasn’t alive now, and I was awful sorry, and so was Jim, and was awful glad when we see you coming; you may ask Jim if I didn’t.”
vi: - Tôi sẽ kể cho ngài nghe mọi chuyện xảy ra. Người mà cầm tay tôi, ông ấy tốt lắm, bảo rằng ông ấy cũng có một đứa con lớn bằng tôi mới chết năm ngoái, vì vậy thấy tôi gặp nguy hiểm cũng thương tình. Khi mọi người nhao nhao lên vì thấy bọc tiền ở trong quan tài, ông ta bỏ tay tôi ra, và nói khẽ: “Chạy đi, nếu không có họ treo cổ mày lên đấy”. Thế là tôi chạy. Tôi chẳng làm thế nào được. Tôi cứ chạy miết cho đến khi tìm thấy chiếc xuồng, rồi đến bè bảo Jim chuồn nhanh lên không có họ bắt tôi đem treo cổ. Tôi cứ lo lắng cho ngài và quận công, Jim cũng thế. Ngài cứ hỏi Jim mà xem có đúng thế không.
tr: “Tamam, tamam, size her şeyi olduğu gibi, dürüstçe anlatacağım majesteleri. Beni tutan adam bana çok iyi davranıyor, benim yaşlarımda bir oğlu olduğunu ama geçen sene öldüğünü söyleyip duruyordu, bir çocuğu böyle tehlikeli bir durumda gördüğü için çok üzgündü; altın bulunup da herkes tabuta doğru hamle edince beni bıraktı ve şöyle fısıldadı: “Hemen topukla şimdi, yoksa seni kesin asarlar!” Ben de kaçtım. Orada durmamın bir anlamı yoktu – hiçbir şey yapamazdım ve kaçabilecekken kalıp asılmak istemedim. O yüzden bir kano buluncaya kadar koştum; buraya geldiğim zaman da Jim’e acele etmesini, yoksa beni yakalayıp asacaklarını söyledim, sizin ve dükün de artık hayatta olmadığını söyledim, çok da üzülmüştüm, Jim de üzüldü, sizin geldiğinizi görünce sevincimizden ne yapacağımızı şaşırdık, bana inanmıyorsanız Jim’e sorun.
es: —De verdad, le voy a decir justo lo que pasó, majestad. El hombre que me sujetaba se portó muy bien conmigo y no hacía más que decir que tenía un hijo de mi edad que se había muerto el año pasado y que le resultaba muy triste ver a un muchacho en una situación tan peligrosa, y cuando se quedaron sorprendidos al encontrar el oro y se abalanzaron hacia el ataúd, me soltó y me dijo: «Vete corriendo, o seguro que te cuelgan», y yo me largué. No parecía que valiese de nada quedarme... Yo no podía hacer nada y no quería que me ahorcasen si podía evitarlo. Así que no paré de correr hasta encontrar la canoa, y cuando llegué aquí le dije a Jim que se diera prisa o todavía podrían venir a agarrarme y ahorcarme, y dije que temía que el duque y usted ya no estuvieran vivos y me puse muy triste, igual que Jim; por eso me he alegrado mucho al verles llegar; pregúntele a Jim si no es verdad.
vi_translation: - I will tell you everything that happened. The man who held my hand, he was very kind, saying that he also had a child as old as me who died last year, so when he saw me in danger, he felt compassion. When everyone was clamoring because they saw the money bundle in the coffin, he let go of my hand and whispered: "Run, or they'll hang you." So I ran. I couldn't do anything else. I just kept running until I found the boat, then went to the raft and told Jim to get away quickly or they'd catch me and hang me. I kept worrying about you and the duke, and so did Jim. Ask Jim if it's true.
tr_translation: “Alright, alright, I will tell you everything as it is, honestly, your majesty. The man who held me treated me very well, he kept saying that he had a son around my age but he died last year, he was very upset to see a child in such a dangerous situation; when the gold was found and everyone rushed towards the coffin, he let me go and whispered: “Run away now, or they will definitely hang you!” So I ran away. There was no point in staying there – I couldn’t do anything and I didn’t want to stay and get hanged when I could escape. So I ran until I found a canoe; when I got here, I told Jim to hurry, otherwise they would catch and hang me, I told him that you and the duke were no longer alive, I was very upset, Jim was upset too, when we saw you coming, we were so happy that we didn’t know what to do, if you don’t believe me, ask Jim.”
es_translation: —Honestly, I am going to tell you exactly what happened, Your Majesty. The man who was holding me was very kind to me and kept saying that he had a son my age who had died last year and that it was very sad for him to see a boy in such a dangerous situation, and when they were surprised to find the gold and rushed towards the coffin, he let me go and said: "Run away, or they will surely hang you," and I took off. It didn't seem to make any sense to stay... I couldn't do anything and I didn't want to be hanged if I could avoid it. So I didn't stop running until I found the canoe, and when I got here I told Jim to hurry or they might still come to catch and hang me, and I said that I feared the duke and you might no longer be alive and I got very sad, just like Jim; that's why I was so happy to see you arrive; ask Jim if it's not true.

en: “Leggo the boy, you old idiot! Would you a done any different? Did you inquire around for him when you got loose? I don’t remember it.”
vi: - Thả thằng bé ra! Tôi hỏi ông lúc ông thoát được thì ông có nghĩ đến nó không? Chắc là không chứ.
tr: “Çocuğu bırak, seni yaşlı ahmak! Sen farklı mı davranırdın sanki? Serbest kaldığında onun nerede olduğuna baktın mı? Hiç hatırlamıyorum.
es: —¡Suelta al muchacho, viejo idiota! ¿Habrías hecho tú otra cosa? ¿Preguntaste tú por él cuando te largaste? Yo no lo recuerdo.
vi_translation: - Let the boy go! I ask you, when you escaped, did you think about him? Probably not.
tr_translation: "Leave the child, you old fool! Would you have acted any differently? Did you check where he was when he was free? I don't remember at all."
es_translation: —Let go of the boy, you old fool! Would you have done anything different? Did you ask about him when you left? I don't remember that.

en: So the king let go of me, and begun to cuss that town and everybody in it. But the duke says:
vi: Nhà vua buông tôi ra, rồi chửi rủa cái thị trấn cùng mọi người ở đó. Nhưng quận công nói:
tr: Kral beni bıraktı, kasabaya ve kasabadaki herkese sayıp sövmeye başladı. Ama dük yine karşı çıktı:
