The man was a Baptist. Uncle Silas knew a family from Baton Rouge who knew that family well. Yes, now I remember, the man had died. He got gangrene, and they had to amputate one of his limbs. But he still couldn't be saved. Of course, he had gangrene… now I remember. The man turned purple and died with the hope of resurrection by God's grace on Judgment Day. They say he had a very strange appearance. Uncle went to town every day to bring you. He went to town again about an hour ago; he will be here soon. You must have met him on the way… An elderly man…”
es_translation: —Well, thank goodness; because sometimes those things kill someone. Last Christmas it was two years since your uncle Silas came from New Orleans on the old Lally Rook and blew a cylinder head and left a man paralyzed. And I think he died afterward. He was a Baptist. Your uncle Silas knew a family from Baton Rouge that knew his very well. Yes, now I remember he did indeed die. He got gangrene and they had to amputate. But even that didn't save him. Yes, it was gangrene, that's what it was. He turned all blue and died with the hope of a glorious resurrection. They say it was scary to see him. Your uncle has gone to town every day to look for you, and he just went out again only an hour ago; he must be about to return. You must have met him on the road, right? Older now, with a...

en: “No, I didn’t see nobody, Aunt Sally. The boat landed just at daylight, and I left my baggage on the wharf-boat and went looking around the town and out a piece in the country, to put in the time and not get here too soon; and so I come down the back way.”
vi: - Cháu không gặp ai cả, di Saly ạ. Tàu cập bến từ sáng sớm, cháu còn để hành lý ở trên bến và đi dạo quanh thị trấn để khỏi về đây sớm quá.
tr: “Hayır, kimseyi görmedim, Sally Teyze. Vapur gün ışırken geldi, ben de eşyalarımı rıhtımdaki bir gemiye bırakıp biraz kasabada, biraz da kırlarda dolaştım; vakit geçireyim de buraya çok erken gelmeyeyim demiştim; o yüzden arka taraftan geldim.
es: —No, no he visto a nadie, tía Sally. El barco llegó justo al amanecer, dejé mi equipaje en el muelle y fui a darme una vuelta por el pueblo y también por el campo para hacer tiempo y no llegar demasiado temprano; por eso he llegado por la parte de atrás.
vi_translation: - I didn't meet anyone, Aunt Saly. The ship docked early in the morning, I left my luggage at the dock and wandered around the town to avoid coming back here too early.
tr_translation: “No, I didn't see anyone, Aunt Sally. The ferry arrived at dawn, and I left my belongings on a ship at the dock and wandered around the town a bit, and then in the countryside; I thought I’d pass the time so I wouldn’t arrive here too early; that’s why I came from the back.”
es_translation: —No, I haven't seen anyone, Aunt Sally. The boat arrived just at dawn, I left my luggage on the dock and went for a walk around the town and also through the countryside to pass the time and not arrive too early; that's why I came in from the back.

en: “Who’d you give the baggage to?”
vi: - Cháu gửi hành lý cho ai?
tr: “Eşyalarını kime bırakmıştın?
es: —¿A quién le diste el equipaje?
vi_translation: - Who do you give the luggage to?
tr_translation: “To whom did you leave your belongings?”
es_translation: —To whom did you give the luggage?

en: “Not where I hid it I reckon it won’t,” I says.
vi: - Không, cháu giấuvào một chỗ kín lắm, không ai lấy được.
tr: “Hayır sakladığım yerde kimse bulamaz,” dedim.
es: —No, donde lo escondí no lo creo —dije.
vi_translation: - No, I hid it in a very secret place, no one can take it.
tr_translation: "No one can find it where I have hidden it," I said.
es_translation: —No, where I hid it, I don't think so —I said.

en: “How’d you get your breakfast so early on the boat?”
vi: - Cháu đến sớm như vậy thì làm sao ăn sáng được?
tr: “Peki sabah kahvaltısını vapurda nasıl o kadar erken ettin?
es: —¿Cómo es que desayunaste tan temprano en el barco?
vi_translation: - If you arrive so early, how will you be able to have breakfast?
tr_translation: “So, how did you have breakfast on the ferry so early in the morning?”
es_translation: —How is it that you had breakfast so early on the ship?

en: It was kinder thin ice, but I says:
vi: Tôi lo lắng không biết nói thế nào, nhưng rồi tôi cũng đáp:
tr: Köşeye sıkıştığımı hissettim, ama hemen cevap verdim:
es: Aquello se estaba poniendo dificil, pero respondí.
vi_translation: I was worried about how to respond, but then I replied:
tr_translation: I felt cornered, but I immediately responded:
es_translation: Things were getting difficult, but I responded.

en: I was getting so uneasy I couldn’t listen good. I had my mind on the children all the time; I wanted to get them out to one side and pump them a little, and find out who I was. But I couldn’t get no show, Mrs. Phelps kept it up and run on so. Pretty soon she made the cold chills streak all down my back, because she says:
vi: Tôi cảm thấy bồn chồn nên không nghe thấy rõ nữa. Tôi chỉ muốn kéo lũ trẻ kia đi ngay để hỏi dò xem tôi là ai. Nhưng bà Phelps cứ bám lấy tôi, hỏi tôi hết chuyện này sang chuyện khác. Lát sau, bà hỏi tôi một câu làm tôi giật bắn cả người.
tr: O kadar diken üstündeydim ki söylenenleri doğru düzgün anlayamıyordum. Aklım hep çocuklardaydı; onları bir köşeye çekip biraz sıkıştırmak ve kim olduğumu öğrenmek istiyordum. Ama bir türlü fırsat bulamıyordum. Bayan Phelps hiç durmadan konuşmaya devam ediyordu. Çok geçmeden tepeden tırnağa ürperdim, çünkü şöyle dedi:
es: Me estaba poniendo tan nervioso que no estaba atento. Pensaba todo el tiempo en los niños; quería llevármelos a sacarles algo de información para averiguar quién era yo. Pero no había forma. La señora Phelps no hacía más que hablar. Al cabo de un rato me dieron escalofríos por todo el cuerpo porque dijo:
vi_translation: I felt restless so I couldn't hear clearly anymore. I just wanted to pull those kids away immediately to inquire about who I am. But Mrs. Phelps kept clinging to me, asking me one thing after another. A moment later, she asked me a question that startled me.
tr_translation: I was so on edge that I couldn't properly understand what was being said. My mind was always on the children; I wanted to pull them aside and press them a bit to find out who I was. But I couldn't find an opportunity. Mrs. Phelps kept talking nonstop. Soon, I shivered from head to toe because she said:
es_translation: I was getting so nervous that I wasn't paying attention. I was thinking about the children all the time; I wanted to take them away to get some information from them to find out who I was. But there was no way. Mrs. Phelps did nothing but talk. After a while, I got chills all over my body because she said:

en: Well, I see I was up a stump—and up it good. Providence had stood by me this fur all right, but I was hard and tight aground now. I see it warn’t a bit of use to try to go ahead—I’d got to throw up my hand. So I says to myself, here’s another place where I got to resk the truth. I opened my mouth to begin; but she grabbed me and hustled me in behind the bed, and says:
vi: Tôi cứng họng. Thượng Đế đã bỏ tôi rồi. Thôi thì đành phải liều vậy. Tôi đã mở miệng định nói, nhưng bỗng bà ấy kéo tôi ra đẩy vào đằng sau giường và nói:
tr: Bu sefer şapa oturmuştum işte – hem de tam oturmuştum. O ana kadar Tanrı yardımcım olmuştu, ama bundan sonra kaçacak bir köşe kalmamıştı. Artık daha fazla numara yapmanın bir anlamı yoktu… Havlu atma vakti gelmişti. İşte doğruyu söyleme riskini göze almam gereken başka bir durum daha, dedim kendi kendime. Tam ağzımı açıyordum ki kadın beni tuttuğu gibi yatağın arka tarafına iteledi.
es: Bueno, comprendí que estaba en un auténtico apuro. La Providencia me había apoyado hasta ese momento, pero ahora me tocaba arreglármelas como pudiera. Vi que no valía de nada tratar de empezar: tenía que confesar la verdad. Así que me dije: «Ahora tengo que arriesgarme otra vez a decir la verdad». Abrí la boca para empezar a hablar, pero ella me agarró, me escondió detrás de la cama, y va y dice:
vi_translation: I was speechless. God has abandoned me. Well, I have no choice but to risk it. I opened my mouth to speak, but suddenly she pulled me aside, pushed me behind the bed, and said:
tr_translation: This time I was in a real fix – I was truly stuck. Until that moment, God had been my helper, but from then on, there was no corner left to escape to. There was no point in pretending any longer... It was time to throw in the towel. Here was another situation where I had to risk telling the truth, I said to myself. Just as I was about to open my mouth, the woman grabbed me and pushed me to the back of the bed.
es_translation: Well, I understood that I was in real trouble. Providence had supported me up to that moment, but now it was up to me to manage as best I could. I saw that it was useless to try to start: I had to confess the truth. So I said to myself: "Now I have to risk telling the truth again." I opened my mouth to start speaking, but she grabbed me, hid me behind the bed, and then she says:

en: I see I was in a fix now. But it warn’t no use to worry; there warn’t nothing to do but just hold still, and try and be ready to stand from under when the lightning struck.
vi: Bây giờ, tôi đang ở trong tình thế khó xử, nhưng lo cũng chẳng ích gì, chỉ có việc đứng im, và sẵn sàng chờ chết thôi.
tr: Artık çıkar yolum kalmamıştı. Ama o anda endişe etmenin bir anlamı yoktu, olduğum yerde kıpırdamadan durmak dışında bir şey yapamazdım zaten, sonra da yıldırım düştüğünde ayakta kalmaya gayret edecektim:
es: Vi que me estaba metiendo en otra buena pero no valía de nada preocuparse; no había nada que hacer más que quedarme callado y tratar de escapar cuando estallara la tormenta.
vi_translation: Now, I am in a difficult situation, but worrying is useless, the only thing to do is stand still and be ready to die.
tr_translation: I had no way out anymore. But at that moment, there was no point in worrying; there was nothing I could do except stand still where I was, and then I would try to stay standing when the lightning struck:
es_translation: I saw that I was getting myself into another mess, but there was no point in worrying; there was nothing to do but stay quiet and try to escape when the storm broke out.

en: I had just one little glimpse of the old gentleman when he come in; then the bed hid him. Mrs. Phelps she jumps for him, and says:
vi: Ông già bước vào nhà. Bị giường che khuất nên tôi không thấy gì. Bà Phelps chạy ùa ra, hỏi:
tr: İçeri giren yaşlı beyi bir anlığına gördüm, sonra yüzü yatağın üst tarafında kaldı. Bayan Phelps heyecanla ona doğru sıçradı:
es: Apenas pude ver al viejo cuando entró porque después me lo tapó la cama. La señora Phelps dio un salto y preguntó:
vi_translation: The old man walked into the house. Blocked by the bed, I couldn't see anything. Mrs. Phelps rushed out and asked:
tr_translation: I saw the elderly gentleman who entered for a moment, then his face remained at the top of the bed. Ms. Phelps jumped towards him excitedly:
es_translation: I could barely see the old man when he entered because the bed blocked my view afterward. Mrs. Phelps jumped and asked:

en: “Has he come?”
vi: - Nó đến chưa?
tr: “Geldi mi?
es: —¿Ha llegado?
vi_translation: - Has it arrived yet?
tr_translation: "Has he/she/it arrived?""
es_translation: —Has he/she arrived?

en: “No,” says her husband.
vi: - Chưa - Ông chồng đáp.
tr: “Hayır,” dedi kocası.
es: —No —respondió su marido.
vi_translation: - Not yet - The husband replied.
tr_translation: “No,” said her husband.
es_translation: —No —her husband replied.

en: “Why, Sally, I couldn’t miss him along the road—you know that.”
vi: Lẽ ra nó phải tới rồi chứ, hay giữa đường ông không nhìn thấy nó?
tr: “Onu görmeden yoldan geçmeme imkân yok, Sally… sen de gayet iyi biliyorsun.
es: —Pero, Sally, es imposible que no lo haya visto, y lo sabes.
vi_translation: It should have arrived by now, or did you not see it on the way?
tr_translation: “There’s no way I can pass by without seeing him, Sally… you know that very well.”
es_translation: —But, Sally, it's impossible that he didn't see it, and you know it.

en: “Why, Silas! Look yonder!—up the road!—ain’t that somebody coming?”
vi: - Kìa, Silas, ông có nhìn trên đường kia kìa, có phải ai đến đó không?
tr: “Silas! Şuraya baksana! Yolun yukarısından biri mi geliyor ne?
es: —¡Mira, Silas! ¡Mira allí! ¡Por el camino! ¿No viene alguien?
vi_translation: - Look, Silas, do you see on the road over there, is someone coming?
tr_translation: “Silas! Look over there! Is someone coming down the road?”
es_translation: —Look, Silas! Look over there! On the road! Is someone coming?

en: He sprung to the window at the head of the bed, and that give Mrs. Phelps the chance she wanted. She stooped down quick at the foot of the bed and give me a pull, and out I come; and when he turned back from the window there she stood, a-beaming and a-smiling like a house afire, and I standing pretty meek and sweaty alongside. The old gentleman stared, and says:
vi: Ông ta nhô người ra phía cửa sổ ngay ở trên đầu giường, ngay lúc đó bà ta cúi nhanh xuống chân giường kéo tôi ra, tôi bước ra, và lúc ông kia quay lại thấy bà vợ đứng đó tươi cười, mặt đỏ lên như một cái bếp lửa, còn tôi thì đứng bên cạnh rụt rè, e sợ. Ông ta nhìn tôi chằm chằm rồi hỏi:
tr: Adam hemen yatağın başındaki pencereye fırladı ve Bayan Phelps de böylece aradığı fırsatı bulabildi. Hemen yatağın ayağına doğru uzandı ve beni dışarı çekti; adam geri döndüğünde Bayan Phelps otuz iki dişi meydanda sırıtıyordu ve ben de yanında uysalca ve ter içinde dikiliyordum. Yaşlı adam dik dik baktı:
es: Él saltó a la ventana junto a la cabecera de la cama y le dio a la señora Phelps la oportunidad que buscaba ella. Se inclinó a los pies de la cama y me dio un tirón para hacerme salir; y cuando su marido se volvió de la ventana allí estaba ella, toda sonriente y radiante como un sol, y yo a su lado, calladito y sudoroso. El anciano me contempla y dice:
vi_translation: He leaned out of the window right above the bed, and at that moment she quickly bent down to the foot of the bed to pull me out. I stepped out, and when he turned back, he saw his wife standing there smiling, her face as red as a stove, while I stood next to her, timid and fearful. He stared at me and then asked:
tr_translation: Adam immediately rushed to the window at the head of the bed, and thus Mrs. Phelps found the opportunity she was looking for. She quickly reached towards the foot of the bed and pulled me out; when the man turned back, Mrs. Phelps was grinning with all her teeth showing, and I was standing beside her obediently and drenched in sweat. The old man stared intently:
es_translation: He jumped to the window next to the head of the bed and gave Mrs. Phelps the opportunity she was looking for. She leaned at the foot of the bed and gave me a tug to pull me out; and when her husband turned from the window, there she was, all smiling and radiant like the sun, and I beside her, quiet and sweaty. The old man looks at me and says:

en: “Why, who’s that?”
vi: - Ai vậy?
tr: “Bu da kim böyle?
es: —Pero, ¿quién es ése?
vi_translation: - Who is that?
tr_translation: “Who is this?”
es_translation: —But, who is that?

en: “Who do you reckon ’t is?”
vi: - Ông không biết ai đấy ư?
tr: “Sence kim?
es: —¿Quién te crees que es?
vi_translation: - Don't you know who that is?
tr_translation: “Who are you?”
es_translation: —Who do you think he is?

en: “I hain’t no idea. Who is it?”
vi: - Ông không biết ai đấy ư? - Không, tôi chịu thôi.
tr: “Hiçbir fikrim yok. Kimmiş?
es: —No tengo ni idea. ¿Quién es?
vi_translation: - Don't you know who that is? - No, I give up.
tr_translation: "I have no idea. Who was it?"
es_translation: —I have no idea. Who is it?

en: “It’s Tom Sawyer!”
vi: - Tom Sawyer đấy!
tr: “Tom Sawyer’ın ta kendisi!
es: —¡Es Tom Sawyer!
vi_translation: - It's Tom Sawyer!
tr_translation: "It's Tom Sawyer himself!""
es_translation: —It's Tom Sawyer!

en: By jings, I most slumped through the floor! But there warn’t no time to swap knives; the old man grabbed me by the hand and shook, and kept on shaking; and all the time how the woman did dance around and laugh and cry; and then how they both did fire off questions about Sid, and Mary, and the rest of the tribe.
vi: Suýt nữa thì tôi ngất xỉu, ngã vật xuống đất. Nhưng ông kia đã nắm lấy tay tôi, lay lay mãi, còn bà vợ thì nhảy vòng quanh, vừa cười, vừa nói. Hai vợ chồng hỏi tôi bao nhiêu câu về Sid, về Mary với tất cả bà con trong họ hàng.
tr: Tanrım, dizlerimin bağı çözülüverdi, neredeyse yere düşecektim. Ama daha kendimi toparlayamadan yaşlı adam bana sarıldı ve elimi sıktı; o bir yandan elimi sallarken, diğer yandan kadın da çevremizde zıplayarak hem gülüyor hem ağlıyordu; ardından ikisi birden Sid, Mary ve kabilenin geri kalanları hakkında beni soru yağmuruna tuttular.
es: ¡Os juro que casi me caigo al suelo! Pero no tuve tiempo de cambiar de táctica; el viejo me agarró de la mano y me la estrechó una y otra vez, y todo el tiempo la mujer bailaba en torno a nosotros riéndose y llorando; después se pusieron los dos a preguntarme montones de cosas acerca de Sid y de Mary y del resto de la tribu.
vi_translation: I almost fainted and collapsed to the ground. But the man grabbed my hand and kept shaking it, while his wife jumped around, laughing and talking. The couple asked me countless questions about Sid, Mary, and all the relatives.
tr_translation: My God, my knees gave way, I almost fell to the ground. But before I could pull myself together, the old man hugged me and shook my hand; while he was shaking my hand, the woman was jumping around us, both laughing and crying; then both of them started bombarding me with questions about Sid, Mary, and the rest of the tribe.
es_translation: I swear I almost fell to the ground! But I didn't have time to change tactics; the old man grabbed my hand and shook it over and over, and all the while the woman danced around us laughing and crying; then the two of them started asking me loads of questions about Sid and Mary and the rest of the tribe.

en: But if they was joyful, it warn’t nothing to what I was; for it was like being born again, I was so glad to find out who I was. Well, they froze to me for two hours; and at last, when my chin was so tired it couldn’t hardly go any more, I had told them more about my family—I mean the Sawyer family—than ever happened to any six Sawyer families. And I explained all about how we blowed out a cylinder-head at the mouth of White River, and it took us three days to fix it. Which was all right, and worked first-rate; because they didn’t know but what it would take three days to fix it. If I’d a called it a bolthead it would a done just as well.
vi: Nhưng họ vui một thì tôi vui mười. Tôi thấy như mình lại mới sinh ra, tôi vui mừng vì được biết tôi là ai. Hai tiếng đồng hồ vừa qua, tôi đã sợ hút hồn. Tôi có nói thêm cho họ biết nhiều cái nữa về gia đình tôi - nghĩa là nói về gia đình nhà thằng Tom Sawyer ấy. Rồi tôi kể lại chuyện tàu bị nổ nồi hơi ở sông Trắng, và phải ở lại đó ba ngày.
tr: Onlar çok mutluydu, ama ben sevinçten yerimde duramıyordum; çünkü yeniden doğmuş gibiydim, kim olduğumu öğrenmekten çok memnundum. İki saat boyunca sorularına devam ettiler; en sonunda çenem artık konuşamayacak kadar yoruldu; onlara ailem hakkında –yani Sawyer ailesi hakkında– öyle çok şey anlatmıştım ki en az altı Sawyer ailesine yeterdi. Ayrıca White Nehri’nin ağzında silindir kapağının nasıl patladığını ve üç gün boyunca tamiratla uğraştıklarını da anlattım. Burada da sorun çıkmadı, hatta gayet inandırıcıydı; çünkü silindir kapağını tamir etmenin üç gün sürüp sürmeyeceği hakkında hiçbir fikirleri yoktu. Bir civata kopmuş desem de aynı düzeyde inanırlardı herhalde.
es: Pero si ellos se alegraron, aquello no era nada en comparación conmigo, porque era como volver a nacer. Me alegré montones de enterarme de quién era. Bueno, se me quedaron pegados dos horas, y por fin, cuando tenía la lengua tan cansada que casi no podía ni moverla, les había dicho ya más cosas de mi familia (quiero decir de la familia Sawyer) de las que hubieran podido ocurrir a seis familias Sawyer juntas. Y les expliqué todos los detalles de cómo se había reventado la cabeza de un cilindro en la desembocadura del río Blanco y nos había llevado tres días arreglarlo. Lo cual estaba muy bien y funcionó estupendamente, porque ellos no sabían si hacían falta tres días para arreglarlo. Si les hubiera dicho que habíamos reventado un perno les habría dado igual.
vi_translation: But if they were happy one-fold, I was happy ten-fold. I felt as if I was born anew, I was joyful because I knew who I was. The past two hours, I was scared out of my wits. I also told them many more things about my family - that is, about Tom Sawyer's family. Then I recounted the story of the boiler explosion on the White River, and how I had to stay there for three days.
tr_translation: They were very happy, but I couldn't contain my joy; because I felt like I was reborn, I was very pleased to learn who I was. They continued with their questions for two hours; finally, my jaw was too tired to speak; I had told them so much about my family – that is, the Sawyer family – that it would have been enough for at least six Sawyer families. I also told them how the cylinder head blew at the mouth of the White River and how they spent three days repairing it. There was no problem here either, in fact, it was quite convincing; because they had no idea whether it would take three days to repair a cylinder head. They would probably have believed me just as much if I had said a bolt had broken.
es_translation: But if they were happy, that was nothing compared to me, because it was like being born again. I was overjoyed to find out who I was. Well, they stuck with me for two hours, and finally, when my tongue was so tired that I could hardly move it, I had already told them more things about my family (I mean the Sawyer family) than could have happened to six Sawyer families combined. And I explained all the details of how a cylinder head had blown at the mouth of the White River and it had taken us three days to fix it. Which was very good and worked wonderfully, because they didn't know if it took three days to fix it. If I had told them that we had blown a bolt, they wouldn't have cared.

en: Now I was feeling pretty comfortable all down one side, and pretty uncomfortable all up the other. Being Tom Sawyer was easy and comfortable, and it stayed easy and comfortable till by-and-by I hear a steamboat coughing along down the river. Then I says to myself, s’pose Tom Sawyer comes down on that boat? And s’pose he steps in here any minute, and sings out my name before I can throw him a wink to keep quiet? Well, I couldn’t have it that way; it wouldn’t do at all. I must go up the road and waylay him. So I told the folks I reckoned I would go up to the town and fetch down my baggage. The old gentleman was for going along with me, but I said no, I could drive the horse myself, and I druther he wouldn’t take no trouble about me.
vi: Đến lúc này thì tôi đã thấy khá yên tâm, nhưng vẫn còn nhiều điều đáng lo. Đóng vai Tom Sawyer thì dễ dàng lắm, nhưng tôi lại thót tim khi nghe thấy tiếng tàu chạy xình xịch ngoài sông vì nhỡ thằng Tom nó đi chuyến tàu ấy đến thì sao? Không thể để như vậy được. Tôi phải ra ngoài đường mà đón nó trước. Nghĩ vậy, tôi bảo mọi người rằng tôi muốn đi lấy hành lý về. Ông chồng cũng muốn đi với tôi, nhưng tôi từ chối, vì tôi cũng tự đánh xe ngựa đi được và không muốn làm phiền đến ông.
tr: Artık kendimi bir yandan çok rahat hissederken, diğer yandan hiç de rahat hissetmiyordum. Tom Sawyer olmak çok kolay ve rahattı; hatta nehrin oradan bir vapurun sesini duyuncaya kadar bu kolaylık ve rahatlık sürdü – ama sonra kendi kendime dedim ki, ya Tom Sawyer o vapurdaysa? Ya aniden ortaya çıkar ve ben daha ona susması için göz kırpamadan adımı söyleyiverirse? Buna izin veremezdim – o zaman tüm planlarım bozulurdu. Yoldan yukarı gitmeli ve onu karşılamalıydım. Bu yüzden teyzemlere kasabaya gidip eşyalarımı alacağımı söyledim. Büyük bey benimle birlikte gelecekti, ama kabul etmedim, atı tek başıma sürebilirdim, zahmet etmesine hiç gerek yoktu.
es: Ahora yo me sentía muy tranquilo por una parte y muy intranquilo por la otra. El ser Tom Sawyer me resultaba fácil y cómodo y lo siguió siendo hasta que al cabo de un rato oí que bajaba por el río un barco de vapor. Entonces me dije: «¿Y si viene Tom Sawyer en ese barco? ¿Y si llega en cualquier momento y me llama por mi nombre antes de que pueda hacerle un guiño para que no diga nada?» Bueno, no podía dejar que pasara, porque lo fastidiaría todo. Tenía que ir al camino y pararlo a tiempo. Así que le dije a aquellos dos que iría al pueblo a buscar mi equipaje. El anciano quería venir conmigo, pero le dije que no, que podía conducir yo mismo el caballo y que prefería que no se molestara por mí.
vi_translation: By this time, I felt quite at ease, but there were still many things to worry about. Playing the role of Tom Sawyer was very easy, but my heart skipped a beat whenever I heard the chugging sound of a boat on the river because what if Tom was on that boat? It can't be left like this. I have to go out on the street to pick it up first. Thinking that, I told everyone that I wanted to go get the luggage. The husband also wanted to go with me, but I refused, as I could drive the carriage myself and didn't want to trouble him.
tr_translation: While on one hand I felt very comfortable, on the other hand I didn't feel comfortable at all. Being Tom Sawyer was very easy and comfortable; this ease and comfort lasted until I heard the sound of a steamboat from the river – but then I said to myself, what if Tom Sawyer is on that steamboat? What if he suddenly appears and says my name before I can even wink at him to keep quiet? I couldn't allow this – then all my plans would be ruined. I had to go up the road and meet him. So I told my aunts that I would go to town and get my things. The big man was going to come with me, but I didn't agree, I could ride the horse by myself, there was no need for him to bother.
es_translation: Now I felt very calm on one hand and very uneasy on the other. Being Tom Sawyer was easy and comfortable for me, and it continued to be so until after a while I heard a steamboat coming down the river. Then I said to myself: "What if Tom Sawyer is on that boat? What if he arrives at any moment and calls me by my name before I can give him a wink to not say anything?" Well, I couldn't let it happen because it would ruin everything. I had to go to the road and stop it in time. So I told those two that I would go to town to fetch my luggage. The old man wanted to come with me, but I told him no, that I could drive the horse myself and that I preferred he didn't trouble himself for me.

en: CHAPTER XXXIII.
vi: Chương XXXIII
tr: Otuz Üçüncü Bölüm
es: Capítulo 33
vi_translation: Chapter XXXIII
tr_translation: Thirty-Third Chapter
es_translation: Chapter 33

en: So I started for town in the wagon, and when I was half-way I see a wagon coming, and sure enough it was Tom Sawyer, and I stopped and waited till he come along. I says “Hold on!” and it stopped alongside, and his mouth opened up like a trunk, and stayed so; and he swallowed two or three times like a person that’s got a dry throat, and then says:
vi: Tôi đánh xe ngựa lên thị trấn. Đi được nửa đường, tôi gặp một chiếc xe khác đi tới. Đúng là thằng Tom Sawyer rồi. Tôi dừng xe lại chờ cho nó đi tới. Tôi nói to: - Dừng xe lại! Tom há hốc miệng, lặng người đi, rồi nuốt nước bọt chừng vài lần và nói:
tr: Böylece arabaya atladım ve kasabaya doğru yola çıktım, daha yolu yeni yarılamıştım ki bir baktım karşıdan bir araba geliyor. Tom Sawyer’i hemen tanıdım, olduğum yerde durdum ve yaklaşıncaya kadar bekledim. “Durun!” diye seslenince arabacı benim hizamda dizginlere asıldı. Tom ağzı açık bakakaldı, sonra iki-üç kez boğazı kurumuş gibi yutkunduktan sonra konuşabildi:
es: ASÍ QUE ME PUSE en marcha hacia el pueblo con la carreta, y cuando estaba a mitad de camino vi que venía otra carreta, y efectivamente era Tom Sawyer, así que me paré y esperé hasta que llegó. Le dije: «¡Frena!», y se paró a mi lado, abrió una boca de a palmo, y así se quedó; tragó saliva dos o tres veces, igual que un cura cuando se le seca la garganta, y después dijo:
vi_translation: I drove the horse-drawn carriage to the town. Halfway there, I encountered another carriage coming towards me. It was indeed Tom Sawyer. I stopped the carriage and waited for him to come closer. I shouted: - Stop the car! Tom opened his mouth wide, stood still in silence, swallowed a few times, and then said:
tr_translation: So I jumped into the car and set off towards the town; I had just reached halfway when I saw a car coming from the opposite direction. I immediately recognized Tom Sawyer, stopped where I was, and waited until he approached. When I shouted "Stop!", the driver pulled the reins right beside me. Tom stared with his mouth open, then after swallowing two or three times as if his throat was dry, he managed to speak:
es_translation: SO I SET off towards the town with the cart, and when I was halfway there, I saw another cart coming, and sure enough, it was Tom Sawyer, so I stopped and waited until he arrived. I said to him: "Stop!", and he stopped next to me, opened his mouth wide, and stayed like that; he swallowed two or three times, just like a priest when his throat gets dry, and then he said:

en: “I hain’t ever done you no harm. You know that. So, then, what you want to come back and ha’nt me for?”
vi: - Tao có làm gì hại mày đâu. Sao mày còn hiện về đây dọa tao?
tr: “Sana hiçbir kötülük etmemiştim. Bunu biliyorsun. Niye geri gelip bana musallat oldun ki şimdi?
es: —Yo nunca te hice nada malo. Y tú lo sabes. Así que, ¿por qué has vuelto a perseguirme?
vi_translation: - I haven't done anything to harm you. Why do you still come back here to scare me?
tr_translation: "I had never done anything bad to you. You know this. Why did you come back to haunt me now?"
es_translation: —I never did anything bad to you. And you know it. So, why have you started chasing me again?

en: “I hain’t come back—I hain’t been gone.”
vi: - Tao có chết đâu mà hiện về.
tr: “Geri gelmedim,” dedim, “çünkü hiç gitmemiştim.
es: —No he vuelto... Nunca me fui.
vi_translation: - I didn't die, so why would I come back as a ghost?
tr_translation: “I didn't come back,” I said, “because I never left.”
es_translation: —I haven't returned... I never left.

en: When he heard my voice it righted him up some, but he warn’t quite satisfied yet. He says:
vi: Nghe tiếng nói của tôi, nó có vẻ đỡ sợ hơn, nhưng vẫn run. Nó nói
tr: Sesimi duyunca biraz aklı başına geldi, ama hâlâ tam anlamıyla ikna olmamıştı.
es: Cuando oyó mi voz se tranquilizó algo, pero todavía no estaba convencido del todo. Dijo:
vi_translation: Hearing my voice, it seemed less scared, but still trembling. It said
tr_translation: When he heard my voice, he came to his senses a bit, but he was still not fully convinced.
es_translation: When he heard my voice, he calmed down a bit, but he still wasn't entirely convinced. He said:

en: “Don’t you play nothing on me, because I wouldn’t on you. Honest injun now, you ain’t a ghost?”
vi: - Mày không đùa tao đấy chứ? Mày không phải là ma chứ?
tr: “Benimle oyun oynama, ben sana hiç oynadım mı? Doğruyu söyle, hayalet misin, değil misin?
es: —No me hagas nada malo, porque yo no te lo haría a ti. ¿Me juras que no eres un fantasma?
vi_translation: - You're not kidding me, are you? You're not a ghost, are you?
tr_translation: “Don't play games with me, have I ever played with you? Tell the truth, are you a ghost or not?”
es_translation: —Don't do anything bad to me, because I wouldn't do it to you. Do you swear that you are not a ghost?

en: “Honest injun, I ain’t,” I says.
vi: - Tao không phải là ma đâu.
tr: “Doğru söylüyorum, değilim,” dedim.
es: —Te lo juro —respondí.
vi_translation: - I'm not a ghost.
tr_translation: “I'm telling the truth, I'm not,” I said.
es_translation: —I swear it —I replied.

en: “No. I warn’t ever murdered at all—I played it on them. You come in here and feel of me if you don’t believe me.”
vi: - Không, tao chưa bị giết bao giờ cả. Mày lại gần đây và nếu không tin thì cứ sờ vào tao mà xem.
tr: Sen öldürülmemiş miydin yani? “Yoo. Öldürülmedim… her şeyi ben ayarlamıştım. İnanmıyorsan gel de bana bir dokun.
es: —No. Nunca me asesinaron... Fue un truco mío. Acércate a tocarme si no me crees.
vi_translation: - No, I have never been killed. Come closer and if you don't believe it, just touch me and see.
tr_translation: Weren't you killed?” "Yo. I wasn't killed... I had arranged everything. If you don't believe me, come and touch me."
es_translation: —No. They never killed me... It was a trick of mine. Come closer and touch me if you don't believe me.

en: So he done it; and it satisfied him; and he was that glad to see me again he didn’t know what to do. And he wanted to know all about it right off, because it was a grand adventure, and mysterious, and so it hit him where he lived. But I said, leave it alone till by-and-by; and told his driver to wait, and we drove off a little piece, and I told him the kind of a fix I was in, and what did he reckon we better do? He said, let him alone a minute, and don’t disturb him. So he thought and thought, and pretty soon he says:
vi: Nó đến gần sờ tôi, thấy đúng thật, nó mừng rỡ quá nhưng nó chưa biết làm thế nào. Và nó muốn biết ngay tất cả mọi chuyện nhưng tôi bảo lát nữa sẽ nói, và bây giờ hãy bảo người đánh xe đợi đấy đã. Rồi tôi kéo nó ra một chỗ, tôi nói cho nó nghe chuyện khó xử của tôi và hỏi nó xem phải xử lý thế nào. Suy nghĩ một phút, nó nói:
tr: Gelip dokununca nihayet inandı, beni tekrar gördüğüne o kadar sevinmişti ki ne yapacağını şaşırdı. Derhal her şeyi anlatmamı istedi, çünkü müthiş ve gizemli bir macera yaşamıştım ki bu tam ona göre bir şeydi. Ama konuşma işini sonraya bırakmak gerektiğini söyledim; sürücüden biraz beklemesini istedim ve Tom’u alıp biraz uzaklaştım. Ona nasıl bir belanın içinde olduğumuzu anlattım ve en iyi çözümün ne olacağını sordum. Onu bir dakika yalnız bırakmamı, hiç rahatsız etmememi istedi. Bir süre derin derin düşündükten sonra bana döndü:
es: Eso fue lo que hizo, y se quedó convencido, y se puso tan contento de volver a verme que no sabía que hacer. Quería enterarse de todo inmediatamente, porque era una gran aventura misteriosa, de manera que era lo que le gustaba. Pero yo le dije que dejara todo aquello para más tarde y le dije a su cochero que esperase, y nos apartamos algo y le conté el problema que tenía y le pregunté qué le parecía mejor hacer. Dijo que se lo dejara pensar un momento y no le dijera nada. Así que se quedó pensando y pensando, y al cabo de un momento va y dice:
vi_translation: It came close to touch me, realizing it was true, it was so happy but it didn't know what to do yet. And it wanted to know everything immediately, but I told it I would explain later, and for now, to tell the driver to wait. Then I pulled it aside, told it about my dilemma, and asked how to handle it. After thinking for a minute, it said:
tr_translation: When he finally touched me, he believed it, he was so happy to see me again that he didn't know what to do. He immediately wanted me to tell him everything because I had experienced a tremendous and mysterious adventure, which was just his kind of thing. But I said we should leave the talking for later; I asked the driver to wait a bit and took Tom aside. I told him what kind of trouble we were in and asked what the best solution would be. He asked me to leave him alone for a minute and not to disturb him at all. After thinking deeply for a while, he turned to me:
es_translation: That was what he did, and he was convinced, and he was so happy to see me again that he didn't know what to do. He wanted to find out everything immediately, because it was a great mysterious adventure, so it was what he liked. But I told him to leave all that for later and told his coachman to wait, and we moved aside a bit and I told him the problem I had and asked him what he thought was best to do. He said to let him think for a moment and not to tell him anything. So he kept thinking and thinking, and after a moment he goes and says:

en: “It’s all right; I’ve got it. Take my trunk in your wagon, and let on it’s your’n; and you turn back and fool along slow, so as to get to the house about the time you ought to; and I’ll go towards town a piece, and take a fresh start, and get there a quarter or a half an hour after you; and you needn’t let on to know me at first.”
vi: - Được rồi, tao đã có cách. Lấy cái hòm của tao để sang xe mày và cứ coi như của mày, rồi mày quay lại đi chầm chậm, tính thế nào vừa đủ thì giờ về đến nhà. Còn tao quay lên tỉnh một lúc rồi lại bắt đầu đi trở lại, đến đó sau mày khoảng mười lăm phút hay nửa giờ, và lúc đầu mày phải làm như là không biết tao là ai mới được.
tr: “Tamamdır, buldum. Eşyalarımı senin arabana koyalım, senin eşyalarınmış gibi davranacaksın. Şimdi geri dön ve yavaş yavaş eve doğru git, kaçta dönmen gerekiyorsa o saatte dönmelisin çünkü. Ben de önce kasabaya döneceğim, oradan tekrar yola çıkıp senin on beş dakika ya da yarım saat arkandan geleceğim.
es: —Está bien; ya lo tengo. Pon mi baúl en tu carreta y di que es el tuyo; y vuelve despacito, para llegar a la casa hacia la hora calculada; yo voy a deshacer un poco de camino para volver a empezar y llegar un cuarto de hora o media hora después que tú, y al principio no tienes que decir que me conoces.
vi_translation: - Alright, I've got a plan. Take my chest, put it in your car and act like it's yours, then you drive back slowly, timing it so you get home just in time. I'll head to the city for a bit and then start back, arriving about fifteen minutes or half an hour after you, and at first, you have to act like you don't know who I am.
tr_translation: “Alright, I found it. Let's put my stuff in your car, and you'll act like it's your stuff. Now go back and slowly head towards home, you should return at the time you are supposed to. I'll first go back to the town, then I'll hit the road again and follow you fifteen minutes or half an hour later.
es_translation: —Alright; I have it now. Put my trunk in your cart and say it's yours; and come back slowly, so you arrive at the house around the estimated time; I will retrace my steps a bit to start over and arrive a quarter or half an hour after you, and at first, you don't have to say that you know me.

en: “All right; but wait a minute. There’s one more thing—a thing that nobody don’t know but me. And that is, there’s a nigger here that I’m a-trying to steal out of slavery, and his name is Jim—old Miss Watson’s Jim.”
vi: - Khoan đã. Còn một chuyện này nữa. Tức là có một tên da đen ở đây, tao đang cố cứu cho nó không bị làm nô lệ nữa, tên hắn là Jim. Thằng Jim của cô Watson ấy m à
tr: “Olur, ama dur bir dakika,” dedim. “Bir mesele daha var… Benden başka hiç kimsenin bilmediği bir mesele. Burada kölelikten kurtarmaya çalıştığım bir zenci var… Adı da Jim… bizim Bayan Watson’ın zencisi.
es: —Muy bien, pero espera un momento. Queda algo más: algo que no sabe nadie más que yo, y es que ahí hay un negro que quiero robar para liberarlo, y se llama Jim; el Jim de la vieja señorita Watson.
vi_translation: - Wait a minute. There's one more thing. That is, there's a black man here, I'm trying to save him from being enslaved, his name is Jim. Miss Watson's Jim, you know.right
tr_translation: “Alright, but wait a minute,” I said. “There is one more issue… An issue that no one else knows but me. There is a black man here whom I am trying to free from slavery… His name is Jim… he is Miss Watson’s black man.”
es_translation: —Very well, but wait a moment. There is something else: something that no one else knows but me, and that is that there is a black man there whom I want to steal to set him free, and his name is Jim; Miss Watson's old Jim.

en: “What! Why, Jim is—”
vi: - Sao? Thằng Jim à? Nó... nó... .
tr: “Ne dedin? Ama Jim…
es: —¡Cómo! pero si Jim ya...
vi_translation: - What? Jim?
tr_translation: “What did you say? But Jim…”
es_translation: —What! But Jim already...

en: He stopped and went to studying. I says:
vi: - Sao? Thằng Jim à? Nó... nó... . Tôi nói ngay:
tr: Birden sustu ve tekrar düşünmeye başladı. “Ne diyeceğini biliyorum,” dedim.
es: Se paró y siguió pensándolo, y luego voy yo y digo:
vi_translation: He... he... . I said immediately:
tr_translation: He suddenly fell silent and began to think again. “I know what you're going to say,” I said.
es_translation: He stopped and kept thinking about it, and then I go and say:

en: “I know what you’ll say. You’ll say it’s dirty, low-down business; but what if it is? I’m low down; and I’m a-going to steal him, and I want you keep mum and not let on. Will you?”
vi: - Tao biết mày định nói gì. Mày sẽ bảo đây là việc xấu xa, hèn hạ: nhưng nếu như thế thì sao? Tao biết như thế là không hay gì nhưng tao sẽ đi đánh cắp nó. Mày phải giữ kín đừng cho ai biết, nghe không?
tr: “Ne diyeceğini biliyorum,” dedim. “Bunun çok pis ve adice bir iş olduğunu söyleyeceksin, ama ne olursa olsun… Adiliği kabul ediyorum ve onu muhakkak kurtaracağım, o yüzden sessiz kalmanı ve kimseye bir şey sezdirmemeni istiyorum. Bunu yapar mısın?
es: —Ya sé lo que vas a decir. Vas a decir que es un asunto sucio y ruin, pero, ¿qué me importa a mí? Yo soy ruin y voy a robarlo y quiero que te quedes callado y no digas nada. ¿Quieres?
vi_translation: - I know what you're going to say. You're going to say this is a bad, despicable thing: but so what? I know it's not good, but I'm going to steal it. You have to keep it a secret and not tell anyone, okay?
tr_translation: “I know what you're going to say,” I said. “You're going to say that this is a very dirty and vile job, but no matter what... I accept its vileness and I will definitely save him, so I want you to stay silent and not let anyone suspect anything. Will you do this?”
es_translation: —I know what you're going to say. You're going to say that it's a dirty and vile matter, but what do I care? I'm vile and I'm going to steal it and I want you to stay quiet and not say anything. Do you want to?

en: “I’ll help you steal him!”
vi: - Tao sẽ giúp mày đi cướp nó về!
tr: “Onu kurtarmana yardım edeceğim!
es: —¡Te voy a ayudar a robarlo!
vi_translation: - I will help you steal it back!
tr_translation: "I will help you save him!"
es_translation: —I'm going to help you steal it!

en: Well, I let go all holts then, like I was shot. It was the most astonishing speech I ever heard—and I’m bound to say Tom Sawyer fell considerable in my estimation. Only I couldn’t believe it. Tom Sawyer a nigger stealer!
vi: - Tao sẽ giúp mày đi cướp nó về! Đó là nói ngạc nhiên nhất là tôi chưa từng nghe và tôi sẵn sàng có thể nói rằng thằng Tom đáng cho tôi kính phục rất nhiều. Nhưng có điều là tôi chưa thể tin nó được, Tom Sawyer mà lại là một thằng đi cướp người da đen ư
tr: Şaşkınlıktan küçük dilimi yutacaktım neredeyse. O güne kadar Tom’un ağzından çıkan en şaşırtıcı sözlerdi bunlar… Ayrıca Tom Sawyer’in epeyce gözümden düştüğünü de söylemek zorundayım. Ama öte yandan inanamıyordum. Zenci hırsızı Tom Sawyer!
es: Me quedé como de piedra, como si me hubieran pegado un tiro. Aquello era lo más asombroso que había oído en mi vida, y tengo que decir que Tom Sawyer decayó mucho en mi estima. Sólo que no podía creérmelo. ¡Tom convertido en un ladrón de negros!
vi_translation: - I will help you steal it back! What surprised me the most was that I had never heard of it and I am ready to say that Tom deserves a lot of my admiration. But the thing is, I still can't believe it, Tom Sawyer as a person who would steal black people??
tr_translation: I was almost speechless with astonishment. These were the most surprising words that had ever come out of Tom's mouth until that day... Additionally, I must say that Tom Sawyer had significantly fallen in my esteem. But on the other hand, I couldn't believe it. Tom Sawyer, the Negro thief!
es_translation: I was stunned, as if I had been shot. That was the most astonishing thing I had ever heard in my life, and I have to say that Tom Sawyer fell a lot in my esteem. I just couldn't believe it. Tom turned into a thief of black people!

en: “Oh, shucks!” I says; “you’re joking.”
vi: Tôi bảo: - Thôi đi, mày đừng đùa như vậy. - Tao nói nghiêm chỉnh đấy. Tôi nói:
tr: “Yok canım, şaka yapıyorsun,” dedim.
es: —¡Bueno, vamos! —dije—. Estás de broma.
vi_translation: I said: - Stop it, don't joke like that. - I'm being serious.
tr_translation: “No way, you must be joking,” I said.
es_translation: —Well, let's go! —I said—. You're joking.

en: “Well, then,” I says, “joking or no joking, if you hear anything said about a runaway nigger, don’t forget to remember that you don’t know nothing about him, and I don’t know nothing about him.”
vi: - Thôi được, đùa hay không đùa cũng vậy, nếu mày nghe nói về một tên da đen chạy trốn thì mày phải nhớ rằng mày không biết gì về nó cả, và tao cũng không biết gì về hắn.
tr: “Neyse, ister şaka olsun ister olmasın, kaçak bir zenciden bahsedildiğini duyarsan sakın bir şeyler bildiğini belli etme, unutma ben de bir şey bilmiyorum.
es: —Bueno, pues —dije yo—, bromas o no, si oyes decir algo de un negro fugitivo no olvides que tú no sabes nada de él y yo tampoco.
vi_translation: - Alright, joke or no joke, if you hear about a runaway black man, you have to remember that you know nothing about him, and I know nothing about him either.
tr_translation: “Anyway, whether it's a joke or not, if you hear talk about a runaway black man, don't let on that you know anything, remember I don't know anything either.”
es_translation: —Well, then —I said—, joke or not, if you hear anything about a runaway black man, don't forget that you know nothing about him and neither do I.

en: Then we took the trunk and put it in my wagon, and he drove off his way and I drove mine. But of course I forgot all about driving slow on accounts of being glad and full of thinking; so I got home a heap too quick for that length of a trip. The old gentleman was at the door, and he says:
vi: Nó đi lấy cái hòm bỏ vào xe tôi, rồi nó đi đằng nó, tôi đi đằng tôi. Nhưng thế nào tôi lại quên khuấy phải cho xe đi chậm, vì trong lòng mừng rỡ quá và đang nghĩ đến rất nhiều thứ. Thành ra tôi về đến nhà quá nhanh. Ông Phelps đang đứng trước cửa chờ tôi, thấy tôi đã về nói:
tr: Ondan sonra sandığı alıp benim arabama koyduk, o yoluna gitti, ben de yoluma gittim. Ama yavaş sürmekle ilgili söylediklerini unutup gitmiştim elbette, çok mutluydum ve kafamın içi düşüncelerle doluydu çünkü; eve o yolculuk için fazla kısa bir zamanda dönüverdim. Yaşlı adam kapıda duruyordu:
es: Entonces él sacó su baúl y lo puso en mi carreta, y se marchó por su camino y yo por el mío. Pero, naturalmente, se me olvidó que tenía que ir despacio de lo contento y lo lleno de ideas que estaba, así que llegué a casa demasiado temprano para un viaje tan largo. El viejo estaba en la puerta y dice:
vi_translation: He went to get the chest and put it in my car, then he went his way, and I went mine. But somehow I completely forgot to drive slowly, because I was too excited and thinking about many things. As a result, I got home too quickly. Mr. Phelps was standing at the door waiting for me, and when he saw that I had returned, he said:
tr_translation: Then we took the chest and put it in my car, he went his way, and I went mine. But of course, I had completely forgotten what he said about driving slowly, I was very happy and my head was full of thoughts; I returned home in an unusually short time for that journey. The old man was standing at the door:
es_translation: Then he took out his trunk and put it in my cart, and he went on his way and I went on mine. But, naturally, I forgot that I had to go slowly because I was so happy and full of ideas, so I arrived home too early for such a long trip. The old man was at the door and says:

en: “Why, this is wonderful! Whoever would a thought it was in that mare to do it? I wish we’d a timed her. And she hain’t sweated a hair—not a hair. It’s wonderful. Why, I wouldn’t take a hundred dollars for that horse now—I wouldn’t, honest; and yet I’d a sold her for fifteen before, and thought ’twas all she was worth.”
vi: - Chà, không thể ngờ rằng cái con ngựa này lại chạy nhanh như thế. Thế mà nó không ra một tí mồ hôi nào, không ướt một cái lông nào đây này. Tuyệt thật. Bây giờ, ai mà trả đến một trăm đô la, mình cũng không bán nó nữa. Thế mà trước kia, mình định bán có mười lăm đồng, tưởng nó cũng chỉ đáng giá bấy nhiêu thôi.
tr: “İşte bu harika, değil mi? Bu kısrağın böyle bir iş başarabileceğini kim tahmin ederdi. Artık yaşlandığını düşünüyordum. Üstelik terlememiş bile, vay canına. Şahane doğrusu. Ben artık bu atı elimi öpene yüz dolara veririm; halbuki daha bu sabah on beş dolar bile etmez diye hayıflanıyor, daha fazlasını isteyemeyeceğimi sanıyordum.
es: —¡Hombre, qué maravilla! ¡Quién habría pensado que esa yegua era capaz de correr tanto! Ojalá le hubiéramos tomado el tiempo. Y no ha sudado ni una gota, ni un gota. Es una maravilla. Hombre, ahora no aceptaría ni cien dólares por esa yegua, de verdad que no, y sin embargo antes la habría vendido por quince y me habría quedado tan contento.
vi_translation: - Well, I never expected this horse to run so fast. And yet it doesn't sweat a bit, not a single hair is wet. It's amazing. Now, even if someone offers a hundred dollars, I wouldn't sell it anymore. Yet before, I intended to sell it for just fifteen dollars, thinking that's all it was worth.
tr_translation: “Isn't this wonderful? Who would have guessed that this mare could accomplish such a feat. I thought she was getting old. And she hasn't even broken a sweat, wow. Truly magnificent. Now, I'll sell this horse to anyone who kisses my hand for a hundred dollars; whereas this morning, I was lamenting that she wasn't even worth fifteen dollars and thought I couldn't ask for more.”
es_translation: —Man, what a marvel! Who would have thought that mare was capable of running so much! I wish we had timed her. And she hasn't sweated a drop, not a single drop. She is a marvel. Man, now I wouldn't accept even a hundred dollars for that mare, really, and yet before I would have sold her for fifteen and been quite happy.

en: That’s all he said. He was the innocentest, best old soul I ever see. But it warn’t surprising; because he warn’t only just a farmer, he was a preacher, too, and had a little one-horse log church down back of the plantation, which he built it himself at his own expense, for a church and schoolhouse, and never charged nothing for his preaching, and it was worth it, too. There was plenty other farmer-preachers like that, and done the same way, down South.
vi: Ông ta chỉ nói có thể. Tôi chưa thấy ông già nào lại tốt bụng và hiền lành như vậy. Ông vốn là một chủ điền và kiêm luôn chức mục sư nữa. Ông ta tự mình bỏ tiền ra xây một cái nhà thờ ở cuối đồn điền, và ông ta đi giảng đạo ở đó không phải lấy tiền. ở phương Nam, có rất nhiều người vừa là chủ điền, vừa là mục sư như vậy.
tr: Başka bir şey demedi. O güne dek gördüğüm en temiz yürekli, en iyi niyetli adamdı. Ama bu şaşırtıcı değildi, çünkü sadece bir çiftçi değil, aynı zamanda rahipti ve plantasyonun arka tarafında minik bir kilisesi vardı. Kilisenin ve dersliğin masraflarını kendi cebinden vermişti ve çok iyi vaazlar vermesine rağmen kimseden beş kuruş almıyordu. Güney’de onun gibi pek çok çiftçi-rahip var ve hepsi aynı şekilde davranıyor.
es: No dijo nada más. Era la persona más inocente y más buena que he visto en mi vida. Pero no era de sorprender, porque no sólo era agricultor, sino también predicador, y tenía una iglesita de troncos en la trasera de la plantación que había construido él de su propio bolsillo para que sirviera de iglesia y de escuela, y nunca cobraba nada por predicar, y la verdad era que lo hacía muy bien. Allá en el Sur había muchos agricultores—predicadores, como él, que también hacían lo mismo.
vi_translation: He only said maybe. I have never seen an old man as kind and gentle as him. He was originally a landowner and also served as a pastor. He personally spent money to build a church at the end of the plantation, and he preached there without taking any money. In the South, there are many people who are both landowners and pastors like that.
tr_translation: He didn't say anything else. He was the kindest-hearted, most well-intentioned man I had ever seen until that day. But this was not surprising, because he was not only a farmer but also a priest, and he had a tiny church at the back of the plantation. He had paid for the expenses of the church and the classroom out of his own pocket, and despite giving very good sermons, he didn't take a penny from anyone. There are many farmer-priests like him in the South, and they all behave the same way.
es_translation: He didn't say anything else. He was the most innocent and kindest person I have ever seen in my life. But it wasn't surprising, because he was not only a farmer but also a preacher, and he had a small log church at the back of the plantation that he had built out of his own pocket to serve as a church and a school, and he never charged anything for preaching, and the truth was that he did it very well. Down in the South, there were many farmer-preachers like him who did the same thing.

en: In about half an hour Tom’s wagon drove up to the front stile, and Aunt Sally she see it through the window, because it was only about fifty yards, and says:
vi: Khoảng nửa giờ sau, xe của thằng Tom đến trước cửa. Dì Saly cũng nhìn thấy qua cửa sổ.
tr: Yaklaşık yarım saat sonra Tom’un arabası ön taraftaki yolda göründü ve yol sadece elli metre kadar uzakta olduğundan Sally Teyze hemen fark etti:
es: Al cabo de una media hora apareció la carreta de Tom en la puerta principal y la tía Sally la vio por la ventana, porque sólo estaba a unas cincuenta yardas, y dijo:
vi_translation: About half an hour later, Tom's car arrived in front of the door. Aunt Saly also saw it through the window.
tr_translation: About half an hour later, Tom's car appeared on the road in front, and since the road was only about fifty meters away, Aunt Sally immediately noticed:
es_translation: After about half an hour, Tom's cart appeared at the front door and Aunt Sally saw it through the window, because it was only about fifty yards away, and she said:

en: “Why, there’s somebody come! I wonder who ’tis? Why, I do believe it’s a stranger. Jimmy” (that’s one of the children) “run and tell Lize to put on another plate for dinner.”
vi: Dì nói: - Có ai đến thế nhỉ? Có lẽ là một người lạ, Jimmy ạ (tên một đứa con). Con chạy ra bảo Lize dọn thêm một đĩa ăn nữa nhé.
tr: “Aaa, biri geliyor! Kim acaba? Yabancı biri galiba. Jimmy (çocuklarından birinin adıydı) koş Lize’ye söyle masaya bir tabak daha koysun.
es: —¡Vaya, ha venido alguien! ¿Quién será? Pues parece que es un desconocido. Jimmy —que era uno de sus hijos—, ve corriendo a decirle a Lize que ponga otro plato para la comida.
vi_translation: She said: - Who could it be? It might be a stranger, Jimmy (the name of a child). Go tell Lize to set an extra plate.
tr_translation: “Aaa, someone is coming! I wonder who? It seems to be a stranger. Jimmy (it was the name of one of the children) run and tell Lize to set another plate on the table.”
es_translation: —Well, someone has come! Who could it be? It seems to be a stranger. Jimmy —who was one of their children—, run and tell Lize to set another plate for the meal.

en: Everybody made a rush for the front door, because, of course, a stranger don’t come every year, and so he lays over the yaller-fever, for interest, when he does come. Tom was over the stile and starting for the house; the wagon was spinning up the road for the village, and we was all bunched in the front door. Tom had his store clothes on, and an audience—and that was always nuts for Tom Sawyer. In them circumstances it warn’t no trouble to him to throw in an amount of style that was suitable. He warn’t a boy to meeky along up that yard like a sheep; no, he come ca’m and important, like the ram. When he got a-front of us he lifts his hat ever so gracious and dainty, like it was the lid of a box that had butterflies asleep in it and he didn’t want to disturb them, and says:
vi: Mọi người kéo ra cửa trước vì ở đây rất ít có người lạ đến thăm. Thằng Tom đã bước đến hàng rào và đang đi vào nhà, chiếc xe ngựa tiếp tục đi vào làng, và chúng tôi đều đã đứng cả ngoài cửa. Tom mặc quần áo may sẵn, dáng điệu đàng hoàng. Nó không phải là một đứa rụt rè như một con cừu. Lúc nó bước đến gần chúng tôi, nó bỏ mũ ra một cách duyên dáng, lịch sự, y như là nó cầm một cái nắp hộp có những con bướm đang đậu và ngủ trong đó mà nó không muốn khẽ động tới. Nó hỏi:
tr: Herkes ön kapıya hücum etti, çünkü çiftliğe yabancı birinin gelmesi sık rastlanan bir şey değildi. O yüzden yabancının gelmesi sarıhummanın gelişinden daha büyük heyecan uyandırıyordu. Tom çitleri geçmiş eve doğru geliyordu, araba dönmüş kasabaya doğru gidiyordu ve biz de ön kapıya yığılmıştık. Tom’un üzerinde yepyeni giysiler; karşısında da bol seyirci vardı… İşte ona gün doğmuştu. Böyle koşullarda nasıl hava basacağını hayal etmek bile güçtü. Öyle kuzu gibi uysal uysal değil, koç gibi dimdik geliyordu. Karşımıza geçip öyle bir şapkasını çıkararak selam verişi vardı ki, şapkanın altında uyuyan narin kelebekleri rahatsız etmemeye çalıştığını sanırdınız.
es: Todo el mundo echó a correr a la puerta principal porque, naturalmente, no llegan desconocidos todos los años, así que resultan más interesantes que la fiebre amarilla. Tom ya había cruzado la puerta e iba hacia la casa; la carreta se volvía hacia el pueblo y todos estábamos amontonados a la entrada. Tom llevaba la ropa comprada en la tienda y tenía un público, que era lo que más le gustaba en el mundo a Tom Sawyer. En circunstancias así no le resultaba nada difícil darse todos los aires que hiciera falta. No era un chico para llegar manso como una oveja; no, llegaba con calma y con aires de importancia, como un carnero. Cuando llegó delante de nosotros se quitó el sombrero muy elegante y muy fino, como si fuera la tapadera de una caja dentro de la que hubiera mariposas durmiendo y no quisiera molestarlas, y va y dice:
vi_translation: Everyone rushed to the front door because it was very rare for strangers to visit here. Tom had reached the fence and was walking into the house, the carriage continued into the village, and we were all standing outside the door. Tom was dressed in ready-made clothes, looking dignified. He was not a timid person like a sheep. As he approached us, he gracefully and politely took off his hat, as if he were holding a lid with butterflies perched and sleeping on it that he didn't want to disturb. He asked:
tr_translation: Everyone rushed to the front door, because it was not common for a stranger to come to the farm. So the arrival of a stranger caused more excitement than the arrival of yellow fever. Tom was coming towards the house, having passed the fences, the car had turned towards the town, and we were all gathered at the front door. Tom was wearing brand new clothes; and there was a large audience in front of him... This was his moment to shine. It was hard to even imagine how he would show off under such circumstances. He was coming not meekly like a lamb, but upright like a ram. The way he took off his hat and greeted us, you would think he was trying not to disturb the delicate butterflies sleeping underneath it.
es_translation: Everyone rushed to the front door because, naturally, strangers don't arrive every year, so they are more interesting than yellow fever. Tom had already crossed the door and was heading towards the house; the cart was turning towards the town and we were all crowded at the entrance. Tom was wearing the clothes bought at the store and had an audience, which was what Tom Sawyer liked most in the world. In such circumstances, it was not difficult for him to put on all the airs he needed. He was not a boy to arrive meek as a lamb; no, he arrived calmly and with an air of importance, like a ram. When he got in front of us, he took off his hat very elegantly and very finely, as if it were the lid of a box inside which butterflies were sleeping and he didn't want to disturb them, and he goes and says:

en: “Mr. Archibald Nichols, I presume?”
vi: - Xin hỏi đây có phải là nhà Archibald Nichols không ạ? Ông Phen trả lời: - Không phải rồi.
tr: “Bay Archibald Nichols’la mı müşerref oluyorum?” dedi.
es: —¿El señor Archibald Nichols, supongo?
vi_translation: - Excuse me, is this the house of Archibald Nichols? Mr. Phen replied: - That's not right.
tr_translation: "Am I honored to meet Mr. Archibald Nichols?" he said.
es_translation: —Mr. Archibald Nichols, I presume?

en: “No, my boy,” says the old gentleman, “I’m sorry to say ’t your driver has deceived you; Nichols’s place is down a matter of three mile more. Come in, come in.”
vi: Rất tiếc người đánh xe ngựa đã lừa cậu. Nhà ông Nichols cách đây ba dặm nữa cơ. Vào đây đã.
tr: “Hayır; oğlum,” dedi yaşlı adam, “ne yazık ki arabacı seni kandırmış; Nichols’ın evi üç mil aşağıda. İçeri gel. İçeri gel.
es: —No, muchacho —dijo el anciano—. Siento decirte que tu conductor te ha engañado; la casa de Nichols está unas tres millas más allá. Pasa, pasa.
vi_translation: I'm sorry, but the coachman has deceived you. Mr. Nichols' house is still three miles away from here. Come in first.
tr_translation: “No; my son,” said the old man, “unfortunately, the coachman has deceived you; Nichols's house is three miles down the road. Come inside. Come inside.”
es_translation: —No, boy —said the old man—. I'm sorry to tell you that your driver has deceived you; Nichols' house is about three miles further. Come in, come in.

en: Tom he took a look back over his shoulder, and says, “Too late—he’s out of sight.”
vi: Tom quay lại nhìn và nói: - Muộn mất rồi, xe đã đi xa quá.
tr: Tom dönüp omzunun üstünden bir baktı. “Çok geç… gözden kayboldu,” dedi.
es: Tom echó una mirada por encima del hombro y dice: —Demasiado tarde, ya no se ve.
vi_translation: Tom turned around and said: - It's too late, the bus has gone too far.
tr_translation: Tom turned and looked over his shoulder. "Too late... it's out of sight," he said.
es_translation: Tom glanced over his shoulder and says: —Too late, you can't see it anymore.

en: “Yes, he’s gone, my son, and you must come in and eat your dinner with us; and then we’ll hitch up and take you down to Nichols’s.”
vi: - Cậu cứ vào đây ăn tối với chúng tôi đã, rồi chúng tôi sẽ cho xe đưa cậu đến nhà ông Nichols.
tr: “Evet, gitti, oğlum, gelip bizimle yemek yemelisin; ondan sonra benim arabama bineriz ve seni Nichols’lara kadar götürürüm.
es: —Sí, se ha ido, hijo mío, y debes entrar y comer con nosotros, y después engancharemos la yegua y te llevamos a casa de Nichols.
vi_translation: - Come in and have dinner with us first, then we will arrange a car to take you to Mr. Nichols' house.
tr_translation: “Yes, he left, my son, you should come and eat with us; after that, we will get in my car and I will take you to the Nichols’ place.”
es_translation: —Yes, he has gone, my son, and you must come in and eat with us, and then we will harness the mare and take you to Nichols' house.

en: “Oh, I can’t make you so much trouble; I couldn’t think of it. I’ll walk—I don’t mind the distance.”
vi: - ồ, cháu không dám làm phiền ông bà thế. Cháu đi bộ một lát là đến nơi thôi mà.
tr: “Şey, o kadar zahmet vermek istemem; katiyen olmaz. Ben yürürüm… Çok uzak değil.
es: —Ah, no puedo causarles tanta molestia; ni pensarlo. Iré a pie... No me importa la distancia.
vi_translation: - Oh, I wouldn't dare trouble you both. It's just a short walk to get there.
tr_translation: "Well, I don't want to trouble you that much; absolutely not. I'll walk... It's not very far."
es_translation: —Ah, I can't cause you so much trouble; not even think about it. I'll go on foot... I don't mind the distance.

en: “But we won’t let you walk—it wouldn’t be Southern hospitality to do it. Come right in.”
vi: - Nhưng chúng tôi không để cậu đi bộ được. Người phương Nam rất hiểu khách. Hãy cứ vào đây đã.
tr: “Ama ben yürümene izin veremem… Güneyli konukseverliğine yakışmaz. Hemen içeri gel.
es: —Pero no te vamos a dejar que vayas a pie; eso no sería la hospitalidad del Sur. Pasa sin más.
vi_translation: - But we won't let you walk. Southern people are very hospitable. Just come in here first.
tr_translation: “But I can't let you walk... It wouldn't befit Southern hospitality. Come inside immediately.”
es_translation: —But we are not going to let you go on foot; that would not be Southern hospitality. Just go on.

en: “Oh, do,” says Aunt Sally; “it ain’t a bit of trouble to us, not a bit in the world. You must stay. It’s a long, dusty three mile, and we can’t let you walk. And, besides, I’ve already told ’em to put on another plate when I see you coming; so you mustn’t disappoint us. Come right in and make yourself at home.”
vi: Dì Saly nói: - Xin mời vào, chúng tôi không thấy phiền đâu. Cậu phải nản lại đây đã. Đường đến đó xa những ba dặm mà bụi lắm, chúng tôi không thể để cậu đi bộ. Vả lại, chúng tôi đã cho người dọn thêm bát đĩa rồi. Cháu cứ tự nhiên Thompson.
tr: “Lütfen içeri gel,” dedi Sally Teyze; “bizim için hiç zahmet olmaz, alt tarafı ne ki. Biraz kalmalısın. Yol üç mil ama her yer toz içinde, yürümene izin veremeyiz. Zaten geldiğini görünce masaya bir tabak daha koymalarını söylemiştim, bizi kırma. İçeri gel ve kendini evinde say.
es: —Sí, por favor —dijo la tía Sally—; no es ninguna molestia. Debes quedarte. Son tres millas largas y hay mucho polvo; no podemos dejar que vayas a pie. Y, además ya les he dicho que pongan otro plato cuando te vi llegar, así que no debes desilusionarnos. Pasa adentro, que estás en tu casa.
vi_translation: Aunt Saly said: - Please come in, we don't mind at all. You must stay here for now. The road to there is as far as three miles and very dusty, we can't let you walk. Moreover, we have already set extra plates. Make yourself at home, Thompson.
tr_translation: “Please come in,” said Aunt Sally; “it’s no trouble for us at all, it’s nothing really. You must stay for a while. The road is three miles but everything is covered in dust, we can’t let you walk. In fact, when I saw you coming, I told them to set another plate at the table, don’t disappoint us. Come in and make yourself at home.”
es_translation: —Yes, please —said Aunt Sally—; it's no trouble at all. You must stay. It's three long miles and there's a lot of dust; we can't let you go on foot. And besides, I've already told them to set another plate when I saw you coming, so you mustn't disappoint us. Come inside, make yourself at home.

en: So Tom he thanked them very hearty and handsome, and let himself be persuaded, and come in; and when he was in he said he was a stranger from Hicksville, Ohio, and his name was William Thompson—and he made another bow.
vi: Thế là Tom cảm ơn một cách rất nhiệt tình và rất khéo, làm ra vẻ miễn cưỡng bước vào nhà; rồi nó nói rằng nó là người vùng Ohio mới đến và nó tên là William Thompson.
tr: Tom onlara içtenlikle ve zarifçe teşekkür etti, daha fazla nazlanmadan içeri girdi; girdikten sonra Ohio, Hicksville’den bir yabancı olduğunu, adının William Thompson olduğunu söyledi ve yeniden eğilerek selam verdi.
es: Así que Tom les dio las gracias con mucha animación y cortesía y se dejó persuadir; una vez dentro dijo que era de Hicksville, Ohio, y que se llamaba William Thompson, e hizo otra reverencia.
vi_translation: So Tom thanked very enthusiastically and skillfully, pretending to reluctantly step into the house; then he said that he was from Ohio and his name was William Thompson.
tr_translation: Tom sincerely and gracefully thanked them, entered without further ado; after entering, he said he was a stranger from Hicksville, Ohio, that his name was William Thompson, and bowed again in greeting.
es_translation: So Tom thanked them very animatedly and courteously and allowed himself to be persuaded; once inside, he said he was from Hicksville, Ohio, and that his name was William Thompson, and made another bow.

en: Well, he run on, and on, and on, making up stuff about Hicksville and everybody in it he could invent, and I getting a little nervious, and wondering how this was going to help me out of my scrape; and at last, still talking along, he reached over and kissed Aunt Sally right on the mouth, and then settled back again in his chair comfortable, and was going on talking; but she jumped up and wiped it off with the back of her hand, and says:
vi: Nó thao thao bất tuyệt về mọi chuyện nó bịa ra ở Ohio, tôi đã bắt đầu thấy khó chịu và lo lắng không biết nó định làm thế nào để giúp tôi thoát khỏi cái tính trạng đàng khó khăn này. Sau cùng, đang nói chuyện bỗng nó đứng lên và hôn ngay vào miệng dì Saly, sau trở lại ngồi đàng hoàng trong ghế của nó, và lại tiếp tục nói chuyện. Dì Saly giật thót người, lấy mu bàn tay lau miệng và nói:
tr: Böylece anlattı da anlattı, Hicksville ve orada yaşayanlar hakkında bir sürü şey uydurdu; artık gerilmeye başlamıştım. Tüm bunların içinde bulunduğumuz duruma ne çözüm getireceğini merak ediyordum; nihayet hiç konuşmasını kesmeden uzanıp Sally Teyze’yi ağzından öpüverdi, sonra da tekrar sandalyesine oturup iyice yerleşti ve sözlerine devam edecekti ki Sally Teyze bir anda sıçrayıp dudaklarını elinin tersiyle silerken haykırdı:
es: Bueno, no dejó de hablar y de hablar y de hablar inventándose cosas de Hicksville y de toda clase de gente que se le iba ocurriendo, y yo me iba poniendo nervioso y preguntándome cómo me iba a ayudar aquello a salir del apuro; por fin, mientras seguía hablando, se levantó y le dio a tía Sally un beso en plena boca y después volvió a sentarse en su silla tan tranquilo e iba a seguir hablando; pero la tía Sally dio un salto, se limpió la boca con el dorso de la mano y dijo:
vi_translation: He rambled on endlessly about all the things he made up in Ohio, and I started to feel uneasy and worried about how he intended to help me get out of this difficult situation. Finally, in the middle of the conversation, he suddenly stood up and kissed Aunt Saly right on the mouth, then sat back down properly in his chair and continued talking. Aunt Saly jerked back, wiped her mouth with the back of her hand, and said:
tr_translation: So he went on and on, making up a bunch of things about Hicksville and the people living there; I was starting to get tense. I was wondering how any of this would provide a solution to our situation; finally, without stopping his speech, he leaned over and kissed Aunt Sally on the mouth, then sat back down in his chair and settled in, about to continue his words when Aunt Sally suddenly jumped up, wiped her lips with the back of her hand, and shouted:
es_translation: Well, he didn't stop talking and talking and talking, making up things about Hicksville and all kinds of people that came to his mind, and I was getting nervous and wondering how that was going to help me out of the predicament; finally, while he was still talking, he got up and gave Aunt Sally a kiss right on the mouth and then sat back down in his chair as calmly as ever and was about to continue talking; but Aunt Sally jumped up, wiped her mouth with the back of her hand, and said:

en: “You owdacious puppy!”
vi: - Thằng bé này láo quá!
tr: “Seni arsız köpek!
es: —¡Atrevido, maleducado!
vi_translation: - This boy is too rude!
tr_translation: "You shameless dog!"
es_translation: —You insolent, rude person!

en: He looked kind of hurt, and says:
vi: Nó có vẻ như bị xúc phạm nói:
tr: Tom ona incinmiş gibi baktı:
es: Él pareció dolerse, y va y dice:
vi_translation: It seemed to be offended, saying:
tr_translation: Tom looked at her as if he were hurt:
es_translation: He seemed to be in pain, and he goes and says:

en: “I’m surprised at you, m’am.”
vi: - Thưa bà, sao lại thế ạ?
tr: “Beni çok şaşırttınız bayan. “Şaşırmak mı? Ben mi şaşırttım seni?
es: —Me sorprende, señora. —Te sorpre...
vi_translation: - Madam, why is it so?
tr_translation: "You surprised me a lot, ma'am." “Surprised? Did I surprise you?
es_translation: —I am surprised, ma'am. —Does it surprise you...

en: “You’re s’rp—Why, what do you reckon I am? I’ve a good notion to take and—Say, what do you mean by kissing me?”
vi: - Mày tưởng tao là ai? Mày hôn tao nghĩa là thế nào?
tr: Şimdi ben sana gününü… Ne yapmaya çalışıyorsun?
es: Pero, ¿quién te crees que soy? Me dan buenas ganas de agarrar y... Pero, ¿qué es eso de darme un beso?
vi_translation: - Who do you think I am? What do you mean by kissing me?
tr_translation: Now I will show you… What are you trying to do?”
es_translation: But, who do you think I am? I really feel like grabbing and... But, what is this about giving me a kiss?

en: He looked kind of humble, and says:
vi: Nó lại làm ra vẻ rất lễ độm đáp:
tr: Tom mütevazı bir edayla cevapladı:
es: Él pareció encogerse, y dijo:
vi_translation: It again made a very polite response:
tr_translation: Tom answered with a modest demeanor:
es_translation: He seemed to shrink, and said:

en: “I didn’t mean nothing, m’am. I didn’t mean no harm. I—I—thought you’d like it.”
vi: -Thưa bà, không có nghĩa thế nào cả, cháu tưởng bà thích thế.
tr: “Hiçbir şey, bayan. Kötü bir niyetim yoktu. Hoşunuza gideceğini düşünmüştüm.
es: —No era con mala intención, señora. No quería disgustarla, yo ... yo... Creí que le gustaría.
vi_translation: -Madam, it doesn't mean anything at all, I thought you liked it that way. Are you crazy?
tr_translation: “Nothing, ma'am. I had no ill intentions. I thought you would like it.”
es_translation: —It wasn't with bad intentions, ma'am. I didn't mean to upset you, I... I... I thought you would like it.

en: “Well, I don’t know. Only, they—they—told me you would.”
vi: - Cháu không biết nữa. Họ bảo rằng bà thích như thế.
tr: “Bilmem. Ama bana… bana hoşunuza gideceğini söylediler.
es: —Bueno, no sé. Es que... Es que...
vi_translation: - I don't know. They said that you like it that way.
tr_translation: "I don't know. But they told me... they told me you would like it."
es_translation: —Well, I don't know. It's just that... It's just that...

en: “They told you I would. Whoever told you’s another lunatic. I never heard the beat of it. Who’s they?”
vi: Họ bảo rằng bà thích như thế. - Đứa nào bảo mày thế là những đứa điên rồ. Tao chưa nghe thấy ai nói lạ thế. Họ là ai?
tr: “Demek öyle dediler. Kim dediyse o da delinin tekiymiş. Hiç böyle bir şey duymadım. Kimden bahsediyorsun?
es: Me dijeron que así sería. —Te dijeron que así sería. Pues el que te lo dijera es otro lunático. Nunca he oído nada igual. ¿Quiénes te lo dijeron?
vi_translation: They said that you like it that way. - Whoever told you that is crazy. I have never heard anyone say something so strange. Who are they?
tr_translation: “So they said that. Whoever said it must be a fool. I've never heard such a thing. Who are you talking about?”
es_translation: They told me it would be like this. —They told you it would be like this. Well, the one who told you is another lunatic. I've never heard anything like it. Who told you?

en: “Why, everybody. They all said so, m’am.”
vi: - Tất cả mọi người đều nói thế, thưa bà.
tr: “Şey… herkes. Hepsi öyle dedi, bayan.
es: —Bueno, todo el mundo. Eso fue lo que dijeron, señora.
vi_translation: - Everyone says so, ma'am.
tr_translation: "Well... everyone." "They all said so, ma'am.""
es_translation: —Well, everyone. That's what they said, ma'am.

en: It was all she could do to hold in; and her eyes snapped, and her fingers worked like she wanted to scratch him; and she says:
vi: Đến lúc này thì bà Saly không chịu được nữa, mắt bà chớp chớp, mấy ngón tay cựa quậy như muốn cào nó, và hỏi:
tr: Sally Teyze kendini kaybetmek üzereydi, gözleri pörtlemişti, parmakları onu tırmalamak istermiş gibi açılmıştı.
es: Ella apenas podía aguantarse, echaba fuego por los ojos y movía los dedos como si quisiera arañarlo, y dijo:
vi_translation: At this point, Mrs. Saly couldn't stand it any longer, her eyes blinked, her fingers twitched as if wanting to scratch it, and she asked:
tr_translation: Aunt Sally was about to lose herself, her eyes were bulging, her fingers were spread as if she wanted to scratch him.
es_translation: She could barely contain herself, her eyes were blazing with anger, and she moved her fingers as if she wanted to scratch him, and she said:

en: “Who’s ‘everybody’? Out with their names, or ther’ll be an idiot short.”
vi: - Tất cả mọi người là ai? Tên họ là gì? Nói mau, không thì đừng trách.
tr: “‘Herkes’ dediğin de kim? Çabuk adlarını ver; yoksa bu dünyadan bir beyinsiz eksilecek.
es: —¿Quién es todo el mundo? Dame sus nombres o habrá un idiota menos en este mundo.
vi_translation: - Who are all these people? What are their names? Speak quickly, or don't blame me.
tr_translation: "'Everyone' you say, who are they?" "Quickly give their names; otherwise, this world will be short one more fool.""
es_translation: —Who is everyone? Give me their names or there will be one less idiot in this world.

en: He got up and looked distressed, and fumbled his hat, and says:
vi: Thằng Tom đứng dậy, làm ra vẻ thất vọng, nhặt mũ lên rồi nói:
tr: Tom keyifsizce ayağa kalktı, şapkasıyla oynayarak konuştu:
es: Tom se levantó, con aire apurado, dándole vueltas al sombrero, y dijo:
vi_translation: Tom stood up, pretending to be disappointed, picked up his hat, and said:
tr_translation: Tom stood up gloomily, speaking while playing with his hat:
es_translation: Tom stood up, looking hurried, turning his hat around, and said:

en: “I’m sorry, and I warn’t expecting it. They told me to. They all told me to. They all said, kiss her; and said she’d like it. They all said it—every one of them. But I’m sorry, m’am, and I won’t do it no more—I won’t, honest.”
vi: - Cháu xin lỗi. Cháu không ngờ mọi chuyện lại xảy ra như thế này. Họ đều bảo cháu phải hôn ba vì bà rất thích như vậy. Từ giờ cháu hứa sẽ không làm như vậy nữa, trừ khi bà yêu cầu mà thôi.
tr: “Özür dilerim, hiç beklemiyordum. Bana öyle dediler. Hepsi öyle dedi. Onu öpersen hoşuna gider; dediler. Hepsi söyledi… hem de hepsi. Ama çok özür dilerim, bayan, bir daha yapmam… yemin ederim.
es: —Lo siento, y no me lo esperaba. Me lo dijeron. Me lo dijeron todos. Todos me dijeron «dale un beso», y dijeron que le gustaría. Lo dijeron todos, hasta el último, pero lo siento, señora, y no volveré a hacerlo. De verdad que no.
vi_translation: - I'm sorry. I didn't expect things to turn out this way. They all told me to kiss you because you really like it. From now on, I promise I won't do it again unless you ask me to.
tr_translation: “I'm sorry, I didn't expect it at all. They told me so. They all said so. They said if you kiss her, she will like it. They all said it… every single one of them. But I'm very sorry, ma'am, I won't do it again… I swear.”
es_translation: —I'm sorry, and I didn't expect it. They told me. They all told me. Everyone told me "give her a kiss," and they said she would like it. Everyone said it, to the last one, but I'm sorry, ma'am, and I won't do it again. Really, I won't.

en: “You won’t, won’t you? Well, I sh’d reckon you won’t!”
vi: Từ giờ cháu hứa sẽ không làm như vậy nữa, trừ khi bà yêu cầu mà thôi.
tr: “Yapmaz mısın, yapmaz mısın? Hele bir yap da görelim!
es: —¿Conque no volverás a hacerlo, verdad? ¡Hombre, te lo aseguro!
