vi_translation: From now on, I promise I won't do it again unless you ask me to.
tr_translation: "Won't you do it, won't you do it? Just try and let's see!"
es_translation: —So you won't do it again, right? Man, I assure you!

en: “No’m, I’m honest about it; I won’t ever do it again—till you ask me.”
vi: Từ giờ cháu hứa sẽ không làm như vậy nữa, trừ khi bà yêu cầu mà thôi.
tr: “Hayır; yemin ettim, bir daha asla yapmayacağım. Tabii siz istemezseniz.
es: —No, lo digo de verdad; no volveré a hacerlo jamás hasta que me lo pida usted.
vi_translation: From now on, I promise I won't do it again unless you ask me to.
tr_translation: “No; I swore, I will never do it again. Of course, unless you want me to.”
es_translation: —No, I mean it; I will never do it again until you ask me to.

en: “Well,” he says, “it does surprise me so. I can’t make it out, somehow. They said you would, and I thought you would. But—” He stopped and looked around slow, like he wished he could run across a friendly eye somewheres, and fetched up on the old gentleman’s, and says, “Didn’t you think she’d like me to kiss her, sir?”
vi: - Tao yêu cầu? Từ bé đến giờ, tao chưa khi nào thấy chuyện lạ như thế. Nhất là hạng người như mày. Nó nhìn chung quanh, có vẻ như muốn tìm gặp một ánh mắt thân mật, rồi nhìn đên ông Phelps và hỏi: - Ông có nghĩ rằng bà ấy muốn cho cháu hôn bà ấy không, thưa ông?
tr: “Gerçekten çok şaşırdım,” dedi Tom. “Doğrusu bir türlü anlayamıyorum. Hoşunuza gideceğini söylediler; ben de hoşunuza gideceğini düşündüm. Ama…” Durdu ve ağır ağır etrafına bakındı, dostça bir yüz arar gibiydi; sonra da yaşlı beye sordu: “Sizde onu öpmemden hoşlanacağını düşünmediniz mi, efendim?
es: Te aseguro que vas a ser el Matusalén más tonto de la creación antes de que yo te pida nada semejante. Ni a ti ni a nadie como tú. —Bueno —dice Tom—, me sorprende muchísimo. No sé por qué, pero no lo entiendo. Dijeron que le gustaría y yo también lo creí. Pero... —se calló y miró lentamente a un lado y a otro, como si quisiera encontrar una mirada amistosa en alguna parte, y por fin se detuvo en el anciano y le preguntó—: ¿No creía usted, caballero, que le gustaría que la besara?
vi_translation: Since I was little, I have never seen anything as strange as this. Especially from someone like you. It looked around, seemingly wanting to meet a friendly gaze, then looked at Mr. Phelps and asked: - Do you think she wants the child to kiss her, sir?
tr_translation: “I am really surprised,” said Tom. “Honestly, I just can't understand it. They said you would like it; I thought you would like it too. But…” He paused and slowly looked around, as if searching for a friendly face; then he asked the old gentleman: “Didn't you think she would like me kissing her, sir?”
es_translation: I assure you that you are going to be the dumbest Methuselah in creation before I ask you for anything like that. .. Neither to you nor to anyone like you. —Well —says Tom—, I am very surprised. I don't know why, but I don't understand it. They said she would like it and I believed it too. But... —he fell silent and slowly looked from side to side, as if trying to find a friendly gaze somewhere, and finally stopped at the old man and asked him—: Didn't you think, sir, that she would like me to kiss her?

en: “Why, no; I—I—well, no, I b’lieve I didn’t.”
vi: - Không, tôi không nghĩ thế.
tr: “Yoo, ben… hiç zannetmem.
es: —Pues no; yo... yo... creo que no.
vi_translation: - No, I don't think so.
tr_translation: “No way, I… don't think so at all.”
es_translation: —Well, no; I... I... don't think so.

en: Then he looks on around the same way to me, and says:
vi: Rồi nó lại nhìn tôi cũng kiểu như vậy, và hỏi:
tr: Yine aynı ifadeyle çevresine bakındı, bu kez bana sordu:
es: Entonces siguió mirando hasta que se detuvo en mí y preguntó:
vi_translation: Then it looked at me again in the same way and asked:
tr_translation: He looked around again with the same expression, this time he asked me:
es_translation: Then he kept looking until he stopped at me and asked:

en: “Tom, didn’t you think Aunt Sally ’d open out her arms and say, ‘Sid Sawyer—’”
vi: - Tom, mày có nghĩ rằng dì Saly sẽ dang hai tay ra và gọi: Sid Sawyer không?
tr: “Tom, Sally Teyze’nin kollarını açıp ‘Sid Sawyer’ diyeceğini düşünmüyor muydun?
es: —Tom, ¿no creías tú que la tía Sally abriría los brazos y diría: «Sid Sawyer...»?
vi_translation: - Tom, do you think Aunt Sally will open her arms and call: Sid Sawyer?
tr_translation: “Tom, didn't you think Aunt Sally would open her arms and say 'Sid Sawyer'?””
es_translation: —Tom, didn't you think that Aunt Sally would open her arms and say, "Sid Sawyer..."?

en: “My land!” she says, breaking in and jumping for him, “you impudent young rascal, to fool a body so—” and was going to hug him, but he fended her off, and says:
vi: - Lạy Chúa - Dì Saly kêu lên một tiếng và nhảy đến chỗ nó - cái thằng ranh này, mày đánh lừa dì thế à? Dí nó vừa sắp ôm lấy nó thì nó gạt ra nói:
tr: Sally Teyze “Ya Rabbim!” diye haykırarak ona doğru atıldı, “seni küçük edepsiz maskara, beni nasıl böyle kandırırsın?” ona sarılmak istedi ama Tom geri çekildi:
es: —¡Dios mío! —dijo ella, interrumpiéndole y dando un salto hacia él—, criatura insolente, mira que engañarla a una así... —e iba a darle un abrazo pero él la apartó y dijo:
vi_translation: - Oh my God - Aunt Saly exclaimed and jumped towards him - you little rascal, did you trick me? Just as she was about to hug him, he pushed her away and said:
tr_translation: Aunt Sally exclaimed, "Oh my God!" and rushed towards him, "you little impudent rascal, how dare you deceive me like this?" She wanted to hug him but Tom pulled back.
es_translation: —My God! —she said, interrupting him and jumping towards him—, insolent creature, to deceive her like that... —and she was about to give him a hug but he pushed her away and said:

en: “No, not till you’ve asked me first.”
vi: - Không được, phải chờ dì yêu cầu đã!
tr: “Olmaz, sen istemeden olmaz.
es: —No, primero me lo tiene que pedir.
vi_translation: - No, we have to wait for Auntie's request first!
tr_translation: "It won't happen, not unless you want it.""
es_translation: —No, first you have to ask me for it.

en: So she didn’t lose no time, but asked him; and hugged him and kissed him over and over again, and then turned him over to the old man, and he took what was left. And after they got a little quiet again she says:
vi: Thế là bà ấy yêu cầu nó ngay, và ôm chặt lấy nó hôn liền mấy cái, rồi quay nó sang phía ông chồng, ông chồng cũng hôn nó một chập nữa. Lát sau, yên lặng cả rồi, dì ấy nói:
tr: Sally Teyze daha fazla oyalanmadan onu öpmesini istedi; sonra ona sarıldı, tekrar tekrar öptü, ardından yaşlı adama verdi ve geri kalanı da o aldı. Biraz sakinleştikten sonra şöyle dedi:
es: Así que ella no perdió el tiempo, sino que se lo pidió y lo llenó de abrazos y de besos una y otra vez, y después se lo pasó al viejo, que hizo lo propio. Y cuando volvieron a tranquilizarse un poco dijo ella:
vi_translation: So she immediately asked for it, and hugged it tightly, kissing it several times, then turned it towards her husband, who also kissed it for a while. After a while, when everything was quiet, she said:
tr_translation: Aunt Sally wanted to kiss him without further delay; then she hugged him, kissed him repeatedly, then gave him to the old man and took the rest herself. After calming down a bit, she said:
es_translation: So she did not waste any time, but asked for it and filled it with hugs and kisses over and over again, and then handed it to the old man, who did the same. And when they calmed down a bit, she said:

en: “Why, dear me, I never see such a surprise. We warn’t looking for you at all, but only Tom. Sis never wrote to me about anybody coming but him.”
vi: - Chưa bao giờ dì thấy bất ngờ như vậy. Dì chú tưởng chỉ có Tom đến thôi. Trong thư chỉ nói rằng thằng Tom sẽ đến. Nó nói”
tr: “Hay Allah, bu ne güzel bir sürpriz böyle. Biz sadece Tom’u bekliyorduk, senin geleceğinden haberimiz yoktu. Ablam ondan başkasının geleceğinden hiç bahsetmedi.
es: —Pero Dios mío, nunca he visto una sorpresa igual. No te estábamos esperando a ti en absoluto, sino únicamente a Tom. Mi hermana nunca me dijo que fuera a venir más que él.
vi_translation: - Auntie has never been so surprised. Your uncle and I thought only Tom was coming. The letter only mentioned that Tom would come. It says
tr_translation: “Oh my God, what a wonderful surprise this is. We were only expecting Tom, we had no idea you were coming. My sister never mentioned anyone else coming.”
es_translation: —But my God, I have never seen such a surprise. We were not expecting you at all, only Tom. My sister never told me that anyone else was coming besides him.

en: “It’s because it warn’t intended for any of us to come but Tom,” he says; “but I begged and begged, and at the last minute she let me come, too; so, coming down the river, me and Tom thought it would be a first-rate surprise for him to come here to the house first, and for me to by-and-by tag along and drop in, and let on to be a stranger. But it was a mistake, Aunt Sally. This ain’t no healthy place for a stranger to come.”
vi: - Đó là vì dì chỉ muốn có thằng Tom đến thôi, còn ngoài ra không muốn ai đến nữa. Nhưng cháu cứ xin mãi, sau cùng, mẹ cháu mới cho cháu đi nữa. Xuống tàu rồi, Tom với cháu bàn nhau rằng phải làm cho dì ngạc nhiên, để nó đến trước rồi cháu giả vờ như đi qua tạt vào, làm như một người lạ.
tr: “Çünkü gerçekten de Tom’un yanında birinin daha gelmesi hesapta yoktu” dedi bizim Tom, “ama onu bıktırıncaya kadar yalvardım ve son dakikada benim de gelmeme izin verdi; sonra Tom’la birlikte nehir aşağı gelirken ilk önce onun gelmesinin, sonra da benim gelip yabancıymış gibi davranmamın on numara sürpriz olacağını düşündük. Ama hata etmişiz, Sally Teyze. Burası bir yabancının gönül rahatlığıyla gelebileceği bir yer değil.
es: —Porque sólo pensó enviar a Tom —dijo él—, pero yo le supliqué y le supliqué y a última hora me dejó venir también; así que cuando bajábamos por el río, Tom y yo pensamos que sería una gran sorpresa que llegase él primero a la casa y después apareciera yo como de repente, haciéndome el desconocido. Pero nos equivocamos, tía Sally. Esta casa no es sana para los desconocidos.
vi_translation: - That’s because aunt only wanted Tom to come, and didn’t want anyone else to come. But I kept asking, and finally, my mom let me go too. After getting off the boat, Tom and I discussed that we should surprise aunt, so he would arrive first and I would pretend to just pass by and drop in, acting like a stranger.
tr_translation: “Because indeed, it was not planned for someone else to come along with Tom,” said our Tom, “but I begged him until he was fed up and at the last minute he allowed me to come too; then while coming down the river with Tom, we thought it would be a great surprise if he came first and then I came and acted like a stranger. But we made a mistake, Aunt Sally. This is not a place where a stranger can come with peace of mind.”
es_translation: —Because he only thought of sending Tom —he said—, but I begged and begged and at the last moment he let me come too; so when we were going down the river, Tom and I thought it would be a great surprise if he arrived at the house first and then I appeared suddenly, pretending to be a stranger. But we were wrong, Aunt Sally. This house is not safe for strangers.

en: “Pa, mayn’t Tom and Sid and me go to the show?”
vi: - Bố cho anh Tom, anh Sid và con đi xem hát được không?
tr: “Tom, Sid ve ben gösteriye gidebilir miyiz baba?
es: —Padre, ¿no podemos Tom y Sid y yo ir a ver la función?
vi_translation: - Dad, can you take Tom, Sid, and me to the theater?
tr_translation: "Dad, can Tom, Sid, and I go to the show?"
es_translation: —Father, can't Tom, Sid, and I go to see the show?

en: “No,” says the old man, “I reckon there ain’t going to be any; and you couldn’t go if there was; because the runaway nigger told Burton and me all about that scandalous show, and Burton said he would tell the people; so I reckon they’ve drove the owdacious loafers out of town before this time.”
vi: - Không - Ông bố trả lời - có lẽ không diễn đâu, mà có thì các cháu cũng không đi được, vì tên da đen chạy trốn nói với ông Burton nói sẽ báo cho mọi người biết, lần này có lẽ họ sẽ tống cổ mấy cái thằng ăn hại ấy ra khỏi đây.
tr: “Hayır,” dedi yaşlı adam, “hem zaten gösteri filan olmayacak; olsaydı da gidemezdiniz; çünkü kaçak zenci bana ve Burton’a o rezil gösteri hakkında her şeyi anlattı, Burton da kasabadakilere anlatmaya gitti; herhalde şimdiye o arsız serserileri kasabadan atmışlardır.
es: —No —contestó el viejo—. Creo que no va a haberla, y aunque la hubiera no podríais ir, porque el negro fugitivo nos ha contado a Burton y a mí todo lo que pasa en esa función escandalosa, y Burton dijo que se lo iba a decir a la gente, así que creo que hemos echado del pueblo a esos gandules presumidos.
vi_translation: - No - the father replied - maybe it won't be performed, and even if it is, you kids won't be able to go, because the runaway black man told Mr. Burton that he would inform everyone, this time they might kick those useless guys out of here.
tr_translation: “No,” said the old man, “and besides, there won't be any show; even if there was, you couldn't go; because the runaway black man told me and Burton everything about that disgraceful show, and Burton went to tell the townspeople; by now, they must have driven those shameless rascals out of town.”
es_translation: —No —answered the old man—. I think there won't be one, and even if there were, you couldn't go, because the runaway black man has told Burton and me everything that happens in that scandalous show, and Burton said he was going to tell the people, so I think we've driven those boastful loafers out of town.

en: So there it was!—but I couldn’t help it. Tom and me was to sleep in the same room and bed; so, being tired, we bid good-night and went up to bed right after supper, and clumb out of the window and down the lightning-rod, and shoved for the town; for I didn’t believe anybody was going to give the king and the duke a hint, and so if I didn’t hurry up and give them one they’d get into trouble sure.
vi: Tôi không biết làm thế nào được. Tom và tôi cũng ngủ một buồng trên gác và chung một giường. Lấy cớ vì mệt qúa, ăn xong chúng tôi xin đi ngủ ngay. Rồi chúng tôi trèo qua cửa sổ, ôm cột đèn tụt xuống đất rồi đi vào thị trấn. Vì tôi không tin rằng những người ở đây đã có ai mách cho nhà vua và quận công biết cho nên nếu tôi không ai đi báo cho họ biết thì họ sẽ bị nguy hiểm.
tr: İşte Jim’den bahsedilmişti! Ama o an yapacak bir şey yoktu. Tom ve ben aynı odada ve aynı yatakta uyuyacaktık; yemekten hemen sonra çok yorgun olduğumuzu söyleyerek herkese iyi geceler dileyip odamıza gittik, derhal pencereden çıkıp paratonerden aşağı kaydık ve hızla kasabaya yöneldik; çünkü krala ve düke kimsenin haber vermediğini düşünüyordum, o halde acele edip onlara olanları anlatmazsak başları büyük belaya girecekti.
es: ¡Así estaban las cosas! Pero no podíamos hacer nada.
vi_translation: I don't know what to do. Tom and I also slept in the same room upstairs and shared a bed. Using the excuse of being too tired, we asked to go to bed immediately after eating. Then we climbed out the window, slid down the lamppost to the ground, and went into town. Because I didn't believe that anyone here had informed the king and the duke, if I didn't go and inform them, they would be in danger.
tr_translation: Here was Jim mentioned! But there was nothing to be done at that moment. Tom and I were going to sleep in the same room and in the same bed; right after dinner, we said goodnight to everyone, claiming we were very tired, and went to our room, immediately climbed out of the window, slid down the lightning rod, and headed quickly to the town; because I thought no one had informed the king and the duke, so if we didn't hurry and tell them what had happened, they would get into big trouble.
es_translation: That's how things were! But we couldn't do anything. Tom and I had to sleep in the same room and in the same bed, so since we were tired, we said goodnight and went to bed immediately after dinner.

en: On the road Tom he told me all about how it was reckoned I was murdered, and how pap disappeared pretty soon, and didn’t come back no more, and what a stir there was when Jim run away; and I told Tom all about our Royal Nonesuch rapscallions, and as much of the raft voyage as I had time to; and as we struck into the town and up through the the middle of it—it was as much as half-after eight, then—here comes a raging rush of people with torches, and an awful whooping and yelling, and banging tin pans and blowing horns; and we jumped to one side to let them go by; and as they went by I see they had the king and the duke astraddle of a rail—that is, I knowed it was the king and the duke, though they was all over tar and feathers, and didn’t look like nothing in the world that was human—just looked like a couple of monstrous big soldier-plumes. Well, it made me sick to see it; and I was sorry for them poor pitiful rascals, it seemed like I couldn’t ever feel any hardness against them any more in the world. It was a dreadful thing to see. Human beings can be awful cruel to one another.
vi: Trên đường đi, Tom kể lại cho tôi nghe tất cả các chuyện về việc mọi người tưởng tôi bị giết như thế nào, rồi bố tôi cũng biến mất không trở về nữa, rồi khi Jim trốn đi thì ở đó xôn xao như thế nào. Còn tôi thì kể cho nó nghe về hai tên khốn kiếp diễn ở kịch “Hoàng gia cổ kim có một”, kể chuyện du lịch trên chiếc bè gỗ từ đó đến nay. Khoảng tám giờ rưỡi, chúng tôi đã vào đến giữa thị trấn, bỗng thấy một đám người tốt đuốc đang kéo đi, gõ xoong chảo và thổi tù và. Chúng tôi vội nhảy tránh sang bên đường cho họ đi. Lúc họ đi qua, chúng tôi thấy họ dắt nhà vua với quận công đi, hai người bị kẹt vào một thanh sắt, khắp người họ đã bị bôi hắc ín và dính cả lông lá vào, không còn ra người nữa. Tôi thấy cảnh đó cũng động lòng và lấy làm tiếc cho hai cái tên khốn khiếp đáng thương ấy. Sao con người đối với con người lại có thể độc ác một cách ghê tởm như thể nhỉ?
tr: Tom yolda bana cinayete kurban gittiğimin sanıldığım, babamın kısa süre sonra kaybolup bir daha hiç geri dönmediğini ve Jim kaçınca nasıl bir patırtı çıktığını filan anlattı; ben de Tom’a vakit yettiği kadarıyla bizim Sarayda Curcuna dolandırıcıları hakkındaki her şeyi ve sal yolculuğumuzu anlattım; kasabaya varıp ortasına kadar geldiğimizde öfkeli bir kalabalığın geldiğini gördük; ellerinde meşaleler vardı, korkunç naralar ve feryatlarla geliyorlardı, kimisi tava çalıyor kimisi boru öttürüyordu; geçsinler diye hemen kendimizi bir kenara attık; kalabalık geçerken kralın ve dükün de birer sırığa oturtulmuş olduğunu gördüm –daha doğrusu onların kral ve dük olduklarını anlamıştım, ama her tarafları katran ve tüyle kaplıydı, bu dünyadaki insanlara benzer hiçbir yanları kalmamıştı– daha ziyade devasa boyutlarda bir çift asker sorgucunu andırıyorlardı. Onları görünce altüst oldum. Bu acınası sefil haydutların haline üzülmüştüm, bundan böyle onlara karşı asla katı yürekli olamayacak gibiydim. Halleri gerçekten tüyler ürperticiydi. İnsanlar birbirlerine karşı nasıl da zalim olabiliyor.
es: Tom y yo teníamos que dormir en la misma habitación y en la misma cama, así que como estábamos cansados nos despedimos y nos fuimos a acostar inmediatamente después de cenar, salimos por la ventana y bajamos por el pararrayos para ir al pueblo, pues no creía que nadie fuera a decirles ni palabra al reyy al duque, así que si no corría yo a avisarles, seguro que se iban a meter en un buen jaleo. Por el camino Tom me contó que todo el mundo se había creído lo de mi asesinato y que padre había desaparecido en seguida y no había vuelto, y el jaleo que se armó cuando Jim se escapó, y yo le conté a Tom toda la historia de nuestros caraduras de «La Realeza Sin Par», y todo lo que me dio tiempo a contarle de nuestro viaje en balsa, y cuando llegamos al pueblo, hacia la parte del centro (serían ya las ocho y media), apareció un montón de gente corriendo con antorchas, dando gritos y aullidos y golpeando cacerolas y soplando en cuernos; nos hicimos a un lado para dejarlos pasar y vi que llevaban al rey y el duque montados en un rail, es decir, supe que eran el rey y el duque, aunque los habían embadurnado de alquitrán y plumas y no parecían seres de este mundo, sino una especie de plumeros monstruosos. Bueno, lamenté verlos y lo sentí por aquellos pobres sinvergüenzas, como si ya no pudiera tener nada contra ellos. Resultaba horrible contemplarlo. Los seres humanos pueden ser terriblemente crueles unos con otros.
vi_translation: On the way, Tom told me all about how everyone thought I had been killed, then my father disappeared and didn't come back, and how there was a commotion when Jim ran away. As for me, I told him about the two scoundrels performing in the play "The Royal Nonesuch," and about the journey on the wooden raft from then until now. Around half-past eight, we had reached the middle of the town when we suddenly saw a crowd of people carrying torches, banging pots and pans, and blowing horns. We quickly jumped to the side of the road to let them pass. As they went by, we saw they were leading the king and the duke, who were trapped in an iron bar, their bodies covered in tar and feathers, no longer looking human. Seeing that scene, I felt moved and sorry for those two wretched scoundrels. How can people be so disgustingly cruel to one another?
tr_translation: Tom told me how I was thought to have been murdered, how my father disappeared shortly after and never returned, and the commotion that ensued when Jim escaped; I, in turn, told Tom everything about the Royal Nonesuch con men and our raft journey as much as time allowed; when we reached the town and got to the middle of it, we saw an angry mob coming; they had torches, and they were coming with terrifying shouts and screams, some banging pans, others blowing horns; we immediately threw ourselves aside to let them pass; as the crowd passed by, I saw that the king and the duke were each mounted on a pole – or rather, I realized they were the king and the duke, but they were covered in tar and feathers, they no longer resembled any human beings in this world – they looked more like a pair of gigantic soldier pincushions. I was devastated when I saw them. I felt sorry for these pitiful wretched scoundrels, and I felt that I could never be hard-hearted towards them again. Their condition was truly hair-raising. How cruel people can be to one another.
es_translation: We went out through the window and climbed down the lightning rod to go to town, as I didn't think anyone was going to say a word to the king and the duke, so if I didn't run to warn them, they were surely going to get into a big mess. On the way, Tom told me that everyone had believed the story about my murder, and that father had disappeared immediately and hadn't returned, and the commotion that ensued when Jim escaped. I told Tom the whole story of our scoundrels from "The Peerless Royalty," and everything I had time to tell him about our raft journey. When we reached the town, towards the center (it must have been around eight-thirty), a bunch of people appeared running with torches, shouting and howling, banging pots and blowing horns; we stepped aside to let them pass, and I saw that they were carrying the king and the duke mounted on a rail. That is, I knew they were the king and the duke, although they had been smeared with tar and feathers and didn't look like beings from this world, but rather a kind of monstrous feather dusters. Well, I regretted seeing them and felt sorry for those poor rascals, as if I couldn't hold anything against them anymore. It was horrible to watch. Human beings can be terribly cruel to one another.

en: We see we was too late—couldn’t do no good. We asked some stragglers about it, and they said everybody went to the show looking very innocent; and laid low and kept dark till the poor old king was in the middle of his cavortings on the stage; then somebody give a signal, and the house rose up and went for them.
vi: Chúng tôi biết bao giờ đã quá muộn, chẳng làm thế nào được nữa. Khi hỏi một vài người, họ nói rằng mọi người ai cũng đến xem kịch, làm ra vẻ không biết gì. Chờ đến khi nhà vua đang múa máy trên sân khấu, rồi có một người ra hiệu, thế là tất cả rạp ùa lên bắt đi.
tr: Çok geç kaldığımızı anlamıştık – yapabileceğimiz hiçbir şey yoktu. Gelip geçenlere neler olduğunu sorduk, anlattıklarına göre herkes gayet masum pozlarda gösteriye gitmiş, zavallı ihtiyar kral sahnedeki maskaralıklarının ortasına gelene kadar bir şey belli etmemişlerdi; sonra birisi işaret verince bütün izleyiciler ayaklanıp onların üstüne çullanmıştı.
es: Vimos que habíamos llegado tarde, que no podíamos hacer nada ya. Preguntamos a algunos de los rezagados qué había pasado y dijeron que todo el mundo había ido a la función con caras de inocentes y se habían quedado tan tranquilos y en silencio hasta que el pobre del rey estaba en medio de sus piruetas en el escenario; entonces alguien dio una señal y todo el público se levantó y se lanzó contra ellos.
vi_translation: We know that it is already too late, there's nothing we can do anymore. When asked a few people, they said that everyone went to watch the play, pretending not to know anything. Wait until the king is gesticulating on stage, then someone gives a signal, and the whole theater rushes up to capture him.
tr_translation: We realized that we were very late – there was nothing we could do. We asked passersby what had happened; according to what they said, everyone had gone to the show in seemingly innocent poses, and the poor old king hadn’t shown any sign until the middle of his antics on stage; then, when someone gave a signal, all the spectators rose up and pounced on them.
es_translation: We saw that we had arrived late, that we couldn't do anything anymore. We asked some of the stragglers what had happened and they said that everyone had gone to the performance with innocent faces and had remained so calm and quiet until the poor king was in the middle of his antics on stage; then someone gave a signal and the entire audience stood up and rushed at them.

en: So we poked along back home, and I warn’t feeling so brash as I was before, but kind of ornery, and humble, and to blame, somehow—though I hadn’t done nothing. But that’s always the way; it don’t make no difference whether you do right or wrong, a person’s conscience ain’t got no sense, and just goes for him anyway. If I had a yaller dog that didn’t know no more than a person’s conscience does I would pison him. It takes up more room than all the rest of a person’s insides, and yet ain’t no good, nohow. Tom Sawyer he says the same.
vi: Chúng tôi trở về nhà, và không còn hăm hở như lúc đi nữa. Tôi thấy mình có một phần đáng trách mặc dù tôi chẳng liên quan gì đến vụ này. Dù mình làm điều phải hay điều trái, nếu con người không nhận thức ra được thì nó vẫn cấu xé mình như thường. Thằng Tom Sawyer cũng nói như thế.
tr: Eve geri döndük, artık kendimi ilk baştaki gibi neşeli değil, adi, aşağılık ve suçlu hissediyordum – halbuki hiçbir şey yapmamıştım. Ama hep böyle değil midir; sizin doğru mu yanlış mı yapmanız hiçbir şeyi değiştirmez, vicdanın hiç mantığı yoktur her halükârda sızlar durur. Vicdanım kadar akılsız bir köpeğim olsa hemen zehirlerdim. Bu meret insanın içindeki geri kalan her şeyden daha fazla yer kaplıyor ve hiçbir işe de yaramıyor. Tom Sawyer da aynı şeyi düşünüyordu.
es: Así que volvimos a casa y yo ya no me sentí tan orgulloso como antes, sino como encogido y avergonzado y como si tuviera la culpa, aunque no había hecho nada. Pero es lo que pasa siempre; no importa que uno haga las cosas bien o mal, porque la conciencia no tiene sentido común y siempre se le echa a uno encima pase lo que pase. Si yo tuviera un perro amarillo que no fuera más inteligente que la conciencia de las personas, lo envenenaría. Ocupa más espacio que todo lo demás, y sin embargo, no sé por qué, no vale para nada. Tom Sawyer dice lo mismo.
vi_translation: We returned home, and we were no longer as eager as when we left. I felt somewhat to blame even though I had nothing to do with this incident. Whether one does right or wrong, if a person doesn't realize it, it still gnaws at them just the same. Tom Sawyer said the same thing.
tr_translation: We returned home, and now I felt neither cheerful like at the beginning, but base, vile, and guilty – even though I had done nothing. But isn't it always like this; whether you do right or wrong changes nothing, the conscience has no logic, it aches incessantly in any case. If I had a dog as foolish as my conscience, I would poison it immediately. This wretched thing takes up more space inside a person than anything else and serves no purpose. Tom Sawyer thought the same thing.
es_translation: So we went back home, and I no longer felt as proud as before, but rather shrunk and ashamed and as if I were to blame, even though I hadn't done anything. But that's what always happens; it doesn't matter whether one does things right or wrong, because the conscience has no common sense and it always gets on top of you no matter what happens. If I had a yellow dog that wasn't smarter than people's conscience, I would poison it. It takes up more space than everything else, and yet, I don't know why, it's good for nothing. Tom Sawyer says the same thing.

en: CHAPTER XXXIV.
vi: Chương XXXIV
tr: Otuz Dördüncü Bölüm
es: Capítulo 34
vi_translation: Chapter XXXIV
tr_translation: Chapter Thirty-Four
es_translation: Chapter 34

en: We stopped talking, and got to thinking. By-and-by Tom says:
vi: Chúng tôi thôi không nói chuyện mà bắt đầu suy nghĩ. Lát sau, Tom nói:
tr: Konuşmayı kesip düşünmeye koyulduk. Çok geçmeden Tom şöyle dedi:
es: DEJAMOS DE HABLAR y nos pusimos a pensar. Al cabo de un rato Tom dice:
vi_translation: We stopped talking and started thinking. A moment later, Tom said:
tr_translation: We stopped talking and started thinking. Shortly after, Tom said:
es_translation: WE STOPPED TALKING and started thinking. After a while, Tom says:

en: “Looky here, Huck, what fools we are to not think of it before! I bet I know where Jim is.”
vi: - Này Huck, chúng mình ngốc quá. Có thể mà cũng không nghĩ ra. Tao biết Jim ở đâu rồi. - ở đâu?
tr: “Huck, nasıl daha önce aklımıza gelmedi? Amma aptalmışız. Jim’in nerede olduğunu çok iyi biliyorum.
es: —Oye, Huck, ¡somos tontos de no haberlo pensado antes! Te apuesto a que sé dónde está Jim.
vi_translation: - Hey Huck, we were so dumb. It was possible, but we couldn't think of it. I know where Jim is now.
tr_translation: “Huck, why didn't we think of this before? We were so stupid. I know exactly where Jim is.”
es_translation: —Hey, Huck, we're fools for not having thought of it before! I bet I know where Jim is.

en: “No! Where?”
vi: - ở đâu?
tr: “Yok ya! Neredeymiş?
es: —¡No! ¿Dónde?
vi_translation: - where?
tr_translation: “No way! Where is it?”
es_translation: —No! Where?

en: “In that hut down by the ash-hopper. Why, looky here. When we was at dinner, didn’t you see a nigger man go in there with some vittles?”
vi: - ở trong cái lều phía dưới nhà đồ tro ấy. Mày không nhớ đến bữa ăn thấy có một anh da đen đi vào đó mang theo ít thức ăn là gì?
tr: “Kül silosunun oradaki kulübede. Hatırlasana, biz akşam yemeğini yerken bir zencinin elinde tepsiyle oraya gittiğini görmedin mi?
es: —En aquella cabaña que hay junto a la de la cal viva. Escucha una cosa: cuando estábamos comiendo, ¿no viste que un negro iba a llevar algo de comida?
vi_translation: - in the tent below the ash house. Don't you remember seeing a black man go in there with some food?
tr_translation: "In the cabin near the ash silo. Remember, didn't you see a black man going there with a tray while we were having dinner?"
es_translation: —In that cabin next to the one with the quicklime. Listen to this: when we were eating, didn't you see a black man taking some food?

en: “For a dog.”
vi: - Cho chó.
tr: Ama köpeğe gitmiyordu işte.
es: —Para un perro. —Yo también.
vi_translation: - For the dog.
tr_translation: But it wasn't going to the dog.”
es_translation: —For a dog. —Me too.

en: “So’d I. Well, it wasn’t for a dog.”
vi: - Tao cũng tưởng thế. Nhưng mà không phải mang cho chó đâu.
tr: Ama köpeğe gitmiyordu işte.
es: Bueno, no era para un perro.
vi_translation: - I thought so too. But it's not for the dog.
tr_translation: But it wasn't going to the dog.”
es_translation: Well, it wasn't for a dog.

en: “Why?”
vi: - Tại sao?
tr: “Niye?
es: —¿Por qué?
vi_translation: - Why?
tr_translation: “Why?”
es_translation: —Why?

en: “Because part of it was watermelon.”
vi: - Vì có miếng dưa trong đó.
tr: “Çünkü üstünde karpuz da vardı.
es: —Porque también llevaba una sandía.
vi_translation: - Because there is a piece of melon in it.
tr_translation: “Because there was also a watermelon on it.”
es_translation: —Because he was also carrying a watermelon.

en: “Well, the nigger unlocked the padlock when he went in, and he locked it again when he came out. He fetched uncle a key about the time we got up from table—same key, I bet. Watermelon shows man, lock shows prisoner; and it ain’t likely there’s two prisoners on such a little plantation, and where the people’s all so kind and good. Jim’s the prisoner. All right—I’m glad we found it out detective fashion; I wouldn’t give shucks for any other way. Now you work your mind, and study out a plan to steal Jim, and I will study out one, too; and we’ll take the one we like the best.”
vi: - Anh da đen lúc vào thì mở khóa, lúc ra lại khóa vào rồi đưa chìa cho chú Phelps. Có đưa nghĩ là có người. Có khóa tức là có người bị giam. Mà có lý nào ở trong một cái đồn điền nhỏ này lại có đến hai người bị giam, vì tao thấy mọi người đều tốt cả. Đúng là Jim bị giam rồi. Tao nhất định sẽ tim ra Jim. Bây giờ máy tính một kế hoạch để cướp Jim ra, tao cũng nghĩ một kế nữa, rồi chúng mình xem cái nào hơn thì làm.
tr: “Zenci asma kilidi açıp içeri girdi, çıktığında da kilidi tekrar yerine taktı. Biz masadan kalkarken de enişteme bir anahtar getirdi… işte o anahtardı, eminim buna. Karpuz orada insan olduğunu, kilit de hapsedildiğini gösteriyor; bu kadar küçük bir plantasyonda iki mahkûm yoktur herhalde, zira buradaki insanların hepsi de gül gibi geçinip gidiyor. Mahkûm bizim Jim’in ta kendisi. Tamam… Bunu detektifler gibi bulduğumuza memnunum, yoksa hiçbir keyfi olmazdı. Şimdi saksıyı çalıştır ve Jim’i kurtarmak için bir plan yap, ben de bir plan yapacağım, hangisini daha çok beğenirsek onu uygularız.
es: —Bueno, el negro abrió el candado al entrar y lo volvió a cerrar al salir. Cuando nos levantamos de la mesa le devolvió al tío una llave, y te apuesto a que era la misma. La sandía indica que es un hombre; la cerradura, que está preso, y no es probable que haya dos presos en una plantación tan pequeña donde toda la gente es tan buena y tan amable. El preso es Jim. Muy bien, me alegro de haberlo averiguado como los detectives; de otra forma no me gustaría. Ahora tienes que empezar a pensarlo y estudiar un plan para robara Jim; yo estudiaré otro y seguiremos el que más nos guste.
vi_translation: - The black man unlocked the door when he entered, locked it again when he left, and then gave the key to Mr. Phelps. That means there is someone inside. If it's locked, it means someone is imprisoned. But it doesn't make sense that in this small plantation there would be two people imprisoned, because I see everyone is good. It's clear that Jim is imprisoned. I am determined to find Jim. Now, you come up with a plan to rescue Jim, and I'll think of another plan, then we'll see which one is better and do it.
tr_translation: “The black man unlocked the padlock and went inside, and when he came out, he put the lock back in place. When we got up from the table, he brought my uncle a key... that was the key, I'm sure of it. The watermelon shows there was a person there, and the lock shows they were imprisoned; in such a small plantation, there probably aren't two prisoners, since everyone here gets along just fine. The prisoner is none other than our Jim. Alright... I'm glad we figured this out like detectives, otherwise, it wouldn't be any fun. Now use your brain and come up with a plan to rescue Jim, and I'll come up with one too, and we'll use whichever one we like better.”
es_translation: —Well, the black man opened the padlock when he entered and locked it again when he left. When we got up from the table, he returned a key to the uncle, and I bet it was the same one. The watermelon indicates that he is a man; the lock, that he is imprisoned, and it is unlikely that there are two prisoners on such a small plantation where all the people are so good and so kind. The prisoner is Jim. Very well, I'm glad I figured it out like the detectives; otherwise, I wouldn't like it. Now you have to start thinking about it and come up with a plan to steal Jim; I'll come up with another one and we'll go with the one we like best.

en: What a head for just a boy to have! If I had Tom Sawyer’s head I wouldn’t trade it off to be a duke, nor mate of a steamboat, nor clown in a circus, nor nothing I can think of. I went to thinking out a plan, but only just to be doing something; I knowed very well where the right plan was going to come from. Pretty soon Tom says:
vi: Thằng Tom quả là cừ. Nếu tôi cũng có một cái đầu như nó thì tôi đã chẳng bị nhà vua và quận công hành hạ bấy lâu nay. Tôi đang nghĩ kế, nhưng chỉ nghĩ loáng thoáng thôi. Một lát sau, Tom hỏi:
tr: Küçücük bir oğlanda böyle bir kafa olması! Tom Sawyer’ınki kadar kafam olsaydı, dük yaparız deseler vermezdim, hatta vapur kaptanı yapsalar, sirk palyaçosu ya da aklıma gelen neyi yapsalar vermezdim. Bir plan yapmaya başladım, ama sadece iş olsun diye yapıyordum; doğru planın hangi kafadan çıkacağını gayet iyi biliyordum. Çok geçmeden Tom bana döndü:
es: ¡Qué cabeza para no ser más que un muchacho! Si yo tuviera la cabeza de Tom Sawyer, no la cambiaría por ser duque, ni piloto de un barco de vapor, ni payaso de circo, ni nada que se me pueda ocurrir. Me puse a pensar un plan, pero sólo por hacer algo. Sabía muy bien de dónde iba a venir el mejor plan. En seguida Tom va y dice:
vi_translation: Tom is really clever. If I had a mind like his, I wouldn't have been tormented by the king and the duke for so long. I'm thinking of a plan, but only vaguely. A moment later, Tom asked:
tr_translation: Such a mind in such a little boy! If I had a mind like Tom Sawyer's, I wouldn't give it up even if they made me a duke, or even if they made me a steamboat captain, a circus clown, or anything else that came to mind. I started making a plan, but I was doing it just for the sake of doing something; I knew very well whose mind the right plan would come from. Soon enough, Tom turned to me:
es_translation: What a head for just being a boy! If I had Tom Sawyer's head, I wouldn't trade it for being a duke, a steamboat pilot, a circus clown, or anything else I could think of. I started thinking of a plan, but just to do something. I knew very well where the best plan was going to come from. Right away Tom goes and says:

en: “Ready?”
vi: - Nghĩ xong chưa?
tr: “Hazır mısın?
es: —¿Listo?
vi_translation: - Have you finished thinking?
tr_translation: “Are you ready?”
es_translation: —Ready?

en: “Yes,” I says.
vi: - Rồi. - Tôi đáp.
tr: “Evet,” dedim.
es: —Sí —respondí.
vi_translation: - Okay. - I replied.
tr_translation: "Yes," I said.
es_translation: —Yes —I replied.

en: “All right—bring it out.”
vi: - Mày nói xem nào.
tr: “Tamam… anlat bakalım.
es: —Bueno, cuéntamelo.
vi_translation: - You tell me.
tr_translation: “Alright… let's hear it.”
es_translation: —Well, tell me about it.

en: “My plan is this,” I says. “We can easy find out if it’s Jim in there. Then get up my canoe to-morrow night, and fetch my raft over from the island. Then the first dark night that comes steal the key out of the old man’s britches after he goes to bed, and shove off down the river on the raft with Jim, hiding daytimes and running nights, the way me and Jim used to do before. Wouldn’t that plan work?”
vi: Tôi nói: - Kế của tao là thế này. Chúng mình đi tim Jim, việc này thì dễ thôi. Đem mai, tao đi vớt xuồng của tao giấu ở chỗ hòn đảo. Đến đêm, chúng mình ăn cắp chìa khóa của ông ấy sau khi ông ấy đi ngủ. Rồi chuồn thẳng ra sông, cho Jim lên bè, ngày thì trốn tránh, đêm lại đi, như là tao với Jim vẫn làm trước đây ấy. Như vậy có được không?
tr: “Benim planım şöyle,” dedim. “Jim’in orada olup olmadığını rahatça anlayabiliriz. Yarın gece gidip kanomu alırım, adaya gidip salı getiririz. İlk aysız gece yaşlı adamın uyumasını bekler, ardından cebinden anahtarı çalarım, Jim’le birlikte nehir aşağı salla gideriz, gündüzleri saklanır geceleri yolculuk ederiz, zaten Jim ve ben daha önce de öyle yapıyorduk. Bu plan işe yarar mı sence?
es: —Mi plan es éste —dije—. Podemos enterarnos fácil de si es Jim el que está ahí. Después, mañana por la noche saco mi canoa y traemos mi balsa de la isla. A la primera noche ocura que tengamos le sacamos la llave de los pantalones al viejo cuando se vaya a la cama y nos vamos río abajo con Jim, escondiéndonos de día y navegando de noche, como hacíamos antes Jim y yo. ¿No funcionaría ese plan?
vi_translation: I said: - My plan is like this. We go find Jim, this part is easy. Tomorrow morning, I'll retrieve my canoe hidden at the island. At night, we'll steal his keys after he goes to sleep. Then we'll head straight to the river, get Jim on the raft, hide during the day, and travel at night, just like Jim and I used to do before. Does that sound good?
tr_translation: “Here is my plan,” I said. “We can easily find out if Jim is there or not. Tomorrow night, I'll go get my canoe, go to the island, and bring the raft. On the first moonless night, I'll wait for the old man to fall asleep, then I'll steal the key from his pocket, and Jim and I will go down the river on the raft, hiding during the day and traveling at night, just like Jim and I used to do before. Do you think this plan will work?”
es_translation: —My plan is this —I said—. We can easily find out if it's Jim who is there. Then, tomorrow night I take out my canoe and we bring my raft from the island. On the first dark night we have, we take the key from the old man's pants when he goes to bed and we head down the river with Jim, hiding during the day and navigating at night, like Jim and I used to do before. Wouldn't that plan work?

en: I never said nothing, because I warn’t expecting nothing different; but I knowed mighty well that whenever he got his plan ready it wouldn’t have none of them objections to it.
vi: Tôi không nói gì, vì tôi cũng không mong gì khác hơn, bởi kế hoạch của nó bao giờ cũng hay nhất.
tr: Bir şey demedim, çünkü ondan başka bir tavır beklemiyordum. Ama kendi planını hazırladığı zaman hiç itiraz edilecek bir yanı olmayacağını gayet iyi biliyordum.
es: No dije nada, porque no esperaba nada diferente, pero sabía muy bien que cuando él tuviera su plan listo, no se le podría hacer ninguna de esas objeciones.
vi_translation: I didn't say anything, because I didn't expect anything different, as his plans were always the best.
tr_translation: I didn't say anything, because I wasn't expecting any other attitude from him. But I knew very well that when he prepared his own plan, there would be nothing to object to.
es_translation: I didn't say anything, because I didn't expect anything different, but I knew very well that when he had his plan ready, none of those objections could be made.

en: “Don’t you reckon I know what I’m about? Don’t I generly know what I’m about?”
vi: - Mày tưởng tao không biết tao đang làm gì à
tr: “Sence ben ne yaptığını bilmeyen biri miyim? Genellikle ne yaptığımı bilerek hareket etmez miyim?
es: —¿Te crees que no sé lo que hago? ¿No sé lo que hago en general?
vi_translation: - You think I don't know what I'm doing?
tr_translation: “Do you think I am someone who doesn't know what they're doing? Don't I usually act knowing what I'm doing?”
es_translation: —Do you think I don't know what I'm doing? Don't I know what I'm doing in general?

en: “Yes.”
tr: “Evet.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: - Yes.
tr_translation: “Yes.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: “Didn’t I say I was going to help steal the nigger?”
vi: - Tao đã nói là tao giúp mày cướp lại tên da đen đúng không?
tr: “Sana o zenciyi kurtarmanda yardım edeceğimi söylemedim mi?
es: —¿No he dicho que iba a ayudar a robar al negro?
vi_translation: - I told you I would help you get back the black guy, didn't I?
tr_translation: “Didn't I tell you I would help you save the black man?”
es_translation: —Didn't I say I was going to help rob the black man?

en: “Yes.”
vi: - Đúng vậy.
tr: “Evet.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: - That's right.
tr_translation: “Yes.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: “Well, then.”
vi: - Thế mày còn định gì nữa?
tr: “Tamam o zaman.
es: —Pues eso.
vi_translation: - So, what else are you planning?
tr_translation: “Alright then.”
es_translation: —Well, that's that.

en: That’s all he said, and that’s all I said. It warn’t no use to say any more; because when he said he’d do a thing, he always done it. But I couldn’t make out how he was willing to go into this thing; so I just let it go, and never bothered no more about it. If he was bound to have it so, I couldn’t help it.
vi: Nó chỉ nói có thể và tôi cũng chỉ nói thế. Tôi biết nói thêm nữa cũng vô ích vì khi nào nó nói thì nhất định nó sẽ làm. Nhưng tôi vẫn không hiểu tại sao nó lại muốn đâm đầu vào những việc như thế này. Tôi đành cứ để mặc, và chẳng buồn nghĩ ngợi đến cái đó làm gì nữa. Lúc chũng tôi về đến nhà thì đã tối mịt và rất yên tĩnh.
tr: Başka bir şey demedi, ben de artık sesimi çıkarmadım. Başka bir şey söylemenin anlamı yoktu, çünkü bir şeyi kafasına koyduysa muhakkak yapardı. Ama bu işi yapmaya nasıl gönüllü olduğunu bir türlü anlayamıyordum; bu yüzden işi oluruna bıraktım ve bir daha bu meseleyi düşünmedim. Böyle yapmak kaderinde yazılıysa benim yapabileceğim bir şey yoktu.
es: No dijo más y yo tampoco. Ya no valía la pena, porque cuando decía que iba a hacer algo siempre lo hacía. Pero aunque no entendía cómo estaba dispuesto a meterse en una cosa así, lo dejé y no me volví a preocupar de aquello. Si estaba decidido a hacerlo, yo no podía evitarlo.
vi_translation: It only said maybe, and I said the same. I knew saying more would be useless because when it says something, it will definitely do it. But I still don't understand why it wants to plunge into things like this. I just let it be and didn't bother thinking about it anymore. When we got home, it was already dark and very quiet.
tr_translation: He didn't say anything else, and I didn't raise my voice anymore. There was no point in saying anything else, because if he set his mind on something, he would definitely do it. But I could never understand how he was so willing to do this job; so I left it to fate and didn't think about the matter again. If doing this was written in his destiny, there was nothing I could do.
es_translation: He didn't say anything more, and neither did I. It wasn't worth it anymore, because when he said he was going to do something, he always did it. But even though I didn't understand how he was willing to get involved in something like that, I left it and didn't worry about it anymore. If he was determined to do it, I couldn't stop him.

en: When we got home the house was all dark and still; so we went on down to the hut by the ash-hopper for to examine it. We went through the yard so as to see what the hounds would do. They knowed us, and didn’t make no more noise than country dogs is always doing when anything comes by in the night. When we got to the cabin we took a look at the front and the two sides; and on the side I warn’t acquainted with—which was the north side—we found a square window-hole, up tolerable high, with just one stout board nailed across it. I says:
vi: Chúng tôi lần ra cái lều ở phía dưới nhà đổ tro để dò la. Chúng tôi qua sân xem đàn chó có sủa ầm ĩ không. Nhưng lũ chó nhận ra chúng tôi, không sủa gì cả. Bước đến cái lều, nhìn kỹ đằng trước và cả hai bên, chúng tôi thấy một cái cửa sổ vuông nho nhỏ, bên ngoài có một miếng ván đóng chặt. Tôi nói:
tr: Eve ulaştığımızda karanlık ve sessizdi; bu yüzden doğrudan kül silosunun oradaki kulübeye yöneldik, şöyle bir bakmak istiyorduk. Köpeklerin ne yapacağını anlamak için doğrudan avludan geçtik. Bizi tanıyorlardı ve geceleyin insan gören çoban köpekleri ne kadar ses çıkarırsa onlar da o kadar çıkarıyordu. Kulübeye vardığımızda önünü ve iki tarafını kolaçan ettik; daha önce görmediğim tarafında –yani kuzey tarafında– yüksekçe sayılabilecek kare şeklinde bir pencere gördük, üzerine sadece bir tane kalın tahta çakılmıştı. “İşte çıkış bileti,” dedim.
es: Cuando volvimos, la casa estaba toda apagada y en silencio, así que fuimos a la cabaña junto a donde estaba la cal viva para examinarla. Cruzamos el patio para ver lo que hacían los perros. Ya nos conocían y no hicieron más ruido que cualquier perro de campo cuando aparece alguien por la noche. Cuando llegamos a la cabaña miramos por la parte de delante y por los dos lados, y del que yo no conocía (que daba al norte) vimos el agujero cuadrado de una ventana, bastante alto, con una sola plancha de madera clavada. Voy y digo:
vi_translation: We made our way to the tent below the ash house to investigate. We went through the yard to see if the dogs would bark loudly. But the dogs recognized us and didn't bark at all. Approaching the tent, looking carefully in front and on both sides, we saw a small square window with a board nailed tightly outside. I said:
tr_translation: When we arrived, it was dark and quiet; so we headed directly to the shack near the ash silo, we wanted to take a look. We went straight through the courtyard to see what the dogs would do. They knew us and made as much noise as shepherd dogs seeing people at night would make. When we reached the shack, we scouted the front and both sides; on the side I hadn't seen before – the north side – we saw a square window that could be considered quite high, with only one thick board nailed over it. “Here is the exit ticket,” I said.
es_translation: When we returned, the house was completely dark and silent, so we went to the cabin next to where the quicklime was to examine it. We crossed the yard to see what the dogs were doing. They already knew us and made no more noise than any country dog would when someone appears at night. When we arrived at the cabin, we looked at the front and both sides, and from the side I didn't know (which faced north), we saw the square hole of a window, quite high, with a single wooden plank nailed over it. I go and say:

en: “Here’s the ticket. This hole’s big enough for Jim to get through if we wrench off the board.”
vi: - Chỗ này được đấy. Cái lỗ này vừa to vừa đủ để cho Jim chui lọt nếu mình tháo được mảnh ván kia ra.
tr: “İşte çıkış bileti,” dedim. “Tahtayı sökersek bu delik Jim’in geçebileceği bir hale gelecektir.
es: —Esto está muy bien. Ese agujero es lo bastante grande para que Jim salga por él si arrancamos la tabla.
vi_translation: - This spot is good. This hole is both large and just enough for Jim to fit through if we can remove that plank.
tr_translation: “Here is the exit ticket,” I said. “If we remove the board, this hole will become big enough for Jim to pass through.”
es_translation: —This is very good. That hole is big enough for Jim to get out if we pull off the board.

en: “It’s as simple as tit-tat-toe, three-in-a-row, and as easy as playing hooky. I should hope we can find a way that’s a little more complicated than that, Huck Finn.”
vi: - Thế thì đơn giản như trở bàn tay. Tao nghĩ chúng mình có thể tìm cách nào khó hơn thế nữa cơ.
tr: “Okuldan kaçmak kadar kolay. Umarım bundan biraz daha karmaşık bir yol bulabiliriz, Huck Finn.
es: —Eso es más sencillo que andar a pie y más fácil que engañar a un tonto. Yo díría que podemos encontrar una forma algo más complicada, Huck Finn.
vi_translation: - Well, that's as easy as turning your hand over. I think we could find a way that's even harder than that.
tr_translation: “As easy as skipping school. I hope we can find a way a bit more complicated than this, Huck Finn.”
es_translation: —That's easier than walking and simpler than fooling a fool. I'd say we can find a slightly more complicated way, Huck Finn.

en: “That’s more like,” he says. “It’s real mysterious, and troublesome, and good,” he says; “but I bet we can find a way that’s twice as long. There ain’t no hurry; le’s keep on looking around.”
vi: - Như thế cũng tạm được, có vẻ bí mật, gay go. Nhưng tao nghĩ chúng mình có thể tìm cách nào lâu gấp đôi như thế, không việc gì mà vội, để đi xem quanh đây đã.
tr: “Bu daha iyi,” dedi. “Gerçekten gizemli, zorlu ve iyi,” dedi. “Ama en az iki kat daha uzun sürecek bir yol bulabileceğimizden eminim. Hiç acelemiz yok, haydi etrafa bakmaya devam edelim.
es: —Eso ya es algo —dijo—. Resulta misterioso, complicado y está bien, pero seguro que podemos encontrar algo que dure por lo menos el doble. No hay prisa, vamos a seguir mirando.
vi_translation: - That's somewhat acceptable, seems secretive and challenging. But I think we can find a way that takes twice as long, there's no need to rush, so we can look around here first.
tr_translation: “This is better,” he said. “Truly mysterious, challenging, and good,” he said. “But I am sure we can find a way that will take at least twice as long. We are in no hurry, let's keep looking around.”
es_translation: —That's something —he said—. It's mysterious, complicated, and fine, but I'm sure we can find something that lasts at least twice as long. There's no rush, let's keep looking.

en: Betwixt the hut and the fence, on the back side, was a lean-to that joined the hut at the eaves, and was made out of plank. It was as long as the hut, but narrow—only about six foot wide. The door to it was at the south end, and was padlocked. Tom he went to the soap-kettle and searched around, and fetched back the iron thing they lift the lid with; so he took it and prized out one of the staples. The chain fell down, and we opened the door and went in, and shut it, and struck a match, and see the shed was only built against a cabin and hadn’t no connection with it; and there warn’t no floor to the shed, nor nothing in it but some old rusty played-out hoes and spades and picks and a crippled plow. The match went out, and so did we, and shoved in the staple again, and the door was locked as good as ever. Tom was joyful. He says;
vi: Giữa cái lều với hàng rào còn có một mái che dài bằng cả căn lều, nhưng nhỏ hẹp hơn, chỉ độ một thước. Cửa đi vào đã khóa chặt. Thằng Tom ra chỗ nhà kho tìm quanh quẩn, đem về một thanh sắt vẫn dùng để nậy nắp hòm. Nó lấy thanh sắt nậy bật một cửa ra. Dây xích rơi xuống. Chúng tôi mở cửa bước vào, rồi đóng cửa lại. Đánh một que diêm lên thấy mái che này chỉ là dựa lưng vào căn lều thôi chứ không có đường thông sang. Bên trong chỉ có mấy cái cuốc xẻng đã mòn. Hết que diêm, chúng tôi bước ra, ghép cái móc cửa sắt trở lại, cửa đóng lại như cũ. Thằng Tom mừng thầm. Nó nói:
tr: Çit ile kulübenin arasında, arka tarafta kulübenin çatısının saçaklarıyla birleşen, kalaslardan yapılmış bir ardiye vardı. Kulübe kadar uzundu, ama dardı… sadece iki metre genişliğindeydi. Kapısı güney uçtaydı ve üzerinde bir asma kilit vardı. Tom sabun kazanının oraya gidip biraz ortalığı araştırdıktan sonra kapağı kaldırmak için kullanılan demir çubukla geri döndü; bu çubukla zorlayarak çivilerden birini söktü. Zincir yere düştü ve biz de kapıyı açıp içeri girdik. Kapıyı arkamızdan kapattıktan sonra etrafı görmek için bir kibrit yaktık. Ardiye sadece kulübenin duvarına yapılmıştı ve arada bağlantı yoktu; ardiyenin zemini topraktı, içinde de sadece birkaç paslı çapa, kürek, kazma ve kırık bir saban vardı. Kibrit sönünce dışarı çıkıp çiviyi yerine taktık, kapı yine eskisi gibi kilitli duruyordu. Tom neşelenmişti. “Tamam, işte şimdi oldu,” dedi.
es: Entre la cabaña y la valla, por el lado de atrás, había un cobertizo pegado a la cabaña por la parte del tejado y hecho de planchas de madera. Era igual de largo que la cabaña, pero estrecho: sólo unos seis metros de ancho. La puerta estaba del lado sur y tenía un candado. Tom fue al caldero del jabón y anduvo buscando, y volvió con esa cosa de hierro con que levantan la tapadera, así que hizo saltar una de las agarraderas del candado. Se cayó la cadena, abrimos la puerta y entramos, la cerramos y al encender una cerilla vimos que el cobertizo sólo estaba construido junto a la cabaña, sin paso hacia ella, que no tenía un suelo, y no había nada más que unas cuantas azadas y palas oxidadas, unos picos y un arado roto. Se apagó la cerilla y nosotros nos fuimos y volvimos a poner la agarradera, de forma que la puerta quedó cerrada igual de bien que antes. Tom estaba encantado, y va y dice:
vi_translation: Between the tent and the fence, there was a long roof as long as the tent, but narrower, only about one meter. The entrance door was tightly locked. Tom went to the shed, looked around, and brought back an iron bar used to pry open box lids. He used the iron bar to pry open a door. The chain fell down. We opened the door and stepped inside, then closed the door again. Striking a match, we saw that this roof was just leaning against the tent and had no passage through. Inside, there were only a few worn-out shovels and hoes. When the match went out, we stepped out, reattached the iron hook, and the door closed as before. Tom was secretly pleased. He said:
tr_translation: Between the fence and the shed, at the back where the shed's roof eaves met, there was a storage made of planks. It was as long as the shed, but narrow... only two meters wide. The door was at the south end and had a padlock on it. After Tom went over to the soap cauldron and did some investigating, he returned with an iron rod used to lift the lid; with this rod, he pried out one of the nails. The chain fell to the ground and we opened the door and went inside. After closing the door behind us, we lit a match to see around. The storage was only built against the wall of the shed and there was no connection between them; the floor of the storage was dirt, and inside there were only a few rusty hoes, shovels, picks, and a broken plow. When the match went out, we went outside and put the nail back in place, the door was locked as before. Tom was cheerful. “Alright, now it's done,” he said.
es_translation: Between the cabin and the fence, at the back, there was a shed attached to the cabin by the roof and made of wooden planks. It was as long as the cabin, but narrow: only about six meters wide. The door was on the south side and had a padlock. Tom went to the soap cauldron and started searching, and came back with that iron thing used to lift the lid, so he pried off one of the padlock's handles. The chain fell off, we opened the door and went in, closed it, and when we lit a match we saw that the shed was only built next to the cabin, with no passage to it, that it had no floor, and there was nothing but a few rusty hoes and shovels, some picks, and a broken plow. The match went out and we left and put the handle back on, so the door was closed just as well as before. Tom was delighted, and he said:

en: “Now we’re all right. We’ll dig him out. It’ll take about a week!”
vi: - Thế là ổn. Chúng mình sẽ đào lỗ cho hắn ra. Phải mất đến một tuần lễ.
tr: “Tamam, işte şimdi oldu,” dedi. “Onu kazarak çıkaracağız. Yaklaşık bir hafta sürecek!
es: —Ahora todo está en orden. Lo vamos a sacar por un túnel. ¡Nos llevará una semana!
vi_translation: - That's settled. We'll dig a hole for him. It will take about a week.
tr_translation: “Alright, now it's done,” he said. “We will dig it out. It will take about a week!”
es_translation: —Now everything is in order. We are going to take him out through a tunnel. It will take us a week!

en: Then we started for the house, and I went in the back door—you only have to pull a buckskin latch-string, they don’t fasten the doors—but that warn’t romantical enough for Tom Sawyer; no way would do him but he must climb up the lightning-rod. But after he got up half way about three times, and missed fire and fell every time, and the last time most busted his brains out, he thought he’d got to give it up; but after he was rested he allowed he would give her one more turn for luck, and this time he made the trip.
vi: Rồi chúng tôi về buồng. Tôi vào bằng cửa sau, chỉ việc nhấc cái dây da lên là mở được cửa, vì họ không buộc. Nhưng thằng Tom Sawyer cho rằng như vậy là không được ly kỳ lắm, cho nên nó phải trèo cái cột đền mà lên. Ba lần nó trèo đến nửa chừng lại tụt xuống. Lần thứ ba ngã một cái tưởng vỡ óc, nó định thôi, nhưng sau khi nghĩ một lát, nó lại trèo lần nữa. Lần này thì được.
tr: Çıkıp eve doğru gittik, ben arka kapıdan girdim –sadece deriden bir kayışı çekmeniz gerekiyor kapıları kilitlemiyorlar– ama Tom Sawyer için bu yeterince romantik değildi: İlla ki paratonerden yukarı tırmanacaktı. Ama üç kez yarı yola kadar çıkıp düştükten, üstelik son seferinde kafasını patlatmaktan kıl payı kurtulduktan sonra vazgeçmek zorunda kalacağını düşünmeye başladı; ama bir süre dinlendikten sonra, belki şansı döner diye son bir kez daha denemeye karar verdi ve bu sefer başardı.
es: Después fuimos a la casa y yo entré por la puerta trasera (no hay más que tirar de una cuerda de cuero, porque allí no cierran las puertas), pero a Tom Sawyer no le pareció lo bastante romántico, y lo único que le valía era subir trepando por el pararrayos. Pero después de trepar hasta la mitad tres veces y fallar y caerse las tres, y en la última casi romperse la cabeza, pensó que mejor sería renunciar, pero después de descansar decidió que lo intentaría una vez más a ver cómo le iba, y esa vez logró llegar.
vi_translation: Then we went back to the room. I entered through the back door, just had to lift the leather strap to open it, because they didn't tie it. But Tom Sawyer thought that wasn't thrilling enough, so he had to climb up the column. Three times he climbed halfway up and then slid down. The third time he fell so hard it seemed like he might have cracked his head, he decided to give up, but after thinking for a while, he climbed again. This time he made it.
tr_translation: We went out and headed home, I entered through the back door – you just need to pull a leather strap, they don't lock the doors – but for Tom Sawyer, this wasn't romantic enough: He insisted on climbing up the lightning rod. But after climbing halfway up three times and falling, and narrowly avoiding cracking his head open the last time, he started to think he might have to give up; but after resting for a while, he decided to give it one last try, hoping his luck would turn, and this time he succeeded.
es_translation: Then we went to the house and I entered through the back door (you just have to pull a leather cord, because they don't lock the doors there), but Tom Sawyer didn't think it was romantic enough, and the only thing that would do for him was to climb up the lightning rod. But after climbing halfway up three times and failing and falling all three times, and almost breaking his head the last time, he thought it would be better to give up, but after resting he decided he would try one more time to see how it would go, and that time he managed to make it.

en: In the morning we was up at break of day, and down to the nigger cabins to pet the dogs and make friends with the nigger that fed Jim—if it was Jim that was being fed. The niggers was just getting through breakfast and starting for the fields; and Jim’s nigger was piling up a tin pan with bread and meat and things; and whilst the others was leaving, the key come from the house.
vi: Sáng hôm sau, chúng tôi dậy sớm đi, đi xuống nhà ở của người da đen để làm quen với anh da đen vẫn đem thức ăn cho Jim. Họ vừa ăn sáng xong xắp sửa ra đồng, còn anh da đen vẫn đến chỗ Jim thì đang xếp bánh thịt với những thứ khác vào một cái nồi sắt. Khi mọi người đã đi thì chìa khóa được mang xuống.
tr: Sabahleyin gün ışırken kalktık ve hem köpekleri sevmek hem de Jim’e yemek veren zenciyle –yani yemek verilen zenci Jim’se– arkadaş olmak için zenci kulübelerinin oraya gittik. Zenciler yeni kahvaltı etmiş tarlalara doğru yola çıkmaya hazırlanıyorlardı; Jim’e yemek veren ise bir tepsiye ekmek, et ve başka şeyler koyuyordu; diğerleri giderken anahtar da evden geldi.
es: Por la mañana nos levantamos al amanecer y bajamos a las cabañas de los negros para acariciar a los perros y hacernos amigos del negro que le llevaba la comida a Jim, si es que era a Jim al que se la llevaba. Los negros acababan de terminar de desayunar y empezaban a ir a los campos, y el negro de Jim estaba llenando una escudilla de metal con pan y carne y otras cosas, y mientras los otros se marchaban le llevaron la llave de la casa.
vi_translation: The next morning, we got up early and went down to the house of the black people to get acquainted with the black man who always brought food for Jim. They had just finished breakfast and were about to go to the fields, while the black man who usually went to Jim was packing meat pies and other things into an iron pot. When everyone had left, the key was brought down.
tr_translation: We woke up at dawn and went to the negro cabins to both pet the dogs and befriend the negro who fed Jim –that is, if the negro being fed was Jim. The negroes had just had breakfast and were preparing to head out to the fields; the one who fed Jim was placing bread, meat, and other things on a tray; as the others left, the key also came from the house.
es_translation: In the morning we got up at dawn and went down to the cabins of the black people to pet the dogs and make friends with the black person who was bringing food to Jim, if it was Jim he was bringing it to. The black people had just finished breakfast and were starting to go to the fields, and Jim's black person was filling a metal bowl with bread and meat and other things, and while the others were leaving, they brought him the key to the house.

en: This nigger had a good-natured, chuckle-headed face, and his wool was all tied up in little bunches with thread. That was to keep witches off. He said the witches was pestering him awful these nights, and making him see all kinds of strange things, and hear all kinds of strange words and noises, and he didn’t believe he was ever witched so long before in his life. He got so worked up, and got to running on so about his troubles, he forgot all about what he’d been a-going to do. So Tom says:
vi: Anh da đen này trông mặt thật hiền lành. Quần áo thì lấy dây buộc túm từng chỗ. Cái đó là để trừ ma quỷ. Hắn nói rằng mấy đêm vừa rồi ma quỷ đến quấy nhiễu hắn tợn lắm, hắn trông thấy nhiều thứ kỳ lạ, nghe thấy đủ các thứ tiếng nói, tiếng động lạ lùng, và hắn không dám tin rằng trong đời hắn từ trước đến nay lại bị ma quỷ quấy nhiễu thế. Hắn nói rất sôi nổi và kể đi kể lại những cái đáng lo sợ ấy, mà quên hẳn rằng bây giờ hắn sắp phải làm gì. Tom hỏi:
tr: Bu zenci iyi huylu ve güleç yüzlüydü, saçını ince tutamlar halinde iplerle bağlamıştı. Bunu cadıları uzak tutmak için yapıyordu. Cadıların birkaç gecedir onu çok rahatsız ettiğini, tuhaf şeyler görmesine, tuhaf sözler ve gürültüler duymasına sebep olduğunu söyledi; cadıların daha önce hiç bu kadar uzun süre musallat olduğunu hatırlamıyordu. İyice gaza gelip hiç durmadan dertlerini sayıp dökmeye başladı, yapmakta olduğu işi tümden unutmuştu. Tom hatırlattı:
es: El negro tenía cara de buenos amigos, muy sonriente, y llevaba el pelo todo atado en ricitos con pedazos de hilo. Era para alejar a las brujas. Dijo que aquellas noches las brujas se lo estaban haciendo pasar muy mal y haciéndole ver todo género de cosas raras y oír todo género de palabras y ruidos raros, y que según creía nunca había estado tanto tiempo embrujado en toda su vida. Se puso tan nervioso hablando de sus problemas que se olvidó de todo lo que tenía que hacer. Entonces Tom le dijo:
vi_translation: This black man looks very gentle. His clothes are tied up in several places with strings. That is to ward off evil spirits. He said that in the past few nights, evil spirits have been disturbing him a lot; he saw many strange things, heard all kinds of strange voices and noises, and he couldn't believe that in his life until now he had been so harassed by evil spirits. He spoke very passionately and repeatedly recounted those frightening things, completely forgetting what he was supposed to do now. Tom asked:
tr_translation: This black man was good-natured and had a cheerful face, he had tied his hair in thin strands with strings. He did this to keep witches away. He said that the witches had been bothering him a lot for a few nights, causing him to see strange things and hear strange words and noises; he couldn't remember the witches ever haunting him for this long before. He got really excited and started to list his troubles without stopping, completely forgetting the work he was doing. Tom reminded him:
es_translation: The black man had a friendly face, very smiling, and wore his hair all tied up in curls with pieces of thread. It was to ward off witches. He said that those nights the witches were giving him a hard time and making him see all kinds of strange things and hear all kinds of strange words and noises, and that he believed he had never been bewitched for so long in his entire life. He got so nervous talking about his problems that he forgot everything he had to do. Then Tom said to him:

en: “What’s the vittles for? Going to feed the dogs?”
vi: - Những thức ăn này để làm gì thế? Cho chó ăn ư?
tr: “Bu yiyecekler ne için? Köpekleri mi besleyeceksin?
es: —¿Para quién es esa comida? ¿Vas a darles de comer a los perros?
vi_translation: - What is this food for? To feed the dog?
tr_translation: “What are these foods for? Are you going to feed the dogs?”
es_translation: —Who is that food for? Are you going to feed the dogs?

en: “Yes, Mars Sid, a dog. Cur’us dog, too. Does you want to go en look at ’im?”
vi: - Con chó lạ lắm. Cậu có muốn đi xem không?
tr: “Evet, Sahip Sid, köpeği besleyeceğim. Hem de acayip bir köpek. Gelip ona bir bakmak ister misiniz? “Evet.
es: —Sí, señorito Sid, a un perro. Un perro muy curioso. ¿Quiere venir a verlo? —Sí.
vi_translation: - The dog is very strange. Do you want to go see it?
tr_translation: “Yes, Master Sid, I will feed the dog. And it's a strange dog. Would you like to come and see it?”
es_translation: —Yes, little master Sid, a dog. A very curious dog. Do you want to come see it?

en: I hunched Tom, and whispers:
vi: Tôi hích Tom một cái, nói thầm:
tr: Tom’a bir dirsek vurup fısıldadım:
es: Le di un golpe a Tom y le dije en voz baja:
vi_translation: I nudged Tom and whispered:
tr_translation: I nudged Tom with an elbow and whispered:
es_translation: I gave Tom a nudge and whispered to him:

en: “You going, right here in the daybreak? That warn’t the plan.”
vi: - Sao lại giữa ban ngày thế này? Kế hoạch có phải thế đâu?
tr: “Gün doğarken doğrudan kulübeye mi gireceksin? Planımız böyle değildi.
es: —¿Vas a ir ahí al amanecer? Ése no era el plan.
vi_translation: - Why is this happening in broad daylight? Wasn't that the plan?
tr_translation: “Are you going to enter the cabin directly at sunrise? That wasn't our plan.”
es_translation: —Are you going there at dawn? That wasn't the plan.

en: “No, it warn’t; but it’s the plan now.”
vi: - Trước không phải thế, nhưng bây giờ phải thế.
tr: “Değildi… ama şimdi plan bu.
es: —No, no lo era, pero ahora sí es el plan.
vi_translation: - It wasn't like that before, but now it has to be.
tr_translation: “It wasn't... but now the plan is this.”
es_translation: —No, it wasn't, but now it is the plan.

en: So, drat him, we went along, but I didn’t like it much. When we got in we couldn’t hardly see anything, it was so dark; but Jim was there, sure enough, and could see us; and he sings out:
vi: Chúng tôi đi ra, nhưng tôi không thích lắm. Lúc bước vào trong lều, chẳng nhìn thấy gì vì tối quá. Nhưng đúng là Jim ở trong đó rồi, Jim trông thấy chúng tôi, gọi ầm lên:
tr: Lanet olsun, zencinin peşinden yürüdük, ama bundan pek hoşlanmamıştım. İçeri girdiğimizde önce hiçbir şey göremedik, çok karanlıktı; ama Jim kesinlikle oradaydı ve bizi görebiliyordu, heyecanla seslendi:
es: Así que, maldita sea, allí fuimos, pero no me gustó lo más mínimo. Cuando llegamos casi no se veía nada de oscuro que estaba, pero allí estaba Jim, sin duda alguna, y nos podía ver, y gritó:
vi_translation: We went out, but I didn't like it much. When stepping into the tent, we couldn't see anything because it was too dark. But Jim was indeed in there, Jim saw us and shouted loudly:
tr_translation: Damn it, we followed the black man, but I didn't really like it. When we entered, we couldn't see anything at first, it was very dark; but Jim was definitely there and could see us, he called out excitedly:
es_translation: So, damn it, there we went, but I didn't like it one bit. When we arrived, you could hardly see anything because it was so dark, but there was Jim, without a doubt, and he could see us, and he shouted:

en: “Why, Huck! En good lan’! ain’ dat Misto Tom?”
vi: - Ôi, cậu Huck, lại cả cậu Tom đó nữa ư
tr: “Hey, Huck! Sevgili dostum! Yanındaki de Bay Tom değil mi?
es: —¡Pero, Huck! ¡Y Dios mío! ¿No es ése el sito Tom?
vi_translation: - Oh, Huck, and Tom too?
tr_translation: "Hey, Huck! My dear friend! And isn't that Mr. Tom next to you?"
es_translation: —But, Huck! My God! Isn't that Tom's place?

en: “Why, de gracious sakes! do he know you genlmen?”
vi: Biết làm sao bây giờ? Anh da đen thốt lên: - Lạy Chúa, hắn ta biết các cậu ư?
tr: “Tanğı aşkına! Bu zenci sizi tanıyoğ mu yoksa?
es: —¡Por todos los santos! ¿Los conoce a ustedes, señoritos?
vi_translation: The black man exclaimed: - Oh Lord, does he know you guys?
tr_translation: "By the morning light! Does this black man know you or what?"
es_translation: —By all the saints! Does he know you, young gentlemen?

en: We could see pretty well now. Tom he looked at the nigger, steady and kind of wondering, and says:
vi: Tom nhìn anh da đen này, vẻ như sửng sốt ngạc nhiên hỏi lại:
tr: Artık içeriyi gayet iyi görebiliyorduk. Tom başını zenciye çevirdi ve merakla ona baktı:
es: Ahora ya se veía bastante bien. Tom miró al negro, muy fijo y como preguntándose algo, y va y dice:
vi_translation: Tom looked at the black man, seemingly astonished, and asked again:
tr_translation: We could now see the inside quite well. Tom turned his head to the black man and looked at him curiously:
es_translation: Now it could be seen quite well. Tom looked at the black man, very intently and as if wondering something, and then he said:

en: “Does who know us?”
vi: - Ai biết chúng tôi?
tr: “Kim bizi tanıyor mu?
es: —¿Quién nos conoce?
vi_translation: - Who knows us?
tr_translation: “Does anyone know us?”
es_translation: —Who knows us?

en: “Why, dis-yer runaway nigger.”
vi: - Tên da đen này ấy.
tr: “İşte şuğadaki kaçak zenci.
es: —Pues este negro fugitivo.
vi_translation: - This black guy.
tr_translation: "There's the runaway black man.""
es_translation: —Well, this runaway black man.

en: “What put it dar? Didn’ he jis’ dis minute sing out like he knowed you?”
vi: Nhưng sao anh lại nghĩ thế? - Thì vừa rồi hắn gọi các cậu đấy thôi?
tr: “Neğeden mi çıkağdım? Az önce sizi tanıyoğmuş gibi seslenmedi mi?
es: —¿Que por qué? ¿No acaba de decir ahora mismo que les conocía?
vi_translation: But why do you think so? - He just called you guys, didn't he?
tr_translation: “Why would I leave? Didn't he just call out to you as if he knew you?”
es_translation: —Why? Didn't you just say that you knew them?

en: Tom says, in a puzzled-up kind of way:
vi: Tom có vẻ lúng túng nói:
tr: Tom şaşırmış gibi yaparak cevap verdi:
es: Tom va y dice, como extrañado:
vi_translation: Tom seemed confused and said:
tr_translation: Tom replied, pretending to be surprised:
es_translation: Tom goes and says, seemingly surprised:

en: “Well, that’s mighty curious. Who sung out? When did he sing out? what did he sing out?” And turns to me, perfectly ca’m, and says, “Did you hear anybody sing out?”
vi: - Lạ nhỉ? Ai gọi? Gọi bao giờ? Gọi thế nào? Rồi nó bình tĩnh quay lại phía tôi, hỏi tiếp: - Mày có nghe thấy ai gọi không?
tr: “İşte bu tuhaf. Kim seslendi? Ne zaman seslendi? Ne dedi?” Gayet soğukkanlı bir halde bana döndü: “Kimsenin seslendiğini duydun mu?
es: —Bueno, esto sí que es curioso. ¿Quién ha dicho nada? ¿Cuándo lo ha dicho? ¿Qué ha dicho? —y se vuelve hacia mí, muy tranquilo, y va y me dice—: ¿Has oído tú a alguien decir algo?
vi_translation: - Strange, isn't it? Who's calling? When did they call? How did they call? Then it calmly turned back to me and continued to ask: - Did you hear someone calling?
tr_translation: “This is strange.” “Who called out?” “When did they call out?” “What did they say?” He turned to me very calmly: “Did you hear anyone call out?””
es_translation: —Well, this is certainly curious. Who said anything? When did they say it? What did they say? —and he turns to me, very calmly, and says to me—: Did you hear anyone say anything?

en: Of course there warn’t nothing to be said but the one thing; so I says:
vi: Dĩ nhiên tôi không thể nào nói khác được và bảo:
tr: Elbette bu soruya verilebilecek tek bir cevap vardı.
es: Naturalmente, no podía decir más que una cosa, así que respondí:
vi_translation: Of course, I couldn't say otherwise and tell:
tr_translation: Of course, there was only one answer that could be given to this question.
es_translation: Naturally, I could only say one thing, so I replied:

en: “No; I ain’t heard nobody say nothing.”
vi: - Không, tao chẳng thấy ai gọi cả.
tr: “Hayır; kimsenin bir şey dediğini duymadım.
es: —No; yo no he oído a nadie decir nada.
vi_translation: - No, I didn't hear anyone calling.
tr_translation: "No; I didn't hear anyone say anything."
es_translation: —No; I haven't heard anyone say anything.

en: Then he turns to Jim, and looks him over like he never see him before, and says:
vi: Rồi nó quay lại Jim, tỏ vẻ như kẻ xa lạ, hỏi:
tr: Bunun üzerine Jim’e döndü ve ona daha önce hayatında hiç görmediği biriymiş gibi bakarak sordu:
es: Después se vuelve hacia Jim y lo mira de arriba abajo como si nunca lo hubiera visto antes y le pregunta: —¿Has dicho algo tú?
vi_translation: Then it turned back to Jim, acting like a stranger, and asked:
tr_translation: Then he turned to Jim and, looking at him as if he were someone he had never seen before in his life, asked:
es_translation: Then he turns to Jim and looks him up and down as if he had never seen him before and asks: "Did you say something?"

en: “No, sah, I hain’t said a word.”
vi: - Không, tôi không gọi gì cả.
tr: “Yok, sahip, tek söz bile çıkmadı.
es: —No, señor, no he dicho ni una palabra.
vi_translation: - No, I didn't call anything.
tr_translation: "No, master, not a single word came out."
es_translation: —No, sir, I haven't said a single word.

en: “Did you ever see us before?”
vi: - Anh đã gặp chúng tôi bao giờ chưa?
tr: “Bizi daha önce gördün mü?
es: —¿Nos has visto antes de ahora?
vi_translation: - Have you ever met us?
tr_translation: “Have you seen us before?”
es_translation: —Have you seen us before now?

en: “No, sah; not as I knows on.”
vi: - Chưa ạ.
tr: “Yok, sahip, ben hiç hatığlamıyoğum daha önce sizi göğdüğümü.
es: —No, señor; no que yo sepa.
vi_translation: - Not yet.
