Tuvimos que hacer los dibujos de los ataúdes y lo demás, las cartas nónimas de los ladrones y subir y bajar por el pararrayos, y hacer el agujero de la cabaña y la escala de cuerda y meterla cocinada dentro de un pastel y enviarle cucharas y cosas para que trabajase, que te metíamos en los bolsillos del mandil...
vi_translation: - No, I didn't dream it. It was Tom and I who set him free... So it began to tell the story, while Aunt Saly sat quietly listening to it. As for me, I felt that interrupting would be pointless. - We had to put so much effort into it, weeks, hours, nights when the whole family was asleep. Then we stole candles, bed sheets, aunt's clothes, then spoons, iron plates, daggers, incubators, millstones, flour, and all sorts of other things. You can't imagine what those saws, pens, and those markings were for; and you couldn't imagine the fun of it. Then we also drew coffin shapes, wrote anonymous letters from the robbers, we kept sliding up and down the lamp post; then dug a hole in the prison, made a rope ladder, then baked a cake and stuffed the rope ladder into it, then put spoons and other things into your kitchen apron pocket.
tr_translation: "No, I haven't lost myself; I know exactly what I'm saying. We saved him... me and Tom. We planned for a long time and finally succeeded. And in a very stylish way." Tom was excited, Aunt Sally no longer stopped him, she just sat and watched his speech with a stern look, I realized there was no point in interrupting. "You can't imagine how hard we worked, Aunt... We struggled for weeks... Every night while you were sleeping, we worked for hours. We had to steal the candles, the sheet, the shirt, and your dress, the spoons, the tin plates, the knives, the bed warmer, the millstone, the flour, and many other things; you would be amazed at how long it took to prepare the saw, the pens, the inscriptions, and other things, and you could never guess how much fun it was. We made coffin pictures and sent anonymous letters from robbers, constantly went up and down the lightning rod, made that hole in the cabin, made a rope ladder and sent it inside a pie, put the spoons and such in your apron pocket..."
es_translation: —No, I haven't lost my mind; I know perfectly well what I'm saying. Yes, Tom and I did set him free. We decided to do it and we did it. And we did it with a lot of style. —It had started moving and she couldn't stop it; she just sat there watching and watching and let it go on. I realized that it made no sense for me to intervene—. But, auntie, it took us a tremendous amount of work, whole weeks, hours and hours every night, while you all slept. We had to steal candles and the sheet and the shirt and your dress and the spoons and the tin plates and the kitchen knives and the heater, the grindstone and the flour and all sorts of things, and you can't imagine the work it took us to make the saws and the pens and the inscriptions and everything else; you have no idea how much fun we had. We had to draw the coffins and the rest, the anonymous letters from the thieves, and go up and down the lightning rod, and make the hole in the cabin and the rope ladder and bake it into a cake and send him spoons and things to work with, which we put in the pockets of your apron...

en: “Mercy sakes!”
vi: - Lạy Chúa! - Dì Saly thốt lên.
tr: “Tanrı aşkına!
es: —¡Dios me ampare!
vi_translation: - Oh Lord! - Aunt Saly exclaimed. -... .
tr_translation: “For God's sake!”
es_translation: —God help me! —...

en: “Well, I never heard the likes of it in all my born days! So it was you, you little rapscallions, that’s been making all this trouble, and turned everybody’s wits clean inside out and scared us all most to death. I’ve as good a notion as ever I had in my life to take it out o’ you this very minute. To think, here I’ve been, night after night, a—you just get well once, you young scamp, and I lay I’ll tan the Old Harry out o’ both o’ ye!”
vi: - Từ thuở cha sinh mẹ đẻ đến giờ, dì chưa từng nghe chuyện nào kì quái như vậy. Thì ra những thằng rannh, chúng mày đã gây ra tất cả cái chuyện rắc rối này làm cho mọi người cuống quýt lên và sợ chết khiếp. Chẳng lẽ chúng mày thích làm cho dì đêm nào cũng phải khổ sở thế ư. Chúng mày là những tên quỷ quái, dì sẽ cho chúng mày một trận để mà chừa kiểu đùa ma mãnh ấy đi.
tr: “Ömrüm boyunca böyle bir şey duyduysam ne olayım! Demek sizdiniz, siz küçük haydutlar, bütün o belaları siz başımıza açtınız, herkesin aklını başından aldınız, korkudan ödümüzü patlattınız. Şimdi sizi bir temiz dövmek geliyor içimden. Geceler boyu burada neler yaşadığımı düşününce… ah, hele bir iyileş, seni velet, o zaman ikinizin birden derisini yüzeceğim!
es: —Bueno, ¡en mi vida he oído cosa igual! Así que fuisteis vosotros, granujas, los que organizasteis todo este jaleo y nos habéis dejado a todos sin saber qué pensar, casi muertos del susto. Me dan más ganas que nunca de hacéroslo pagar en este mismo momento. ¡Pensar que me he pasado aquí, noche tras noche... espera a ponerte bien del todo, bribón, y verás cómo te saco el diablo del cuerpo a palos!
vi_translation: - Since the day I was born, I've never heard of such a strange story. So it turns out you brats caused all this trouble, making everyone frantic and scared to death. Do you really enjoy making me suffer every night? You little devils, I'll give you a lesson to stop playing such mischievous pranks.
tr_translation: “If I've ever heard such a thing in my life, may I be damned! So it was you, you little rascals, you caused all those troubles, you drove everyone out of their minds, you scared us to death. Now I feel like giving you a good beating. When I think about what I went through here night after night... oh, just wait until you get better, you brat, then I'll skin both of you alive!”
es_translation: —Well, in my life I've never heard anything like it! So it was you, rascals, who organized all this commotion and left us all not knowing what to think, almost scared to death. It makes me more eager than ever to make you pay for it right now. To think that I've spent night after night here... wait until you're fully recovered, scoundrel, and you'll see how I beat the devil out of you!

en: “Well, you get all the enjoyment you can out of it now, for mind I tell you if I catch you meddling with him again—”
vi: - Bây giờ chúng mày đã được vui chơi thỏa thích rồi, dì mà bắt được chúng mày còn quan hệ với nó nữa thì...
tr: “Peki, şimdilik istediğin kadar keyfini çıkar çünkü bir daha seni onun etrafında yakalarsam…
es: —Bueno, pásatelo todo lo bien que puedas ahora, porque te aseguro que como vuelva a cogerte hablando con él...
vi_translation: - Now you all have had your fun, but if I catch you having any more dealings with it...
tr_translation: "Well, for now, enjoy yourself as much as you want because if I catch you around him again...""
es_translation: —Well, have as much fun as you can now, because I assure you that if I catch you talking to him again...

en: “Meddling with who?” Tom says, dropping his smile and looking surprised.
vi: - Quan hệ với ai? - Thằng Tom vừa cười vừa hỏi, vẻ rất ngạc nhiên.
tr: “Kimin etrafında?” Tom’un gülümsemesi aniden dondu kaldı, çok şaşırmıştı.
es: —¿Hablando con quién? —pregunta Tom, dejando de sonreír y con aire sorprendido.
vi_translation: - Relationship with whom? - Tom asked, laughing, looking very surprised.
tr_translation: "Around whom?" Tom's smile suddenly froze, he was very surprised.
es_translation: —Talking to whom? —asks Tom, stopping his smile and looking surprised.

en: “With who? Why, the runaway nigger, of course. Who’d you reckon?”
vi: - Với ai à? Tên da đen chạy trốn chứ ai? Mày tưởng ai nữa?
tr: “Kim mi? Kaçak zenci elbette? Kim sanmıştın?
es: —¿Con quién? Pues con el negro fugitivo, claro. ¿Qué te creías?
vi_translation: - With whom? The black guy who ran away, of course. Who else do you think?
tr_translation: “Who? The runaway black man, of course? Who did you think?”
es_translation: —With whom? Well, with the runaway black man, of course. What did you think?

en: Tom looks at me very grave, and says:
vi: - Tom nhìn tôi rất nghiêm nghị và hỏi:
tr: Tom’un yüzü bir anda buludandı ve bana döndü.
es: Tom me miró muy grave, y va y dice:
vi_translation: - Tom looked at me very seriously and asked:
tr_translation: Tom's face suddenly clouded over and he turned to me.
es_translation: Tom looked at me very seriously, and then he said:

en: “Tom, didn’t you just tell me he was all right? Hasn’t he got away?”
vi: - Tom, sao mày vừa bảo với tao là ổn cả? Hắn đã trốn được chưa?
tr: “Tom, az önce bana onun iyi olduğunu söylememiş miydin? Kaçmamış mıydı?
es: —Tom, ¿no me acabas de decir que estaba bien? ¿No se ha escapado?
vi_translation: - Tom, why did you just tell me that everything is fine? Has he escaped yet?
tr_translation: “Tom, didn't you just tell me that he was fine? Hadn't he escaped?”
es_translation: —Tom, didn't you just tell me that he was fine? Hasn't he escaped?

en: “Him?” says Aunt Sally; “the runaway nigger? ’Deed he hasn’t. They’ve got him back, safe and sound, and he’s in that cabin again, on bread and water, and loaded down with chains, till he’s claimed or sold!”
vi: Dì Saly hỏi: - Tên da đen chạy trốn ấy à? Tất nhiên là chưa được. Họ đã bắt nó về, và lại nhốt nó vào trong buồng ấy rồi, chỉ cho ăn bánh và nước không thôi, buộc dây xích cẩn thận, chờ đến bao giờ người ta đến xin hay đem bán đi.
tr: “O mu?” dedi Sally Teyze; “Kaçak zenci mi? Hiç de kaçamadı. Onu kıskıvrak yakalayıp geri getirdiler, tekrar kulübesine koydular, sadece ekmek ve su veriyorlar ve dört bir yanından zincire vurdular; sahibi gelinceye ya da satılıncaya kadar da öyle kalacak!
es: —¿Él? —dice la tía Sally— ¿el negro fugitivo? Claro que no. Aquí lo han vuelto a traer sano y salvo, y está en la misma cabaña, a pan y agua, ¡y cargado de cadenas hasta que vengan a reclamarlo o lo vendamos!
vi_translation: Sister Saly asked: - The black man who ran away? Of course not yet. They have caught him and locked him back in that room, only giving him bread and water, carefully chained, waiting until someone comes to claim or sell him.
tr_translation: “Is it him?” said Aunt Sally; “The runaway black man? He didn't escape at all. They caught him tight and brought him back, put him in his cabin again, only give him bread and water, and chained him from all sides; he will stay that way until his owner comes or he is sold!”
es_translation: —Him? —says Aunt Sally— The runaway black man? Of course not. They've brought him back here safe and sound, and he's in the same cabin, on bread and water, and loaded with chains until someone comes to claim him or we sell him!

en: Tom rose square up in bed, with his eye hot, and his nostrils opening and shutting like gills, and sings out to me:
vi: Tom đang nằm trên giường bỗng ngồi nhổm ngay dậy, mắt đỏ ngầu, hai lỗ mũi phập phồng như mang cá, rồi nó nhìn tôi hét:
tr: Tom gözlerinden kıvılcımlar saçarak yatağında doğruldu, burun delikleri solungaç gibi açılıp kapamyordu, öfkeyle haykırdı:
es: Tom se sentó de golpe en la cama, con la mirada encendida y abriendo y cerrando las ventanillas de la nariz como si fueran agallas, y me grita:
vi_translation: Tom was lying on the bed when he suddenly sat up, his eyes bloodshot, his nostrils flaring like a fish's gills, then he looked at me and shouted:
tr_translation: Tom sat up in his bed with sparks flying from his eyes, his nostrils flaring like gills, and shouted in anger:
es_translation: Tom sat up abruptly in bed, with his eyes wide open and flaring his nostrils as if they were gills, and he shouts at me:

en: “They hain’t no right to shut him up! Shove!—and don’t you lose a minute. Turn him loose! he ain’t no slave; he’s as free as any cretur that walks this earth!”
vi: - Họ không có quyền bắt Jim. Mày chạy ngay đi, thả hắn ra! Hắn không phải là nô lệ, hắn cũng tự do như mọi người trên trái đất này!
tr: “Onu kapatmaya hakları yok! İtip kakmaya hiç yok!.. Bir dakika bile kaybetme. Onu serbest bırak! O bir köle değil, bu dünyada yaşayan herkes kadar özgür!
es: —¡No tienen derecho a tenerlo encerrado! ¡Largo!, y no pierdas un minuto. ¡Suéltalo! No es ningún esclavo. ¡Es tan libre como el que más!
vi_translation: - They have no right to capture Jim. You run away immediately, set him free! He is not a slave, he is as free as anyone on this earth!
tr_translation: "They have no right to shut it down! They have no right to push it around at all!.. Don't waste a single minute. Set it free! It is not a slave, it is as free as everyone living in this world!"
es_translation: —You have no right to keep him locked up! Get out, and don't waste a minute. Let him go! He is not a slave. He is as free as anyone else!

en: “What does the child mean?”
vi: -Thằng bé này nói lạ nhỉ?
tr: “Bu çocuk ne söylemeye çalışıyor?
es: —¿De qué habla este chico?
vi_translation: -This kid talks strangely, doesn't he?
tr_translation: “What is this child trying to say?”
es_translation: —What is this boy talking about?

en: “I mean every word I say, Aunt Sally, and if somebody don’t go, I’ll go. I’ve knowed him all his life, and so has Tom, there. Old Miss Watson died two months ago, and she was ashamed she ever was going to sell him down the river, and said so; and she set him free in her will.”
vi: - Dì Saly, những gì cháu nói đều là sự thật cả đấy. Cháu và thằng Tom nữa đều biết rõ về hắn. Cô Watson đã chết từ hai tháng nay rồi, và cô ấy rất xấu hổ vì đã định đem bán hắn xuống miền Nam. Cô ấy bảo thế là cô ấy đã bằng lòng để hắn được tự do.
tr: “Söylediğim her şeyde ciddiyim, Sally Teyze, kimse gidip onu bırakmazsa kendim giderim. Kendimi bildiğimden beri onu tanırım, Tom da tanır. Yaşlı Bayan Watson iki ay önce öldü ve onu nehrin aşağısında birilerine satmayı aklından geçirdiği için o kadar utanmıştı ki vasiyetinde onu özgür bıraktı.
es: —Lo digo de verdad, tía Sally, y si no va nadie iré yo. Lo he conocido toda la vida igual que aquí Tom. La vieja señorita Watson murió hace dos meses y sintió vergüenza de haber pretendido venderlo río abajo y lo dijo, y le dio la libertad en su testamento.
vi_translation: - Aunt Sally, everything I said is true. Both Tom and I know him well. Miss Watson has been dead for two months now, and she was very ashamed of planning to sell him down South. She said that she agreed to let him be free.
tr_translation: "I mean everything I said, Aunt Sally, if no one goes and frees him, I will go myself. I've known him since I can remember, and Tom knows him too. Old Miss Watson died two months ago, and she was so ashamed of thinking about selling him down the river that she freed him in her will."
es_translation: —I mean it, Aunt Sally, and if no one goes, I will. I've known him all my life just like Tom here. Old Miss Watson died two months ago and felt ashamed for having intended to sell him down the river and said so, and she granted him freedom in her will.

en: “Then what on earth did you want to set him free for, seeing he was already free?”
vi: - Cháu biết rằng nó đã tự do rồi thì còn định trả lại tự do gì cho nó nữa?
tr: “İyi ama onu ne diye kurtarmaya çalışıyordun, evladım? Zaten özgürmüş ya!
es: —Entonces, ¿para qué demonios querías ponerlo en libertad, si ya era libre?
vi_translation: - You know that it is already free, so what freedom are you planning to return to it?
tr_translation: “Alright, but why were you trying to save him, my child? He was already free!”
es_translation: —So, why the hell did you want to set him free if he was already free?

en: “Well, that is a question, I must say; and just like women! Why, I wanted the adventure of it; and I’d a waded neck-deep in blood to—goodness alive, AUNT POLLY!”
vi: - Đấy mới là vấn đề. Chẳng qua là cháu thích chuyện phiêu lưu, và cháu đã phải xông pha vào máu lửa để làm cái đó. Lạy Chúa! Dì Polly!
tr: “İşte bu soru tam bir kadının soracağı türden! Macera olsun diye kurtardım tabii ki. Kendi kanımda boğulmayı bile göze almıştım ben bunun için. Aman Tanrım, Polly Teyze!
es: —¡Bueno, ésa sí que es una pregunta, he de decirlo, típica de una mujer! Hombre, pues porque quería probar la aventura, y habría sido capaz de meterme en sangre hasta el cuello para... ¡Dios santo, TÍA POLLY!
vi_translation: - That's the real issue. It's just that I like adventure, and I had to plunge into blood and fire to do it. Oh my God! Aunt Polly!
tr_translation: “This is exactly the kind of question a woman would ask! Of course, I saved it for the adventure. I was even willing to risk drowning in my own blood for this. Oh my God, Aunt Polly!”
es_translation: —Well, that is indeed a question, I must say, typical of a woman! Man, well, because I wanted to try the adventure, and I would have been capable of getting into blood up to my neck for... Good heavens, AUNT POLLY!

en: If she warn’t standing right there, just inside the door, looking as sweet and contented as an angel half full of pie, I wish I may never!
vi: Lúc đó, tôi thấy dường như dì polly đứng bên trong khung cửa, hiền dịu và oai nghiêm như một bà tiên.
tr: Hakikaten de Polly Teyze oradaydı ve her zamanki şeker yanakları ve tatlı yüzüyle kapının önünde melek gibi durmuş bize bakıyordu.
es: ¡Que me muera ahora mismo si no estaba allí, justo al lado de la puerta, con un aire tan complaciente y satisfecho como un ángel que se acabase de hartar de pastel!
vi_translation: At that moment, I seemed to see Aunt Polly standing inside the doorway, gentle and majestic like a fairy.
tr_translation: Indeed, Aunt Polly was there, standing like an angel in front of the door with her usual sweet cheeks and kind face, looking at us.
es_translation: May I die right now if he wasn't there, right next to the door, with an air as complacent and satisfied as an angel who had just gorged on cake!

en: Aunt Sally jumped for her, and most hugged the head off of her, and cried over her, and I found a good enough place for me under the bed, for it was getting pretty sultry for us, seemed to me. And I peeped out, and in a little while Tom’s Aunt Polly shook herself loose and stood there looking across at Tom over her spectacles—kind of grinding him into the earth, you know. And then she says:
vi: Dì Saly chạy ra ôm chầm lấy gì Poly, suýt nữa thì va cả đầu vào bà ấy, rồi khóc lên, còn tôi thì chui tọt vào gầm giường. Tôi ghé mắt nhìn ra, trong chốc lát, dì Polly của thằng Tom đi vào, nhìn nó chằm chằm qua đôi mục kỉnh của bà ấy như sắp sửa nghiền nát nó. Rồi bà ấy nói:
tr: Sally Teyze hemen ona doğru atıldı, boynuna sarılıp ağlamaya başladı ve ben de bu arada yatağın altına sığışıverdim; çünkü işler bizim için hararetli bir hal almaya başlamıştı. Çaktırmadan baktığımda Tom’un Polly Teyzesi kendini kardeşinin kollarından kurtarmış, gözlüğünün üzerinden Tom’a bakıyor – adeta onu yerin dibine geçiriyordu. Sonra şöyle dedi:
es: La tía Sally saltó hacia ella y casi le arrancó la cabeza de un abrazo. Se puso a llorar con ella, y yo encontré un buen sitio debajo de la cama, porque me dio la sensación de que aquello se estaba poniendo bastante difícil para nosotros. Miré por debajo y al cabo de un rato la tía Polly se soltó y se quedó contemplando a Tom por encima de las gafas, ya sabéis, como si estuviera haciéndolo pedacitos. Y después va y dice:
vi_translation: Aunt Saly ran out and hugged Aunt Polly tightly, almost bumping her head into her, then started crying, while I slipped under the bed. I peeked out, and in a moment, Tom's Aunt Polly came in, staring at him through her glasses as if she was about to crush him. Then she said:
tr_translation: Aunt Sally immediately rushed towards him, hugged him around the neck, and started crying, and in the meantime, I slipped under the bed because things were starting to get heated for us. When I looked surreptitiously, I saw that Tom's Aunt Polly had freed herself from her sister's arms and was looking at Tom over her glasses – as if she was going to bury him into the ground. Then she said:
es_translation: Aunt Sally jumped towards her and almost took her head off with a hug. She started crying with her, and I found a good spot under the bed, because I had the feeling that things were getting pretty tough for us. I looked from underneath and after a while Aunt Polly let go and stood there looking at Tom over her glasses, you know, as if she were tearing him to pieces. And then she goes and says:

en: “Yes, you better turn y’r head away—I would if I was you, Tom.”
vi: - Tom, mày quay mặt đi còn hơn. Nếu là tao thì tao cũng làm như vậy.
tr: “Başını çevirsen iyi edersin gerçekten… Yerinde olsam ben de aynını yapardım, Tom.
es: —Sí, más te vale mirar a otro lado; es lo que haría yo en tu caso, Tom.
vi_translation: - Tom, you'd better turn away. If it were me, I would do the same.
tr_translation: “You'd really do well to turn your head... If I were you, I'd do the same, Tom.”
es_translation: —Yes, you'd better look the other way; it's what I would do in your case, Tom.

en: “Oh, deary me!” says Aunt Sally; “is he changed so? Why, that ain’t Tom, it’s Sid; Tom’s—Tom’s—why, where is Tom? He was here a minute ago.”
vi: Dì Saly kêu lên: - Ô hay, nó không phải là thằng Tom, nó là thằng Sid, Tom! Tom! Thằng Tom nó đã chạy đâu rồi, nó vừa mới có đây mà!
tr: “Aman Tanrım!” dedi Sally Teyze, “O kadar çok mu değişmiş? Bu Tom değil ki, Sid; Tom da… Tom da… Tom nereye gitti şimdi? Bir saniye önce buradaydı.
es: —¡Ay Dios mío! —dice la tía Sally— ¿es que ha cambiado tanto? Pero si ése no es Tom, es Sid; Tom está... pero, ¿dónde está Tom? Estaba aquí hace un momento.
vi_translation: Aunt Saly exclaimed: - Oh, hey, it's not Tom, it's Sid, Tom! Tom! Where has Tom run off to, he was just here!
tr_translation: “Oh my God!” said Aunt Sally, “Has he changed that much? This isn't Tom, Sid; Tom is… Tom is… Where did Tom go now? He was here a second ago.”
es_translation: —Oh my God! —says Aunt Sally— Has he changed that much? But that's not Tom, it's Sid; Tom is... but, where is Tom? He was here just a moment ago.

en: “You mean where’s Huck Finn—that’s what you mean! I reckon I hain’t raised such a scamp as my Tom all these years not to know him when I see him. That would be a pretty howdy-do. Come out from under that bed, Huck Finn.”
vi: - Cô muốn nói là thằng Huck Finn ở đâu đấy à? Chẳng lẽ tôi nuôi thằng nhãi con ấy bao nhiêu năm nay mà không nhân ra nó hay sao? Huck Finn, ra khỏi gầm giường đi!
tr: “Herhalde Huck Finn nerede demek istiyorsun… çünkü ondan bahsediyorsun! Tom gibi bir haylazı yetiştirip büyüttükten sonra onu görünce tanımayacak değilim herhalde. Gerçekten çok tuhaf olurdu. Çık yatağın altından, Huck Finn.
es: —Quieres decir dónde está Huck Finn.. . ¡a ése te refieres! Calculo que no he criado a un bribón como mi Tom todos estos años para no conocerlo cuando lo veo. Estaría bueno. Sal de debajo de la cama, Huck Finn.
vi_translation: - Do you mean to say that Huck Finn is somewhere around here? Is it possible that I've been raising that kid for so many years and still wouldn't recognize him? Huck Finn, come out from under the bed!
tr_translation: “I suppose you mean where Huck Finn is… because you are talking about him! After raising and growing up a rascal like Tom, I would certainly recognize him when I see him. It would indeed be very strange. Come out from under the bed, Huck Finn.”
es_translation: —You mean where Huck Finn is... that's who you mean! I reckon I haven't raised a rascal like my Tom all these years not to recognize him when I see him. That would be good. Come out from under the bed, Huck Finn.

en: So I done it. But not feeling brash.
vi: Tôi chui ra, nhưng không được tự nhiên như trước nữa.
tr: Utana sıkıla yatağın altından çıktım.
es: Eso fue lo que hice. Pero no me sentía muy contento.
vi_translation: I crawled out, but it wasn't as natural as before.
tr_translation: I came out from under the bed, feeling shy and embarrassed.
es_translation: That was what I did. But I didn't feel very happy.

en: Aunt Sally she was one of the mixed-upest-looking persons I ever see—except one, and that was Uncle Silas, when he come in and they told it all to him. It kind of made him drunk, as you may say, and he didn’t know nothing at all the rest of the day, and preached a prayer-meeting sermon that night that gave him a rattling ruputation, because the oldest man in the world couldn’t a understood it. So Tom’s Aunt Polly, she told all about who I was, and what; and I had to up and tell how I was in such a tight place that when Mrs. Phelps took me for Tom Sawyer—she chipped in and says, “Oh, go on and call me Aunt Sally, I’m used to it now, and ’tain’t no need to change”—that when Aunt Sally took me for Tom Sawyer I had to stand it—there warn’t no other way, and I knowed he wouldn’t mind, because it would be nuts for him, being a mystery, and he’d make an adventure out of it, and be perfectly satisfied. And so it turned out, and he let on to be Sid, and made things as soft as he could for me.
vi: Dì Saly hoảng loạn đầu óc, còn chú Silas, khi nghe thấy mọi chuyện, chú ấy cũng hoảng loạn không kém. Đêm ấy, chú gọi cả nhà ra cầu nguyện để cho chú ấy tỉnh lại. Thế rồi dì Polly của thằng Tom mới kể hết lại rằng tôi là ai, tôi là thế nào, và tôi phải đứng dậy nói đầu đuôi tại sao. Dì Saly chen vào ngắt lời: - Cháu cứ gọi cô là dì Saly, cô đã quen rồi, không cần phải đổi nữa. Bà Polly bảo là thằng Tom nói đúng, cô Watson đã để cho Jim được tự do. Như vây.
tr: Sally Teyze kadar neye uğradığını şaşırmış bir insan görmemiştim daha önce, ama sonra gördüm: İçeri girdiğinde hikâyeyi anlattıkları Silas Enişte’nin hali daha da vahimdi. Adeta zil zurna sarhoş olmuştu, günün geri kalanında kendini şaşırmış bir halde dolandı durdu, o gece verdiği vaaz yüzünden de acayip ünlendi, çünkü en yaşlılar bile söylediğinin tek kelimesini anlamamıştı. Böylece Tom’un Polly Teyzesi benim kim olduğum ve neler yaptığımla ilgili her şeyi anlattı, bunun üzerine ben de Bayan Phelps Tom Sawyer olduğumu sandığında ne kadar zor durumda olduğumu açıklamaya çalıştım – ama sözümü kesti: “Ayol, tamam, yine bana Sally Teyze de, zaten alıştım, başka şey demene gerek yok –yani Sally Teyze beni Tom Sawyer sanınca mecburen kaderime razı olmuştum– başka çıkar yol yoktu, üstelik Tom’un itiraz etmeyeceğini biliyordum, zira böyle şeylere bayılırdı, gizemli işleri sever, hemen bir maceraya çevirir ve o zaman mutlu olurdu. İşte böylece o da Sid olmayı kabul etmiş ve benim için işleri kolaylaştırmaya çalışmıştı.
es: La tía Sally se convirtió en una de las personas que menos comprendía nada que yo haya visto en mi vida, salvo una, y ése fue el tío Silas, cuando vino y se lo contaron todo. Podría decirse que fue como si se emborrachase, y todo el resto del día se pasó sin comprender nada. Aquella noche predicó un sermón en la reunión de la iglesia que le dio una reputación fenómena, porque no lo habría entendido ni la persona más vieja del mundo. Así que la tía Polly le dijo a todo el mundo quién era yo, y tuve que confesar que estaba en una situación tan mala que cuando la señora Phelps me tomó por Tom Sawyer... —y entonces ella intervino y dijo: «Vamos, vamos, llámame tía Sally, ya estoy acostumbrada y no hay por qué cambiar las cosas»—, que cuando la tía Sally me tomó por Tom Sawyer tuve que aceptarlo, porque no podía hacer otra cosa, y yo sabía que a Tom no le importaría, al contrario, le encantaría por tratarse de un misterio y lo convertiría todo en una aventura y se quedaría contentísimo. Así salieron las cosas, y él hizo como que era Sid y me las facilitó todo lo que pudo.
vi_translation: Aunt Sally was in a state of panic, and Uncle Silas, upon hearing everything, was no less panicked. That night, he called the whole family to pray so that he could regain his composure. Then Tom's Aunt Polly recounted everything about who I was, what I was like, and I had to stand up and explain everything from the beginning. Aunt Sally interrupted: - You can just call me Aunt Saly, I'm used to it, no need to change it. Aunt Polly said that Tom was right, Miss Watson had set Jim free. That's it.
tr_translation: I had never seen a person as bewildered as Aunt Sally before, but then I did: When Uncle Silas, to whom they were telling the story, came in, his state was even more dire. He was practically dead drunk, wandered around in a daze for the rest of the day, and became incredibly famous because of the sermon he gave that night, as even the oldest folks couldn't understand a single word he said. Thus, Tom's Aunt Polly explained everything about who I was and what I had done, and then I tried to explain how difficult it was for me when Mrs. Phelps thought I was Tom Sawyer – but she interrupted me: "Oh, alright, just call me Aunt Sally again, I'm already used to it, no need to say anything else – I had to accept my fate when Aunt Sally mistook me for Tom Sawyer – there was no other way, besides, I knew Tom wouldn't object, because he loved such things, he liked mysterious affairs, would immediately turn them into an adventure, and then he would be happy. So, he accepted being Sid and tried to make things easier for me.
es_translation: Aunt Sally became one of the people who understood the least of anything I have ever seen in my life, except for one, and that was Uncle Silas, when he came and they told him everything. You could say it was as if he got drunk, and he spent the rest of the day not understanding anything. That night he preached a sermon at the church meeting that gave him a phenomenal reputation, because not even the oldest person in the world would have understood it. So Aunt Polly told everyone who I was, and I had to confess that I was in such a bad situation that when Mrs. Phelps took me for Tom Sawyer... —and then she intervened and said: "Come on, come on, call me Aunt Sally, I'm used to it and there's no need to change things"—, that when Aunt Sally took me for Tom Sawyer I had to accept it, because I couldn't do anything else, and I knew Tom wouldn't mind, on the contrary, he would love it because it was a mystery and he would turn it all into an adventure and be very happy. That's how things turned out, and he pretended to be Sid and made everything as easy as he could for me.

en: Well, Aunt Polly she said that when Aunt Sally wrote to her that Tom and Sid had come all right and safe, she says to herself:
vi: Rồi bà Polly kể dì Saly viết thư cho bà ấy nói rằng Tom và Sid đã nói tới nơi yên ổn cả; thì bà ấy đã tự nhủ:
tr: Neyse, Polly Teyze bu sefer Tom’un ve Sid’in sağ salim geldiğine dair Sally Teyze’nin mektubu gelince kendi kendine şöyle dediğini anlattı:
es: Bueno, la tía Polly dijo que cuando la tía Sally le escribió que Tom y Sid habían llegado sanos y salvos se había dicho: «¡Vaya vaya!
vi_translation: Then Mrs. Polly said that Aunt Sally had written her a letter saying that Tom and Sid had arrived safely; and she had told herself:
tr_translation: Anyway, Aunt Polly said to herself this time when she received Aunt Sally's letter confirming that Tom and Sid had arrived safely:
es_translation: Well, Aunt Polly said that when Aunt Sally wrote to her that Tom and Sid had arrived safe and sound, she had said to herself: "Well, well!"

en: “Well, I wonder! Why, I wrote you twice to ask you what you could mean by Sid being here.”
vi: - Em có nhận được tin gì của chị đâu? - Tôi có viết thư cho cô hai lần hỏi rằng thằng Sid ở đấy nghĩa là thế nào?
tr: “Yaa, neden acaba! Sana iki kez yazdım ve Sid’in orada olduğunu söylemekle ne kastettiğini sordum.
es: —¡Vaya, qué raro! Pero si te he escrito dos veces para preguntarte a qué te referías al decir que había llegado Sid.
vi_translation: - I haven't received any news from you? - I wrote to you twice asking what it means that Sid is there?
tr_translation: “Yeah, I wonder why! I wrote to you twice and asked what you meant by saying Sid was there.”
es_translation: —Wow, how strange! But I wrote to you twice to ask what you meant by saying that Sid had arrived.

en: “Well, I never got ’em, Sis.”
vi: - Em không hề nhận được lá thư nào của chị.
tr: “Yok, bana mektup filan gelmedi, abla.
es: —Bueno, hermana, pero nunca me llegaron.
vi_translation: - I did not receive any letter from you.
tr_translation: "No, I didn't receive any letter, sister."
es_translation: —Well, sister, but they never arrived for me.

en: Aunt Polly she turns around slow and severe, and says:
vi: - Lại là mày, Tom!
tr: Polly Teyze yüzünde sert bir ifadeyle ağır ağır Tom’a döndü.
es: La tía Polly se dio la vuelta muy lenta y severa, y va y dice:
vi_translation: - It's you again, Tom!
tr_translation: Aunt Polly slowly turned to Tom with a stern expression on her face.
es_translation: Aunt Polly turned around very slowly and sternly, and then said:

en: “You, Tom!”
vi: - Lại là mày, Tom!
tr: “Tom, sen yaptın!
es: —¡Tú, Tom!
vi_translation: - It's you again, Tom!
tr_translation: "Tom, you did it!""
es_translation: —You, Tom!

en: “Well—what?” he says, kind of pettish.
vi: - Sao cơ ạ? - Nó đáp, vẻ nghịch ngợm.
tr: “Ne yapmışım ki?” diye uysalca sordu Tom.
es: —Bueno... ¿qué? —contesta él, como enfadado.
vi_translation: - What did you say?
tr_translation: “What have I done?” Tom asked meekly.
es_translation: —Well... what? —he replies, sounding angry.

en: “Don’t you what me, you impudent thing—hand out them letters.”
vi: - Sao cơ ạ? - Nó đáp, vẻ nghịch ngợm. - Mày đừng hỏi tao cái gì nữa.
tr: “Ne yapmışım deme bana, seni arsız seni… Çıkar bakalım mektupları.
es: —No me vengas preguntando qué, insolente; dame esas cartas.
vi_translation: - It replied, mischievously. - Don't ask me anything else.
tr_translation: “Don't tell me what I've done, you shameless one, you... Take out the letters, let's see.”
es_translation: —Don't come asking me what, insolent; give me those letters.

en: “What letters?”
vi: Đưa thư ra đây! - Thư nào ạ?
tr: ” Hangi mektupları ?”
es: —¿Qué cartas?
vi_translation: Hand over the letter! - Which letter?
tr_translation: "Which letters?"
es_translation: —What letters?

en: “Them letters. I be bound, if I have to take aholt of you I’ll—”
vi: - Thư nào nữa. Tao bực mình rồi đấy, mày còn định nói dối nữa thì tao...
tr: “O mektupları. Hemen vermezsen, ben bulmak zorunda kalırsam o zaman…
es: —Esas cartas. Te aseguro que si tengo que echarte mano, te voy a...
vi_translation: - What letter? I'm really annoyed now, if you keep lying, I will...
tr_translation: “Those letters. If you don't give them to me right away, if I have to find them myself, then...”
es_translation: —Those letters. I assure you that if I have to lay a hand on you, I'm going to...

en: “They’re in the trunk. There, now. And they’re just the same as they was when I got them out of the office. I hain’t looked into them, I hain’t touched them. But I knowed they’d make trouble, and I thought if you warn’t in no hurry, I’d—”
vi: Tao bực mình rồi đấy, mày còn định nói dối nữa thì tao... - Dạ, ở trong hòm ấy. Nó vẫn nguyên như lúc cháu lấy ở bưu điện về. Cháu không xem, mà cũng không sờ đến. Nhưng cháu đoán là sẽ có chuyện rắc rối, nên cháu...
tr: “Mektuplar sandıkta. Evet, orada. Kesinlikle dokunmadım, postaneden aldığım haliyle duruyorlar. Açıp bakmadım, dokunmadım bile. Ama mektupların sorun çıkaracağını biliyordum, ayrıca senin acelen olmadığını düşünmüştüm…
es: —Están en el baúl. Ya está dicho. Y están igual que estaban cuando me las dieron en correos. No las he visto. No las he tocado. Pero sabía que iban a crear problemas y pensé que no te corrían prisa y que...
vi_translation: - Yes, it's in that box. It's still exactly as it was when I picked it up from the post office. I haven't looked at it, nor have I touched it. But I guessed there would be some trouble, so I...
tr_translation: "The letters are in the chest. Yes, there. I definitely didn't touch them, they are just as I received them from the post office. I didn't open or even touch them. But I knew the letters would cause trouble, and I thought you weren't in a hurry..."
es_translation: —They are in the trunk. That's already been said. And they are just as they were when they were given to me at the post office. I haven't seen them. I haven't touched them. But I knew they were going to cause problems and I thought they weren't urgent for you and that...

en: “Well, you do need skinning, there ain’t no mistake about it. And I wrote another one to tell you I was coming; and I s’pose he—”
vi: Nhưng cháu đoán là sẽ có chuyện rắc rối, nên cháu... - Tao nhất định phải lột da mày mới được. Tôi còn viết một cái thư nữa, báo tin cho cô là tôi đang sắp xuống đây, hay là nó cũng... .
tr: “Derini yüzdürmek için can atıyorsun ha, bundan hiç şüphem kalmadı. Ayrıca buraya geleceğimi haber veren bir mektup daha atmıştım ve sanırım Tom…
es: —Bueno, te mereces una paliza, de eso no hay duda. Te escribí otra para decirte que iba a venir, y supongo que...
vi_translation: - I will definitely skin you alive. I also wrote another letter, informing her that I am about to come down here, or maybe it also...
tr_translation: "You're itching to skin me alive, huh? I have no doubt about that anymore. Also, I had sent another letter informing you that I would come here, and I believe Tom..."
es_translation: —Well, you deserve a beating, there's no doubt about that. I wrote you another one to tell you that I was going to come, and I suppose that...

en: “No, it come yesterday; I hain’t read it yet, but it’s all right, I’ve got that one.”
vi: - Thư ấy mới đến hôm qua; em chưa đọc, nhưng em đã cất nó rồi.
tr: “Yok, o dün geldi; henüz onu okumadım, ama sorun yok. O bende.
es: —No, llegó ayer; todavía no la he leído, pero llegó bien, ésa la tengo yo.
vi_translation: - That letter just arrived yesterday; I haven't read it yet, but I have already put it away.
tr_translation: "No, it arrived yesterday; I haven't read it yet, but there's no problem. It's with me."
es_translation: —No, it arrived yesterday; I haven't read it yet, but it arrived fine, I have that one.

en: I wanted to offer to bet two dollars she hadn’t, but I reckoned maybe it was just as safe to not to. So I never said nothing.
vi: Tôi muốn đánh cuộc ngay hai đô la rằng hiện tại dì Saly không có lá thư ấy, nhưng nghĩ lại thấy mình nên im lặng thì hay hơn. Thế là tôi không nói nửa lời
tr: Mektubun Sally Teyze’de olmadığına iki dolarına bahse girerdim, ama o sırada sesimi çıkarmamak daha akıllıca olacak gibiydi. Hiçbir şey demedim.
es: Yo hubiera apostado dos dólares a que no, pero calculé que quizá era más seguro no apostar. Así que no dije nada.
vi_translation: I want to bet two dollars right now that Aunt Saly doesn't have that letter, but on second thought, I realized it would be better to stay silent. So I didn't say a word.
tr_translation: I would bet two dollars that the letter is not with Aunt Sally, but it seemed wiser to keep quiet at that moment. I didn't say anything.
es_translation: I would have bet two dollars that it wasn't, but I figured it might be safer not to bet. So I didn't say anything.

en: CHAPTER THE LAST
vi: Chương cuối cùng
tr: Sonuncu Bölüm
es: Capítulo último
vi_translation: The Final Chapter
tr_translation: Final Chapter
es_translation: Last Chapter

en: The first time I catched Tom private I asked him what was his idea, time of the evasion?—what it was he’d planned to do if the evasion worked all right and he managed to set a nigger free that was already free before? And he said, what he had planned in his head from the start, if we got Jim out all safe, was for us to run him down the river on the raft, and have adventures plumb to the mouth of the river, and then tell him about his being free, and take him back up home on a steamboat, in style, and pay him for his lost time, and write word ahead and get out all the niggers around, and have them waltz him into town with a torchlight procession and a brass-band, and then he would be a hero, and so would we. But I reckoned it was about as well the way it was.
vi: Ngay lúc gặp riêng được Tom, tôi liền hỏi nó nghĩ thế nào trong thời gian vượt ngục? Nó sẽ tính thế nào nếu như cuộc vượt ngục thành công và trả lại tự do cho Jim như thế nào? Nó bảo nếu chúng tôi cứu được Jim ra yên lành thì sẽ cho hắn ngồi bè trôi về dưới xuôi, và cùng đi mạo hiểm đến tận cửa sông, lúc đó bảo cho hắn biết là hắn đã được tự do rồi, sau đấy đưa hắn lên tàu thủy về nhà, trả công cho hắn, gọi tắt cả những anh em da đen ở chung quanh đến nhảy mua rước hắn vào trong thị trấn, có kèn trống đi đầu cẩn thận; hắn sẽ trở thành một vị anh hùng, và hai đứa tôi cũng thế. Nhưng tôi nghĩ cũng đã làm được gần như vậy rồi.
tr: Tom’u ilk tenhada yakaladığımda, kaçış sırasında aklında nasıl bir fikir olduğunu sordum. Kaçış sorunsuz geçseydi ve zaten özgür olan bir köleyi serbest bırakmayı başarsaydık ne yapmayı düşünüyordu. Bunun üzerine, en baştan beri kafasında olan planı bana anlattı: Jim’i kurtarabilseydik onunla birlikte salın üstünde nehir aşağı gidecektik, nehrin ağzına varıncaya kadar bir sürü macera yaşayacaktık, ondan sonra Jim’e özgür olduğunu söyleyecek, bir vapurla eve kadar konforlu bir yolculuk yaptıracaktık, kaybettiği zaman için ona para verecektik, önceden köydeki bütün zencilere haber salacaktık, Jim’i bir bando ve meşaleli geçit töreniyle köye götüreceklerdi; böylece Jim kahraman olacaktı, biz de öyle. Ama olayların şimdi geldiği nokta da bir o kadar iyiydi.
es: LA PRIMERA VEZ que pude ver a Tom a solas le pregunté en qué había pensado cuando lo de la evasión, qué pensaba hacer si la evasión salía bien y lograba poner en libertad al negro que ya antes era libre. Respondió que lo que había planeado desde un principio, si lográbamos sacar a Jim y ponerlo a salvo, era seguir con él por el río en la balsa y tener montones de aventuras allí, y después decirle que era libre y llevarlo de vuelta a casa en un barco de vapor, bien fino, y pagarle por todo el tiempo que había perdido y escribir por adelantado para que todos los negros fueran a recibirlo y a llevarlo bailando al pueblo con una procesión de antorchas y una banda de música. Entonces sería un héroe y nosotros también. Pero yo calculé que ya estaba bien tal como estaban las cosas.
vi_translation: As soon as I got a chance to meet Tom alone, I immediately asked him what he thought during the escape? How would he plan if the escape was successful and how would he restore freedom to Jim? He said that if we managed to rescue Jim safely, we would let him sit on a raft drifting downstream, and together we would venture all the way to the river's mouth. At that point, we would tell him that he was free, then put him on a steamboat home, reward him, gather all the black folks around to dance and escort him into town with a proper parade, complete with drums and trumpets; he would become a hero, and so would the two of us. But I think we've almost done just that already.
tr_translation: When I first caught Tom alone, I asked him what idea he had in mind during the escape. What he was thinking of doing if the escape went smoothly and we managed to free a slave who was already free. Upon this, he told me the plan that had been in his mind from the beginning: If we could save Jim, we would go down the river on the raft together, have many adventures until we reached the mouth of the river, then we would tell Jim he was free, give him a comfortable journey home on a steamboat, give him money for the time he lost, inform all the blacks in the village beforehand, and they would take Jim to the village with a band and a torchlight procession; thus Jim would be a hero, and so would we. But the point where things had come now was just as good.
es_translation: THE FIRST TIME I could see Tom alone, I asked him what he had thought about during the escape, what he planned to do if the escape went well and he managed to free the black man who was already free before. He replied that what he had planned from the beginning, if we managed to get Jim out and keep him safe, was to continue with him down the river on the raft and have lots of adventures there, and then tell him he was free and take him back home on a fine steamboat, and pay him for all the time he had lost and write ahead so that all the black people would come to greet him and take him dancing into town with a torchlight procession and a band. Then he would be a hero and so would we. But I figured things were fine just the way they were.

en: We had Jim out of the chains in no time, and when Aunt Polly and Uncle Silas and Aunt Sally found out how good he helped the doctor nurse Tom, they made a heap of fuss over him, and fixed him up prime, and give him all he wanted to eat, and a good time, and nothing to do. And we had him up to the sick-room, and had a high talk; and Tom give Jim forty dollars for being prisoner for us so patient, and doing it up so good, and Jim was pleased most to death, and busted out, and says:
vi: Chúng tôi giúp Jim được thoát khỏi xiềng xích, Khi biết Jim đã giúp bác sĩ trông nom Tom như thế nào thì dì Polly, chú Silas và dì Saly đều cảm động lắm, khen ngợi hết lời, cho Jim ăn đủ các thứ mà Jim thích, nghỉ ngơi, và chẳng phải làm gì cả. Tom cho Jim bốn mươi đô la vì đã là một người bị giam rất kiên nhẫn và đóng cái vai trò đó rất khá. Jim sướng chết đi được, bật ra nói:
tr: Jim’i derhal zincirlerinden kurtarmıştık, sonra da Polly Teyze, Silas Enişte ve Sally Teyze doktorun Tom’u tedavisine ne kadar yardımcı olduğunu öğrenmiş, onu baş tacı yapmış, her isteğini yerine getirmiş, önünden kuşsütünü eksik etmemiş, üstelik yapacak hiçbir iş vermemişlerdi. Onu Tom’un odasına getirip bol bol muhabbet etmiştik, Tom büyük bir sabırla bizim hatırımıza mahkûmluk ettiği, üstelik çok da başarılı olduğu için Jim’e kırk dolar verdi. Jim sevincinden kafayı üşütecekti neredeyse:
es: No tardamos nada en quitarle las cadenas a Jim, y cuando la tía Polly, el tío Silas y la tía Sally se enteraron de lo bien que había ayudado al médico a cuidar de Tom, le hicieron muchas zalemas y lo mimaron mucho y le dieron de comer todo lo que quería para que lo pasara bien y no tuviese que hacer nada. Le hicimos subir al cuarto del enfermo, donde estuvimos charlando mucho tiempo, y Tom le dio a Jim cuarenta dólares por haber hecho de prisionero con nosotros con tanta paciencia y haberlo hecho todo tan bien, y Jim casi se murió de contento y se puso a gritar:
vi_translation: We helped Jim get free from the chains. When Aunt Polly, Uncle Silas, and Aunt Sally learned how Jim had helped the doctor take care of Tom, they were very moved, praised him endlessly, gave Jim all the food he liked, let him rest, and didn't make him do anything at all. Tom gave Jim forty dollars for being a very patient prisoner and playing that role very well. Jim was overjoyed and exclaimed:
tr_translation: We had immediately freed Jim from his chains, and then Aunt Polly, Uncle Silas, and Aunt Sally, having learned how much the doctor had helped treat Tom, had made him their favorite, fulfilled his every wish, never let him lack for anything, and moreover, had given him no work to do. We brought him to Tom's room and had many conversations, and Tom, because he had endured imprisonment for our sake with great patience and had been very successful, gave Jim forty dollars. Jim was almost going to lose his mind from joy:
es_translation: We didn't take long to remove Jim's chains, and when Aunt Polly, Uncle Silas, and Aunt Sally found out how well he had helped the doctor take care of Tom, they showered him with praise, pampered him a lot, and gave him all the food he wanted so he could enjoy himself and not have to do anything. We took him up to the sickroom, where we chatted for a long time, and Tom gave Jim forty dollars for having been so patient as a prisoner with us and for having done everything so well, and Jim almost died of happiness and started shouting:

en: “Dah, now, Huck, what I tell you?—what I tell you up dah on Jackson islan’? I tole you I got a hairy breas’, en what’s de sign un it; en I tole you I ben rich wunst, en gwineter to be rich agin; en it’s come true; en heah she is! Dah, now! doan’ talk to me—signs is signs, mine I tell you; en I knowed jis’ ’s well ’at I ’uz gwineter be rich agin as I’s a-stannin’ heah dis minute!”
vi: - Cậu Huck này, tồi nói có sai đâu? Tôi bảo cậu là ngực tôi có nhiều lông, đó là dấu hiệu may mắn; rồi tôi còn nói là trước kia tôi đã một lần giầu có, sau này sẽ còn giàu nữa. Thế là bây giờ đúng rồi nhé. Đây, tiền đây này. Tôi đã bảo mà, tôi biết chắc là có ngày tôi sẽ giàu nữa, đúng thật như chính tôi bây giờ đây này.
tr: “Hah, işte, Huck, ben sana ne dediydim? Jackson Adası’nda sana ne dediydim? Benim göğsüm kıllı dediydim, peki neyin işağetiydi bu? Sana anlatmıştım biğ zamanlağ zengin olduğumu, ileğide yine zengin olacağım demiştim. Ve geğçekleşti! Hey yavğum be! Alamete güveniğim ben, alametin doğğuluğundan şaşmam. Şu an buğada duğduğumu nasıl biliyoğsam, işte öyle biliyoğdum mukakkak tekğağ zengin olacağımı!
es: —Vaya, Huck, ¿qué te decía? ¿Lo que te dije en la isla de Jackson? Te dije que tengo muchos pelos en el pecho y que eso es una buena señal, y te dije que había sido rico una vez y que iba a volver a ser rico otra vez, y ahora se ha cumplido, ¡míralo! ¿Te enteras? No me digas que no: las señales son señales y no lo olvides; ¡yo sabía que iba a volver a ser rico, tan seguro como que el sol sale por el Este!
vi_translation: - Hey Huck, didn't I tell you? I told you that I have a lot of hair on my chest, which is a sign of good luck; and I also said that I was once wealthy and that I would be rich again in the future. So now it's true, isn't it? Here, here's the money. I told you, I knew for sure that one day I would be rich again, and it's true just like I am right now.
tr_translation: “Ha, see, Huck, what did I tell you? What did I tell you on Jackson Island? I told you my chest was hairy, so what was that a sign of? I had told you once that I was rich, and I said I would be rich again. And it came true! Oh boy! I trust in omens, I never doubt the truth of omens. Just as I know I am alive right now, I knew for sure that I would be rich again!”
es_translation: —Well, Huck, what was I telling you? What I told you on Jackson Island? I told you that I have a lot of hair on my chest and that it's a good sign, and I told you that I was rich once and that I was going to be rich again, and now it has come true, look at it! Do you get it? Don't tell me you don't: signs are signs and don't forget it; I knew I was going to be rich again, as sure as the sun rises in the East!

en: And then Tom he talked along and talked along, and says, le’s all three slide out of here one of these nights and get an outfit, and go for howling adventures amongst the Injuns, over in the Territory, for a couple of weeks or two; and I says, all right, that suits me, but I ain’t got no money for to buy the outfit, and I reckon I couldn’t get none from home, because it’s likely pap’s been back before now, and got it all away from Judge Thatcher and drunk it up.
vi: Rồi Tom nói chuyện mãi, nó bảo rằng để đêm nào ba người chúng tôi lại đi ra ngoài kia kiếm vài thứ dụng cụ và làm một chuyến phiêu lưu vài ba tuần lễ nữa vào tận lãnh thổ người da đỏ. Tôi bảo được, tôi cũng thích thế, nhưng tôi không có tiền mua dụng cụ, và tôi nghĩ rằng ở nhà cũng chẳng có đâu; vì có lẽ bố tôi đã trở về đó rồi và đã lấy hết tiền ở chỗ lão chánh án Thatcher mà đem đi uống rượu.
tr: Ondan sonra Tom lafa başladı, uzun uzun konuştuktan sonra, “Haydi birkaç gece içinde üçümüz birden buradan tüyelim, kılık değiştirip Kızılderili Bölgesi’nde birkaç hafta müthiş maceralar yaşayalım,” dedi. Ben de, “Tamam, bana göre hava hoş,” dedim. Ama kılık kıyafet alacak param yoktu, üstelik eve döndüğüm zaman da param olmayacaktı; çünkü babam büyük ihtimalle çoktan köye dönmüş, Yargıç Thatcher’dan bütün parayı alıp içkiye yatırmıştı.
es: Después Tom se puso a hablar y hablar y dijo que una de aquellas noches nos podíamos escapar los tres y reunir una banda en busca de aventuras estupendas entre los indios, en su territorio, durante dos semanas o tres. Yo dije que muy bien, que me iba perfectamente, pero no tenía dinero para comprarme la ropa y calculaba que no me lo iban a mandar de casa, porque probablemente padre ya habría vuelto y el juez Thatcher se lo habría dado todo y él se lo habría bebido.
vi_translation: Then Tom kept talking, saying that one night the three of us should go out there to get some tools and go on an adventure for a few weeks into Indian territory. I said okay, I liked that idea too, but I didn't have money to buy tools, and I thought there wouldn't be any at home either; because my father had probably returned and taken all the money from Judge Thatcher to go drinking.
tr_translation: Then Tom started talking, and after a long conversation, he said, "Let's all sneak out of here within a few nights, disguise ourselves, and have some amazing adventures in the Indian Territory for a few weeks." I said, "Alright, that's fine with me." But I didn't have any money to buy clothes, and when I got home, I wouldn't have any money either; because my father had probably already returned to the village, taken all the money from Judge Thatcher, and spent it on liquor.
es_translation: Then Tom started talking and talking and said that one of these nights the three of us could escape and form a band in search of amazing adventures among the Indians, in their territory, for two or three weeks. I said that was fine, that it suited me perfectly, but I didn't have money to buy clothes and I figured they wouldn't send it from home, because father had probably already returned and Judge Thatcher would have given him everything and he would have drunk it all.

en: “No, he hain’t,” Tom says; “it’s all there yet—six thousand dollars and more; and your pap hain’t ever been back since. Hadn’t when I come away, anyhow.”
vi: Tom nói: - Không, chưa đâu. Tất cả hơn sáu nghìn đô la vẫn còn cả đó, và bố mày từ đó đến nay cũng không thấy trở về nữa.
tr: “Hiç de öyle değil,” dedi Tom. “Bütün paran orada… Altı bin dolar, hatta daha fazlası. Baban da seni aramaya çıktığından beri bir daha görünmedi. Daha doğrusu ben buraya doğru yola çıktığımda ortada yoktu.
es: —No, nada de eso —y va y dice Tom—; ahí sigue todito: seis mil dólares y más; tu padre no volvió nunca. Por lo menos hasta que me vine yo aquí.
vi_translation: Tom said: - No, not yet. All more than six thousand dollars are still there, and your father hasn't returned since then.
tr_translation: “It’s not like that at all,” said Tom. “All your money is there… Six thousand dollars, maybe even more. Your father hasn’t been seen since he went out looking for you. In fact, when I set out for here, he was nowhere to be found.”
es_translation: —No, nothing like that —and then Tom says—; it's all still there: six thousand dollars and more; your father never came back. At least not until I came here.

en: Jim says, kind of solemn:
vi: Jim nói trịnh trọng:
tr: Jim biraz kederli lafa karıştı:
es: Jim dijo, como muy solemne:
vi_translation: Jim said solemnly:
tr_translation: Jim joined the conversation a bit sadly:
es_translation: Jim said, very solemnly:

en: “He ain’t a-comin’ back no mo’, Huck.”
vi: - Ông ấy không về nữa đâu. cậu Huck ạ.
tr: “Baban biğ daha hiç gelmeyecek, Huck.
es: —No va a volver más, Huck.
vi_translation: - He is not coming back anymore, Huck.
tr_translation: “Dad will never come back again, Huck.”
es_translation: —He is not coming back anymore, Huck.

en: “Why, Jim?”
vi: - Sao Jim lại nói thế?
tr: “Neden, Jim?
es: —¿Por qué, Jim?
vi_translation: - Why did Jim say that?
tr_translation: “Why, Jim?”
es_translation: —Why, Jim?

en: “Nemmine why, Huck—but he ain’t comin’ back no mo.”
vi: - Tôi biết chắc điều đó mà, cậu đừng hỏi nữa.
tr: “Nedenini boş veğ, Huck, ama biğ daha geği gelmeyecek, ben biliyoğum.
es: —No importa por qué, Huck, pero no va a volver más.
vi_translation: - I am sure of that, don't ask anymore.
tr_translation: “Never mind the reason, Huck, but I know it won't happen again.”
es_translation: —It doesn't matter why, Huck, but he won't be coming back anymore.

en: But I kept at him; so at last he says:
vi: Nhưng tôi gặng hỏi mãi, sau cùng hắn nói:
tr: Ama bu içime sinmemişti, onu iyice sıkıştırınca anlattı:
es: Pero yo insistí, así que al final él va y dice:
vi_translation: But I kept asking persistently, and finally he said:
tr_translation: But I wasn't satisfied with this, and when I pressed him further, he confessed:
es_translation: But I insisted, so in the end he goes and says:

en: Tom’s most well now, and got his bullet around his neck on a watch-guard for a watch, and is always seeing what time it is, and so there ain’t nothing more to write about, and I am rotten glad of it, because if I’d a knowed what a trouble it was to make a book I wouldn’t a tackled it, and ain’t a-going to no more. But I reckon I got to light out for the Territory ahead of the rest, because Aunt Sally she’s going to adopt me and sivilize me, and I can’t stand it. I been there before.
vi: Bây giờ, thằng Tom đã gần khỏi hẳn. Nó buộc viên đạn vào một cái dây đeo lên cổ để làm cái đồng hồ và thỉnh thoảng lại giở ra xem giờ. Tôi không biết viết gì thêm nữa cho cuốn sách này. Nếu như tôi biết là viết một cuốn sách sẽ khó khăn như thế nào thì tôi sẽ chẳng viết, mà cũng không có ý định viết nữa. Nhưng dù sao, tôi cũng phải đi ngay đến địa phận của những người da đỏ vì dì Saly định nuôi tôi và khai hóa cho tôi; mà tôi thì tôi không chịu được điều đó, tôi đã thừa biết về nó rồi.
tr: Tom artık gayet iyi, kurşunu da bir cep saati kabına koyup boynuna taktı. Zırt pırt saat niyetine ona bakıyor. İşte böyleyken böyle, artık yazacak başka bir şey kalmadı, ben de buna çok memnunum. Bu kitabı yazmanın bu kadar zor olduğunu bilseydim hayatta başlamazdım, bir daha da böyle bir işe girişirsem ne olayım. Ama galiba artık Kızılderili Bölgesi’ne doğru ufaktan tüymemin vakti geldi, çünkü Sally Teyze beni evlat edinmeyi, sonra da adam etmeyi düşünüyor; artık o kadarına dayanamam. Daha önce denemiştim ben bunu.
es: Tom ya está casi bien y lleva la bala colgada al cuello con una caja de reloj, y siempre mira qué hora es, así que ya no hay nada más que escribir. Yo me alegro cantidad, porque si hubiera sabido lo difícil que era escribir un libro, no me habría puesto a ello, y no pienso volver a hacerlo. Pero calculo que tengo que marcharme al territorio antes que naide, porque la tía Sally va a adoptarme y a cevilizarme, y no lo aguanto. Ya sé lo que es pasar por eso.
vi_translation: Now, Tom was almost completely recovered. He tied the bullet to a string and wore it around his neck like a watch, occasionally taking it out to check the time. I don't know what else to write for this book. If I had known how difficult writing a book would be, I wouldn't have written it, nor would I have intended to write it. But anyway, I still have to go to the territory of the Native Americans because Aunt Saly intends to raise and civilize me; and I cannot stand that, as I already know enough about it.
tr_translation: Tom is quite well now, and he put the bullet in a pocket watch case and hung it around his neck. He keeps looking at it frequently as if it were a watch. So that's how it is, there's nothing left to write about, and I'm very pleased with that. If I had known that writing this book would be this difficult, I would never have started, and if I ever undertake such a task again, may I be damned. But I guess it's time for me to quietly slip away to the Indian Territory, because Aunt Sally is thinking of adopting me and then making a man out of me; I can't bear that. I've tried that before.
es_translation: Tom is almost well now and he wears the bullet hanging around his neck in a watch case, and he always checks what time it is, so there's nothing more to write about. I'm really glad, because if I had known how hard it was to write a book, I wouldn't have started it, and I don't plan to do it again. But I reckon I have to head to the territory before anyone else, because Aunt Sally is going to adopt me and civilize me, and I can't stand it. I know what it's like to go through that.
